mr . trimble has been in the hospital but is expected back tuesday .	210.62395
the housing bill is expected to encounter strong opposition by the coalition of southern democrats and conservative republicans .	14.618522
the democratic leadership , however , hopes to pass it sometime this week .	40.372486
the $6 , 100 , 000 , 000 measure , which was passed last monday by the senate , provides for forty-year mortgages at low down-payments for moderate-income families .	37.166973
it also provides for funds to clear slums and help colleges build dormitories .	105.760155
the education bill appears to be temporarily stalled in the rules committee , where two northern democratic members who usually vote with the administration are balking because of the religious controversy .	66.03797
they are james j . delaney of queens and thomas p . o ' neill jr . of massachusetts .	30.319513
what could rescue the bill would be some quick progress on a bill amending the national defense education act of 1958 .	32.070145
this would provide for long-term federal loans for construction of parochial and other private-school facilities for teaching science , languages and mathematics .	40.496365
mr . delaney and mr . o ' neill are not willing to vote on the public-school measure until the defense education bill clears the house education and labor committee .	50.314114
about half of all peace corps projects assigned to voluntary agencies will be carried out by religious groups , according to an official of the corps .	42.075203
in the $40 , 000 , 000 budget that has been submitted for congressional approval , $26 , 000 , 000 would be spent through universities and private voluntary agencies .	26.957838
twelve projects proposed by private groups are at the contract-negotiation stage , gordon boyce , director of relations with the voluntary agencies , said in a washington interview .	23.075958
six of these were proposed by religious groups .	4.079702
they will be for teaching , agriculture and community development in southeast asia , africa , the middle east and latin america .	32.54462
interviews with several church leaders have disclosed that this development has raised the question whether the peace corps will be able to prevent confusion for church and state over methods , means and goals .	80.86158
there are a number of ways this could happen , the churchmen pointed out , and here is an example	32.44291
last month in ghana an american missionary discovered when he came to pay his hotel bill that the usual rate had been doubled .	67.46574
the u . s . government is paying for it .	31.676949
the u . s . government pays for all its overseas workers ' ' .	15.734403
`` i don ' t work for the government ' ' , the american said .	38.012722
`` same thing ' ' , he said .	4.6856823
and then , some churchmen remarked , there is a more classical church-state problem	58.48403
can religious agencies use government funds and peace corps personnel in their projects and still preserve the constitutional requirement on separation of church and state ? ?	48.874043
r . sargent shriver jr . , director of the corps , is certain that they can .	34.43905
no religious group , he declared in an interview , will receive peace corps funds unless it forswears all proselytizing on the project it proposes .	32.242046

the soviet union and other members of the communist bloc are rapidly expanding their economic , technical and military assistance to the uncommitted nations .	19.308672

this was the biggest annual outlay since the communist program for the under-developed countries made its modest beginning in 1954 .	33.153297
in 1960 more than 6 , 000 communist technicians were present in those countries .	30.78863
united nations , n . y . , june 18	451.2659
-- a committee of experts has recommended that a country ' s population be considered in the distribution of professional posts at the united nations .	35.515694
this was disclosed today by a responsible source amid intensified efforts by the soviet union to gain a greater role in the staff and operation of the united nations .	41.52226
one effect of the proposal , which puts a premium on population instead of economic strength , as in the past , would be to take jobs from european nations and give more to such countries as india .	76.86705
india is the most populous united nations member with more than 400 , 000 , 000 inhabitants .	16.921305
the new formula for filling staff positions in the secretariat is one of a number of recommendations made by a panel of eight in a long and detailed report .	35.75783
the report was completed after nearly eighteen months of work on the question of the organization of the united nations .	21.023666
the advisory committee on administrative and budgetary questions is expected to receive the report this week .	58.569035
the jobs formula is understood to follow these lines	69.60072
each of the organization ' s ninety-nine members would get two professional posts , such as political affairs officer , a department head or an economist , to start .	91.10941
each member would get one post for each 10 , 000 , 000 people in its population up to 150 , 000 , 000 people or a maximum of fifteen posts .	25.498741
each member with a population above 150 , 000 , 000 would get one additional post for each additional 30 , 000 , 000 people up to an unspecified cut-off point .	29.388628
-- the three leaders of laos agreed today to begin negotiations tomorrow on forming a coalition government that would unite the war-ridden kingdom .	46.115234
the decision was made in zurich by prince boun oum , premier of the pro-western royal government	14.54372
prince souvanna phouma , leader of the nation ' s neutralists and recognized as premier by the communist bloc , and prince souphanouvong , head of the pro-communist pathet lao forces .	20.259094
their joint statement was welcomed by the western delegations who will attend tomorrow the nineteenth plenary session of the fourteen-nation conference on the future of laos .	30.634556
an agreement among the princes on a coalition government would ease their task , diplomats conceded .	83.8556
w . averell harriman of the united states , malcolm macdonald of britain , maurice couve de murville , france ' s foreign minister , and howard c . green , canada ' s minister of external affairs , concluded , meanwhile , a round of consultations here on future tactics in the conference .	23.504795
the pace of the talks has slowed with each passing week .	163.03838
princess moune , prince souvanna phouma ' s young daughter , read the princes ' statement .	53.09773
they had a two-hour luncheon together in `` an atmosphere of cordial understanding and relaxation ' ' , she said .	12.637979
the three laotians agreed upon a six-point agenda for their talks , which are to last three days .	79.788185
the princess said it was too early to say what would be decided if no agreement was reached after three days .	136.20248
the meetings in zurich , the statement said , would deal only with principles that would guide the three factors in their search for a coalition government .	107.209526

-- thousands of bleacher-type seats are being erected along pennsylvania avenue between the capitol and the white house for the big inaugural parade on jan . 20 .	24.07498
assuming the weather is halfway decent that day , hundreds of thousands of persons will mass along this thoroughfare as president john f . kennedy and retiring president dwight d . eisenhower leave capitol hill following the oath-taking ceremonies and ride down this historic ceremonial route .	42.069374
pennsylvania avenue , named for one of the original 13 states , perhaps is not the most impressive street in the district of columbia from a commercial standpoint .	37.32045
but from a historic viewpoint none can approach it .	4.982234
within view of the avenue are some of the united states government ' s tremendous buildings , plus shrines and monuments .	25.945944
of course , 1600 pennsylvania , the white house , is the most famous address of the free world .	23.18174
within an easy walk from capitol hill where pennsylvania avenue comes together with constitution avenue , begins a series of great federal buildings , some a block long and all about seven-stories high .	98.99623
great chapters of history have been recorded along the avenue , now about 169 years old .	22.972479
in the early spring of 1913 a few hundred thousand persons turned out to watch 5000 women parade .	48.36524
they were the suffragettes and they wanted to vote .	20.578241
in the 1920 presidential election they had that right and many of them did vote for the first time .	56.547035

also the department of justice building is located where j . edgar hoover presides over the federal bureau of investigation .	11.67371
street car tracks run down the center of pennsylvania , powered with lines that are underground .	73.66246

moving past the presidential viewing stand and lafayette square will be at least 40 marching units .	32.64115
about 16 , 000 military members of all branches of the armed forces will take part in the parade .	27.857347
division one of the parade will be the service academies .	56.883247

then will come nine other states in the order of their admission to the union .	65.111435
division three will be headed by the marines followed by 12 states	82.72183
division four will be headed by the navy , followed by 11 states	42.071896
division five , by the air force followed by 11 states .	25.16414
division six will be headed by the coast guard , followed by the reserve forces of all services , five states , puerto rico , the virgin islands , guam , american samoa , the trust territories and the canal zone .	21.197292
-- what does 1961 offer in political and governmental developments in mississippi ? ?	245.60735
even for those who have been observing the political scene a long time , no script from the past is worth very much in gazing into the state ' s immediate political future .	82.73784
this is largely because of the unpredictability of the man who operates the helm of the state government and is the elected leader of its two million inhabitants -- gov . ross barnett .	33.11561
barnett , who came into office with no previous experience in public administration , has surrounded himself with confusion which not only keeps his foes guessing but his friends as well .	118.93967
consequently , it is uncertain after nearly 12 months in office just which direction the barnett administration will take in the coming year .	142.90167
some predict the administration will settle down during 1961 and iron out the rough edges which it has had thus far .	149.6737
the builtin headache of the barnett regime thus far has been the steady stream of job-seekers and others who feel they were given commitments by barnett at some stage of his eight-year quest for the governor ' s office .	48.34595
there are many who predict that should barnett decide to call the legislature back into special session , it will really throw his administration into a scramble .	52.629593
certainly nobody will predict that the next time the lawmakers come back together barnett will be able to enjoy a re-enactment of the strange but successful `` honeymoon ' ' he had in the 1960 legislative session .	42.42288
if barnett doesn ' t call a special session in 1961 , it will be the first year in the last decade that the legislature has not met in regular or special session .	36.08991
the odds favor a special session , more than likely early in the year .	46.86442
legislators always get restless for a special session ( whether for the companionship or the $22 . 50 per diem is not certain ) and if they start agitating .	39.911777
barnett is not expected to be able to withstand the pressure .	32.19516
the issue which may make it necessary to have a session is the highly sensitive problem of cutting the state ' s congressional districts from six to five to eliminate one congressional seat .	84.28622
with eyes focused on the third congressional district , the historic delta district , and congressman frank e . smith as the one most likely to go , the redistricting battle will put to a test the longstanding power which lawmakers from the delta have held in the legislature .	72.06379
mississippi ' s relations with the national democratic party will be at a crossroads during 1961 , with the first democratic president in eight years in the white house .	40.007267
split badly during the recent presidential election into almost equally divided camps of party loyalists and independents , the democratic party in mississippi is currently a wreck .	21.01892
and there has been no effort since the election to pull it back together .	62.497528
barnett , as the titular head of the democratic party , apparently must make the move to reestablish relations with the national democratic party or see a movement come from the loyalist ranks to completely bypass him as a party functionary .	40.287243
with a democratic administration , party patronage would normally begin to flow to mississippi if it had held its democratic solidarity in the november election .	76.678696
now , the picture is clouded , and even us sens . james o . eastland and john c . stennis , who remained loyal to the ticket , are uncertain of their status .	21.855236
reports are that it is more than probable that the four congressmen from mississippi who did not support the party ticket will be stripped of the usual patronage which flows to congressmen .	41.60074
-- the gov . jimmie h . davis administration appears to face a difficult year in 1961 , with the governor ' s theme of peace and harmony subjected to severe stresses .	67.30665
the year will probably start out with segregation still the most troublesome issue .	61.311375
but it might give way shortly to another vexing issue -- that of finances in state government .	54.300156
the transition from segregation to finances might already be in progress , in the form of an administration proposal to hike the state sales tax from 2 per cent to 3 per cent .	37.150593
the administration has said the sales tax proposal is merely part of the segregation strategy , since the revenues from the increase would be dedicated to a grant in aid program .	90.639946
but the tardiness of the administration in making the dedication has caused legislators to suspect the tax bill was related more directly to an over-all shortage of cash than to segregation .	67.66255
indeed , the administration ' s curious position on the sales tax was a major factor in contributing to its defeat .	30.72235
the administration could not say why $28 million was needed for a grant-in-aid program .	13.130248
the effectiveness of the governor in clearing up some of the inconsistencies revolving about the sales tax bill may play a part in determining whether it can muster the required two-thirds vote .	41.610043
the tax bill will be up for reconsideration wednesday in the house when the legislature reconvenes .	26.737581
davis may use the tax bill as a means to effect a transition from special sessions of the legislature to normalcy .	43.24549
if it fails to pass , he can throw up his hands and say the legislature would not support him in his efforts to prevent integration .	42.890007
he could terminate special sessions of the legislature .	3.7978938
actually , davis would have to toss in the towel soon anyway .	39.729317
many legislators are already weary and frustrated over the so-far losing battle to block token integration .	63.99286
this is not the sort of thing most politicos would care to acknowledge publicly .	80.72073
they would like to convey the notion something is being done , even though it is something they know to be ineffectual .	39.16967
passage of the sales tax measure would also give davis the means to effect a transition .	98.73996
he could tell the legislature they had provided the needed funds to carry on the battle .	69.64703
then he could tell them to go home , while the administration continued to wage the battle with the $28 million in extra revenues the sales tax measure would bring in over an eight months period .	114.23191
it is difficult to be certain how the administration views that $28 million , since the views of one leader may not be the same as the views of another one .	87.92506
but if the administration should find it does not need the $28 million for a grant-in-aid program , a not unlikely conclusion , it could very well seek a way to use the money for other purposes .	49.054943
this would be in perfect consonance with the underlying concern in the administration -- the shortage of cash .	39.530357
it could become an acute problem in the coming fiscal year .	280.83713
if the administration does not succeed in passing the sales tax bill , or any other tax bill , it could very well be faced this spring at the fiscal session of the legislature with an interesting dilemma .	37.84373
since the constitution forbids introduction of a tax bill at a fiscal session , the administration will either have to cut down expenses or inflate its estimates of anticipated revenues .	57.36201
in either case , it could call a special session of the legislature later in 1961 to make another stab at raising additional revenues through a tax raiser .	35.306072
the prospect of cutting back spending is an unpleasant one for any governor .	249.43916
it is one that most try to avoid , as long as they can see an alternative approach to the problem .	25.686325
but if all alternatives should be clearly blocked off , it can be expected the davis administration will take steps to trim spending at the spring session of the state legislature .	47.33674
this might be done to arouse those who have been squeezed out by the trims to exert pressure on the legislature , so it would be more receptive to a tax proposal later in the year .	31.224182
a constant problem confronting davis on any proposals for new taxes will be the charge by his foes that he has not tried to economize .	50.578896
any tax bill also will revive allegations that some of his followers have been using their administration affiliations imprudently to profit themselves .	61.261692
the new year might see some house-cleaning , either genuine or token , depending upon developments , to give davis an opportunity to combat some of these criticisms .	39.552193
city controller alexander hemphill charged tuesday that the bids on the frankford elevated repair project were rigged to the advantage of a private contracting company which had `` an inside track ' ' with the city .	30.560394
estimates of the city ' s loss in the $344 , 000 job have ranged as high as $200 , 000 .	38.623386
hemphill said that the hughes steel erection co . contracted to do the work at an impossibly low cost with a bid that was far less than the `` legitimate ' ' bids of competing contractors .	32.22182
the hughes concern then took `` shortcuts ' ' on the project but got paid anyway , hemphill said .	27.51241
the controller ' s charge of rigging was the latest development in an investigation which also brought these disclosures tuesday	82.71839
the city has sued for the full amount of the $172 , 400 performance bond covering the contract .	67.456055
the philadelphia transportation co . is investigating the part its organization played in reviewing the project .	124.80745
the signature of harold v . varani , former director of architecture and engineering in the department of public property , appeared on payment vouchers certifying work on the project .	31.22013
varani has been fired on charges of accepting gifts from the contractor .	8.37489
managing director donald c . wagner has agreed to cooperate fully with hemphill after a period of sharp disagreement on the matter .	34.282692
the announcement that the city would sue for recovery on the performance bond was made by city solicitor david berger at a press conference following a meeting in the morning with wagner and other officials of the city and the ptc as well as representatives of an engineering firm that was pulled off the el project before its completion in 1959 .	47.997356
the hughes company and the consolidated industries , inc . , both of 3646 n . 2d st . , filed for reorganization under the federal bankruptcy law .	34.093864
on monday , the hughes concern was formally declared bankrupt after its directors indicated they could not draw up a plan for reorganization .	67.0368
business relations between the companies and city have been under investigation by hemphill and district attorney james c . crumlish , jr . .	26.934221
the suit was filed later in the day in common pleas court 7 against the hughes company and two bonding firms .	102.10131
travelers indemnity co . and the continental casualty co . .	8.880525
at berger ' s direction , the city also intervened in the hughes bankruptcy case in u . s . district court in a move preliminary to filing a claim there .	43.40189
`` i am taking the position that the contract was clearly violated ' ' , berger said .	26.601027
the contract violations mostly involve failure to perform rehabilitation work on expansion joints along the el track .	193.79869
the contract called for overhauling of 102 joints .	5.934802
the city paid for work on 75 , of which no more than 21 were repaired , hemphill charged .	144.03963
hemphill said the hughes concern contracted to do the repairs at a cost of $500 for each joint .	35.470192
the bid from a . belanger and sons of cambridge , mass . , which listed the same officers as hughes , was $600 per joint .	75.49069
but , hemphill added , bids from other contractors ranged from $2400 to $3100 per joint .	9.295738
berger ' s decision to sue for the full amount of the performance bond was questioned by wagner in the morning press conference .	40.377163
wagner said the city paid only $37 , 500 to the hughes company .	8.070647
`` we won ' t know the full amount until we get a full report ' ' , wagner said .	68.23334
`` we can claim on the maximum amount of the bond ' ' , berger said .	12.736641
wagner replied , `` can ' t you just see the headline ' city hooked for $172 , 000 ' ' ' ? ?	34.85425
berger insisted that `` we know enough to sue for the full amount ' ' .	43.378532
douglas m . pratt , president of the ptc , who attended the meeting , said the transit company is reviewing the work on the el .	48.18928
`` we want to find out who knew about it ' ' , pratt said .	6.7708654
`` certain people must have known about it ' ' .	1.8278449
`` the ptc is investigating the whole matter ' ' , pratt said .	5.4167004
samuel d . goodis , representing the philadelphia hotel association , objected on tuesday to a proposed boost by the city in licensing fees , saying that occupancy rates in major hotels here ranged from 48 to 74 percent last year .	43.182186
goodis voiced his objection before city council ' s finance committee .	7.457819
for hotels with 1000 rooms , the increased license fee would mean an expense of $5000 a year , goodis said .	30.602493
his testimony came during a hearing on a bill raising fees for a wide variety of licenses , permits and city services .	44.083576
the new fees are expected to raise an additional $740 , 000 in the remainder of 1961 and $2 , 330 , 000 more a year after that .	25.919296
the ordinance would increase the fee for rooming houses , hotels and multi-family dwellings to $5 a room .	28.064478
the cost of a license now is $2 , with an annual renewal fee of $1 .	26.146654
goodis said that single rooms account for 95 percent of the accomodations in some hotels .	14.452208
the city expects the higher rooming house , hotel and apartment house fees to bring in an additional $457 , 000 a year .	31.687859
the increase also was opposed by leonard kaplan , spokesman for the home builders association of philadelphia , on behalf of association members who operate apartment houses .	91.571526
a proposal to raise dog license fees drew an objection from councilwoman virginia knauer , who formerly raised pedigreed dogs .	13.259606
the ordinance would increase fees from $1 for males and $2 for females to a flat $5 a dog .	103.29796
mrs . knauer said she did not think dog owners should be penalized for the city ' s services to animal care .	55.701717
in reply , deputy police commissioner howard r . leary said that the city spends more than $115 , 000 annually to license and regulate dogs but collects only $43 , 000 in fees .	20.382153
he reported that the city ' s contributions for animal care included $67 , 000 to the women ' s s . p . c . a .	25.616966
$15 , 000 to pay six policemen assigned as dog catchers and $15 , 000 to investigate dog bites .	30.636536
city finance director richard j . mcconnell indorsed the higher fees , which , he said , had been under study for more than a year .	55.247955
the city is not adequately compensated for the services covered by the fees , he said .	49.357174
the new fee schedule also was supported by commissioner of licenses and inspections barnet lieberman and health commissioner eugene a . gillis .	9.905048
petitions asking for a jail term for norristown attorney julian w . barnard will be presented to the montgomery county court friday , it was disclosed tuesday by horace a . davenport , counsel for the widow of the man killed last nov . 1 by barnard ' s hit-run car .	26.267271
the petitions will be presented in open court to president judge william f . dannehower , davenport said .	21.52122
barnard , who pleaded no defense to manslaughter and hit-run charges , was fined $500 by judge warren k . hess , and placed on two years ' probation providing he does not drive during that time .	52.82638
he was caught driving the day after the sentence was pronounced and given a warning .	155.51541
victim of the accident was robert lee stansbery , 39 .	13.875157
his widow started the circulation of petitions after barnard was reprimanded for violating the probation .	5.2799335
the city planning commission on tuesday approved agreements between two redevelopers and the redevelopment authority for the purchase of land in the $300 , 000 , 000 eastwick redevelopment area project .	21.83538
the commission also approved a novel plan that would eliminate traffic hazards for pedestrians in the project .	21.96277
one of the agreements calls for the new eastwick corp . to purchase a 1311 acre tract for $12 , 192 , 865 .	13.447642
the tract is bounded by island ave . , dicks ave . , 61st st . , and eastwick ave . .	6.90483
it is designated as stage 1 residential on the redevelopment authority ' s master plan and will feature row houses , garden apartments , four small parks , schools , churches , a shopping center and several small clusters of stores .	55.15643
the corporation was formed by the reynolds metal co . and the samuel a . and henry a . berger firm , a philadelphia builder , for work in the project .	41.518368
the second agreement permits the authority to sell a 520-acre tract west of stage 1 residential to philadelphia builders eastwick corp . , a firm composed of 10 philadelphia area builders , which is interested in developing part of the project .	62.78365
the plan for eliminating traffic hazards for pedestrians was developed by dr . constantinos a . doxiadis , former minister of reconstruction in greece and a consulting planner for the new eastwick corp . .	15.891756
the plan calls for dividing the project into 16 sectors which would be barred to vehicular traffic .	28.573254
it provides for a series of landscaped walkways and a central esplanade that would eventually run through the center of the entire two-and-a-half-mile length of the project .	25.410107
the esplanade eliminates grovers ave . , which on original plans ran through the center of the development .	60.251152
the esplanade would feature pedestrian bridges over roads in the project .	14.305541
kansas city , mo . , feb . 9 ( upi )	6.462287
-- the president of the kansas city local of the international association of fire fighters was severly injured today when a bomb tore his car apart as he left home for work .	38.865368
battalion chief stanton m . gladden , 42 , the central figure in a representation dispute between the fire fighters association and the teamsters union , suffered multiple fractures of both ankles .	38.63473
the battalion chief said he had just gotten into his 1958 model automobile to move it from the driveway of his home so that he could take his other car to work .	98.70376
`` i ' d just turned on the ignition when there was a big flash and i was lying on the driveway ' ' , he said .	13.535613
gladden ' s wife and two of his sons , john , 17 , and jim , 13 , were inside the house .	37.341446
the younger boy said the blast knocked him out of bed and against the wall .	31.185562
the explosion sent the hood of the car flying over the roof of the house .	13.898722
the left front wheel landed 100 feet away .	2.9239764
police laboratory technicians said the explosive device , containing either tnt or nitroglycerine , was apparently placed under the left front wheel .	56.701534
it was first believed the bomb was rigged to the car ' s starter .	10.478739
gladden had been the target of threatening telephone calls in recent months and reportedly received one last night .	53.447857
the fire department here has been torn for months by dissension involving top personnel and the fight between the fire fighters association and the teamsters union .	41.141266
gladden has been an outspoken critic of the present city administration and led his union ' s battle against the teamsters , which began organizing city firemen in 1959 .	56.212894
the fire fighters association here offered a $5 , 000 reward for information leading to the arrest of the person or persons responsible for the bombing .	37.150196
a $500 reward was offered by the association ' s local in kansas city , kas . .	10.9444895
the association said it would post 24 hour guards at gladden ' s home and at those of james mining and eugene shiflett .	38.360863
mining is secretary-treasurer of the local and shiflett is a member of its executive committee .	51.497135
ankara , turkey , oct . 24 ( ap )	2.6779904
-- turkish political leaders bowed today to military pressure and agreed to form an emergency national front government with gen . cemal gursel as president .	95.002625
an agreement between the leaders of four parties which contested indecisive elections on oct . 15 was reached after almost 18 hours of political bargaining under the threat of an army coup d ' etat .	31.161457
by-passing the military junta which has ruled turkey since the overthrow of premier adnan menderes 17 months ago , the army general staff , led by gen . cedvet sunay , had set a deadline for the parties to join in a national coalition government .	31.135607
the army leaders threatened to form a new military government if the parties failed to sign an eight point protocol agreeing on gen . gursel as president .	115.99241
gen . gursel has headed the military junta the last 17 months .	27.678675
the military also had demanded pledges that there would be no changes in the laws passed by the junta and no leaders of the menderes regime now in prison would be pardoned .	34.776814
party leaders came out of the final meeting apparently satisfied and stated that complete agreement had been reached on a solution to the crisis created by the elections which left no party with enough strength to form a government on its own .	117.75089
vincent g . ierulli has been appointed temporary assistant district attorney , it was announced monday by charles e . raymond , district attorney .	26.663935
ierulli will replace desmond d . connall who has been called to active military service but is expected back on the job by march 31 .	89.482994
ierulli , 29 , has been practicing in portland since november , 1959 .	15.127057
he is a graduate of portland university and the northwestern college of law .	44.503323
he is married and the father of three children .	7.710375
helping foreign countries to build a sound political structure is more important than aiding them economically , e . m . martin , assistant secretary of state for economic affairs told members of the world affairs council monday night .	43.11051
martin , who has been in office in washington , d . c . , for 13 months spoke at the council ' s annual meeting at the multnomah hotel .	15.719248
he told some 350 persons that the united states ' challenge was to help countries build their own societies their own ways , following their own paths .	62.51464
`` we must persuade them to enjoy a way of life which , if not identical , is congenial with ours ' ' , he said but adding that if they do not develop the kind of society they themselves want it will lack ritiuality and loyalty .	69.00267
insuring that the countries have a freedom of choice , he said , was the biggest detriment to the soviet union .	15.943904
he cited east germany where after 15 years of soviet rule it has become necessary to build a wall to keep the people in , and added , `` so long as people rebel , we must not give up ' ' .	60.69045
martin called for patience on the part of americans .	72.93819
`` the countries are trying to build in a decade the kind of society we took a century to build ' ' , he said .	47.552612
by leaving our doors open the united states gives other peoples the opportunity to see us and to compare , he said .	51.296036
`` we have no reason to fear failure , but we must be extraordinarily patient ' ' , the assistant secretary said .	28.541458
economically , martin said , the united states could best help foreign countries by helping them help themselves .	108.47297
private business is more effective than government aid , he explained , because individuals are able to work with the people themselves .	51.560627
the united states must plan to absorb the exported goods of the country , at what he termed a `` social cost ' ' .	28.49964
martin said the government has been working to establish firmer prices on primary products which may involve the total income of one country .	71.60356
the portland school board was asked monday to take a positive stand towards developing and coordinating with portland ' s civil defense more plans for the city ' s schools in event of attack .	78.14125
but there seemed to be some difference of opinion as to how far the board should go , and whose advice it should follow .	104.34579
the board members , after hearing the coordination plea from mrs . ralph h . molvar , 1409 sw maplecrest dr . , said they thought they had already been cooperating .	37.75284
chairman c . richard mears pointed out that perhaps this was not strictly a school board problem , in case of atomic attack , but that the board would cooperate so far as possible to get the children to where the parents wanted them to go .	64.66225
dr . melvin w . barnes , superintendent , said he thought the schools were waiting for some leadership , perhaps on the national level , to make sure that whatever steps of planning they took would `` be more fruitful ' ' , and that he had found that other school districts were not as far along in their planning as this district .	79.93762
`` los angeles has said they would send the children to their homes in case of disaster ' ' , he said .	23.880165
i think everybody is agreed that we need to hear some voice on the national level that would make some sense and in which we would have some confidence in following .	79.14462
mrs . molvar , who kept reiterating her request that they `` please take a stand ' ' , said , `` we must have faith in somebody -- on the local level , and it wouldn ' t be possible for everyone to rush to a school to get their children ' ' .	36.128918
dr . barnes said that there seemed to be feeling that evacuation plans , even for a high school where there were lots of cars `` might not be realistic and would not work ' ' .	48.84549
mrs . molvar asked again that the board join in taking a stand in keeping with jack lowe ' s program .	59.401676
the board said it thought it had gone as far as instructed so far and asked for more information to be brought at the next meeting .	79.05975
it was generally agreed that the subject was important and the board should be informed on what was done , is going to be done and what it thought should be done .	59.91669

a stronger stand on their beliefs and a firmer grasp on their future were taken friday by delegates to the 29th general council of the assemblies of god , in session at the memorial coliseum .	40.197987
the council revised , in an effort to strengthen , the denomination ' s 16 basic beliefs adopted in 1966 .	39.864788
the changes , unanimously adopted , were felt necessary in the face of modern trends away from the bible .	97.75457
the council agreed it should more firmly state its belief in and dependence on the bible .	52.242065
at the adoption , the rev . t . f . zimmerman , general superintendent , commented , `` the assemblies of god has been a bulwark for fundamentalism in these modern days and has , without compromise , stood for the great truths of the bible for which men in the past have been willing to give their lives ' ' .	29.268463
however , the first belief stood for entire revision with a new third point added to the list .	150.20758
the first of 16 beliefs of the denomination , now reads	62.49458
`` the scriptures , both old and new testament , are verbally inspired of god and are the revelation of god to man , the infallible , authoritative rule of faith and conduct ' ' .	23.133049
the third belief , in six points , emphasizes the diety of the lord jesus christ , and	7.277326
-- and his exaltation to the right hand of god .	6.562998
friday afternoon the rev . t . f . zimmerman was reelected for his second consecutive two-year term as general superintendent of assemblies of god .	25.89273
his offices are in springfield , mo . .	11.702875
friday night the delegates heard the need for their forthcoming program , `` breakthrough ' ' scheduled to fill the churches for the next two years .	29.826591
in his opening address wednesday the rev . mr . zimmerman , urged the delegates to consider a 10-year expansion program , with `` breakthrough ' ' the theme for the first two years .	21.407896
the rev . r . l . brandt , national secretary of the home missions department , stressed the need for the first two years ' work .	45.577087
`` surveys show that one out of three americans has vital contact with the church .	66.06156
this means that more than 100 million have no vital touch with the church or religious life ' ' , he told delegates friday .	39.7126
talking of the rapid population growth ( upwards of 12 , 000 babies born daily ) with an immigrant entering the united states every 1-1/2 minutes , he said `` our organization has not been keeping pace with this challenge ' ' .	49.799183
`` in 35 years we have opened 7 , 000 churches ' ' , the rev . mr . brandt said , adding that the denomination had a national goal of one church for every 10 , 000 persons .	16.95558
`` in this light we need 1 , 000 churches in illinois , where we have 200	68.33229
800 in southern new england , we have 60	46.75573
we need 100 in rhode island , we have none ' ' , he said .	13.59833
to step up the denomination ' s program , the rev . mr . brandt suggested the vision of 8 , 000 new assemblies of god churches in the next 10 years .	20.216276
to accomplish this would necessitate some changes in methods , he said .	83.34037
`` the church ' s ability to change her methods is going to determine her ability to meet the challenge of this hour ' ' .	45.022594
-- encouraging by every means , all existing assemblies of god churches to start new churches .	84.989586
-- engaging mature , experienced men to pioneer or open new churches in strategic population centers .	146.84155
-- surrounding pioneer pastors with vocational volunteers ( laymen , who will be urged to move into the area of new churches in the interest of lending their support to the new project ) .	40.565865
-- arranging for ministerial graduates to spend from 6-12 months as apprentices in well-established churches .	16.096619
u . s . dist . judge charles l . powell denied all motions made by defense attorneys monday in portland ' s insurance fraud trial .	40.727993
denials were of motions of dismissal , continuance , mistrial , separate trial , acquittal , striking of testimony and directed verdict .	17.605797
in denying motions for dismissal , judge powell stated that mass trials have been upheld as proper in other courts and that `` a person may join a conspiracy without knowing who all of the conspirators are ' ' .	71.17356
attorney dwight l . schwab , in behalf of defendant philip weinstein , argued there is no evidence linking weinstein to the conspiracy , but judge powell declared this is a matter for the jury to decide .	18.65531
schwab also declared there is no proof of weinstein ' s entering a conspiracy to use the u . s . mails to defraud , to which federal prosecutor a . lawrence burbank replied	17.130009
`` it is not necessary that a defendant actually have conpired to use the u . s . mails to defraud as long as there is evidence of a conspiracy , and the mails were then used to carry it out ' ' .	18.300495
in the afternoon , defense attorneys began the presentation of their cases with opening statements , some of which had been deferred until after the government had called witnesses and presented its case .	56.316643
-- the orioles tonight retained the distinction of being the only winless team among the eighteen major-league clubs as they dropped their sixth straight spring exhibition decision , this one to the kansas city athletics by a score of 5 to 3 .	53.926437
indications as late as the top of the sixth were that the birds were to end their victory draught as they coasted along with a 3-to-o advantage .	86.68718
over the first five frames , jack fisher , the big righthander who figures to be in the middle of oriole plans for a drive on the 1961 american league pennant , held the a ' s scoreless while yielding three scattered hits .	76.788246
then dick hyde , submarine-ball hurler , entered the contest and only five batters needed to face him before there existed a 3-to-3 deadlock .	52.560875
a two-run homer by norm siebern and a solo blast by bill tuttle tied the game , and single runs in the eighth and ninth gave the athletics their fifth victory in eight starts .	59.46796
with one down in the eighth , marv throneberry drew a walk and stole second as hyde fanned tuttle .	15.809451
catcher frank house ' s throw in an effort to nab throneberry was wide and in the dirt .	19.916338
then heywood sullivan , kansas city catcher , singled up the middle and throneberry was across with what proved to be the winning run .	43.99196
rookie southpaw george stepanovich relieved hyde at the start of the ninth and gave up the a ' s fifth tally on a walk to second baseman dick howser , a wild pitch , and frank cipriani ' s single under shortstop jerry adair ' s glove into center .	30.800568

-- a texas halfback who doesn ' t even know the team ' s plays , eldon moritz , ranks fourth in southwest conference scoring after three games .	44.41813
time stands still every time moritz , a 26-year-old army signal corps veteran , goes into the field .	64.78174
although he never gets to play while the clock is running , he gets a big kick -- several every saturday , in fact -- out of football .	122.80649
moritz doesn ' t even have a nose guard or hip pads but he ' s one of the most valuable members of the longhorn team that will be heavily favored saturday over oklahoma in the cotton bowl .	50.28683
that ' s because he already has kicked 14 extra points in 15 tries .	35.997875
he ran his string of successful conversions this season to 13 straight before one went astray last saturday night in the 41-8 slaughter of washington state .	77.76097
moritz is listed on the longhorn roster as a right halfback , the position at which he lettered on the 1956 team .	56.306683
but ask coach darrell royal what position he plays and you ' ll get the quick response , `` place-kicker ' ' .	35.558624
a 208-pound , 6-foot 1-inch senior from stamford , moritz practices nothing but place-kicking .	195.16553
last year , when he worked out at halfback all season , he didn ' t get into a single game .	61.661617
`` this year , coach royal told me if i ' d work on my place-kicking he thought he could use me ' ' , said moritz .	43.948147
`` so i started practicing on it in spring training .	79.62088
moritz was bothered during the first two games this year by a pulled muscle in the thigh of his right ( kicking ) leg and , as a result , several of his successful conversions have gone barely far enough .	44.558075
moritz said monday his leg feels fine and , as a result , he hopes to start practicing field goals this week .	49.977367
he kicked several while playing at stamford high school , including one that beat anson , 3-0 , in a 1953 district game .	42.74111
`` i kicked about 110 extra points in 135 tries during three years in high school ' ' , he said , `` and made 26 in a row at one time .	29.235092
i never did miss one in a playoff game -- i kicked about 20 in the five playoff games my last two years ' ' .	41.678406
moritz came to texas in 1954 but his freshman football efforts were hampered by a knee injury .	25.800161
he missed the 1955 season because of an operation on the ailing knee , then played 77 minutes in 1956 .	38.640865
his statistical record that year , when texas won only one game and lost nine , was far from impressive he carried the ball three times for a net gain of 10 yards , punted once for 39 yards and caught one pass for 13 yards .	68.14951
he went into the army in march , 1957 , and returned two years later .	32.07208
but he was scholastically ineligible in 1959 and merely present last season .	231.34799
place kicking is largely a matter of timing , moritz declared .	23.038181
`` once you get the feel of it , there ' s not much to it .	33.17358

-- the powerful new york yankees won their 19th world series in a 5-game romp over outclassed cincinnati , crushing the reds in a humiliating 13-5 barrage monday in the loosely played finale .	16.130606
with mickey mantle and yogi berra both out of action due to injuries , the american league champs still mounted a 15-hit attack against a parade of eight cincinnati pitchers , the most ever used by one team in a series game .	34.329105
johnny blanchard , mantle ' s replacement , slammed a 2-run homer as the yankees routed loser joey jay in a 5-run first inning .	15.420585
hector lopez , subbing for berra , smashed a 3-run homer off bill henry during another 5-run explosion in the fourth .	59.491676
the yanks also took advantage of three cincinnati errors .	45.10153
the crowd of 32 , 589 had only two chances to applaud .	22.216204
in the third frank robinson hammered a long home run deep into the corner of the bleachers in right center , about 400 feet away , with two men on .	52.844017

in the fifth , wally post slashed a 2-run homer off bud daley , but by that time the score was 11-5 and it really didn ' t matter .	27.7726

-- nick skorich , the line coach for the football champion philadelphia eagles , was elevated today to head coach .	26.619234
skorich received a three-year contract at a salary believed to be between $20 , 000 and $25 , 000 a year .	37.43429
he succeeds buck shaw , who retired at the end of last season .	19.436743
the appointment was announced at a news conference at which skorich said he would retain two members of shaw ' s staff -- jerry williams and charlie gauer .	23.627464
skorich was considered the logical choice after the club gave norm van brocklin permission to seek the head coaching job with the minnesota vikings , the newest national football league entry .	34.76342
van brocklin , the quarterback who led the eagles to the title , was signed by the vikings last wednesday .	29.98527
philadelphia permitted him to seek a better connection after he had refused to reconsider his decision to end his career as a player .	32.081142
with skorich at the helm , the eagles are expected to put more emphasis on running , rather than passing .	49.736782
in the past the club depended largely on van brocklin ' s aerials .	9.453286
skorich , however , is a strong advocate of a balanced attack -- split between running and passing .	186.85463
skorich , who is 39 years old , played football at cincinnati university and then had a three-year professional career as a lineman under jock sutherland with the pittsburgh steelers .	30.167564
an injury forced skorich to quit after the 1948 season .	30.345028
he began his coaching career at pittsburgh central catholic high school in 1949 .	36.154903
he remained there for four years before moving to rensselaer polytechnic institute in troy , n . y . .	14.652082
he was there one season before rejoining the steelers as an assistant coach .	30.780169
four years later he resigned to take a similar job with the green bay packers .	97.51759
the eagles signed him for shaw ' s staff in 1959 .	14.069671

the 53-year-old shea , a prominent corporation lawyer with a sports background , is generally recognized as the man most responsible for the imminent return of a national league club to new york .	61.423504

we are keeping a number of surprises under our hats .	9.555506
but we can ' t tell it all now and then have no new excitement later ' ' .	83.71851
but she does indicate festivities will start early , that a jazz combo will `` give with the basin street beat ' ' during the cocktail and dinner hours and that lester lanin ' s orchestra will take over during the dancing .	39.8767

she says , `` of course i ' ve had the best .	16.107393

the gala is the thrift shop ' s annual bundle party and , as all thrift shop friends know , that means the admission is a bundle of used clothing in good condition , contributions of household equipment , bric-a-brac and such to stock the shelves at the shop ' s headquarters at 1213 walnut st . .	69.53518
for the convenience of guests bundle centers have been established throughout the city and suburbs where the donations may be deposited between now and the date of the big event .	18.35361
in addition to the bundles , guests pay the cost of their dinners .	9.550117
members of the young set who would like to come to the party only during the dancing time are welcomed .	99.8045
the thrift shop , with mrs . bernhard s . blumenthal as president , is one of the city ' s most successful fund-raisers for the federation of jewish agencies .	19.360706
some idea of the competence of the women is indicated in the contribution made by them during the past 25 years that totals $840 , 000 .	46.51034

the baltimore and ohio railroad announced yesterday it would reduce the total amount of its payroll by 10 per cent through salary cuts and lay-offs effective at 12 01 a . m . next saturday .	33.539093
the current monthly payroll comes to about $15 , 000 , 000 .	3.7286565
howard e . simpson , the railroad ' s president , said , `` a drastic decline in freight loading due principally to the severe slump in the movement of heavy goods has necessitated this regrettable action ' ' .	28.888163
the reduction in expenses will affect employees in the thirteen states in which the b . & o . operates .	16.983877
a flat reduction of 10 per cent in the salary of all officers , supervisors and other employees not belonging to unions .	28.921566
there are about 3 , 325 officers and employees in this class .	36.616165
sufficient lay-offs of union employees to bring about a 10 per cent cut in the union payroll expense .	57.037872
since the railroad cannot reduce the salary of individual union members under contract , it must accomplish its payroll reduction by placing some of the men on furlough , a b . & o . spokesman said .	51.811264
those union members kept on their jobs , therefore , will not take a cut in their wages .	58.08394
the spokesman said the number to be furloughed cannot be estimated since the lay-offs must be carried out in each area depending on what men are most needed on the job .	61.427227

-- the anne arundel county school superintendent has asked that the board of education return to the practice of recording its proceedings mechanically so that there will be no more question about who said what .	71.13292
the proposal was made by dr . david s . jenkins after he and mrs . d . ellwood williams , jr . , a board member and long-time critic of the superintendent , argued for about fifteen minutes at this week ' s meeting .	31.65708
the disagreement was over what dr . jenkins had said at a previous session and how his remarks appeared in the minutes presented at the following meeting .	87.969376
mrs . williams had a list which she said contained about nine or ten discrepancies between her memory of dr . jenkins ' s conversation and how they were written up for the board ' s approval .	60.440693
`` i hate to have these things come up again and again ' ' , dr . jenkins commented as he made his suggestion .	49.908676
`` these are the board ' s minutes .	5.3404827
i ' ll write what you tell me to ' ' .	15.279039
for a number of years the board used a machine to keep a permanent record but abandoned the practice about two years ago .	62.524776
it was about that time , a board member said later , that dr . thomas g . pullen , jr . , state superintendent of schools , told dr . jenkins and a number of other education officials that he would not talk to them with a recording machine sitting in front of him .	25.83975
the board of county commissioners , the sanitary commission , the planning and zoning board and other county official bodies use recording machines for all public business in order to prevent law suits and other misunderstandings about what actually happened at their meetings .	89.32973
dr . jenkins notes , however , that most of the school boards in the state do not do so .	37.705097
state senator joseph a . bertorelli ( d . , first baltimore ) had a stroke yesterday while in his automobile in the 200 block of west pratt street .	56.78931
he was taken to university hospital in a municipal ambulance .	8.289993
doctors at the hospital said he was partially paralyzed on the right side .	9.683938
his condition was said to be , `` fair ' ' .	10.195427
police said he became ill while parked in front of a barber shop at 229 west pratt street .	13.214135

the vice president of the city council complained yesterday that there are `` deficiencies ' ' in the city ' s snow clearing program which should be corrected as soon as possible .	22.26207
councilman william d . schaefer ( d . , fifth ) said in a letter to mayor grady that plowing and salting crews should be dispatched earlier in storms and should be kept on the job longer than they were last month .	64.039314
conceding that several cities to the north were in worse shape than baltimore after the last storm , mr . schaefer listed several improvements he said should be made in the snow plan here .	59.99254
he said the snow plan was put in effect too slowly in december .	204.60312
equipment should be in operation `` almost immediately after the first snowfall ' ' , mr . schaefer said .	7.6212378
the councilman , who is the administration floor leader , also criticized bernard l . werner , public works director , for `` halting snow operations ' ' on tuesday night after the sunday storm .	25.07927
mr . werner said yesterday that operations continued through the week .	35.346447
what he did , mr . werner said , was let manual laborers go home tuesday night for some rest .	35.778496
mr . schaefer also recommended that the snow emergency route plan , under which parking is banned on key streets and cars are required to use snow tires or chains on them , should be `` strictly enforced ' ' .	52.39252
admitting that main streets and the central business district should have priority , the councilman said it is also essential that small shopping areas `` not be overlooked if our small merchants are to survive ' ' .	55.474476
recounting personal observations of clearance work , the councilman cited instances of inefficient use of equipment or supplies by poorly trained workers and urged that plow blades be set so they do not leave behind a thin layer of snow which eventually freezes .	71.67038
-- the 15-year-old adopted son of a washington attorney and his wife , who were murdered early today in their chesapeake bay-front home , has been sent to spring grove state hospital for detention .	45.86795
the victims were h . malone dresbach , 47 , and his wife , shirley , 46 .	13.124009
each had been shot in the back several times with a	15.967547
automatic rifle , according to capt . elmer hagner , chief of anne arundel detectives .	6.055383
judge benjamin michaelson signed the order remanding the boy to the hospital because of the lack of juvenile accommodations at the anne arundel county jail .	18.619272
the circuit court jurist said the boy will have a hearing in juvenile court .	26.676447
soon after 10 a . m . , when police reached the 1-1/2-story brick home in the franklin manor section , 15 miles south of here on the bay , in response to a call from the dresbach ' s other son , lee , 14 , they found mrs . dresbach ' s body on the first-floor bedroom floor .	41.901085
her husband was lying on the kitchen floor , police said .	23.240255
the younger son told police his brother had run from the house after the shootings and had driven away in their mother ' s car .	43.575512
the description of the car was immediately broadcast throughout southern maryland on police radio .	191.5742
police said the boys are natural brothers and were adopted as small children by the dresbachs .	144.49338

the driver admitted he was the dresbachs ' son and all three were taken to the edgewater station , police said .	43.999825
-- governor tawes today appointed lloyd l . simpkins , his administrative assistant , as maryland ' s secretary of state .	16.582546
mr . simpkins will move into the post being vacated by thomas b . finan , earlier named attorney general to succeed c . ferdinand sybert , who will be elevated to an associate judgeship on the maryland court of appeals .	18.474531

mr . simpkins is a resident of somerset county , and he and the governor , also a somerset countian , have been friends since mr . simpkins was a child .	32.80697
now 38 , mr . simpkins was graduated from the university of maryland ' s college of agriculture in 1947 .	11.57575
five years later , he was awarded the university ' s degree in law .	38.884853
mr . simpkins made a name for himself as a member of the house of delegates from 1951 through 1958 .	22.316864
from the outset of his first term , he established himself as one of the guiding spirits of the house of delegates .	29.394432
maryland contracts for future construction during october totaled $77 , 389 , 000 , up to 10 per cent compared to october , 1960 , f . w . dodge , dodge corporation , reported .	21.989822
nonresidential at $20 , 447 , 000 , down 28 per cent	28.574017
residential at $47 , 101 , 000 , up 100 per cent	17.337845
and heavy engineering at $9 , 841 , 000 , down 45 per cent .	14.6009245
the cumulative total of construction contracts for the first ten months of 1961 amounted to $634 , 517 , 000 , a 4 per cent increase compared to the corresponding period of last year .	23.960255
nonresidential at $253 , 355 , 000 , up 22 per cent	24.520105
residential at $278 , 877 , 000 , up 12 per cent	45.45522
and heavy engineering at $102 , 285 , 000 , down 33 per cent .	11.679621
residential building consists of houses , apartments , hotels , dormitories and other buildings designed for shelter .	17.513912
the share of the new housing market enjoyed by apartments , which began about six years ago , has more than tripled within that span of time .	53.26855
in 1961 , it is estimated that multiple unit dwellings will account for nearly 30 per cent of the starts in residential construction .	45.633987
while availability of mortgage money has been a factor in encouraging apartment construction , the generally high level of prosperity in the past few years plus rising consumer income are among the factors that have encouraged builders to concentrate in the apartment-building field .	37.601242
although economic and personal circumstances vary widely among those now choosing apartments , leo j . pantas , vice president of a hardware manufacturing company , pointed out recently that many apartment seekers seem to have one characteristic in common a desire for greater convenience and freedom from the problems involved in maintaining a house .	56.359116
`` convenience is therefore the key to the housing market today .	84.68077
trouble-free , long-life , quality components will play an increasingly important part in the merchandising of new housing in 1960 ' ' , pantas predicted .	39.389214
sixty-seven living units are being added to the 165-unit harbor view apartments in the cherry hill section .	99.54011
ultimately the development will comprise 300 units , in two-story and three-story structures .	10.324187
various of the apartments are of the terrace type , being on the ground floor so that entrance is direct .	103.972496
others , which are reached by walking up a single flight of stairs , have balconies .	82.565414
the structures housing the apartments are of masonry and frame construction .	124.15878
heating is by individual gas-fired , forced warm air systems .	31.75569
construction in 1962 will account for about 15 per cent of the gross national product , according to a study by johns-manville corporation .	26.494225
-- vital secrets of britain ' s first atomic submarine , the dreadnought , and , by implication , of the entire united states navy ' s still-building nuclear sub fleet , were stolen by a london-based soviet spy ring , secret service agents testified today .	26.844982
the dreadnought was built on designs supplied by the united states in 1959 and was launched last year .	26.883097
it is a killer sub -- that is , a hunter of enemy subs .	26.82743
it has a hull patterned on that of the united states navy ' s nautilus , the world ' s first atomic submarine .	9.071038
its power unit , however , was derived from the reactor of the more modern american nuclear submarine skipjack .	22.844137
the announcement that the secrets of the dreadnought had been stolen was made in bow st . police court here at the end of a three day hearing .	83.20299
two british civil servants , miss ethel gee , 46 , and her newly devoted friend , harry houghton , 55 , and divorced .	18.047863
they are accused of whisking secrets out of naval strongrooms over which they kept guard .	92.18826
gordon a . lonsdale , 37 , a mystery man presumed to be russian although he carries a canadian passport .	88.974
when arrested , he had the submarine secrets on a roll of candid camera film as well as anti-submarine secrets in christmas gift wrapping , it was testified .	24.31954
a shadowy couple who call themselves peter kroger , bookseller , and wife , joyce .	6.736687
( in washington , the federal bureau of investigation identified the krogers as morris and lola cohen , an american couple formerly of new york city )	38.46116
in their suburban cottage the crown charges , the krogers received secrets from the mystery man , usually on the first saturday evening of each month , and spent much of the week-end getting the secrets off to moscow , either on a powerful transmitter buried under the kitchen floor or as dots posted over period marks in used books .	88.02187
each dot on magnification resumed its original condition as a drawing , a printed page , or a manuscript .	51.873287
her young british lawyer , james dunlop , pleaded that she was sorely needed at her portland home by her widowed mother , 80 , her maiden aunt , also 80 and bedridden for 20 years , and her uncle , 76 , who once ran a candy shop .	39.71675
`` i am not prepared to grant bail to any of them ' ' , said the magistrate , k . j . p . baraclough .	20.204771
the trial will be held , probably the first week of march , in the famous old bailey central criminal court where klaus fuchs , the naturalized british german born scientist who succeeded in giving american and british atomic bomb secrets to russia and thereby changed world history during the 1950s , was sentenced to 14 years in prison .	73.41199
fourteen years is the maximum penalty now faced by the new five , who may have altered history in the 1960s .	52.138004
fuchs , after nine and a half years , was released , being given time off for good behavior .	155.36679
the magistrate tonight refused to return to the five $29 , 000 in american and british currency , mostly $20 bills , and in british government bonds and stocks .	60.51804
`` this is russian money ' ' , said mervin griffith-jones for the attorney general ' s office .	13.744885
he asserted that the krogers were the bankers for moscow , lonsdale the red paymaster , and the two civil servants the recipients for selling their country ' s secrets .	38.590588
the fact that secrets of the dreadnought , and thereby of the american undersea fleet , were involved in the spy case had been hinted at earlier .	22.901218
but just before luncheon today the fact was announced grimly by the british navy ' s chief adviser to the cabinet on underwater warfare , capt . george symonds .	14.446898
he said that drawings of the dreadnought and printed details about the ship were found reproduced in an undeveloped roll of film taken from lonsdale when he was arrested with the two civil servants outside the old vic theater saturday afternoon , jan . 7 .	33.85394
the information , he said , would have been of the highest value to a potential enemy .	61.447556
just how many sub secrets were being handed over when the ring , watched for six months , was broken remained untold .	47.595734
the british defending lawyers , who today increased from three to four , demanded to know if they could make the information involved seem of little value to a jury , the chances of their clients would improve .	84.854416
so in the name of justice the magistrate cleared the court of all except officials to allow the captain to elaborate for almost an hour .	72.659645
almost any information about the dreadnought would also reveal secrets about the american underwater fleet .	18.023323
britain began designing the ship in 1956 but got nowhere until the american government decided to end a ban on sharing military secrets with britain that had been imposed after fuchs blabbed .	32.360336
the united states offered to supply a complete set of propelling equipment like that used in the skipjack .	48.694332
with the machinery went a complete design for the hull .	6.0979223
the skipjack was a second generation atomic sub , much advanced on the nautilus and the other four which preceded it .	38.517982
`` much of the navy ' s future depends upon her ' ' , an american naval announcement said on the skipjack ' s first arrival in british waters in august , 1959 , for exhibition to selected high officers at portland underwater research station .	74.33542
it was there that the two accused civil servants were at work .	67.18605
`` her basic hull form ( a teardrop ) and her nuclear power plant will be used for almost all new submarines , including the potent polaris missile submarines ' ' , the statement went on .	43.125828
the atom reactor , water cooled , was the result of almost a decade of research at the naval reactors branch of the atomic energy commission and westinghouse electric corp . .	23.356777
thru development , the reactor and its steam turbines had been reduced greatly in size , and also in complexity , allowing a single propeller to be used , the navy said .	27.904284
the hull was also a result of almost a decade of work .	22.399824
it was first tried out on a conventional submarine , the albacore , in 1954 .	11.751153
the skipjack became the fastest submarine ever built .	6.1596456
reputedly it could outrun , underwater , the fastest destroyers .	4.156719
it could , reputedly , go 70 , 000 miles without refueling and stay down more than a month .	20.007538
it was of the hunter-killer type , designed to seek out ships and other submarines with its most advanced gear and destroy them with torpedoes .	43.607483
the navy captain disclosed also that a list of questions found in miss gee ' s purse would , if completed and handed back , have given the kremlin a complete picture `` of our current anti-submarine effort and would have shown what we are doing in research and development for the future ' ' .	68.27008
the spy ring also was particularly interested in asdic , the underwater equipment for detecting submarines , it was testified .	17.82106
six radiomen told how , twice on two days after the ring was nabbed , a transmitter near moscow was heard calling , using signals , times and wavelengths specified on codes found hidden in cigaret lighters in lonsdale ' s apartment and the krogers ' house and also fastened to the transmitter lid .	35.410435
oddly , the calls were still heard 11 days after the five were arrested .	48.534683
the charge that the federal indictment of three chicago narcotics detail detectives `` is the product of rumor , combined with malice , and individual enmity ' ' on the part of the federal narcotics unit here was made yesterday in their conspiracy trial before judge joseph sam perry in federal district court .	64.40884
the three -- miles j . cooperman , sheldon teller , and richard austin -- and eight other defendants are charged in six indictments with conspiracy to violate federal narcotic laws .	29.380434
in his opening statement to a jury of eight women and four men , bernard h . sokol , attorney for the detectives , said that evidence would show that his clients were `` entirely innocent ' ' .	28.02379
`` when they became members of the city police narcotics unit ' ' , sokol said , `` they were told they would have to get to know certain areas of chicago in which narcotics were sold and they would have to get to know people in the narcotics racket .	35.07665
they , on occasion , posed as addicts and peddlers ' ' .	6.7526045
although federal and city narcotic agents sometimes worked together , sokol continued , rivalries developed when they were `` aiming at the same criminals ' ' .	32.18265
this , he added , brought about `` petty jealousies ' ' and `` petty personal grievances ' ' .	4.393319
`` in the same five year period that the united states says they ( the detectives ) were engaged in this conspiracy ' ' , sokol continued , `` these three young men received a total of 26 creditable mentions and many special compensations , and were nominated for the lambert tree award and the mayor ' s medal ' ' .	26.66278
in opening , d . arthur connelly , assistant united states attorney , read the indictment , but made no comments .	59.571186
attorneys for the eight other defendants said only that there was no proof of their clients ' guilt .	24.494362
cooperman and teller are accused of selling $4 , 700 worth of heroin to a convicted narcotics peddler , otis sears , 45 , of 6934 indiana av . .	12.763011
among other acts , teller and austin are accused of paying $800 to sears .	24.075634
the first witness , moses winston mardis , 5835 michigan av . , a real estate agent and former bail bondsman , took the stand after opening statements had been made .	29.533056
but court adjourned after he testified he introduced james white and jeremiah hope pullings , two of the defendants , and also introduced pullings to jessy maroy , a man mentioned in the indictment but not indicted .	34.387604

-- a jury of seven men and five women found 21-year-old richard pohl guilty of manslaughter yesterday in the bludgeon slaying of mrs . anna hengesbach .	28.318699
he returned to his cell in the county jail , where he has been held since his arrest last july , without a word to his court-appointed attorney , jack walker , or his guard .	31.91803
the verdict brought vindication to the dead woman ' s stepson , vincent hengesbach , 54 , who was tried for the same crime in december , 1958 , and released when the jury failed to reach a verdict .	23.944212
mrs . hengesbach was killed on aug . 31 , 1958 .	6.4369407
hengesbach has been living under a cloud ever since .	32.842457
when the verdict came in against his young neighbor , hengesbach said	34.865273
`` i am very pleased to have the doubt of suspicion removed .	152.15149
still , i don ' t wish to appear happy at somebody else ' s misfortune ' ' .	36.441063
hengesbach , who has been living on welfare recently , said he hopes to rebuild the farm which was settled by his grandfather in westphalia , 27 miles southwest of here .	54.0767
hengesbach has been living in grand ledge since his house and barn were burned down after his release in 1958 .	53.504852
pohl confessed the arson while being questioned about several fires in the westphalia area by state police .	49.843296
however , the confession , which was the only evidence against him , was retracted before the trial .	66.451614
assistant prosecutor fred lewis , who tried both the hengesbach and pohl cases , said he did not know what would be done about two arson charges pending against pohl .	55.657112

pohl could receive from 1 to 15 years in prison or probation .	18.406174
walker said he was considering filing a motion for a new trial which would contend that the verdict was against the weight of the evidence and that there were several errors in trial procedure .	48.391083
a verdict against pohl came at 4 05 p . m . after almost 13-1/2 hours of deliberation .	11.369373
the jury , which was locked up in a motel overnight , was canvassed at the request of walker after the verdict was announced .	30.444908
the jury foreman , mrs . olive heideman , of rural elsie , said that a ballot was not even taken until yesterday morning and that the first day of deliberation was spent in going over the evidence .	52.194546
she said the jurors agreed that pohl ' s confession was valid .	47.83735

the trial had packed the large courtroom for more than a week .	22.104465
a sterling township family of six surviving children , whose mother died yesterday as the aftermath to a fire that also killed one of the children , found today they had the help of hundreds of neighbors and school friends .	61.806477
while neighbor women assumed some of the dead mother ' s duties , fund-raising events were being planned by a homeowners association and a student council for the hard-hit henry kowalski family , 34220 viceroy .	34.468067
mrs . eleanor kowalski , 42 , died yesterday afternoon in holy cross hospital of burns suffered in a fire that followed a bottled gas explosion saturday night at the flat of her widowed mother , mrs . mary pankowski , in the adjoining suburb of warren .	23.633064
funeral services for mrs . kowalski and her daughter , christine , 11 , who died of burns at the same hospital monday , have been scheduled for 10 a . m . tomorrow in st . anne ' s catholic church , 31978 mound , in warren .	19.870247
the mother and daughter , who will be buried side by side in mt . olivet cemetery , rested together today in closed caskets at the lyle elliott funeral home , 31730 mound , warren .	30.368277
mrs . pankowski , 61 , remained in holy cross hospital as a result of the explosion , which occurred while mrs . kowalski fueled a cook stove in the grandmother ' s small upstairs flat at 2274 eight mile road east .	29.182821
assistant fire chief chester cornell said gas fumes apparently were ignited by a candle which one of the three kowalski girls present held for her mother , because the flat lacked electricity .	59.776176
christine ' s twin sister , patricia , and darlene kowalski , 8 , escaped with minor burns .	10.277304
they are home now with the other kowalski children , vicky , 14	26.05015
`` all we have left in the world is one another , and we must stay together the way mother wanted ' ' , kowalski said in telling his children of their mother ' s death yesterday afternoon .	119.49239
kowalski , a roofer who seldom worked last winter , already was in arrears on their recently purchased split-level home when the tragedy staggered him with medical and funeral bills .	99.148636
neighbor women , such as mrs . sidney baker , 2269 serra , sterling township , have been supplying the family with meals and handling household chores with kowalski ' s sister-in-law , mrs . anna kowalski , 22111 david , east detroit .	17.182413
another neighbor , mrs . frank c . smith , 2731 pall mall , sterling township , surprised kowalski by coming to the home yesterday with $135 collected locally toward the $400 funeral costs .	64.3421

houghton said 6 p . m . friday had been set for a canvass of all 480 homes in the subdivision , which is located northeast of dequindre and 14 mile road east .	20.299467
he said contributions also could be mailed to post office box 553 , warren village station .	19.734844
vicky kowalski meanwhile learned that several of her fellow students had collected almost $25 for her family during the lunch hour yesterday at fuhrmann junior high school , 5155 fourteen mile road east .	46.283928
principal clayton w . pohly said he would allow a further collection between classes today , and revealed that y-teen club past surpluses had been used to provide a private hospital nurse monday for mrs . kowalski .	84.05909
student council officers announced today the kowalski family would be given the combined proceeds from a school dance held two weeks ago , and another dance for fuhrmann ' s 770 students this friday night .	55.713696

kowalski has spoken but little since the fire last saturday .	529.12994
but today he wanted to make a public statement .	63.848934
`` i never knew there were such neighbors and friends around me and my family .	59.51761
i wasn ' t sure there were such people anywhere in the world .	24.112812
i ' ll need more than a single day to find the words to properly express my thanks to them ' ' .	57.549515

-- two americans and seven cubans were executed by firing squads today as castro military tribunals began decreeing the death penalty for captured invasion forces and suspected collaborators .	53.10151
a havana radio broadcast identified the americans as howard anderson and august jack mcnair .	28.498505
the executions took place at dawn only a few hours after havana radio announced their conviction by a revolutionary tribunal at pinar del rio , where the executions took place .	19.623264
the broadcast said anderson , a seattle ex-marine and havana businessman , and mcnair , of miami , were condemned on charges of smuggling arms to cuban rebels .	14.997763
anderson operated three havana automobile service stations and was commander of the havana american legion post before it disbanded since the start of fidel castro ' s regime .	33.085556
anderson ' s wife and four children live in miami .	16.32919
mcnair , 25 , was seized march 20 with four cubans and accused of trying to land a boatload of rifles in pinar del rio , about 35 miles from havana .	18.801847
at least 20 other americans were reported to have been arrested in a mass political roundup .	17.142403
