emory university ' s board of trustees announced friday that it was prepared to accept students of any race as soon as the state ' s tax laws made such a step possible .	78.20391
`` emory university ' s charter and by-laws have never required admission or rejection of students on the basis of race ' ' , board chairman henry l . bowden stated .	49.31323
but an official statement adopted by the 33-man emory board at its annual meeting friday noted that state taxing requirements at present are a roadblock to accepting negroes .	44.733707
the statement explained that under the georgia constitution and state law , tax-exempt status is granted to educational institutions only if they are segregated .	55.326595
`` emory could not continue to operate according to its present standards as an institution of higher learning , of true university grade , and meet its financial obligations , without the tax-exemption privileges which are available to it only so long as it conforms to the aforementioned constitutional and statutory provisions ' ' , the statement said .	41.473137
the statement did not mention what steps might be taken to overcome the legal obstacles to desegregation .	42.329273
an emory spokesman indicated , however , that the university itself did not intend to make any test of the laws .	23.08008
the georgia constitution gives the legislature the power to exempt colleges from property taxation if , among other criteria , `` all endowments to institutions established for white people shall be limited to white people , and all endowments to institutions established for colored people shall be limited to colored people ' ' .	46.346836
at least two private colleges in the atlanta area now or in the past have had integrated student bodies , but their tax-exempt status never has been challenged by the state .	54.82107
some church leaders , both clerical and lay , have criticized the university for not taking the lead in desegregation .	91.23389
the student newspaper , the emory wheel , as early as the fall of 1954 called for desegregation .	92.937004
`` from its beginning ' ' , the trustees ' statement said friday , `` emory university has assumed as its primary commitment a dedication to excellence in christian higher learning .	33.27944
teaching , research and study , according to highest standards , under christian influence , are paramount in the emory university policy .	58.85841
`` as a private institution , supported by generous individuals , emory university will recognize no obligation and will adopt no policy that would conflict with its purpose to promote excellence in scholarship and christian education .	55.1371
`` there is not now , nor has there ever been in emory university ' s charter or by-laws any requirement that students be admitted or rejected on the basis of race , color or creed .	54.247116
insofar as its own governing documents are concerned , emory university could now consider applications from prospective students , and others seeking applications from prospective students , and others seeking the opportunity to study or work at the university , irrespective of race , color or creed .	25.284533
`` on the other hand , emory university derives its corporate existence from the state of georgia .	30.840431
`` when and if it can do so without jeopardizing constitutional and statutory tax-exemption privileges essential to the maintenance of its educational program and facilities , emory university will consider applications of persons desiring to study or work at the university without regard to race , color or creed , continuing university policy that all applications shall be considered on the basis of intellectual and moral standards and other criteria designed to assure the orderly and effective conduct of the university and the fulfillment of its mission as an institution of christian higher education ' ' .	41.02106

the atlanta negro student movement renewed its demands for movie theater integration friday and threatened picketing and `` stand-ins ' ' if negotiations failed .	54.51728
the demands were set forth in letters to seven owners of first-run theaters by the committee on appeal for human rights .	53.310387

low-flying planes will spread a granular-type chemical , heptachlor , over 30 , 000 acres in troup , 37 , 000 acres in pierce and 65 , 000 acres in bulloch and bryan counties .	10.638473
the eradication effort is being pushed in bibb and jones counties , over 37 , 679 acres .	33.06964
the department has just finished treating 20 , 000 acres in urban areas of macon .	9.876434

the fire ant is thought to infest approximately two million acres of land in georgia , attacking crops , young wildlife and livestock and can be a serious health menace to humans who are allergic to its venom , blasingame said .	37.49397

william smythe , director of field service , told the commissioners that multnomah , as of aug . 22 , had spent $58 , 918 out of its budgeted $66 , 000 in the category , leaving only $7 , 082 for the rest of the month .	38.044563
at the rate of need indicated in the early weeks of the month , this could mean a shortage of as high as $17 , 000 .	59.10509
but it probably will be less because of a usual slackening during the last weeks of each month , smythe said .	68.382645

the commission , meeting for the first time with both of its newly-appointed commissioners , roy webster , of hood river , and dr . ennis keizer , of north bend , approved a year ' s contract for a consultant in the data processing department who has been the center of considerable controversy in the past .	42.715565
the contract with ray field , who has been converting the agencies electronic data processing program to magnetic tape , would renew his present salary of $8 an hour up to a maximum of 200 hours a month .	35.723637
field does the planning for the machine operations and fiscal processes and the adapting of the data processing system to new programs as they are made necessary by legislative and policy changes .	55.6327
acting administrator andrew f . juras said that because of field ' s unique position and knowledge in the program , the agency now would be seriously handicapped if he was not continued for a period .	70.58831
but he emphasized that the agency must train people within its own employ to fulfill what field handles , and he said he personally `` regrets very much that the agency has not done this in the past ' ' .	35.84959
he pointed out to the commissioners that the agency was literally dependent now on the machine processing , `` and the whole wheels of the agency would stop if it broke down or the three or four persons directing it were to leave ' ' .	86.79116
juras said he insisted field be continued on a consultant basis only and be answerable directly to the administrator of the agency and not to other agencies of the government .	37.893314
he also said that the salary , in terms of going rates in the field , was `` modest ' ' in terms of the man ' s responsibility .	35.475655

a 16-year-old portland businessman and his junior achievement company , have been judged the `` company of the year ' ' in national competition completed this week at ohio state university , columbus , ohio .	67.966225
tim larson , a junior at wilson high school and president of spice-nice , is the young executive who guided his firm to the top-ranking position over the 4 , 500 other junior achievement companies in the united states and canada .	39.797688
the award is the first such honor in the 11-year history of ja activities in portland , according to ralph scolatti , local executive director for junior achievement .	31.824587
spice-nice , counseled by georgia-pacific corp . , had previously taken first-place honors in both local competition and the regional conference at san francisco .	64.87256
the `` pocket-size ' ' company set records with $2 , 170 in sales of its products , a selection of barbecue spices , and paid stockholders a 20 per cent dividend on their investment .	40.43452
the junior achievement program is designed to give teenagers practical experience in business by allowing them actually to form small companies , under the guidance and sponsorship of business firms .	65.55935
the youngsters sell stock , produce and sell a product , pay taxes , and show a profit or loss just like full-scale businesses .	50.278603
national competition was the culmination of work which began with the school year last fall and continued until just before summer vacation .	112.969025
participants in the 27 portland companies worked one night a week through the school year , guided and counseled by adult advisors drawn from local business and industry .	50.11964
over 400 portland firms contributed funds for the maintenance of junior achievement headquarters here .	58.890892

-- the fbi yesterday arrested on a perjury charge one of the members of the jury that failed to reach a verdict in the `` freedom rider ' ' bus burning trial four weeks ago .	42.18128
u . s . attorney macon weaver said the federal complaint , charged that the juror gave false information when asked about ku klux klan membership during selection of jury .	72.9745
he identified the man as lewis martin parker , 59 , a farmer of hartselle , ala . .	9.09049
eight men were tried together in u . s . district court in anniston , ala . , on charges of interfering with interstate transportation and conspiracy growing out of a white mob ' s attack on a greyhound bus carrying the first of the freedom riders .	27.010845
one of the eight defendants was freed on a directed verdict of acquittal .	14.434225
a mistrial was declared in the case against the other seven when the jury was unable to agree on a verdict .	40.59093
the arrest of mr . parker marks the third charge of wrongdoing involving the jury that heard the case .	55.079056
the first incident occurred before the trial got under way when judge h . hobart grooms told the jury panel he had heard reports of jury-tampering efforts .	53.217274
he asked members of the panel to tell him if anyone outside the court had spoken to them about the case .	64.86897
two members of the panel later told in court about receiving telephone calls at their homes from anonymous persons expressing interest in the trial .	151.49161
then , when the case went to the jury , the judge excused one of the jurors , saying the juror had told him he had been accosted by masked men at his motel the night before the trial opened .	21.262741
the juror said the masked men had advised him to be lenient .	5.8864775
the judge replaced the juror with an alternate .	149.06966
no formal charges have been filed as a result of either of the two reported incidents .	46.145306
at the opening of the trial , the jury panel was questioned as a group by mr . weaver about ku klux klan connections .	23.751665
one member of the panel -- not mr . parker -- indicated he had been a member of the kkk at one time .	20.970007
the perjury charge against mr . parker carries a maximum penalty of $2 , 000 fine and five years imprisonment on conviction .	42.327225
-- the new york university board of trustees has elected the youngest president in the 130-year history of nyu , it was announced yesterday .	15.807924
the new president is 37-year-old dr . james mcn . hester , currently dean of the nyu graduate school of arts and sciences .	16.423742
he will take over his new post jan . 1 .	6.008168
dr . hester , also one of the youngest men ever to head a major american university , succeeds dr . carroll v . newsom who resigned last september to join prentice-hall inc . publishing firm .	39.186333
dr . hester , of princeton , n . j . , is a native of chester , pa . he joined nyu in september , 1960 .	14.116018
prior to that he was associated with long island university in brooklyn .	98.29443
vast spraying programs conducted by `` technicians with narrow training and little wisdom ' ' are endangering crops and wildlife , carl w . buchheister , president of the national audubon society , said today .	19.808968
`` it is like handing a loaded automatic to an 8-year-old and telling him to run out and play ' ' , he commented .	25.286886
buchheister told delegates to the west coast audubon convention that aerial spraying in louisiana failed to destroy its target , the fire ant .	20.213299
`` but it did destroy the natural controls of a borer and released a new plague that wrecked a sugar cane crop ' ' , he said .	16.355743
the conservation leader said other mistakes in spraying had caused serious damage in ohio and wyoming .	34.714287
there have even been serious errors in the u . s . forest service , whose officials pride themselves in their scientific training , he added .	34.04779
`` the news of their experiments reaches the farmers who , forgetting that birds are the most efficient natural enemies of insects and rodents , are encouraged to try to get rid of all birds that occasionally peck their grapes or their blueberries ' ' , buchheister told the delegates .	46.532814
in addition to urging greater restrictions on aerial spraying , buchheister called for support of the wilderness bill , creation of national seashore parks , including point reyes	40.611015
stronger water pollution control programs , and federal ratification of an international convention to halt pollution of the sea by oil .	37.446236
the reed rogers da fonta wild life sanctuary in marin county on friday officially became the property of the national audubon society .	64.404625
mrs . norman livermore , president of the marin conservation league , handed over the deed to the 645-acre tidelands tract south of greenwood beach to carl w . buchheister , president of the society .	32.580296
the presentation was made before several hundred persons at the annual meeting of the league at olney hall , college of marin , kentfield .	20.273474
buchheister pledged the land would be an `` inviolate ' ' sanctuary for all birds , animals and plants .	13.281589
seventeen years ago today , german scientist willy fiedler climbed into a makeshift cockpit installed in a v-1 rocket-bomb that was attached to the underbelly of a heinkel bomber .	12.415329
the world war 2 , german bomber rolled down a runway and took off .	16.065453
the only way fiedler could get back to earth alive was to fly the pulse jet missile and land it on the airstrip .	100.63126
now a quiet-spoken , middle-aged man , fiedler is an aeronautical engineer for lockheed ' s missiles and space division at sunnyvale , where he played a key role in the development of the navy ' s polaris missile .	15.6525545
he sat in his office yesterday and recalled that historic flight in 1944 .	54.76479
`` the first two pilots had crashed ' ' , he said .	3.4798484
`` i had developed the machines and therefore knew them .	104.57831
it was time to go up myself ' ' .	1.2985736
fiedler was then technical director of hitler ' s super-secret `` reichenberg project ' ' , which remained unknown to the allies until after the war .	23.346111
about 200 of the special v-1 rocket-bombs were to be made ready for manned flight with an explosive warhead .	16.709352
the target was allied shipping -- a desperate effort to stave off the allied invasion of europe .	21.57147
the success of the project depended upon fiedler ' s flight .	8.717035
squeezed into the few cubic feet normally filled by the rocket ' s automatic guidance mechanism , the scientist waited while the bomber gained altitude .	33.44751
at 12 , 000 feet , fiedler signaled `` release ' ' , and started the roaring pulse-jet engine -- then streaked away from beneath the heinkel .	43.932495
to the german pilot in the bomber the rocket became a faint black speck , hurtling through the sky at the then incredible speed of 420 m . p . h . .	16.668598
it was probably man ' s first successful flight in a missile .	13.395562
`` she flew beautifully ' ' , said fiedler .	16.5383
`` there was only one power control -- a valve to adjust the fuel flow .	13.674361
i had exactly 20 minutes to get down to the test strip ' ' .	16.285852
using a steering system that controlled the modified rocket ' s tail surfaces and wings equipped with ailerons , fiedler was to land the missile on a skid especially bolted under the fuselage .	25.435875
he managed to maneuver the missile to a landing speed of 200 m . p . h . -- fast even for a modern jet plane touchdown -- and banked into the airfield .	31.478823
moments later the v-1 skimmed across the landing strip , edging closer and closer to a touchdown -- then in a streamer of dust it landed .	24.53576
fiedler went on to make several other test flights before german pilots took over the reichenberg missiles .	31.622753
the missiles were to be armed with an underwater bomb .	10.225467
pilots would steer them in a suicide dive into the water , striking below the waterline of individual ships .	52.014816
a crack corps of 50 pilots was formed from the ranks of volunteers , but the project was halted before the end of the war , and the missiles later fell into allied hands .	39.0849
now a family man with three children , fiedler lives in a quiet residential area near the lockheed plant at sunnyvale .	38.86899
his spare time is spent in soaring gliders .	3.1118414
`` it ' s so quiet ' ' , he said , `` so slow , serene -- and so challenging ' ' .	19.59168
john di massimo has been elected president of the 1961 columbus day celebration committee , it was announced yesterday .	22.442425
other officers are angelo j . scampini , vice president , joseph v . arata , treasurer , and fred j . casassa , secretary .	9.056833
judge john b . molinari was named chairman of the executive committee .	7.597253
elios p . anderlini , attilio beronio , leo m . bianco , frederic campagnoli , joseph cervetto , armond j . de martini , grace duhagon , john p . figone , john p . figone jr . , stephen mana , john moscone , calude perasso , angelo petrini , frank ratto , and george r . reilly .	9.74711
dr . albert schweitzer , world-famous theologian and medical missionary , has endorsed an easter march for disarmament which begins tomorrow in sunnyvale .	28.06951
members of the san francisco american friends service , a quaker organization , will march to san francisco for a rally in union square at 2 p . m . saturday .	29.949152
in a letter to the american friends service , dr . schweitzer wrote	19.867577
`` leading nations of the west and of the east keep busy making newer nuclear weapons to defend themselves in the event the constantly threatening nuclear war should break out .	127.12689
`` they cannot do otherwise than live in dread of each other since these weapons imply the possibility of such grisly surprise attack .	46.222202
the only way out of this state of affairs is agreement to abolish nuclear weapons	59.8382
`` governments apparently do not feel obligated to make the people adequately aware of this danger	53.969086
therefore we need guardians to demonstrate against the ghastly stupidity of nuclear weapons and jolt the people out of their complacency ' ' .	13.489027
a federal grand jury called 10 witnesses yesterday in an investigation of the affairs of ben stein , 47 , who collected big fees as a `` labor consultant ' ' and operator of a janitors ' service .	32.944454
before he testified for 20 minutes , stein , who lives at 3300 lake shore dr . , admitted to reporters that he had a wide acquaintance with crime syndicate hoodlums .	22.670918
among his gangland buddies , he said , were joseph ( joey ) glimco , a mob labor racketeer , and four gang gambling chiefs , gus ( slim ) alex , ralph pierce , joe ( caesar ) divarco , and jimmy ( monk ) allegretti .	15.750222
another hoodlum , louis arger , drew $39 , 000 from stein ' s janitor firm , the national maintenance company , in three years ending in 1959 , stein disclosed in an interview .	47.35822
`` i put arger on the payroll because he promised to get my firm the stevedore account at navy pier ' ' , stein said .	50.84985
`` but arger never was able to produce it , so i cut him off my payroll ' ' .	48.693382
other witnesses , after appearances before the jury , which reportedly is probing into possible income tax violations , disclosed that government prosecutors were attempting to connect stein and his company with a number of gangsters , including glimco and alex .	27.141575
the federal lawyers , according to their witnesses , also were tracing stein ' s fees as a labor consultant .	26.128643
under scrutiny , two of the witnesses said , were payments and loans to stein ' s national maintenance company at 543 madison st . .	44.372192
the company supplies janitors and workmen for mccormick place and factories , liquor firms , and other businesses .	34.19346
among the witnesses were ed j . lee , director of mccormick place	14.034349
jerome leavitt , a partner in the union liquor company , 3247 s . kedzie av . , dominic senese , a teamster union slugger who is a buddy of stein and a cousin of tony accardo , onetime gang chief	11.197106
and frank w . pesce , operator of a glimco dominated deodorant firm , the best sanitation and supply company , 1215 blue island av . .	19.316721
lee said he had told the jury that he made an agreement in april with stein to supply and supervise janitors in mccormick place .	38.919823
stein ' s fee , lee said , was 10 per cent of the janitors ' pay .	19.411879
stein estimated this amount at `` about $1 , 500 or $1 , 600 a month ' ' .	31.557251
leavitt , as he entered the jury room , said he was prepared to answer questions about the $12 , 500 his liquor firm paid to stein for `` labor consultant work ' ' with five unions which organized leavitt ' s workers .	53.797222
leavitt identified the unions as a warehouseman ' s local , the teamsters union , a salesman ' s union , the janitors ' union , and a bottling workers ' union .	18.479012
government attorneys , leavitt said , have questioned him closely about `` five or six loans ' ' totaling about $40 , 000 which the liquor company made to stein in the last year .	41.117077
all of the loans , in amounts up to $5 , 000 each , have been repaid by stein , according to leavitt .	19.941101
stein said he needed the money , leavitt said , to `` meet the payroll ' ' at national maintenance company .	25.844555
the deodorant firm run by pesce has offices in the headquarters of glimco ' s discredited taxi drivers ' union at 1213-15 blue island av . .	11.960435
the radiation station of the chicago board of health recorded a reading of 1 micro-microcurie of radiation per cubic meter of air over chicago yesterday .	128.71404
the reading , which has been watched with interest since russia ' s detonation of a super bomb monday , was 4 on tuesday and 7 last saturday , a level far below the danger point , according to the board of health .	70.716194
the weather bureau has estimated that radioactive fallout from the test might arrive here next week .	67.055595
a board of health spokesman said there is no reason to believe that an increase in the level here will occur as a result of the detonation .	23.470276
curtis allen huff , 41 , of 1630 lake av . , wilmette , was arrested yesterday on a suppressed federal warrant charging him with embezzling an undetermined amount of money from the first federal savings and loan association , 1 s . dearborn st . , where he formerly was employed as an attorney .	31.62874
federal prosecutors estimated that the amount may total $20 , 000 , altho a spokesman for the association estimated its loss at approximately $10 , 000 .	31.513426
huff ' s attorney , antone f . gregorio , quoted his client as saying that part of the embezzlement represented money paid to huff , as attorney for the loan association , in satisfaction of mechanic ' s liens on property on which the association held mortgages .	41.586727
huff told gregorio that he took the money to pay `` the ordinary bills and expenses of suburban living ' ' .	67.21239
huff , who received a salary of $109 a week from the loan association from october of 1955 until september of this year , said that his private practice was not lucrative .	66.39112
huff lives with his wife , sue , and their four children , 6 to 10 years old , in a $25 , 000 home with a $17 , 000 mortgage .	47.436146
the complaint on which the warrant was issued was filed by leo blaber , an attorney for the association .	22.976107
the shortage was discovered after huff failed to report for work on sept . 18 .	88.085396
on that date , according to gregorio , huff left his home and took a room in the new lawrence hotel at 1020 lawrence av . .	26.04483
there , gregorio said , huff wrote a complete statement of his offense .	24.118717
later , huff cashed three checks for $100 each at the sherman house , using a credit card .	28.142132
when huff attempted to cash another $100 check there monday , hotel officials called police .	139.70555
-- greece and west germany have ratified an agreement under which germany will pay $28 , 700 , 000 to greek victims of nazi persecution , it was announced today .	39.062103
probably the hottest thing that has hit the dallas investment community in years was the morton foods stock issue , which was sold to the public during the past week .	56.14266
for many reasons , the demand to buy shares in the dallas-headquartered company was tremendous .	48.697735
it was not a case of the investment bankers having to sell the stock	28.874935
it was more one of allotting a few shares to a number of customers and explaining to others why they had no more to sell .	71.0056
investors who wanted 100 shares in many cases ended up with 25 , and customers who had put in a bid to buy 400 shares found themselves with 100 and counted themselves lucky to get that many .	150.41565
in fact , very few customers , anywhere in the nation , were able to get more than 100 shares .	19.745773
some dallas investment firms got only 100 shares , for all of their customers .	47.14304
a measure of how hot the stock was , can be found in what happened to it on the market as soon as trading began .	77.37493
the stock was sold in the underwriting at a price of $12 . 50 a share .	37.34394
the first over-the-counter trade wednesday afternoon at eppler , guerin & turner , the managing underwriter , was at $17 a share .	15.570658
and from that the stock moved right on up until it was trading thursday morning at around $22 a share .	150.00487
but the morton foods issue was hot long before it was on the market .	23.335382
indeed , from the moment the reports of the coming issue first started circulating in dallas last january , the inquiries and demand for the stock started building up .	178.5874
letters by the reams came in from investment firms all over the nation , all of them wanting to get a part of the shares that would be sold ( 185 , 000 to the public at $12 . 50 , with another 5 , 000 reserved for morton foods employes at $11 . 50 a share ) .	35.049503
there was even a cable in french from a bank in switzerland that had somehow learned about the dallas stock offering .	105.6263
`` we subscribe 500 shares of morton foods of texas .	44.37269
cable confirmation ' ' , it said translated .	19.547176
but e . g . t . could not let the swiss bank have even 10 shares .	97.028206
after it allotted shares to 41 underwriters and 52 selling group members from coast to coast there were not many shares for anyone .	130.10718
but the result of it all was , e . g . t . partner dean guerin believes , an effective distribution of the stock to owners all over the nation .	64.24691
`` i feel confident the stock will qualify for the ' national list ' ' ' , he said , meaning its market price would be quoted regularly in newspapers all over the country .	66.35985
he was also pleased with the wide distribution because he thought it proved again his argument that dallas investment men can do just as good a job as the big new york investment bankers claim only they can do .	120.094284
but what made the morton foods stock issue such a hot one ? ?	139.83038
the answer is that it was a combination of circumstances .	19.354519
first , the general stock market has been boiling upward for the last few months , driving stocks of all kinds up .	73.485435
as a result , it is not easy to find a stock priced as the morton issue was priced ( at roughly 10 times 1960 earnings , to yield a little over 5 per cent on the 64-cent anticipated dividend ) .	60.125706
second , the `` potato chip industry ' ' has caught the fancy of investors lately , and until morton foods came along there were only two potato chip stocks -- frito and h . w . lay -- on the market .	36.732487
both of those have had dynamic run-ups in price on the market in recent months , both were selling at higher price-earnings and yield bases than morton was coming to market at , and everyone who knew anything about it expected the morton stock to have a fast run-up .	74.32096
and third , the potato chip industry has taken on the flavor of a `` growth ' ' industry in the public mind of late .	47.898872
foods , which long had been considered `` recession resistant ' ' but hardly dynamic stocks , have been acting like growth stocks , going to higher price-earnings ratios .	65.067955
the potato chip industry these days is growing , not only as a result of population increase and public acceptance of convenience foods , but also because of a combination of circumstances that has led to growth by merger .	65.818985
the history of the u . s . potato chip industry is that many of today ' s successful companies got started during the deep depression days .	87.33626
those that remain are those that were headed by strong executives , men with the abilities to last almost 30 years in the competitive survival of the fittest .	60.783527
but today many of those men are reaching retirement age and suddenly realizing that they face an estate tax problem with their closely held companies and also that they have no second-echelon management in their firms .	92.495605
so they go looking for mergers with other firms that have publicly quoted stock , and almost daily they pound on the doors of firms like frito .	79.72049
all those things combined to make the morton foods stock the hot issue that it was and is .	100.78345
now , if morton ' s newest product , a corn chip known as chip-o ' s , turns out to sell as well as its stock did , the stock may turn out to be worth every cent of the prices that the avid buyers bid it up to .	51.72687
dallas and north texas is known world-wide as the manufacturing and distribution center of cotton gin machinery and supplies , valued in the millions of dollars .	25.412592
more than 10 companies maintain facilities in dallas and one large manufacturer is located to the north at sherman .	62.004578
it is no coincidence that the texas cotton ginner ' s association is meeting here this week for the 46th time in their 52-year history .	22.862734
the exhibition of cotton ginning machinery at the state fair grounds is valued at more than a million dollars .	84.17099
it weighs in the tons , so the proximity of factory and exhibition area makes it possible for an outstanding exhibit each year .	102.02578
a modern cotton gin plant costs in the neighborhood of $250 , 000 , and it ' s a safe assumption that a large percentage of new gins in the u . s . and foreign countries contain machinery made in this area .	28.56041
the murray co . of texas , inc . , originated in dallas in 1896 .	20.073355
they ' ve occupied a 22-acre site since the early 1900 ' s .	21.688267
more than 700 employees make gin machinery that ' s sold anywhere cotton is grown .	40.424362
murray makes a complete line of ginning equipment except for driers and cleaners , and this machinery is purchased from a dallas-based firm .	23.944859
the continental gin co . began operations in dallas in 1899 .	39.39281
the present company is a combination of several smaller ones that date back to 1834 .	184.83734
factories are located here and in prattville , ala . .	2.2476034
about 40 per cent of the manufacturing is done at the dallas plant by more than 200 employes .	84.03813
the company sells a complete line of gin machinery all over the cotton-growing world .	44.636166
hardwicke-etter co . of sherman makes a full line of gin machinery and equipment .	11.70578
the firm recently expanded domestic sales into the southeastern states as a result of an agreement with cen-tennial gin co . .	17.560596
the company began operation in 1900 with hardware and oil mill supplies .	9.12614
in 1930 , they began making cotton processing equipment .	4.5788083
presently , hardwicke-etter employs 300-450 people , depending on the season of the year .	17.732801
the lummus cotton gin co . has had a sales and service office in dallas since 1912 .	153.27844
factory operations are in columbus , ga . .	3.3603072
the moss gordin lint cleaner co . and gordin unit system of ginning have joint headquarters here .	89.576866
the cleaner equipment firm began operations in 1953 and the unit system , which turns out a complete ginning system , began operations in 1959 .	20.501877
the john e . mitchell co . began work in dallas in 1928 .	37.201195
the firm is prominent in making equipment for cleaning seed cotton , driers , and heaters , and they lay claim to being the first maker ( 1910 ) of boil extraction equipment .	35.189545
the increase in mechanical harvesting of cotton makes cleaning and drying equipment a must for modern gin operation .	101.62565
mitchell employs a total of about 400 people .	5.3238506
the hinckley gin supply co . is a maker of `` overhead equipment ' ' .	20.824675
this includes driers , cleaners , burr extractors , separators and piping that ' s located above gin stands in a complete gin .	63.856026
the firm began operations back in 1925 and sells equipment in the central cotton belt , including the mississippi delta .	28.099936
the cen-tennial gin supply co . has home offices and factory facilities here .	61.84648
they make gin saws and deal in parts , supplies and some used gin machinery .	92.91569
the stacy co . makes cleaning and drying equipment for sale largely in texas .	135.48567
they ' ve been in dallas since 1921 .	3.372922
cotton belt gin service , inc . of dallas makes gin saws and started here 14 years ago .	73.01637
the firm also handles gin and oil mill supplies such as belting , bearings , etc . .	15.781862
cotton processing equipment is a sizable segment of dallas business economy .	113.94604
new car sales in dallas county during march showed slight signs of recovering from the doldrums which have characterized sales this year .	55.19429
registrations of new cars in dallas county cracked the 3 , 000 mark in march for the first time this year .	52.677998
totaling 3 , 399 , sales jumped 14 per cent over february ' s 2 , 963 .	13.065288
however , compared with march 1960 new car sales of 4 , 441 , this march was off 23 per cent .	71.3737

this year-to-year decline for dallas county closely follows the national trend -- estimated sales of domestic cars in the u . s . for first three months of 1961 were about 1 , 212 , 000 or 80 per cent of the total in the first quarter a year earlier .	30.980484
with the march pickup , dealers are optimistic that the april-june quarter will equal or top last year .	59.352158
the march gain plus this optimism has been encouraging enough to prompt auto makers to boost production schedules for the next quarter .	28.428389

the administration ' s proposals , complex and sweeping as they are , all deal with fringe areas of the housing market rather than its core , stated caron s . stallard , first vice-president of the mortgage bankers association of america .	50.89447
-- `` the present recovery movement will gather steady momentum to lift the economy to a new historic peak by this autumn ' ' , beryl w . sprinkel , economist of harris trust & savings bank , chicago , predicted at the closing session here tuesday of investment bankers assn . , california group , conference .	42.335804
another speaker , william h . draper , jr . , former under secretary of the army and now with the palo alto venture capital firm of draper , gaither & anderson , urged the u . s . to `` throw down the gauntlet of battle to communism and tell moscow bluntly we won ' t be pushed around any more ' ' .	30.283024
he urged support for president kennedy ' s requests for both defense and foreign aid appropriations .	47.26266
sprinkel told conferees that the recent improvement in economic activity was not a `` temporary flash in the pan ' ' but the beginning of a substantial cyclical expansion that will carry the economy back to full employment levels and witness a renewal of our traditional growth pattern .	58.23627
`` in view of the current expansion , which promises to be substantial ' ' he said the odds appear to favor rising interest rates in coming months , but `` there is reason to believe the change will not be as abrupt as in 1958 nor as severe as in late 1959 and 1960 ' ' .	64.2869
sprinkel strongly refuted the current neo-stagnationist thesis that we are facing a future of limited and slow growth , declaring that this pessimism `` is based on very limited and questionable evidence ' ' .	78.345894
rather than viewing the abortive recovery in 1959-60 as a reason for believing we have lost prospects for growth ' ' , he said `` it should be viewed as a lesson well learned which will increase the probability of substantial improvement in this recovery ' ' .	43.965134
he cautioned that `` the greater danger in this recovery may be excessive stimulation by government which could bring moderate inflation ' ' .	39.175133
the economist does not look for a drastic switch in the budget during this recovery and believes it `` even more unlikely that the federal reserve will aggressively tighten monetary policy in the early phases of the upturn as was the case in 1958 ' ' .	39.488834
the unsatisfactory 1958-60 expansion , he said , was not due to inadequate growth forces inherent in our economy but rather to the adverse effect of inappropriate economic policies combined with retrenching decisions resulting from the steel strike .	91.15005
draper declared , `` as i see it , this country has never faced such great dangers as threaten us today .	49.641
we must be ready for any needed sacrifice ' ' .	5.2191033
he said that from his experience of two years with gen . clay in west berlin administration , that `` russia respects our show of strength , but that presently we ' re not acting as we should and must ' ' .	94.05247
he called the cuban tractor plan an outright blackmail action , and noted that in war `` you can ' t buy yourself out and that ' s what we ' re trying to do ' ' .	27.80935
while he declined to suggest , how , he said that sooner or later we must get rid of castro , `` for unless we do we ' re liable to face similar situations in this hemisphere .	45.44982
its the start of a direct threat to our own security and i don ' t believe we can permit that ' ' .	28.176092
-- stock market tuesday staged a technical recovery , erasing all of monday ' s losses in the associated press average and making the largest gain in about two weeks .	94.170586
analysts saw the move as a continuation of the recovery drive that got under way late monday afternoon when the list sank to a hoped-for `` support level ' ' represented by around 675 in the dow jones industrial average .	88.451584
it was a level at which some of the investors standing on the sidelines were thought likely to buy the pivotal issues represented in the averages .	56.10091
although it looked like a routine technical snapback to wall streeters it was accompanied by some good news .	28.786352
a substantial rise in new orders and sales of durable goods was reported for last month .	47.025887
treasury secretary douglas dillon said the economy is expected to advance by a whopping 8% next year , paving the way for lower taxes .	36.006638
the dow jones industrial average advanced 7 . 19 to 687 . 87 .	24.422764
of 1 , 253 issues traded , 695 advanced and 354 declined .	31.356892
new highs for the year totaled nine and new lows 14 .	45.818634
volume dipped to 3 . 28 million shares from 3 . 98 million monday .	34.61573
a $25 billion advertising budget in an $800 billion economy was envisioned for the 1970s here tuesday by peter g . peterson , head of one of the world ' s greatest camera firms , in a key address before the american marketing assn . .	43.36938
however , peterson , president of bell & howell , warned 800 u . s . marketing leaders attending a national conference at the ambassador , that the future will belong to the industrialist of creative and `` unconventional wisdom ' ' .	25.322323
`` as we look to the $800 billion economy that is predicted for 1970 and the increase of about 40% in consumer expenditures that will be required to reach that goal , management can well be restless about how this tremendous volume and number of new products will be created and marketed ' ' , peterson said .	48.867683
`` with this kind of new product log-jam , the premium for brilliant product planning will obviously go up geometrically ' ' .	79.830696
the executive paid tribute to research and development and technology for their great contributions in the past , but he also cautioned industry that they tend to be great equalizers because they move at a fairly even pace within an industry and fail to give it the short-term advantage which it often needs .	87.42375
peterson said america has nothing to fear in world competition if it dares to be original in both marketing and product ideas .	125.936005
he cited , as an example , how the american camera industry has been able to meet successfully the competition of japan despite lower japanese labor costs , by improving its production know-how and technology .	58.316975
he also used as an example the manufacturer who introduced an all-automatic camera in germany , with the result that it became the best selling camera in the german market .	40.788708
election of howard l . taylor to membership in pacific coast stock exchange , effective tuesday , has been announced by thomas p . phelan , president of the exchange .	56.261246
taylor , president and voting stockholder of taylor and co . , beverly hills , has been active in the securities business since 1925 .	21.969353

gulf ' s holdings could have been converted into 2 , 700 , 877 shares of union oil common upon surrender of debentures plus cash , according to union .	67.38677

the new offering tuesday consisted of $60 million worth of 4-7/8 debentures , due june 1 , 1986 , at 100% , and $60 million of 4-1/2% convertible subordinated debentures due june 1 , 1991 , at 100% .	13.223279
the convertible debentures are convertible into common shares at $65 a share by june 1 , 1966	45.004112

-- i bought 50 shares of diversified growth stock fund on oct . 23 , 1959 , and 50 more shares of the same mutual fund on feb . 8 , 1960 .	30.899815
i am getting dividends on only 50 shares .	6.7869625
in other words , i am getting only half the dividends i should .	78.47964
-- write to the fund ' s custodian bank -- the first national bank of jersey city , n . j . .	30.813519
that bank handles most of the paper work for diversified growth stock fund , fundamental investors , diversified investment fund and television-electronics fund .	44.14989
the bank installed a magnetic tape electronic data processing system to handle things .	38.04867
but it seems that this `` electronic brain ' ' wasn ' t `` programmed ' ' correctly .	7.622658
this resulted in a great number of errors .	6.0730824
and letters began to come in to this column from irate shareholders .	22.820915
i visited the bank in march and wrote a story about the situation .	85.48426
at that time , the people at the bank said they felt that they had the situation in hand .	57.52477
they indicated that no new errors were being made and that all old errors would be corrected `` within 60 days ' ' .	42.620884
that 60-day period is over and letters are still coming in from shareholders of these four funds , complaining about mistakes in their accounts .	77.615715
maybe it ' s taking longer to get things squared away than the bankers expected .	219.58289
any shareholder of any of these funds who finds a mistake in his account certainly should get in touch with the bank .	80.63133
he selects queries or general interest to answer .	5.2602677
-- alfred hayes , president of the federal reserve bank of new york , said tuesday `` there is no present need for far-reaching reforms ' ' which would basically alter the international financial system .	23.708004
hayes said that if a way can be found to deal effectively with short-term capital movements between nations , `` there is no reason , in my judgment why the international financial system cannot work satisfactorily for at least the foreseeable future ' ' .	79.40966
-- new york central railroad president alfred e . perlman said tuesday his line would face the threat of bankruptcy if the chesapeake & ohio and baltimore & ohio railroads merge .	27.043203
perlman said bankruptcy would not be an immediate effect of the merger , but could possibly be an ultimate effect .	45.39665
the railroad president made the statement in an interview as the interstate commerce commission opened round 2 of its hearing into the c & o ' s request to control and then merge with the b & aj .	42.029545
`` all these kind of things weaken us ' ' , perlman said .	4.9188614
board chairman howard simpson of the baltimore & ohio railroad co . , testified the b & o was in its worst financial condition since the depression years and badly needed the economic lift it would get from consolidation with the chesapeake & ohio railroad .	33.36656
`` the financial situation of the baltimore & ohio , has become precarious -- much worse than at any time since the depression of the 1930s ' ' , he told the hearing .	28.468834
c & o president walter j . tuohy was summoned back for cross-examination by new york central attorneys before examiner john bradford who is hearing the complex case .	58.48029
the new york central also has asked the icc to permit it to gain control of the b & aj .	23.38101
central was rebuffed by the other two railroads in previous attempts to make it a three-way merger .	26.01944
the proposed c & o-b & o railroad would make it the hemisphere ' s second largest .	47.453377

-- `` consumer uncertain about economic conditions ' ' .	1.7893735
this was the chief reason for a so-so sales outlook given by two-thirds of 56 builders polled by the national housing center .	56.718895
other reasons mentioned by one-third or more of the builders were `` resistance to high interest rates , cost advantage of buying over renting has narrowed , shelter market nearing saturation and prospects unable to qualify ' ' .	107.47262
the poll was taken at the center ' s annual builders ' intentions conference .	75.2415
expect their own production volume , and presumably sales , to jump 30 percent in 1961 .	68.83884
look for home building nationally to advance less than 10 percent this year from 1960 ' s 1 , 257 , 700 non-farm housing starts .	22.901386
the industry has said 1960 was a poor year .	29.999273
why the discrepancy between the builders ' forecasts for themselves and for the industry ? ?	56.01217

-- farm machinery dealer bob houtz tilts back in a battered chair and tells of a sharp pickup in sales `` we ' ve sold four corn pickers since labor day and have good prospects for 10 more .	64.338844
we sold only four pickers all last year ' ' .	5.5145273
gus ehlers , competitor of mr . houtz in this farm community , says his business since august 1 is running 50% above a year earlier .	137.17421
`` before then , my sales during much of the year had lagged behind 1960 by 20% ' ' , he says .	25.198896
though the sales gains these two dealers are experiencing are above average for their business , farm equipment sales are climbing in most rural areas .	77.45659
paradoxically , the sales rise is due in large measure to government efforts to slash farm output .	120.59008
although the administration ' s program cut crop acreage to the lowest point since 1934 , farmers , with the help of extra fertilizer and good weather , are getting such high yields per acre that many are being forced to buy new harvesting machines .	47.09664
fields of corn and some other crops in many cases are so dense that older equipment cannot handle them efficiently .	127.43241
the higher price supports provided by the new legislation , together with rising prices for farm products , are pushing up farm income , making it possible for farmers to afford the new machinery .	60.304787
seven of the eight companies that turn out full lines of farm machinery say sales by their dealers since the start of august have shown gains averaging nearly 10% above last year .	111.06243
`` in august our dealers sold 13% more farm machinery than a year earlier and in september retail sales were 14% higher than last year ' ' , says mark v . keeler , farm equipment vice president of international harvester co . .	34.34421
for the year to date , sales of the company ' s farm equipment dealers still lag about 5% behind 1960 .	37.770607
among individual dealers questioned in nearly a score of states , two out of three report their sales since august 1 show sizable gains from a year earlier , with the increases ranging from 5% to 50% .	47.11778
not all sections are showing an upswing , however	112.56075
the drought-seared north central states are the most notable exceptions to the uptrend .	12.647344
the significance of the pickup in farm machinery sales extends beyond the farm equipment industry .	36.81098
the demand for farm machinery is regarded as a yardstick of rural buying generally .	33.7669
farmers spend more of their income on tractors and implements than on any other group of products .	50.52262
more than 20 million people live on farms and they own a fourth of the nation ' s trucks , buy more gasoline than any other industry and provide a major market for home appliances , chemicals and other products .	62.8732
farmers are so eager for new machinery that they ' re haggling less over prices than they did a year ago , dealers report .	112.55297
`` farmers aren ' t as price conscious as last year so we can get more money on a sale ' ' , says jack martin , who sells j . i . case tractors and implements in sioux city , iowa .	50.210045
`` this morning , we allowed a farmer $600 on the old picker he traded in on a new $2 , 700 model .	41.726635
last year , we probably would have given him $700 for a comparable machine ' ' .	19.29082
in august of 1960 , he sold seven .	400.4848
with dealer stocks of new equipment averaging about 25% below a year ago , the affects of the rural recovery are being felt almost immediately by the country ' s farm equipment manufacturers .	80.36989
for example , farm equipment shipments of international harvester in august climbed about 5% above a year earlier , mr . keeler reports .	32.719948
tractor production at massey-ferguson , ltd . , of toronto in july and august rose to 2 , 418 units from 869 in the like period a year earlier , says john staiger , vice president .	39.178802
with the lower dealer inventories and the stepped-up demand some manufacturers believe there could be shortages of some implements .	80.5491
merritt d . hill , ford motor co . vice president , says his company is starting to get calls daily from dealers demanding immediate delivery or wanting earlier shipping dates on orders for corn pickers .	107.71826
except for a few months in late 1960 and early 1961 , retail farm equipment sales have trailed year-earlier levels since the latter part of 1959 .	67.694046
the rise in sales last winter was checked when the government ' s new feed grain program was adopted	100.23321
the program resulted in a cutback of around 20% in planted acreage and , as a result , reduced the immediate need for machines .	36.4831
nearly all of the farm equipment manufacturers and dealers say the upturn in sales has resulted chiefly from the recent improvement in crop prospects .	74.79397
total farm output for this year is officially forecast at 129% of the 1947-49 average , three points higher than the july 1 estimate and exactly equal to the final figure for 1960 .	89.60822
the government also is aiding farmers ' income prospects .	6.7903895
agriculture department economists estimate the government this year will hand farmers $1 . 4 billion in special subsidies and incentive payments , well above the record $1 . 1 billion of 1958 and about double the $639 million of 1960 .	65.920334
price support loans may total another $1 billion this year .	34.891907
with cash receipts from marketings expected to be slightly above 1960 , farmers ' gross income is estimated at $39 . 5 billion , $1 . 5 billion above 1960 ' s record high .	36.687027
net income may reach $12 . 7 billion , up $1 billion from 1960 and the highest since 1953 .	48.64829
the government reported last week that the index of prices received by farmers rose in the month ended at mid-september for the third consecutive month , reaching 242% of the 1910-14 average compared with 237% at mid-july .	28.976072
kennedy opposes any widespread relief from a high court depletion ruling .	39.03601
the supreme court decision in mid-1960 was in the case of a company making sewer pipe from clay which it mined .	34.951015
the company , in figuring its taxable earnings , deducted a percentage of the revenue it received for its finished products .	40.500843
such `` depletion allowances ' ' , in the form of percentages of sales are authorized by tax law for specified raw materials producers using up their assets .	136.00635
the high court held that the company must apply its percentage allowance to the value of the raw materials removed from the ground , not to the revenue from finished products .	64.46442
a measure passed by congress just before adjourning softened the ruling ' s impact , on prior-year returns still under review , for clay-mining companies that make brick and tile products .	58.865204
the measure allows such companies in those years to apply their mineral depletion allowances to 50% of the value of the finished products rather than the lower value of raw clay alone .	54.93
president kennedy , in signing the relief measure into law , stressed he regarded it as an exception .	146.4041
`` my approval of this bill should not be viewed as establishing a precedent for the enactment of similar legislation for other mineral industries ' ' , the president said .	41.214115
charitable deductions come in for closer scrutiny by the i . r . s . .	29.522694
the service announced that taxpayers making such claims may be called on to furnish a statement from the recipient organization showing the date , purpose , amount and other particulars of the contribution .	68.00143
requests for substantiation , the service indicated , can be especially expected in cases where it suspects the donor received some material benefit in return , such as tickets to a show .	134.66954
in such an instance , revenuers stressed , the deduction must be reduced by the value of the benefit received .	18.842066
a rule on the federal deductibility of state taxes is contested .	12.259924
a realty corporation in louisiana owed no tax , under federal law , on its gain from the sale of property disposed of in line with a plan of liquidation .	84.09806
louisiana , however , collected an income tax on the profits from the sale .	25.583921
the corporation , in filing its final federal income return , claimed the state tax payment as a deductible expense , as permitted under u . s . tax law .	37.33086
the revenue service disallowed the claim , invoking a law provision that generally bars deductions for expenses incurred in connection with what it said was tax-exempt income .	45.02302
it said the tax-freedom of the gain in this case stemmed not from the exempt status of the income but from a special rule on corporate liquidations .	49.777813
the tax court decision and a similar earlier finding by the ninth circuit court of appeals challenges a year-old i . r . s . ruling on the subject .	48.34574
the service has not said what its next step will be .	35.67784
peace corps volunteers are assured a tax benefit under the law creating the agency .	43.92878
it provides that the $1 , 800 termination payment each cadet is to get , after serving a two-year hitch without pay , will be spread over both years , not taxed in its entirety at a possibly higher rate in the year received .	87.482635
the owner of a public relations firm owed no income tax on payments he received from a client company and `` kicked back ' ' to the company ' s advertising manager , the tax court ruled .	42.42648
the taxpayer testified that in order to retain the account he had to pad his invoices and pay the excess to the manager .	15.845149
the court upheld the taxpayer ' s contention that these `` kickbacks ' ' were not his income though they passed through his hands .	45.99602
the court limited its decision to the tax issue involved , commenting `` it is not our province to pass judgment on the morality of the transaction ' ' .	47.335926
a portable kerosene range designed for use aboard boats is sold with a special railing to keep it from moving with the motion of the vessel .	62.620613
the revenue service said the addition of the attachment does not keep the range from coming under the federal manufacturers ' excise tax on household-type appliances .	52.3732
hiring the wife for one ' s company may win her tax-aided retirement income .	35.251022
a spouse employed by a corporation her husband controls , for example , may be entitled to distributions under the company ' s pension plan as well as to her own social security coverage .	29.726454
she would be taxed on the pensions when received , of course , but the company ' s contributions would be tax-free .	38.03113
a frequent pitfall in this sort of arrangement , experts warn , is a tendency to pay the wife more than her job is worth and to set aside an excessive amount for her as retirement income .	109.37926
in that event , they note , the revenue service might declare the pension plan is discriminatory and deny it tax privileges under the law .	45.406593
possible upshots the company could be denied a deduction for its pension payments , or those payments for the wife and other employes could be ruled taxable to them in the year made .	42.09277
state briefs voters in four counties containing and bordering denver authorized the imposition of an additional 2% sales tax within that area .	68.59447
denver itself collects a 1% sales tax which is to be absorbed in the higher area tax .	76.14866
the washington state supreme court ruled that the state ' s occupation tax applied to sales , made at cost to an oil company , by a wholly-owned subsidiary set up to purchase certain supplies without divulging the identity of the parent .	47.13661
the state ' s occupation tax is computed on gross sales .	45.920975
the court held that the tax applied to non-profit sales because the corporations realized economic benefits by doing business as two separate entities .	163.1832
-- consumer spending edged down in april after rising for two consecutive months , the government reported .	81.49023
the commerce department said seasonally adjusted sales of retail stores dropped to slightly under $18 billion in april , down 1% from the march level of more than $18 . 2 billion .	37.35422
april sales also were 5% below those of april last year , when volume reached a record for any month , $18 . 9 billion ( see chart on page one ) .	60.329376
the seasonal adjustment takes into account such factors as easter was on april 2 this year , two weeks earlier than in 1960 , and pre-easter buying was pushed into march .	70.24247
commerce department officials were inclined to explain the april sales decline as a reaction from a surge of consumer buying in march .	76.04266

the attractive greer garson , who loves beautiful clothes and selects them as carefully as she does her professional roles , prefers timeless classical designs .	52.646675
occasionally she deserts the simple and elegant for a fun piece simply because `` it ' s unlike me ' ' .	55.420776
in private life , miss garson is mrs . e . e . fogelson and on the go most of the time commuting from dallas , where they maintain an apartment , to their california home in los angeles ' suburban bel-air to their ranch in pecos , new mexico .	43.026676
therefore , her wardrobe is largely mobile , to be packed at a moment ' s notice and to shake out without a wrinkle .	26.51693
her creations in fashion are from many designers because she doesn ' t want a complete wardrobe from any one designer any more than she wants `` all of her pictures by one painter ' ' .	41.820004
her favorite cocktail dress is a norell , a black and white organdy and silk jersey .	14.490803
irene suits rate high because they are designed for her long-bodied silhouette .	31.2211
she also likes the femininity and charm of designs by ceil chapman and helen rose .	16.201042
`` i bought my first dress from him when i was still a struggling young actress ' ' , she reminisces .	32.866795
`` i like his clothes for their drama and simplicity and appreciate the great impact he has on fashion ' ' .	47.86958
black and white is her favorite color combination along with lively glowing pinks , reds , blues and greens .	22.981014
of scotch-irish-scandinavian descent , greer garson was born in county down , ireland .	296.26102
her mother was a greer and her father ' s family came from the orkney isles .	19.62923
reared in england , she studied to be a teacher , earned several scholarships and was graduated with honors from the university of london .	55.359264
she took postgraduate work at the university of grenoble in france and then returned to london to work on market research with an advertising firm .	103.85694
her acting began with the birmingham repertory company and she soon became the toast of the west end .	61.13962
among stage performances was a starring role in `` golden arrow ' ' directed by noel coward .	13.972104
it was during `` old music ' ' at the st . james theater that hollywood ' s louis b . mayer spotted her .	36.992844
after signing a motion-picture contract , she came to america and had `` goodbye , mr . chips ' ' as her first assignment after a year ' s wait .	35.789883
other triumphs include `` random harvest ' ' , `` madame curie ' ' , `` pride and prejudice ' ' , `` the forsythe saga ' ' and `` mrs . miniver ' ' ( which won her the academy award in 1943 ) .	11.867639
honors that have come to greer garson are countless .	3.717375
just this april she was nominated for the seventh time for an academy award for her portrayal of eleanor roosevelt in `` sunrise at campobello ' ' .	27.32116
she gave a fine portrayal of auntie mame on broadway in 1958 and has appeared in live television from `` captain brassbound ' s conversion ' ' to `` camille ' ' .	49.858047
she is in madame tussard ' s waxworks in london , a princess of the kiowa tribe and an honorary colonel in many states .	14.140019
she is adept at skeet shooting , trout fishing , afro-cuban and oriental dancing and southwestern archaeology .	16.787788
she now serves on the board of directors of the dallas symphony orchestra and the dallas theater center and on the board of trustees of the dallas museum of fine arts .	35.33739
she is state chairman for the new mexico tuberculosis and cancer associations .	69.77006
both miss garson and her oilman-rancher husband are active supporters of boys clubs of america and patrons of the vivid art and opera colony that flourishes in new mexico .	49.378677

use one 6-ounce chicken breast for each guest .	2.2943945
dip in melted butter and roll in flour .	2.5573845
place side by side in a 2-inch deep baking pan .	3.8005924
bake slowly about one hour at 250-275 f . until lightly brown .	54.14465
add enough warmed cream , seasoned to taste with onion juice , to about half cover the chicken breasts .	26.118628
while this is baking , saute mushrooms , fresh or canned , in butter .	13.372741
serve each breast on a thin slice of slow-baked ham and sprinkle with thompson seedless grapes .	17.797892

contemporary furniture that is neither danish nor straight-line modern but has sculptured pattern , many design facets , warmth , dignity and an effect of utter comfort and livability .	71.12732
that is the goal of two new collections being introduced in dallas this month .	85.318436
though there has been some avant garde indication that contemporary furniture might go back to the boxy look of the ' 20 ' s and ' 40 ' s , two manufacturers chose to take the approach of the sophisticated , but warm look in contemporary .	91.189514
these two , heritage and drexel , chose too not to produce the exactly matching design for every piece , but a collection of correlated designs , each of which could stand alone .	77.60828
the heritage collection , to be shown by sanger-harris and anderson ' s studio , has perhaps more different types of woods and decorations than any one manufacturer ever assembled together at one time .	41.494953
called perennian , to indicate its lasting , good today and tomorrow quality , the collection truly avoids the monotony of identical pieces .	80.04091
walnut , wormy chestnut , pecan , three varieties of burl , hand-woven philippine cane , ceramic tiles , marble are used to emphasize the feeling of texture and of permanence , the furniture to fit into rooms with tiled floors , brick or paneled walls , windows that bring in the outdoors .	18.66766
it is a collection with a custom-design look , offering simplicity with warmth , variety and vitality .	49.122055
the drexel collection , called composite , to be shown by titche ' s offers a realistic approach to decorating , a mature modern that is a variation of many designs .	46.149994
rounded posts give a soft , sculptured look , paneled doors have decorative burl panels or cane insets plus softening arches , table tops are inlaid in macassar ebony or acacia .	13.585568
a high-legged buffet provides easy-to-reach serving , a cocktail table has small snack tables tucked under each end , recessed arched panels decorate a 60-inch long chest .	31.216694
an interesting approach to the bedroom is presented , with a young , basic , functional group of chests , dressers and corner units and a canted headboard .	38.31954
the other bedroom has heavier styling , door-fronted dressers with acacia panels , a poster bed or a bed with arched acacia panels and matching mirror .	13.695976
colorful , bright eastman chromspun fabrics , with the magenta , pink and white tones predominating as well as golden shades are used with composite .	12.226067
the fabrics have scotchgard finish to resist soil and wrinkles .	4.15571
design elements closely rooted to traditional forms but wearing a definite contemporary label keynote drexel ' s fall 1961 group , composite .	88.31899
the spider-leg pedestal table has a base finished in an ebony , to set off the lustrous brown of the walnut top .	25.486185
see-through design of the chairs combines both the nostalgic ladder back and an oriental shoji flavor .	35.916542
to bring warmth to the dining area , golden orange tones are used in the fabrics .	20.368313
dignity and comfort , in a contemporary manner , reflecting the best aspects of today ' s design , with substance and maturity , keynote the perennian collection from heritage .	52.96108
center panel , hand-screened wood , actually is a back of one of the tall bookcases .	31.770576
mellow bronzy-green-gold fabrics and the gleam of copper and hand-crafted ceramic accessories reiterate the mood as does the alexander smith carpet in all wool loop pile .	51.42163

giving up the violin opened a whole new career for ilona schmidl-seeberg , a tiny hungarian who fritz kreisler had predicted would have a promising career on the concert stage .	30.500402
a heart attack when she was barely 20 put an end to the 10-hour daily practicing .	138.86943
she put the violin away and took out some linen , needles and yarn to while away the long , idle days in budapest .	129.39987
now her modern tapestries have been exhibited on two continents and , at 26 , she feels she is on the threshold of a whole new life in los angeles .	62.01197
her days as an art student at the university of budapest came to a sudden end during the hungarian uprisings in 1957 and she and her husband stephen fled to vienna .	54.32945
there they continued their studies at the university , she in art , he in architecture .	62.92622
and there she had her first showing of tapestry work .	38.434383
there ' s a lot of talk about the problem of education in america today .	50.238605
what most people don ' t seem to realize , if they aren ' t tied up with the thing as i am , is that 90% of the problem is transportation .	46.614998
i never dreamed of the logistical difficulties involved until , at long last , both of my boys got squeezed into high school .	132.54932
it seems like only last year that we watched them set out up the hill hand in hand on a rainy day in their yellow raincoats to finger-paint at the grammar school .	43.672188
getting to and from school was no problem .	3.0737107
now they go to a high school that is two miles away .	82.195854
one might think the problem would be similar .	4.0445642
they could walk , ride on a bus or be driven .	42.743954
it ' s much more complex than that .	36.9303
generally , they go to school with a girl named gloriana , who lives down the block , and has a car .	53.92559
this is a way of getting to school , but , i understand , it entails a certain loss of social status .	31.61555
a young man doesn ' t like to be driven up in front of a school in a car driven by a girl who isn ' t even in a higher class than he is , and is also a girl .	43.79914
`` why don ' t you walk to school then ' ' ? ?	20.40091
`` my father walked , through two miles of snow , in illinois ' ' .	22.899044
`` no ' ' , i said , `` i didn ' t happen to grow up in illinois ' ' .	24.16224
i explained , however , that i had my share of hardship in making my daily pilgrimage to the feet of wisdom .	77.061516
i had to ride a streetcar two miles .	24.5216
sometimes there weren ' t even any seats .	7.2314157
i had to stand up , with the ladies .	53.809795
sometimes i got on the wrong car and didn ' t get to school at all , but wound up at the ocean , or some other dismal place , and had to spend the day there .	44.5544
i ' ve tried to compromise by letting them take the little car now and then .	89.74664
when they do that my wife has to drive me to work in the big car .	34.531124
she has to have at least one car herself .	66.8397
i feel a certain loss of status when i am driven up in front of work in a car driven by my wife , who is only a woman .	33.689907
if they have to take any car , they ' d rather take the big one .	63.745712
they say that when they take a car , gloriana doesn ' t take her car , but rides with them .	34.276627
but when gloriana rides with them they also have to take the two girls who usually ride with her , so the little car isn ' t big enough .	58.357895
the logic of that is impeccable , of course , except that i feel like a fool being driven up to work in a little car , by my wife , when everybody knows i have a big car and am capable of driving myself .	65.79526
the solution , naturally , is the bus .	40.36591
however , it ' s a half-mile walk down a steep hill from our house to the bus , and it ' s too hard on my legs .	32.96878
my wife could drive us down the hill and we could all walk from there .	170.68733
nobody walks anymore but crackpots and harry truman , and he ' s already got an education .	56.393417

here ' s an idea for a child ' s room that is easy to execute and is completely charming , using puppets for lamp bases .	41.407593
most children love the animated puppet faces and their flexible bodies , and they prefer to see them as though the puppets were in action , rather than put away in boxes .	55.115177
displayed as lamps , the puppets delight the children and are decorative accent .	45.159767
to create such a lamp , order a wired pedestal from any lamp shop .	20.746101
measure the puppet to determine the height of the light socket , allowing three to four inches above the puppet ' s head .	20.342731
make sure that the metal tube through which the wire passes is in the shape of an inverted `` l ' ' , the foot of the `` l ' ' about three inches long , so that the puppet can hang directly under the light .	30.359821
using the strings that manipulate the puppet , suspend him from the light fixture by tying the strings to the lamp base .	12.53872
in this way , you can arrange his legs and arms in any desired position , with feet , or one foot , barely resting on the pedestal .	39.12067
if the puppets are of uniform size , you can change them in accord with your child ' s whims .	33.48098
although a straight drum shade would be adequate and sufficiently neutral that the puppets could be changed without disharmony , it is far more fun to create shades in the gay spirit of a child ' s playtime .	26.780607
those illustrated are reminiscent of a circus top or a merry-go-round .	16.90892
today ' s trend toward furniture designs from america ' s past is teaching home-owners and decorators a renewed respect for the shrewd cabinetmakers of our colonial era .	40.958927
a generation ago there were plenty of people who appreciated antiques and fine reproductions .	11.990256
in the background lurked the feeling , however , that these pieces , beautiful as they were , lacked the utilitarian touch .	55.011414
so junior ' s bedroom was usually tricked out with heavy , nondescript pieces that supposedly could take the `` hard knocks ' ' , while the fine secretary was relegated to the parlor where it was for show only .	44.92871
this isn ' t true of the many homemakers of the 1960 ' s , according to decorator consultant , leland alden .	17.89376
housewives are finding literally hundreds of ways of getting the maximum use out of traditional designs , says mr . alden and they are doing it largely because colonial craftsmen had `` an innate sense of the practical ' ' .	77.43384
there are a number of reasons why the eighteenth century designer had to develop `` down to earth ' ' designs -- or go out of business .	42.72949

is there anything a frustrated individual can do about communism ' s growing threat on our doorstep and around the world ? ?	28.537
more than 300 teenagers last sunday proved there is and as many more are expected to prove it again for jim kern and his wife lynn from 4 to 8 p . m . sunday at first presbyterian church .	41.88082
at that time the second half of the christian youth crusade against communism will be staged .	66.39533
a young real estate salesman , kern first got seriously interested in the problems posed by communism when in the navy air force .	106.96168
he was particularly struck by a course on communist brainwashing .	33.94179
kern began reading a lot about the history and philosophy of communism , but never felt there was anything he , as an individual , could do about it .	64.918144
when he attended the christian anti-communist crusade school here about six months ago , jim became convinced that an individual can do something constructive in the ideological battle and set out to do it .	63.39246
the best approach , he figured , was to try to influence young people like the high schoolers he and his wife serve as advisors at first presbyterian church .	98.95367
and he wanted to be careful that the kids not only learn about communist but also about what he feels is the only antidote -- a biblically strong christianity .	118.85406
so the christian youth crusade against communisn developed and more than 300 top teenagers and 65 adult advisers from presbyterian churches of the area sat enthralled at the four-hour program .	49.445038
this sunday those attending the second session will hear a lecture by kern on the world situation	151.88814
a review of the philosophy of communist leaders by ted slack , another real estate agent who became interested as a philosophy major at the university of miami	49.30024
and talks on how their christian faith can guide them in learning about and fighting communism during high school and college days , by ted place , director of greater miami youth for christ , and jon braun , director of campus crusade for christ .	96.290665
the second half of the film `` communism on the map ' ' and the movie `` operation abolition ' ' also will be shown .	36.536766
response to the program has been so encouraging , kern said , that a city-wide youth school at dade county auditorium may be set up soon .	31.110437
and to encourage other churches to try their own programs , kern said this sunday ' s sessions -- including the free dinner -- will be open to anyone who makes reservations .	62.196312
the need for and the way to achieve a christian home will be stressed in special services marking national christian family week in miami area churches next week .	131.32092
of particular meaning to the charles macwhorter family , 3181 sw 24th ter . , will be the family dedication service planned for 10 50 a . m . sunday at first christian church .	28.972092
it will be the second time the assistant manager of a coral gables restaurant and his wife have taken part in the twice-a-year ceremonies for families with new babies .	66.439445
the first one , two years ago , changed the routine of their home life .	83.57804
`` when you stand up in public and take vows to strive to set an example before your children and to teach them the fundamentals of the christian faith , you strive a little harder to uphold those vows ' ' , explains the slender vice president of the young couples sunday school class .	40.929386
until that first dedication service , he and lois felt their children were too young to take part in any religious life at home .	63.98459
they have five daughters -- coral lee , 5 , glenda rae , 4 , pamela , 3 , karen , 2 , and shari , five months .	13.561226
but after that service , they decided to try to let the girls say grace at the table , have bedtime prayers , and bible stories .	64.11993
to their surprise , the children all were eager and quite able to take part .	178.43103
even the two-year-old feels miffed if the family has a prayer-time without her .	61.11674

enrique jorda , conductor and musical director of the san francisco symphony , will fulfill two more guest conducting engagements in europe before returning home to open the symphony ' s golden anniversary season , it was announced .	30.54357
the guest assignments are scheduled for november 14 and 18 , with the orchestra sinfonica siciliana in palermo and the orchestra of radio cologne .	16.205437
the season in san francisco will open with a special gala concert on november 22 .	14.981122
