until the last year or so the profession of friendship with the united states had been an article of faith with trujillo , and altogether too often this profession was accepted here as evidence of his good character .	83.46301
tardily the government here came to understand how this country ' s own reputation was tarnished by the association with repression .	25.88001
last year , after trujillo had been cited for numerous aggressions in the caribbean , the united states and many other members of the organization of american states broke diplomatic relations with him .	20.740856
thereupon followed a demonstration that tyranny knows no ideological confines .	5.2963657
trujillo ' s dictatorship had been along conservative , right-wing lines .	10.428344
but after the censure he and his propaganda started mouthing communist slogans .	26.736261
there was considerable evidence of a tacit rapprochement with castro in cuba , previously a bete noire to trujillo -- thus illustrating the way in which totalitarianism of the right and left coalesces .	27.315266
what comes after trujillo is now the puzzle .	7.832195
the dominican people have known no democratic institutions and precious little freedom for a generation , and all alternative leadership has been suppressed .	104.29505
perhaps the army will be able to maintain stability , but the vacuum of free institutions creates a great danger .	69.40727
the dominican republic could turn toward communist-type authoritarianism as easily as toward western freedom .	107.87674
such a twist would be a tragedy for the dominican people , who deserve to breathe without fear .	33.04277
for that reason any democratic reform and effort to bring genuine representative government to the dominican republic will need the greatest sympathy and help .	43.04017
high-speed buses on the george washington memorial parkway , operating between downtown washington and cabin john , glen echo and brookmont , would constitute an alluring sample of what the new national capital transportation agency can do for this city .	69.71495
in presenting plans for such express buses before the montgomery county council , the administrator of the ncta , c . darwin stolzenbach , was frankly seeking support for the projects his agency will soon be launching .	29.211159
such support should not be difficult to come by if all the plans to be presented by the ncta are as attractive as this outline of express buses coming into the downtown area .	43.02554
because the buses would not stop on the parkway , land for bus stations and for parking areas nearby will be needed .	27.83232
the ncta is well advised to seek funds for this purpose from the present session of congress .	27.095715
the inference has been too widely accepted that because the communists have succeeded in building barricades across berlin the free world must acquiesce in dismemberment of that living city .	85.650566
so far as the record is concerned , the western powers have not acquiesced and should not do so .	48.893543
though walter ulbricht , by grace of soviet tanks , may be head man in east germany , that does not give him any right to usurp the government of east berlin or to absorb that semi-city into the soviet zone .	34.49135
the wartime protocol of september 12 , 1944 , designated a special `` greater berlin ' ' area , comprising the entire city , to be under joint occupation .	63.047443
it was not a part of any one of the three ( later four ) zones for occupation by soviet , american , british , and french troops respectively .	69.82514
after the berlin blockade and airlift , the council of foreign ministers in 1949 declared a purpose `` to mitigate the effects of the present administrative division of germany and of berlin ' ' .	42.36961
for some time the communists honored the distinction between the soviet zone of germany and the soviet sector of berlin by promulgating separately the laws for the two areas .	26.320042
then they moved offices of the east german puppet government into east berlin and began illegally to treat it as the capital of east germany .	31.070929
that this and the closing of the east berlin-west berlin border have not been accepted by the western governments appears in notes which britain , france , and the united states sent to moscow after the latter ' s gratuitous protest over a visit of chancellor adenauer and other west german officials to west berlin .	44.947376
the chancellor had as much business there as ulbricht had in east berlin -- and was certainly less provocative than the juvenile sound-truck taunts of gerhard eisler .	21.139296
the british and other replies to that moscow note pointed out efforts of the communist authorities `` to integrate east berlin into east germany by isolating it from the outside and attempting to make it the capital of east germany ' ' .	38.846294
they insisted on the `` fundamental fact ' ' that `` the whole of berlin has a quadripartite status ' ' .	25.48619
this is far from acknowledging or recognizing those efforts as an accomplished fact .	270.2052
there remains , of course , the question of what the west can do beyond diplomatic protest to prevent the illegal efforts from becoming accomplished facts .	118.87062
one ground of action certainly exists when fusillades of stray shots go over into west berlin as communist `` vopos ' ' try to gun down fleeing unarmed residents .	77.42202
another remained when an american army car was recovered but with a broken glass .	37.434505
the glass may seem trivial but communist official hooliganism feeds on such incidents unless they are redressed .	11.754664
remembering the step-by-step fate of danzig and the west german misgivings about `` salami ' ' tactics , it is to be hoped that the dispatch of general clay to west berlin as president kennedy ' s representative will mark a stiffening of response not only to future indignities and aggressions but also to some that have passed .	52.658672
thousands of buffalo ( `` bison ' ' they will never be to the man on the street ) grazing like a mobile brown throw-rug upon the rolling , dusty-green grassland .	46.34458
a horizon even and seamless , binding the vast sun-bleached dome of sky to earth .	37.66367
that picture of the american prairie is as indelibly fixed in the memory of those who have studied the conquest of the american continent as any later cinema image of the west made in live-oak canyons near hollywood .	42.596798
for it was the millions of buffalo and prairie chicken and the endless seas of grass that symbolized for a whole generation of americans the abundant supply that was to take many of them westward when the ohio and mississippi valleys began to fill .	55.278046
the national park service now proposes to preserve an area in pottawatomie county , northeast kansas , as a `` prairie national park ' ' .	19.601704
there the buffalo would roam , to be seen as a tapestry , not as moth-eaten zoo specimens .	36.92732
wooded stream valleys in the folds of earth would be saved .	23.735622
grasslands would extend , unfenced , unplowed , unbroken by silo or barn -- as the first settlers saw them .	26.329336
the park service makes an impressive ecological and statistical case for creating this new park .	223.52942
american history should clinch the case when congress is asked to approve .	31.892635
a philadelphia distiller is currently breaching the customary prohibition against hard-liquor advertising on tv and radio .	72.30256
starting with small stations not members of the national association of broadcasters , the firm apparently is seeking to break down the anti-liquor barriers in major-market stations .	25.037733
probably the best answer to this kind of entering wedge is congressional action requiring the federal communications commission to ban such advertising through its licensing power .	171.53973
the national association of broadcasters code specifically bars hard-liquor commercials .	2.3518515
past polls of public opinion show popular favor for this policy .	69.300125
even the distilled spirits institute has long had a specific prohibition .	49.9246
why , then , with these voluntary barricades and some state laws barring liquor ads , is it necessary to seek congressional action ? ?	76.54507
simply because the subverting action of firms that are not members of the distilled spirits institute and of radio and tv stations that are not members of the nab tends to spread .	45.934925
soon some members of the two industry groups doubtless will want to amend their codes on grounds that otherwise they will suffer unfairly from the efforts of non-code competitors .	45.802784
although the false glamour surrounding bourbon or other whisky commercials is possibly no more fatuous than the pseudo-sophistication with which tv soft-drinks are downed or toothpaste applied , there is a sad difference between enticing a viewer into sipping oopsie-cola and gulling him into downing bourbon .	24.061981
registered democrats in new york city this year have the opportunity to elect their party ' s candidates for mayor and other municipal posts and the men who will run their party organization .	49.412514
in the central contest , that for mayor , they may have found some pertinent points in what each faction has said about the other .	51.488407
mayor robert f . wagner must , as his opponents demand , assume responsibility for his performance in office .	58.47388
while all citizens share in blame for lax municipal ethics the wagner regime has seen serious problems in the schools , law enforcement and fiscal policies .	82.71997
the mayor is finding it awkward to campaign against his own record .	32.691135
state controller arthur levitt , on the other hand , cannot effectively deny that he has chosen to be the candidate of those party leaders who as a rule have shown livelier interest in political power than in the city ' s welfare .	47.140476
they , too , have links with the city ' s ills .	13.979635
both men are known to be honest and public-spirited .	6.644962
mayor wagner ' s shortcomings have perhaps been more mercilessly exposed than those of mr . levitt who left an impression of quiet competence in his more protected state post .	85.875336
as mayor , mr . levitt might turn out to be more independent than some of his leading supporters would like .	76.64975
his election , on the other hand , would unquestionably strengthen the `` regulars ' ' .	14.144213
mr . wagner might or might not be a `` new ' ' mayor in this third term , now that he is free of the pressure of those party leaders whom he calls `` bosses ' ' .	53.3669
these are , of course , the same people whose support he has only now rejected to seek the independent vote .	263.91483
but his reelection would strengthen the liberal democrats and the labor unions who back him .	94.20881
if this choice is less exciting than new york democrats may wish , it nevertheless must be made .	129.31569
the vote still gives citizens a voice in the operation of their government and their party .	62.891846
both mr . k ' s have so far continued to speak softly and carry big sticks over laos .	196.91405
president kennedy , already two quiet demands down , still refused thursday to be drawn into delivering a public ultimatum to moscow .	60.49548
but at the same time he moved his helicopter-borne marines to within an hour of the fighting .	25.352007
and secretary rusk , en route to bangkok , doubtless is trying to make emergency arrangements for the possible entry of australian or thai seato forces .	53.677956
for mr . kennedy , speaking softly and carrying a sizable stick is making the best of a bad situation .	64.29922
the new president is in no position to start out his dealings with moscow by issuing callable bluffs .	42.293835
he must show at the outset that he means exactly what he says .	105.313934
in this case he has put the alternatives clearly to mr . khrushchev for the third time .	43.13239
at his press conference mr . kennedy said , `` all we want in laos is peace not war a truly neutral government not a cold war pawn ' ' .	59.9756
at the scene he has just as clearly shown his military strength in unprovocative but ready position .	304.1051
since laos is of no more purely military value to moscow itself than it is to washington , this approach might be expected to head off mr . khrushchev for the moment .	56.96641
but because of the peculiar nature of the military situation in laos , the soviet leader must be tempted to let things ride -- a course that would appear to cost him little on the spot , but would bog washington in a tactical mess .	66.06988
as wars go , laos is an extremely little one .	36.277473
casualties have been running about a dozen men a day .	46.868824
the hard core of the pro-communist rebel force numbers only some 2 , 000 tough viet minh guerrilla fighters .	89.01851
but for the united states and its seato allies to attempt to shore up a less tough , less combat-tested government army in monsoon-shrouded , road-shy , guerrilla-th ' -wisp terrain is a risk not savored by pentagon planners .	48.982647
but if anything can bring home to mr . khrushchev the idea that he will not really get much enjoyment from watching this braddock-against-the-indians contest , it will probably be the fact that seato forces are ready to attempt it -- plus the fact that moscow has something to lose from closing off disarmament and other bigger negotiations with washington .	61.72454
fortunately both the republicans and america ' s chief western allies now are joined behind the neutral laos aim of the president .	96.11291
actually it would be more accurate to say that the leader of the alliance now has swung fully behind the british policy of seeking to achieve a neutral laos via the international bargaining table .	60.686916
it is ironic that washington is having to struggle so for a concept that for six years it bypassed as unreasonable .	63.33155
the state department tacitly rejected the neutral laos idea after the geneva conference of 1954 , and last year washington backed the rightist coup that ousted neutral premier souvanna phouma .	17.731194
but since last fall the united states has been moving toward a pro-neutralist position and now is ready to back the british plan for a cease-fire patrolled by outside observers and followed by a conference of interested powers .	73.8069
the road to a guaranteed-neutral , coup-proof laos is today almost as difficult as warfare on that nation ' s terrain .	175.34712
but for the safety of southeast asia , and for the sake of the laotian people -- who would not be well-ruled by either militant minority now engaged in the fighting -- this last big effort to seal that country from the cold war had to be made .	50.93464
the world awaits mr . khrushchev ' s choice of alternatives .	28.300169
the senate ' s overwhelming ( 64-13 ) vote to support locally controlled educational tv efforts should be emulated in the lower house .	100.996956
twice previously the senate has approved measures backing etv and the house has let them die .	53.951126
the house communications subcommittee is expected to report out a good bill calling for the states to match federal funds .	94.74761
this year ' s senate measure would provide each state and the district of columbia with $1 , 000 , 000 to be used in support of private , state , or municipal etv efforts .	24.223572
the funds would be used for equipment , not for land , buildings , or operation .	82.56581
the relatively few communities that have educational stations have found them of considerable value .	97.685745
but , lacking money from commercial sponsors , the stations have had difficulties meeting expenses or improving their service .	160.27246
other communities -- the ones to be aided most by the senate bill -- have had difficulty starting such stations because of the high initial cost of equipment .	212.6338
sam rayburn was a good man , a good american , and , third , a good democrat .	51.681892
he was all of these rolled into one sturdy figure	3301.0486
mr . speaker , mr . sam , and mr . democrat , at one and the same time .	19.834913
the house was his habitat and there he flourished , first as a young representative , then as a forceful committee chairman , and finally in the post for which he seemed intended from birth , speaker of the house , and second most powerful man in washington .	77.33944
mr . rayburn was not an easy man to classify or to label .	43.80639
he was no flaming liberal , yet the new deal , the fair deal and the new frontier needed him .	134.5327
he was not a rear-looking conservative , yet partisans of that persuasion will miss him as much as any .	76.46521
two of the vital qualities demanded of a politician by other politicians are that he always keep a confidence and that he keep his word .	93.096985
sam rayburn took unnumbered secrets with him to the grave , for he was never loquacious , and his word , once given , was not subject to retraction .	39.04064
it might be added that as he kept his word so he expected that others keep theirs .	258.57993
the demonstration of his power was never flamboyant or theatrical .	20.146952
a growl , a nod , was usually enough .	142.23904
when it was not , one of the great dramas of washington would be presented .	28.311111
he would rise in the well of the house , his chin upon his chest , his hands gripping the side of a desk , and the political and legislative chatter would subside into silence .	30.165615
he spoke briefly , sensibly , to the point and without oratorical flourishes .	15.674862
he made good , plain american common sense and the house usually recognized it and acted upon it .	96.79272
these public efforts were rare because mr . rayburn normally did his counseling , persuading and educating long before an issue reached its test on the house floor .	116.521935
he expected democrats to do their duty when it had been patiently pointed out to them .	34.707047
with his long service he had a long memory , an excellent thing in a political leader .	75.554436
he was , of course , in the house for a very long time .	30.804615
there are only two men remaining in congress who , with rayburn , voted for the declaration of war against germany in 1917 .	33.57495
to almost two generations of americans it must have seemed as though the existence of mr . sam coincided with that of the house .	36.010082
to be presiding officer of it was the end of his desire and ambition .	52.280777
the senate to him was not the `` upper body ' ' and he corrected those who said he served `` under ' ' the president .	35.31391
sound the roll of those with whom he served and who preceded him in death .	69.36291
woodrow wilson , with whom he began his years in washington , warren g . harding , calvin coolidge , fdr , with whom he managed a social revolution .	23.03627
and those still with us , herbert c . hoover , harry s . truman , dwight d . eisenhower and john f . kennedy .	10.536587
he was a fighter for those of his own party .	35.704002
mr . truman has only to recall the `` hopeless ' ' campaign of 1948 to remember what a loyal partisan he was and the first experience of mr . kennedy with congress would have been sadder than it was had not mr . sam been there .	57.53368
as it was , his absence because of his final illness was a blow to the administration .	36.63459
he was his own man , not an automatic obstructionist .	20.890957
he kept his attacks on republicanism for partisan campaigns , but that is part of the game he was born to play .	27.184952
under any name -- mr . speaker , mr . democrat , mr . sam -- he was a good man .	9.205053
thirteen italian airmen who went to the congo to serve the cause of peace under the united nations banner have instead met violent death at the hands of congolese troops supposedly their friends .	126.556114
in 18 months , no more grisly incident has been reported from that jungle .	42.37534
simply out of bloodlust , their murderers dismembered the bodies and tossed the remains into the river .	36.36942
the excuse was offered for them that they had mistaken the italians for belgian mercenaries .	13.869317
in other words , atrocities by savages wearing the uniform of the central government might be condoned , had the victims been serving the cause of dissident katanga .	63.011677
does this suggest that the congo is fit for nationhood or that un is making any progress whatever toward its goal of so making it ? ?	134.42926
to the contrary , through the past six weeks violence has been piled upon violence .	69.79468
mass rapes , troop mutinies , uncontrolled looting and pillage and reckless military adventures , given no sanction by any political authority , have become almost daily occurrences .	43.5385
yet this basic condition of outlawry and anarchy is not the work of katanga .	28.206116
it happens in the territory of the leopoldville government , which is itself a fiction , demonstrably incapable of governing , and commanding only such limited credit abroad as un support gives it .	70.36876
the main question raised by the incident is how much longer will un bury its head in the sand on the congo problem instead of facing the bitter fact that it has no solution in present terms ? ?	119.31947
the probable answer is that it will do so just as long as russia can exercise a veto in favor of chaos and until young african nations wake up to the truth that out of false pride they are visiting ruin on central africa .	107.70999
right now , they are pushing a resolution which would have un use its forces to invade and subjugate katanga .	20.887825
that notion is fantastically wrong-headed from several points of view .	2.3573608
the un army is too weak , too demoralized for the task .	18.778597
further , it has its work cut out stopping anarchy where it is now garrisoned .	39.557938
last , it makes no sense to deliver katanga , the one reasonably solid territory , into the existing chaos .	97.51555
the congo should have been mandated , because it was not ready for independence .	12.103169
the idea was not even suggested because political expediency prevailed over wisdom .	17.614483
it is perhaps too late now to talk of mandate because it is inconsistent with what is termed political realism .	39.54844
but if any realism and feeling for truth remain in the general assembly , it is time for men of courage to measure the magnitude of the failure and urge some new approach .	71.22578
otherwise , un will march blindly on to certain defeat .	195.18805
a recent editorial discussing a labor-management agreement reached between the southern pacific co . and the order of railroad telegraphers has been criticized on the grounds that it was not based on complete information .	26.398754
the editorial was based on a news association dispatch which said that the telegraphers had secured an agreement whereby they were guaranteed 40 hours ' pay per week whether they worked or not and that a reduction in their number was limited to 2 per cent per year .	62.730923
our comment was that this was `` featherbedding ' ' in its ultimate form and that sympathy for the railroad was misplaced since it had entered into such an agreement .	38.020542
the statement was also made that undoubtedly the railroad had received some compensating benefit from the telegraphers , but that it was difficult to imagine what could balance a job for life .	34.78598
additional information supplied to us discloses that the railroad gained a stabilized supply of telegraphers of which it was in need .	54.39433
also , normal personnel attrition would make the job reduction provision more or less academic .	185.77786
the situation with regard to the southern pacific was therefore a special one and not necessarily applicable to other situations in other industries .	114.54593
the solution reached in the agreement was more acceptable to the railroad than that originally included in a series of union demands .	47.131634
time was when the house of delegates of the american bar association leaned to the common sense side .	77.28337
but the internationalists have taken over the governing body of the bar , and when the lads met in st . louis , it was not to grumble about the humidity but to vote unanimously that the united nations was scarcely less than wonderful , despite an imperfection here and there .	28.300953
it was , the brief writers decided , `` man ' s best hope for a peaceful and law abiding world ' ' .	57.053867
peace , it ' s wonderful , and `` world law ' ' , it ' s wonderful , too , and shouldn ' t we get an international covenant extending it into space , before the russians put some claim jumper on the moon ? ?	43.095123
meanwhile , in moscow , khrushchev was adding his bit to the march of world law by promising to build a bomb with a wallop equal to 100 million tons of tnt , to knock sense into the heads of those backward oafs who can ' t see the justice of surrendering west berlin to communism .	44.503304
a nuclear pacifier of these dimensions -- roughly some six and a half times bigger than anything the united states has triggered experimentally -- would certainly produce a bigger bang , and , just for kicks , khrushchev might use it to propel the seminar of the house of delegates from st . louis to the moon , where there wouldn ' t even be any beer to drink .	42.346363
while he was at it , the philosopher of the kremlin contributed an additional assist to the rule of reason by bellowing at those in the west who can ' t appreciate coexistence thru suicide .	63.72055
`` fools ' ' , he bayed , `` what do you think you are doing ' ' ? ?	23.003254
the only response we can think of is the humble one that at least we aren ' t playing the marimba with our shoes in the united nations , but perhaps the heavy domes in the house of delegates can improve on this feeble effort .	35.739704
another evidence of the spreading rule of reason was provided from mexico city with the daily hijacking of an american plane by a demented algerian with a gun .	42.530056
the craft made the familiar unwelcome flight to havana , where , for some unknown reason , castro rushed to the airport to express mortification to the colombian foreign minister , a passenger , who is not an admirer of old ten o ' clock shadow .	35.517727
the plane was sent back to the united states , for a change , but castro kept the crazy gunman , who will prove a suitable recruit to the revolution .	40.636585
less respect for the legal conventions was displayed by castro ' s right hand man , che guevara , who edified the inter-american economic and social council meeting in montevideo by reading two secret american documents purloined from the united states embassy at caracas , venezuela .	35.40122
the contents were highly embarrassing to american spokesmen , who were on hand to promise latin americans a 20 billion dollar foreign aid millennium .	65.66869
perhaps the moralities of world law are not advanced by stealing american diplomatic papers and planes , but the kennedy administration can always file a demurrer to the effect that , but for its own incompetence in protecting american interests , these things would not happen .	43.84713
the same can be said about the half-hearted cuban invasion mounted by the administration last april , which , we trust , is not symptomatic of the methods to be invoked in holding off the felonious khrushchev .	78.256775
pass the iron rations , please , and light another candle , for it ' s getting dark down here and we ' re minded to read a bit of world law just to pass the time away .	73.896164
the board of suspension of the interstate commerce commission has ordered a group of railroads not to reduce their freight rates on grain , as they had planned to do this month .	50.063198
the request for lower rates originated with the southern railway , which has spent a good deal of time and money developing a 100-ton hopper car with which it says it can move grain at about half what it costs in the conventional , smaller car .	76.97704
by reducing rates as much as 60 per cent , it and its associated railroads hope to win back some of the business they have lost to truckers and barge lines .	74.92665
the board ' s action shows what free enterprise is up against in our complex maze of regulatory laws .	51.21128
word of dag hammarskjold ' s death in an african plane crash has sent a shockwave around the globe .	56.894478
as head of the united nations he was the symbol of world peace , and his tragic end came at a moment when peace hangs precariously .	44.082684
it was on the eve of a momentous u . n . session to come to grips with cold war issues .	52.987946
mr . hammarskjold was in africa on a mission of peace .	14.900368
he had sought talks with moise tshombe , the secessionist president of congo ' s katanga province where recent fighting had been bloody .	25.41693
the story of the fatal crash is not fully known .	65.41467
the u . n . -chartered plane which was flying from the conference city of ndola in northern rhodesia had been riddled with machinegun bullets last weekend and was newly repaired .	33.071583
whether this , or overt action , was the cause of the crash must be promptly determined .	55.730198
the death of mr . hammarskjold removes the united nations ' most controversial leader .	39.401684
he was controversial because he was uncompromising for peace and freedom with justice .	66.33372
he courageously defended the rights of small nations , and he stood his ground against the savage attacks of the communist bloc .	25.802603
the congo , in whose cause he died , was the scene of one of his greatest triumphs .	22.428265
his policies had resolved the conflicts that threatened to ignite the cold war and workable solutions were beginning to take shape .	28.012169
when the recent katangan outbreaks imperiled these solutions mr . hammarskjold , despite the danger , flew to exert a calming influence .	35.223854
the u . n . session scheduled for today will meet under the cloud of his passing .	93.77501
it is a crucial session with the world on the edge of momentous developments .	11.910829
if the manner of his passing moves the nations to act in the spirit of his dedication the sore issues that plague the world can yet be resolved with reason and justice .	63.351486
reaching agreement on projects of value to the whole community has long been one of greater miami ' s hardest tasks .	49.04671
even when public bodies arrived at a consensus , at least one dissenting vote has been usual .	51.654087
so we note approvingly a fresh sample of unanimity .	6.38335
all nine members of the inter-american center authority voted for goodbody & company ' s proposal to finance the long-awaited trade and cultural center .	42.003696
the widely known financial firm has 60 days to spell out the terms of its contract .	72.84062
if the indenture is accepted , the authority will proceed to validate a bond issue repayable from revenue .	36.990456
then goodbody will hand over a minimum of $15 . 5 million for developing the spacious graves tract to house the center .	21.59115
the next step awaits approval today by the metro commissioners as the members of the dade county port authority .	10.033519
they allotted $500 , 000 three years ago to support interama until its own financing could be arranged .	45.531666
less than half the sum has been spent , since the interama board pinched pennies during that period of painstaking negotiations .	47.81866
the balance is being budgeted for the coming year .	41.54324
it is one of the rare public ventures here on which nearly everyone is agreed .	185.40662
the city of miami recently yielded a prior claim of $8 . 5 million on the graves tract to clear the way for the project .	29.082003
so have the people ' s elected spokesmen at the state and federal levels .	56.303406
interama , as it rises , will be a living monument to greater miami ' s ability to get together on worthwhile enterprises .	19.517483
progress , or lack of it , toward civil rights in the 50 states is reported in an impressive 689-page compilation issued last week by the united states commission on civil rights .	63.23746
much happened in this field during the past 12 months .	71.36601
each state advisory committee documented its own activity .	10.844446
some accounts are quite lengthy but florida ' s is the shortest of all , requiring only four paragraphs .	43.12335
`` the established pattern of relative calm in the field of race relations has continued in all areas ' ' , reported this group headed by harold colee of jacksonville and including two south floridians , william d . singer and john b . turner of miami .	60.93182
`` no complaints or charges have been filed during the past year , either verbally or written , from any individual or group .	51.17653
`` the committee continues to feel that florida has progressed in a sound and equitable program at both the state and local levels in its efforts to review and assess transition problems as they arise from time to time in the entire spectrum of civil rights ' ' .	41.982754
problems have arisen in this sensitive field but have been handled in most cases with understanding and restraint .	56.081924
the progress reported by the advisory committee is real .	382.0937
while some think we move too fast and others too slowly , florida ' s record is a good one and stands out among the 50 .	112.62652
west germany will face the crucial tests that lie ahead , on berlin and unification , with a coalition government .	37.956627
this is the key fact emerging from sunday ' s national election .	22.941586
chancellor adenauer ' s christian democratic party slipped only a little in the voting but it was enough to lose the absolute bundestag majority it has enjoyed since 1957 .	44.381554
in order to form a new government it must deal with one of the two rival parties which gained strength .	47.812893
the aging chancellor in all likelihood will be retired .	51.487804
both willy brandt ' s social democrats , who gained 22 seats in the new parliament , and the free democrats , who picked up 23 , will insist on that before they enter the government .	82.68062
moon-faced ludwig erhart , the economic expert , probably will ascend to the leadership long denied him .	173.43835
if he becomes chancellor , dr . erhart would make few changes .	145.36821
the wizard who fashioned west germany ' s astonishing industrial rebirth is the soul of free enterprise .	23.843164
he is dedicated to building the nation ' s strength and , as are all west germans , to a free berlin and to reunion with captive east germany .	70.395775
what is in doubt as the free germans and their allies consider the voting trends is the nature of the coalition that will result .	79.77966
if the party of adenauer and erhart , with 45 per cent of the vote , approaches the party of willy brandt , which won 36 per cent , the result would be a stiffening of the old resolve .	20.114828
west berlin ' s mayor brandt vigorously demanded a firmer stand on the dismemberment of his city and won votes by it .	35.426422
the free democrats ( 12 per cent of the vote ) believe a nuclear war can be avoided by negotiating with the soviet union , and more dealings with the communist bloc .	22.042145
the question left by the election is whether west germany veers slightly toward more firmness or more flexibility .	79.45848
it could go either way , since the gains for both points of view were about the same .	83.191
regardless of the decision two facts are clear .	5.3993435
west germany , with its industrial and military might , reaffirmed its democracy and remains firm with the free nations .	76.502625
and the career of konrad adenauer , who upheld germany ' s tradition of rock-like leaders which bismarck began , draws near the end .	91.99562
americans are a nation of joiners , a quality which our friends find endearing and sometimes amusing .	138.3502
but it can be dangerous if the joiner doesn ' t want to make a spectacle of himself .	8.386571
for instance , so-called `` conservative ' ' organizations , some of them secret , are sprouting in the garden of joining where `` liberal ' ' organizations once took root .	84.441826
one specific example is a secret `` fraternity ' ' which will `` coordinate anti-communist efforts ' ' .	10.2576885
the principle is commendable but we suspect that in the practice somebody is going to get gulled .	24.400316
according to the chicago tribune news service , state atty . gen . stanley mosk of california has devised a series of questions which the joiner might well ask about any organization seeking his money and his name 1 .	40.13925
does it assail schools and churches with blanket accusations ? ?	8.517375
does it attack other traditional american institutions with unsupportable and wild charges ? ?	21.848124
does it put the label of un-american or subversive on everyone with whom it disagrees politically ? ?	19.44025
does it attempt to rewrite modern history by blaming american statesmen for wars , communism , depression , and other troubles of the world ? ?	45.655468
does it employ crude pressure tactics with such means as anonymous telephone calls and letter writing campaigns ? ?	109.6529
do its spokesmen seem more interested in the amount of money they collect than in the principles they purport to advocate ? ?	66.166885
in some instances a seventh question can be added 7 .	190.39813
does the organization show an affinity for a foreign government , political party or personality in opposition or preference to the american system ? ?	102.31756
if the would-be joiner asks these questions he is not likely to be duped by extremists who are seeking to capitalize on the confusions and the patriotic apprehensions of americans in a troubled time .	13.078206
falling somewhere in a category between einstein ' s theory and sand fleas -- difficult to see but undeniably there , nevertheless -- is the tropical green `` city ' ' of islandia , a string of offshore islands that has almost no residents , limited access and an unlimited future .	58.526936
whatever land you can see here , from the north tip end of elliott key looking southward , belongs to someone -- people who have title to the land .	122.113235
and what you can ' t see , the land underneath the water , belongs to someone , too .	75.735115
the only real problem is to devise a plan whereby the owners of the above-water land can develop their property without the public losing its underwater land and the right to its development for public use and enjoyment .	78.21913
in the fairly brief but hectic history of florida , the developers of waterfront land have too often wound up with both their land and ours .	60.048546
in this instance , happily , insistence is being made that our share is protected .	96.05408
and until this protection is at least as concrete as , say , the row of hotels that bars us from our own sands at miami beach , those who represent us all should agree to nothing .	112.06398
the reaction of certain city council members to california ' s newest anti-secrecy laws was as dismaying as it was disappointing .	41.059776
we had assumed that at least this local legislative body had nothing to hide , and , therefore , had no objections to making the deliberations of its committees and the city commissions available to the public .	38.415638
in the preamble to the open-meeting statutes , collectively known as the brown act , the legislature declares that `` the public commissions , boards and councils and other public agencies in this state exist to aid in the conduct of the people ' s business .	30.859087
it is the intent of the law that their actions be taken openly and that their deliberations be conducted openly .	65.3249
`` the people of this state do not yield their sovereignty to the agencies that serve them .	75.55238
the people , in delegating authority , do not give their public servants the right to decide what is good for the people to know and what is not good for them to know .	53.89177
the full implementation of these noble words , however , has taken the efforts of five sessions of the legislature .	31.457027
since 1953 california has led the nation in enacting guarantees that public business shall be publicly conducted , but not until this year did the lawmakers in sacramento plug the remaining loopholes in the brown act .	76.961266
despite the lip service paid by local governments , the anti-secrecy statutes have been continuously subverted by reservations and rationalizations .	11.240994
when all else fails , it is argued that open sessions slow down governmental operations .	248.45947
we submit that this is a most desirable effect of the law -- and one of its principal aims .	38.447685
without public scrutiny the deliberations of public agencies would no doubt be conducted more speedily .	115.601814
but the citizens would , of course , never be sure that the decisions that resulted were as correct as they were expeditious .	89.33169
if the dominican republic achieves free , democratic government , it will be due in large part to the u . s . show of force that enabled president balaguer to prevent a threatened restoration of trujillo dictatorship .	29.24956
mr . balaguer is in control , and opposition leaders have no further excuse to suspect his offer of a coalition government preliminary to free elections in the spring .	61.834805
had u . s . warships not appeared off the dominican coast , there is every possibility that the country would now be wracked by civil war .	24.244503
ultimately either the trujillos would have been returned to power or the conflict would have produced conditions favorable to a takeover by dominican elements responsive to castro in cuba .	65.53628
within the organization of american states , there may be some criticism of this unilateral american intervention which was not without risk obviously .	73.441895
but there was no complaint from the dominican crowds which lined ciudad trujillo ' s waterfront shouting , `` vive yankees ' ' ! !	9.14264
more , the u . s . action was hailed by a principal opposition leader , dr . juan bosch , as having saved `` many lives and many troubles in the near future ' ' .	36.552956
mr . balaguer ' s troubles are by no means over .	69.28453
he will need the help of all oas members to eradicate , finally , the forces of authoritarianism , pro-trujillo and pro-castro alike .	22.215792
in cooperating toward that objective , oas might move with the speed and effectiveness demonstrated by the united states .	40.745327
those watching the growing rivalry between craft unions and industrial unions may recognize all the pressures that led to the big labor split in 1935 .	48.936905
now , as then , it is a matter of jobs .	25.771513
craft unions seek work that industrial unions claim , such as factory maintenance .	112.29828
the issue was sufficiently potent in 1935 to spark secession from the american federation of labor of its industrial union members .	53.88338
that breach was healed 20 years later by merger of the american federation of labor and the congress of industrial organizations .	28.50882
or that ' s what it looked like at the time .	21.238356
but automation and the increasing complexity of factories has renewed the competition for jobs .	25.694921
walter reuther , leader of the industrial union faction of the afl-cio , says another two years of this squabbling will be disastrous for all american labor .	29.81931
whether it could be as disastrous for american labor as , say , jimmy hoffa of the teamsters , is a matter of conjecture .	16.100788
but the jurisdictional disputes that result from the craft-industrial rivalry do not win friends for labor .	66.8354
engaged as it is in a battle for world trade as a condition of national survival , this country can have little patience with labor ' s family feuds .	69.80054
the concept of labor as a special class is outmoded , and in the task confronting america as bastion of the free world , labor must learn to put the national interest first if it is itself to survive .	53.956635
the army , navy and air force , among others , may question secretary freeman ' s claim that the high estate of united states agriculture is the `` strongest deterrent ' ' to the spread of communism .	48.369503
but the secretary insists that the success of the american farmer is the `` greatest single source of strength ' ' in the struggle to insure freedom around the world .	37.54757
mr . freeman said that in many of the countries he visited on a recent world trade trip people were more awed by america ' s capacity to produce food surpluses than by our industrial production -- or even by the soviet ' s successes in space .	77.699
american taxpayers have been impressed by the surpluses for a long , long time .	22.614958
in fact , over the years , the american farmer ' s capacity to over-produce has cost the taxpayers a large dollar .	38.92413
and thus far , mr . freeman has offered very little relief .	65.170334
the 1961 feed grain program , which the secretary sponsored , has been declared a billion dollar fiasco .	23.12501
in exchange for higher price supports , growers pledged reduction in planted acreage .	5.2738905
but the farmers outsmarted washington by shortening the distance between the rows and pouring on the fertilizer .	24.787395
the result $1 . 1 billion added to the deficit in the federal budget .	18.856524
perhaps , as mr . freeman says , american agriculture may stop the communists , but it is also swindling the american taxpayer .	40.41625
a senate subcommittee headed by sen . jackson of washington has been going over the state department and has reached some predictable conclusions .	49.123344
the department needs a clearer `` sense of direction ' ' at the top and it needs fewer , but better , people , sen . jackson says .	64.48551
the subcommittee is not alone in questioning the effectiveness of the department .	13.311151
president kennedy has indicated his dissatisfaction with its performance .	41.743134
but those who would revitalize so complex an organization must , first of all , overcome the resistance of layers of officials wedded to traditional procedures , suspicious of innovation and fearful of mistakes .	64.4686
nor does sen . jackson discuss the delicate situation created by the presence in the white house of a corps of presidential assistants engaged in the study of foreign policy .	33.536926
this tends to create friction and confusion and has not made it easier for secretary rusk to restore vigor and initiative among his subordinates .	79.97178
but competent observers believe he is making progress , particularly toward what sen . jackson lists as the primary need -- `` a clearer understanding of where our vital national interests lie and what we must do to promote them ' ' .	78.50786
the jackson report will provide some of the political support mr . rusk will need if he is to get rid of department personnel engaged , as sen . jackson puts it , `` in work that does not really need doing ' ' .	46.571415
mr . rusk should also draw comfort from sen . jackson ' s recommendation that congressional methods of dealing with national security problems be improved .	40.42202
self-criticism is a rare but needed commodity in congress .	179.83769
forecasting economic activity is a hazardous undertaking even for the specialist .	38.86014
but now apparently the job of secretary of labor requires that he be willing to risk his reputation as a prognosticator of unemployment trends .	35.864334
james p . mitchell , when he was the head of the department , promised to eat his hat if unemployment didn ' t drop below three million a couple of years ago .	85.453735
he lost , but settled for a cake in the shape of a fedora .	10.991653
his successor , secretary goldberg , also has been guessing wrong on a drop in the unemployment rate which has been holding just under 7 per cent for the last 11 months .	48.534622
no betting man , mr . goldberg says he ' s merely `` putting my neck out again ' ' by predicting the rate will go down this month .	84.28481
he is basing his guess on new government statistics that show business has broadened its stride -- a new record high in personal income , an increase in housing starts , a spurt in retail sales and a gain in orders for durable goods .	49.213264
mr . mitchell had an excuse for losing -- the steel strike lasted much longer than he anticipated .	121.573494
mr . goldberg has less reason for missing .	5.319331
the economy seems to be sailing along on an even keel and the 1961 hurricane season and auto strikes are at an end so they can ' t be blamed in november .	75.68865
the odds thus appear favorable that the secretary ' s neck may be spared .	26.253696
cambodia ' s chief of state , who has been accused of harboring communist marauders and otherwise making life miserable for neighboring south viet nam and thailand , insists he would be very unhappy if communism established its power in southeast asia .	56.856644
but so convinced of communism ' s inevitable triumph is prince sihanouk that he is ready to throw in the towel .	35.119534
`` i have to see the facts ' ' , is the way the prince puts it .	38.09767
and from that point of vantage he concedes another two years of grace to nations maintaining a pro-western posture .	180.4549
prince sihanouk ' s powers of prognostication some day may be confirmed but history is not likely to praise the courage of his convictions .	30.414278
commerce secretary hodges seems to have been cast in the role of pacemaker for official washington ' s economic forecasters .	32.72554
weeks ago he saw a business upturn in the second quarter of this year while his colleagues in the cabinet were shaking their heads in disagreement .	48.31862
recently treasury secretary dillon and labor secretary goldberg fell into line with mr . hodges ' appraisal , though there has been some reluctance to do so at the white house .	41.466335
and now mr . hodges has pioneered further into the economic unknown with the announcement that he thinks business has stopped sliding and that it should start going upward from this point .	55.65215
he is the first top administration officer to see the bottom of the slump .	22.384966
the secretary based his assessment on the upturn in retail sales .	13.145517
february ' s volume was 1 per cent above january ' s for the first pickup since last october , although it ' s still 1 . 5 per cent off from february 1960 .	44.955284
corroborating mr . hodges ' figures was the federal reserve board ' s report of the large sales increase in the nation ' s department stores for the week ending march 4 .	37.155495
in newark , for example , this gain was put at 26 per cent above the year-earlier level .	23.153227
of course , some of the credit for the sale boost must be given to improvement in the weather and to the fact that easter comes more than two weeks earlier than in 1960 .	43.467102
another optimistic sign , this one from the labor department , was the report that the long rise in unemployment compensation payments `` was interrupted for the first time in the week ending feb . 25 ' ' .	46.953045
initial claims for jobless benefits were said to have dropped by 8 , 100 in the week ending march 4 .	34.562927
mr . hodges is so hopeful over the outlook that he doesn ' t think there will be any need of a cut in income taxes .	29.457453
well , we can ' t have everything .	21.449293
prosperity for the whole nation is certainly preferred to a tax cut .	150.55185
new jersey folk need not be told of the builder ' s march to the sea , for in a single generation he has parceled and populated miles of our shoreline and presses on to develop the few open spaces that remain .	61.288456
now the stone harbor bird sanctuary , 31 acres of magic attraction for exotic herons , is threatened , but the battlefront extends far beyond our state .	40.62185
against the dramatic fight being waged for preservation of 30 miles of cape cod shoreline , the tiny tract at stone harbor may seem unimportant .	18.26445
but interior secretary udall warns that there is a race on between those who would develop our few surviving open shorelines and those who would save them for the enjoyment of all as public preserves .	74.337654
the move for establishment of a national seashore park on 30 , 000 acres of cape cod , from provincetown to chatham , is strengthened by president kennedy ' s interest in that area .	24.576883
but preservation of the natural beauty of the cape is of more than regional concern , for the automobile age has made it the recreation spot of people from all over the country .	89.34349
by comparison , stone harbor bird sanctuary ' s allies seem less formidable , for aside from the audubon society , they are mostly the snowy , common and cattle egrets and the louisiana , green , little blue and black-crowned herons who nest and feed there .	73.594
but there is hope , for conservation commissioner bontempo has tagged the sanctuary as the kind of place the state hopes to include in its program to double its park space .	92.74416
the desirability of preserving such places as the cape dunes and stone harbor sanctuary becomes more apparent every year .	24.381666
public sentiment for conserving our rich natural heritage is growing .	38.278545
much of the glamor president kennedy ' s peace corps may have held for some prospective applicants has been removed by sargent shriver , the head corpsman .	38.337284
anybody who is expecting a joyride should , according to mr . shriver , get off the train right now .	52.34732
first of all , the recruits will have to undergo arduous schooling .	3.9533944
then off to a remote place in an underdeveloped country where the diet , culture , language and living conditions will be different .	82.05147
and the pay , of course , will be nil .	1.895797
despite all this , the idea apparently has captured the imagination of countless youths whose parents are probably more surprised by the response than anybody else .	53.067898
the study of the st . louis area ' s economic prospects prepared for the construction industry joint conference confirms and reinforces both the findings of the metropolitan st . louis survey of 1957 and the easily observed picture of the missouri-illinois countryside .	62.88558
st . louis sits in the center of a relatively slow-growing and in some places stagnant mid-continent region .	21.282215
slackened regional demand for st . louis goods and services reflects the region ' s relative lack of purchasing power .	80.56566
not all st . louis industries , of course , have a market area confined to the immediate neighborhood .	51.932693
but for those which do , the slow growth of the area has a retarding effect on the metropolitan core .	31.061226
the city has a stake in stimulating growth and purchasing power throughout outstate missouri and southern illinois .	104.63747
gov . dalton ' s new commerce and industry commission is moving to create a nine-state regional group in a collective effort to attract new industry .	56.588818
another would be to take the advice of dr . elmer ellis , president of the university of missouri , and provide for an impartial professional analysis of missouri ' s economy .	26.25548
he says the state , in order to proceed with economic development , must develop an understanding of how the various parts of its economy fit together and dovetail into the national economy .	44.424885
the research center of the university ' s school of business and public administration is prepared to undertake the analysis dr . ellis has been talking about .	52.739388
he and dean john w . schwada of the business school outlined the project at a recent conference .	91.61817
the university can make a valuable contribution to the state ' s economic development through such a study .	29.726198
in southern illinois , the new federal program of help to economically depressed areas ought to provide some stimulus to growth .	35.43436
the carbondale industrial development corp . has obtained a $500 , 000 loan to help defray the cost of remodeling a city-owned factory to accommodate production that will provide 500 new jobs .	25.13186
carbondale is in the herrin-murphysboro-west frankfort labor market , where unemployment has been substantially higher than the national average .	34.369442
the federal program eventually should have a favorable impact on missouri ' s depressed areas , and in the long run that will benefit st . louis as well .	32.66438
politics-ridden st . clair county in illinois presents another piece of the problem of metropolitan development .	44.16258
more industrial acreage lies vacant in st . clair county than in any other jurisdiction in the st . louis area .	41.901367
the unstable political situation there represents one reason new plants shy away from the east side .	103.570206
and then there is st . louis county , where the democratic leadership has shown little appreciation of the need for sound zoning , of the important relationship between proper land use and economic growth .	36.40728
st . louis county under its present leadership also has largely closed its eyes to the need for governmental reform , and permitted parochial interests to take priority over area-wide interests .	79.91311
some plant-location specialists take these signs to mean st . louis county doesn ' t want industry , and so they avoid the area , and more jobs are lost .	57.05202
metropolitan st . louis ' s relatively slow rate of growth ought to be a priority concern of the political , business , civic and other leaders on both sides of the mississippi .	38.828163
without a great acceleration in the metropolitan area ' s economy , there will not be sufficient jobs for the growing numbers of youngsters , and st . louis will slip into second-class status .	40.639908
many of our very best friends are reformers .	5.8071337
still we must confess that sometimes some of them go too far .	45.14594
take , for example , the reformers among new york city ' s democrats .	34.648666
having whipped mr . de sapio in the primaries and thus come into control of tammany hall , they have changed the name to chatham hall .	40.119915
even though headquarters actually have been moved into the chatham building , do they believe that they can make the new name stick ? ?	56.60069
granted that the tammany name and the tammany tiger often were regarded as badges of political shame , the sachems of the hall also have a few good marks to their credit .	41.91993
but it is tradition rather than the record which balks at the expunging of the tammany name .	11.797475
after all , it goes back to the days in which sedition was not un-american , the days in which the sons of st . tammany conspired to overthrow the government by force and violence -- the british government , that is .	31.282793
further , do our reforming friends really believe that the cartoonists will consent to the banishment of the tiger from their zoo ? ?	12.225855
they will -- when they give up the donkey and the elephant .	18.145697
instead of attempting the impossible , why not a publicity campaign to prove that all the tiger ' s stripes are not black ? ?	30.59364
the white house itself has taken steps to remove a former batista official , col . mariano faget , from his preposterous position as interrogator of cuban refugees for the immigration service .	25.847778
the faget appointment was preposterous on several grounds .	8.997242
the kennedy administration had assured anti-castro cubans that it would have nothing to do with associates of dictator batista .	30.86158
using a batista man to screen refugees represented a total misunderstanding of the democratic forces which alone can effectively oppose castro .	69.201294
moreover , col . faget ' s information on cuba was too outdated to be useful in `` screening ' ' castro agents	52.49371
the colonel fled to the friendly haven of the dominican dictatorship as soon as castro seized power .	29.378345
and while he had headed batista ' s anti-communist section , the batista regime did not disturb the communists so much as more open opponents who were alleged to be communists .	49.827957
responsibility for the faget appointment rests with gen . j . m . swing , an eisenhower appointee as head of the immigration service .	26.927763
gen . swing has received public attention before this for abuse of some of the prerogatives of his office .	34.59739
some reports say he was rescued from timely retirement by his friend , congressman walter of pennsylvania , at a moment when the kennedy administration was diligently searching for all the house votes it could get .	38.419174
congressman walter has been all-powerful in immigration matters , but he has announced plans to retire in 1962 .	22.707508
at that point the administration will have little reason to hang onto gen . swing .	32.98099
the faget case was the kind of salvage job the administration should not have to repeat .	85.36239
as president , dwight d . eisenhower often assumed a role aloof from the strife of partisan politics .	17.637005
as a former president , however , mr . eisenhower abandoned this role to engage in partisan sniping during a new york republican rally , and generally missed his target .	43.89521
mr . eisenhower seized upon the incident of the postcard lost by a peace corps girl in nigeria to attack the entire corps as a `` juvenile experiment ' ' and to suggest sending a corps member to the moon .	46.839844
nowhere did the speaker recognize the serious purpose of the corps or its welcome reception abroad .	48.53885
his words were the more ungracious to come from a man who lent his name to the eisenhower exchange fellowships dedicated to the same goal of international understanding .	22.866371
the former president blithely ignored recent history in speaking of `` dollarette ' ' dollars under kennedy administration fiscal policies .	82.089584
it was the eisenhower administration which produced the largest peacetime deficit .	4.495034
finally , mr . eisenhower found nothing but confusion in washington .	61.50742
this statement recalls the 1959 berlin crisis , when president eisenhower first told reporters that berlin could not be defended with conventional weapons and then added that a nuclear defense was out of the picture too .	67.30746
the crisis has been renewed since then but the confusion has hardly been compounded .	46.707508
ex-presidents , relieved of accountability for policy , sometimes seem to feel free of accountability for their words .	136.63994
some of former president truman ' s off-the-cuff discourses have been in that vein .	37.969753
nobody can deny the right of former chief executives to take part in politics , but the american people expect them always to remember the obligations of national leadership and to treat issues with a sense of responsibility .	46.831318
this is a matter of respect for the presidency .	21.383553
mr . eisenhower ' s new york speech does not encourage respect for that or for his elder statesmanship .	168.67085
the queen mary has long been a symbol of speed , luxury , and impeccable british service on the high seas .	49.245922
reports that the venerable liner , which has been in service since 1936 , was to be retired struck a nostalgic note in many of us .	43.546246
but the cunard line , influenced by unpleasant economic facts and not sentiment , has decided to keep the queen mary in service until next spring at least .	109.659805
a new queen , with the prosaic title of q3 , had been planned for several years to replace the queen mary .	18.642015
the british government , concerned about the threat of unemployment in the shipbuilding industry , had put through a bill to give cunard loans and grants totaling $50 , 400 , 000 toward the $84 , 000 , 000 cost of a new 75 , 000-ton passenger liner .	23.749342
since 1957 , more and more trans-atlantic passengers have been crossing by air .	47.84342
economy class fares and charter flights have attracted almost all new passengers to the airlines .	49.947838
competition from other steamship lines has cut cunard ' s share of sea passengers from one-third to one-fourth and this year the line showed a marked drop of profits on the atlantic run .	52.643192
the cunard line has under consideration replacing the queen mary with a ship smaller than 75 , 000 tons .	33.77722
this would be cheaper to operate and could be used for cruises during the lean winter months .	26.306585
also under consideration is an increased investment in cunard eagle airways which has applied to serve new york .	31.080746
the decline of the cunard line from its position of dominance in atlantic travel is a significant development in the history of transportation .	98.023796
gen . maxwell taylor ' s statement in saigon that he is `` very much encouraged ' ' about the chances of the pro-western government of viet nam turning back communist guerrilla attacks comes close to an announcement that he will not recommend dispatching united states troops to bolster the vietnamese army .	17.436874
gen . taylor will report to president kennedy in a few days on the results of his visit to south viet nam and , judging from some of his remarks to reporters in the far east , he is likely to urge a more efficient mobilization of vietnamese military , economic , political and other resources .	32.717583
there was good reason for gen . taylor to make an inspection trip at this time .	23.66356
communist guerrillas recently have been reported increasing their activities and the great flood of the mekong river has interposed a new crisis .	22.19735
south viet nam ' s rice surplus for next year -- more than 300 , 000 tons -- may have been destroyed .	29.53464
the viet cong , the communist rebels , may have lost their stored grain and arms factories .	64.037605
the rebels may try to seize what is left of the october harvest when the floods recede and the monsoon ends in november .	59.72532
nothing that is likely to happen , however , should prompt the sending of united states soldiers for other than instructional missions .	68.181305
the indochina struggle was a war to stay out of in 1954 , when gen . ridgway estimated it would take a minimum of 10 to 15 divisions at the outset to win a war the french were losing .	58.46705
it is a war to stay out of today , especially in view of the fact that president ngo dinh diem apparently does not want united states troops .	35.592678
he may want additional technical help , and this should be forthcoming .	12.21891
south viet nam has received $1 , 450 , 000 , 000 in united states aid since 1954 and the rate of assistance has been stepped up since vice president lyndon b . johnson ' s visit last may .	42.336308
gen . taylor , the president ' s special military adviser , is a level-headed officer who is not likely to succumb to propaganda or pressure .	35.63911
it is probable that his recommendations will be informed and workable , and that they will not lead to involving the united states in an asian morass .	27.893454
gov . john m . dalton , himself a lawyer and a man of long service in government , spoke with rich background and experience when he said in an address here that lawyers ought to quit sitting in the missouri general assembly , or quit accepting fees from individuals and corporations who have controversies with or axes to grind with the government and who are retained , not because of their legal talents , but because of their government influence .	77.30121
ambassador stevenson yesterday described the u . n . ' s problem of electing a temporary successor to the late dag hammarskjold as `` the gravest crisis the institution has faced ' ' .	25.196043
if the decision goes wrong , it may be -- as mr . stevenson fears -- `` the first step on the slippery path downhill ' ' to a u . n . without operational responsibilities and without effective meaning .	57.176014
the integrity of the office not merely requires that the secretary general shall be , as the charter puts it , `` the chief administrative officer of the organization ' ' , but that neither he nor his staff shall seek or receive instructions from any government or any other authority `` external to the organization ' ' .	51.534447
in other words , the secretary general is to be a nonpartisan , international servant , not a political , national one .	60.07117
he should be , as dag hammarskjold certainly was , a citizen of the world .	24.22595
the charter does stipulate that `` due regard ' ' shall be paid to the importance of recruiting the staff on `` as wide a geographical basis as possible ' ' .	33.843918
the united states and its allies have had no objection to this .	22.635284
what they have objected to is the attempt of the russians to make use of the tragedy of dag hammarskjold ' s death to turn the entire u . n . staff from the secretary down into political agents of the respective countries from which they come .	46.650295
the controversy now revolves mainly around the number and geographic origin of the deputies of the secretary general and , more particularly , around the nature of his relationship with them .	56.31546
although the united states and the u . s . s . r . have been arguing whether there shall be four , five or six top assistants , the most important element in the situation is not the number of deputies but the manner in which these deputies are to do their work .	38.99957
if any one of them has any power to veto the secretary general ' s decisions the nature of the organization will have changed .	40.9526
if they give him advice when he asks it , or if they perform specified duties under his direction , the nature of the u . n . will not of necessity change .	59.92369
the secretary general must have , subject to the constitutional direction of the security council and the general assembly , the power to act , to propose action and to organize action without being hobbled by advisers and assistants acting on someone else ' s instructions .	42.931126
this is the root issue for which the united states should stand .	50.630474
we should not become confused or let our public become confused over irrelevant questions of number or even of geography .	136.49934
what we must have , if the united nations is to survive , is as nonpolitical , nonpartisan an organization at the top as human beings can make it , subject to no single nation ' s direction and subservient to no single nation ' s ambition .	62.071964
the new city charter , which should get a yes vote as question no . 1 on nov . 7 , would not make a good mayor out of a bad one .	114.23181
there is no such magic in man-made laws .	1.8120475
but it would greatly strengthen any mayor ' s executive powers , remove the excuse in large degree that he is a captive of inaction in the board of estimate , increase his budget-making authority both as to expense and capital budgets , and vest in him the right to reorganize city departments in the interest of efficiency and economy .	60.58066
lawmaking power is removed from the board of estimate and made a partnership responsibility of the city council and the mayor .	44.22865
thus there is a clearer division of authority , administrative and legislative .	35.144848
the board is diminished in both respects , while it retains control over zoning , franchises , pier leases , sale , leasing and assignment of property , and other trusteeship functions .	18.216948
the board will be able to increase , decrease , add or eliminate budget items , subject to the mayor ' s veto	55.85814
but the city council will now share fully this budget-altering power .	75.51781
overriding of mayoral veto on budget changes will require concurrence by board and council , and a two-thirds vote .	32.977722
the controller retains his essential `` fiscal watchdog ' ' functions	7.187619
his broad but little used investigative powers are confirmed .	75.80463
he loses now-misplaced tax collection duties , which go to the finance department .	44.659477
on net balance , in spite of controller gerosa ' s opposition to the new charter as an invasion of his office , the controller will have the opportunity for greater usefulness to good government than he has now .	66.7467
borough presidents , while retaining membership in the board of estimate , lose their housekeeping functions .	42.660206
highways go to a new department of highways , sewers to the department of public works , such street cleaning as borough presidents now do ( in queens and richmond ) to the sanitation department .	32.01395
the expense ( operating ) budget is to be a program budget , and red tape is cut to allow greater autonomy ( with the mayor approving ) in fund transfers within a department .	135.82755
the capital budget , for construction of permanent improvements , becomes an appropriating document instead of just a calendar of pious promises	55.572914
but , as a second-look safeguard , each new project must undergo a board of estimate public hearing before construction proceeds .	86.86932
a road block to desirable local or borough improvements , heretofore dependent on the pocketbook vote of taxpayers and hence a drag on progress , is removed by making these a charge against the whole city instead of an assessment paid by those immediately affected .	109.77925
this will have a beneficial effect by expediting public business	1130.9607
enlargement of the city council and a new method of selecting members will be discussed tomorrow .	54.731377
the inter-american press association , which blankets the western hemisphere from northern canada to cape horn , is meeting in new york city this week for the first time in eleven years .	32.392036
the i . a . p . a . is a reflection of the problems and hopes of the hemisphere	32.446823
and in these days this inevitably means a concentration on the effects of the cuban revolution .	24.811672
as the press in cuba was gradually throttled by the castro regime , more and more cuban publishers , editors and correspondents were forced into exile .	20.378178
the i . a . p . a . found itself driven from journalism into politics as it did its best to bring about the downfall of the castro government and the return of the cuban press to the freedom it knew before batista ' s dictatorship began in 1952 .	41.244904
freedom of the press was lost in cuba because of decades of corruption and social imbalances .	49.788773
