the twenty-second soviet communist party congress opens in moscow today in a situation contrasting sharply with the script prepared many months ago when this meeting was first announced .	65.403725
according to the original program , premier khrushchev expected the millions looking toward the kremlin this morning to be filled with admiration or rage -- depending upon individual or national politics -- because of the `` bold program for building communism in our time ' ' which the congress will adopt .	78.88206
but far from being concerned about whether or not russia will have achieved utopia by 1980 , the world is watching moscow today primarily for clues as to whether or not there will be nuclear armageddon in the immediate future .	78.60087
the evident contradiction between the rosy picture of russia ' s progress painted by the communist party ' s program and the enormous dangers for all humanity posed by premier khrushchev ' s berlin policy has already led to speculation abroad that the program may be severely altered .	33.339836
whether it is or not , the propaganda impact on the free world of the document scheduled to be adopted at this meeting will be far less than had been originally anticipated .	55.628216
and there must be many soviet citizens who know what is going on and who realize that before they can hope to enjoy the full life promised for 1980 they and their children must first survive .	127.55667
this congress will see premier khrushchev consolidating his power and laying the groundwork for an orderly succession should death or illness remove him from the scene in the next few years .	43.26687
the widespread purge that has taken place the past twelve months or so among communist leaders in the provinces gives assurance that the party officials who will dominate the congress , and the central committee it will elect , will all have passed the tightest possible khrushchev screening , both for loyalty to him and for competence and performance on the job .	79.496796
dr . james b . conant has earned a nationwide reputation as a moderate and unemotional school reformer .	23.573414
his earlier reports considered the american public schools basically sound and not in need of drastic change .	187.4192
now , a close look at the schools in and around the ten largest cities , including new york , has shattered this optimism .	61.808514
dr . conant has come away shocked and angry .	31.673363
his new book , entitled `` slums and suburbs ' ' , calls for fast and drastic action to avert disaster .	40.71473
there is room for disagreement concerning some of dr . conant ' s specific views .	19.533545
his strong opposition to the transfer of negro children to schools outside their own neighborhood , in the interest of integration , will be attacked by negro leaders who have fought for , and achieved , this open or permissive enrollment .	88.43668
dr . conant may underestimate the psychological importance of even token equality .	36.328938
his suggestion that the prestige colleges be made the training institutions for medical , law and graduate schools will run into strong opposition from these colleges themselves -- even though what he is recommending is already taking shape as a trend .	196.06247
but these are side issues to a powerful central theme .	22.047297
that theme cuts through hypocrisies , complacency and double-talk .	2.2839558
it labels the slums , especially the negro slums , as dead-end streets for hundreds of thousands of youngsters .	12.674723
the villains of the piece are those who deny job opportunities to these youngsters , and dr . conant accuses employers and labor unions alike .	32.23586
the facts , he adds , are hidden from public view by squeamish objections to calling bad conditions by their right name and by insistence on token integration rather than on real improvement of the schools , regardless of the color of their students .	96.69257
a call for action `` before it is too late ' ' has alarming implications when it comes from a man who , in his previous reports on the schools , cautioned so strongly against extreme measures .	49.32065
dr . conant ' s conscientious , selfless efforts deserve the nation ' s gratitude .	19.160444
he has served in positions of greater glamour , both at home and abroad	40.027267
but he may well be doing his greatest service with his straightforward report on the state of the public schools .	60.344456
a fascinating letter has just reached this desk from a correspondent who likes to receive so-called junk mail .	35.497967
he was delighted to learn that the post office department is now going to expand this service to deliver mail from representatives in congress to their constituents without the use of stamps , names , addresses or even zone numbers .	43.48865
in accordance with legislation passed at the last session of congress , each representative is authorized to deliver to the post office in bulk newsletters , speeches and other literature to be dropped in every letter box in his district .	36.52387
this means an added burden to innumerable postmen , who already are complaining of heavy loads and low pay , and it presumably means an increased postal deficit , but , our correspondent writes , think of the additional junk mail each citizen will now be privileged to receive on a regular basis .	55.299614
occasional letters are sent by individuals to one another and many are written by companies to one another , but these are mostly typewritten .	130.68382
most mail these days consists of nothing that could truly be called a letter .	127.364494
old , tired , trembling the woman came to the cannery .	8.749003
she had , she said , heard that the plant was closing .	68.24053
it couldn ' t close , she said .	4.4103227
she had raised a calf , grown it beef-fat .	2.8219213
she had , with her own work-weary hands , put seeds in the ground , watched them sprout , bud , blossom , and get ready to bear .	25.131165
she was ready to kill the beef , dress it out , and with vegetables from her garden was going to can soup , broth , hash , and stew against the winter .	41.236217
she had done it last year , and the year before , and the year before that , and she , and her people were dependent upon these cans for food .	53.54824
this did not happen in counties of north georgia , where the rivers run and make rich the bottom land .	96.182594
nor in south georgia , where the summer sun shines warmly and gives early life to the things growing in the flat fields .	101.00683
this happened in decatur , dekalb county , not 10 miles from the heart of metropolitian atlanta .	53.69141

mr . podger always particularly enjoyed the last night of each summer at loon lake .	22.34124
the narrow fringe of sadness that ran around it only emphasized the pleasure .	142.67058
the evening was not always spent in the same way .	21.524956
this year , on a night cool with the front of september moving in , but with plenty of summer still about , the podgers were holding a neighborhood gathering in the pod .	70.831474
the little cottage was bursting with people of all ages .	57.208084
in the midst of it all , mr . podger came out on the pod porch , alone .	17.866451
he had that day attended a country auction , and he had come back with a prize .	28.313047
the prize was an old-fashioned , woven cloth hammock , complete with cross-top pillow , fringed side pieces , and hooks for hanging .	26.523006
mrs . podger had obligingly pushed things around on the porch to make room for it , and there it was , slung in a vine-shaded corner , the night breeze rippling its fringe with a slow , caressing movement .	31.322739
mr . podger sat down in it , pushed himself back and forth in one or two slow , rhythmic motions , and then swung his feet up into it .	56.79134
he closed his eyes and let the unintelligible drift of voices sweep pleasantly over him .	88.34961
suddenly one young voice rose above the others .	14.507786
`` but ' ' , it said , `` do you always know when you ' re happy ' ' ? ?	22.604479
the voice sank back into the general tangle of sound , but the question stayed in mr . podger ' s mind .	47.380886
here , in the cool , autumn-touched evening , mr . podger mentally retraced a day that had left him greatly contented and at peace .	51.38259
it had begun with the blue jay feather .	63.378345
walking along the lake before breakfast , mr . podger had seen the feather , and the bird that had lost it in flight .	24.663406
the winging spread of blue had gone on , calling harshly , into the wood .	45.596443
the small shaft of blue had drifted down and come to rest at his feet .	35.033188
all day long mr . podger , who was a straw-hat man in the summer , had worn the feather in the band of his broad-brimmed sunshield .	20.139109
would a blue feather in a man ' s hat make him happy all day ? ?	225.40936
but it was something to have seen it floating down through the early morning sunshine , linking the blue of the sky with the blue of the asters by the lake .	22.915178
then , since the auction was being held nearby , he had walked to it .	40.159813
and there , on the way , had been the box turtle , that slow , self-contained , world-ignoring relic of pre-history , bent , for reasons best known to itself , on crossing the road .	66.55788
it was doing very well , too , having reached the center , and was pursuing its way with commendable singleness of purpose when mr . podger saw hazard approaching in the shape of a flashy little sports car .	57.528633
would he take pains to avoid it ? ?	1.0168012
taking off his hat and signaling the driver with it , mr . podger stepped into the road , lifted the surprised turtle and consummated its road-crossing with what must have been a breath-taking suddenness .	26.204805
the turtle immediately withdrew into its private council room to study the phenomenon .	86.63664
but mr . podger and the driver of the sports car waved at each other .	27.943176
here in the cool darkness mr . podger could still feel the warmth of midday , could still see the yellow butterflies dancing over the road , could still see the friendly grin on the young , sun-browned face as the driver looked back over his shoulder for a moment before the car streaked out of sight .	53.40123
for a few brief minutes they had all been part of one little drama .	97.70489
the three would never meet again , but for some reason or other mr . podger was sure he would always remember the incident .	61.251705
at will , the voice of the auctioneer , the voices of the bidders , and finally the small boy who had been so interested in mr . podger ' s hammock purchase .	29.739023
`` i like them things , too ' ' , he had said .	10.437636
if you ' re lyin ' out in the hammock at night , and it gets kinda cool -- you know -- you just take these sides with the fringe on -- see -- and wrap ' em right over you .	48.575546
i do it , lots o ' times -- i like to lie in a hammock at night , by myself , when it ' s all quiet .	44.039886
the wind moves it a little bit -- you know .	45.751904
mr . podger had thanked him gravely , and now he made use of the advice .	69.35696
as he pulled the fringed sides up and made himself into a cocoon , mr . podger saw that thin , attractive , freckled little face again , and hoped that the boy , too , was lying in a cool , fringed-wrapped quiet .	35.126904
alacrity , the podger cat , came by the hammock , rubbed her back briefly against it , and then , sure of a welcome , hopped up .	76.54638
she remarked that she found the night wind a little chilly , and mr . podger took her inside the fringe .	34.600723
soon her purring rivaled the chirping of the tree crickets , rivaled the hum of voices from inside the pod .	20.059402
mr . podger was just adding this to his pictures of the day when the screen door opened and pam burst out .	19.586863
`` it ' s getting so chilly we ' ve lighted a fire , and we ' re going to tell a round robin story -- a nice , scary one .	20.970657
why are you out here all by yourself ? ?	4.7006855

`` of course i am ' ' , he said .	5.085886
i just came out here to know it ' ' .	5.366087
as the south begins another school year , national and even world attention is directed at the region ' s slow progress toward racial equality in the public schools .	103.213165
desegregation is beginning in two more important southern cities -- dallas and atlanta .	42.47974
in each city civic and education leaders have been working hard to get public opinion prepared to accept the inevitability of equal treatment .	58.55795
these programs emphasize the acceptance of biracial classrooms peacefully .	24.805277
the programs do not take sides on the issue itself .	75.60136
they point out simply that `` it is the law of the land ' ' .	6.427226
the two cities have the examples of little rock and new orleans to hold up as warnings against resorting to violence to try to stop the processes of desegregation .	40.506077
even better , they have the examples of nashville and houston to hold up as peaceful and progressive programs .	48.88063
in each case there was an initial act of violence .	8.432483
in houston , there were a few incidents of friction between whites and negroes , none of which were serious .	43.79178
in each city quick public reaction and fast action by the city government halted the threats of more serious incidents .	34.241543
the nashville plan , incidentally , has become recognized as perhaps the most acceptable and thus the most practical to put into effect in the troubled south .	87.056015
it is a `` stair-step ' ' plan , in which desegregation begins in the first grade .	39.267036
each year another grade is added to the process , until finally all 12 grades are integrated .	269.98703
the schedules are flexible so that the program can be accelerated as the public becomes more tolerant or realizes that it is something that has to be done , `` so why not now ' ' .	31.155872
the program has worked well in both nashville and houston .	5.1411104
it met a serious rebuff in new orleans , where the two schools selected for the first moves toward integration were boycotted by white parents .	73.61201
another attempt will be made this year in new orleans to resume the program .	26.916979
generally , throughout the south , there is a growing impatience with the pattern of violence with which every step of desegregation is met .	49.22585
perhaps the most eloquent move toward removal of racial barriers has been in dallas .	253.86855
during the summer , negroes began quietly patronizing previously segregated restaurants and lunch counters in downtown retail establishments .	24.983717
it was part of a citywide move toward full integration .	109.56484
so successful has been this program , worked out by white and negro civic leaders , that further extensions are expected in the next few months .	23.878736
hotels , for example , are ready to let down the bars .	98.049934
already , at least one hotel has been quietly taking reservations on a nonracial basis .	20.686129
several conventions have been held in recent months in hotels on a nonsegregated basis .	20.906448
this is a radical change in attitude from the conditions which prevailed several years ago , when a series of bombings was directed against negroes who were moving into previously all-white neighborhoods of dallas .	25.090525
it is also symptomatic of a change in attitude which appears to be spreading all across the south .	62.191242
southern whites themselves are realizing that they had been wrong in using violence to try to stop negroes from claiming equal rights .	107.228806
they insist they are ashamed of such violence and intimidation as occurred in alabama when the freedom riders sought to break down racial discrimination in local bus depots .	40.649055
all across the south there are signs that racial violence is finding less approval among whites who themselves would never take active part but might once have shown a tolerant attitude toward it .	142.59741
business leaders are aware now that they suffer greatly from any outbreak of violence .	22.506527
they are putting strong pressure on their police departments to keep order .	70.56765
in the past these same southerners were inclined to look the other way .	40.382496
and as the businessmen have begun to act , a real sense of co-operation has sprung up .	28.789991
this co-operation has emboldened other southern whites to add their voices to demands for peaceable accommodation .	44.316826
they realize that by acting in concert , rather than individually , they will not be picked out as objects of retaliation -- economic and otherwise .	54.69837
since moving from a chicago suburb to southern california a few months ago , i ' ve been introduced to a new game called lanesmanship .	22.002256
played mostly on the freeways around los angeles , it goes like this	120.826935
a driver cruising easily at 70 m . p . h . in lane a of a four-lane freeway spies an incipient traffic jam ahead .	21.47449
traffic in the next lane appears to be moving more smoothly so he pokes a tentative fender into lane b , which is heavily populated by cars also moving at 70 m . p . h . .	39.016205
the adjacent driver in lane b has three choices open to him .	110.18437
he can ( 1 ) point his car resolutely at the invading fender and force the other driver back into lane a	51.527027
( 2 ) slow down and permit the ambivalent driver to change lanes	220.20668
or ( 3 ) alternately accelerate and decelerate , thus keeping the first driver guessing as to his intentions , thereby making a fascinating sport of the whole affair .	55.504826
the really remarkable thing to me is that most california natives unhesitatingly elect to slow down and permit the invading car free access .	43.655853
whether or not this is done out of enlightened self-preservation , i don ' t know .	13.76976
but it is done , consistently and i ' m both surprised and impressed .	73.78012
this could never happen in my native chicago .	6.9604936
there such soggy acquiesence would be looked upon as a sure sign of deteriorating manhood .	12.629436
in chicago , the driver cut out would likely jam his gas pedal to the floor in an effort to force the other car back .	60.37044
failing this , he would pull alongside at the first opportunity and shake his fist threateningly .	13.668136
this negative explanation of courtesy on the freeways , however , does an injustice to southern california drivers .	50.744747
at the risk of losing my charge-a-plate at marshall field and company , i would like to challenge an old and hallowed stereotype .	99.182205
after three months of research , i can state unequivocally that los angeles drivers are considerably more courteous and competent than any other drivers i ' ve ever encountered .	67.235725
during one recent day of driving about los angeles there were actually a dozen occasions when oncoming drivers stopped an entire lane of traffic to permit me to pull out of an impossible side street .	55.775925

he hasn ' t played too much , because richards has been working on him furiously in batting practice .	39.84264

he was down , hard to talk to , and far too nonchalant on the field .	62.57802

is the mother of an `` autistic ' ' child at fault ? ?	19.155426
( the `` autistic ' ' child is one who seems to lack a well-defined sense of self .	37.572903
he tends to treat himself and other people as if they were objects -- and sometimes he treats objects as if they were people .	87.81335
) did his mother make him this way ? ?	17.514818
we believe that autism , like so many other conditions of defect and deviation , is to a large extent inborn .	25.459984
a mother can help a child adapt to his difficulties .	140.52863
sometimes she can -- to a large extent -- help him overcome them .	78.63217
but we don ' t think she creates them .	11.64127
we don ' t think she can make her child defective , emotionally disturbed or autistic .	57.903336
the mother of a difficult child can do a great deal to help her own child and often , by sharing her experiences , she can help other mothers with the same problem .	38.95347
since little is known about autism , and almost nothing has been written for the layman , we ' d like to share one experienced mother ' s comments .	75.733635
as the mother of an autistic child who is lacking in interest and enthusiasm about almost anything , i have to manipulate my son ' s fingers for him when he first plays with a new toy .	39.416016
he wants me to do everything for him .	2.8261132
`` you don ' t believe that autistic children become autistic because of something that happens to them or because of the way their mother treats them .	66.33833
but i do and my psychiatrist does , too .	85.98354
i know , that my son wants control and direction , but being autistic myself i cannot give full control or direction .	173.13882
`` one thing i notice which i have seldom heard mentioned .	74.88951
this is that autistic people don ' t enjoy physical contact with others -- for instance , my children and i .	102.99464
when i hold my son he stiffens his whole body in my arms until he is as straight and stiff as a board .	108.42317
he pushes and straightens himself as if he can ' t stand the feeling of being held .	54.98191
physical contact is uncomfortable for him ' ' ! !	27.910736
as a rule , the autistic child doesn ' t enjoy physical contact with others .	22.951933
parents have to find other ways of comforting him .	66.72598
for the young child this may be no more than providing food , light or movement .	89.44647
as he grows older it may be a matter of providing some accustomed object ( his `` magic ' ' thing ) .	68.52081
or certain words or rituals that child and adult go through may do the trick .	60.673176
the answer is different for each autistic child , but for most there is an answer .	73.46031
`` dear doctors we learned this year that our older son , daniel , is autistic .	56.16922
we did not accept the diagnosis at once , but gradually we are coming to .	53.26847
fortunately , there is a nursery school which he has been able to attend , with a group of normal children .	42.709187
`` i try to treat daniel as if he were normal , though of course i realize he is far from that at present .	109.84245
what i do is to try to bring him into contact with reality as much as possible .	64.07219
i try to give him as many normal experiences as possible .	54.23682
`` what is your experience with autistic children ? ?	4.5365896
how do they turn out later ' ' ? ?	3.4458568
many autistic children grow up to lead relatively normal lives .	25.028263
certainly , most continue to lack a certain warmth in communication with other people , but many adjust to school , even college , to jobs and even to marriage and parenthood .	88.15822
-- a first grader colors pictures one solid color , everything -- sky , grass , boy , wagon , etc . .	38.457462
when different colors are used , she is just as likely to color trees purple , hair green , etc . .	91.43426
the other children in the class use this same coloring book and do a fairly good job with things their proper color .	102.129944
should i show my daughter how things should be colored ? ?	11.129689
is a relaxed home atmosphere enough to help her outgrow these traits ? ?	29.382883
-- her choice of one color means she is simply enjoying the motor act of coloring , without having reached the point of selecting suitable colors for different objects .	82.041176
this immature use of crayons may suggest that she is a little immature for the first grade .	20.068066
no , coloring isn ' t exactly something you teach a child .	34.755188
you sometimes give them a little demonstration , a little guidance , and suggestions about staying inside the lines .	42.571922
but most learn to color and paint as and when they are ready with only a very little demonstration .	50.555122
seen in decorating circles of late is a renewed interest in an old art embroidery .	36.302048
possibly responsible for this is the incoming trend toward multicolor schemes in rooms , which seems slated to replace the one-color look to which we have been accustomed .	26.979101
just as a varitinted oriental rug may suggest the starting point for a room scheme , so may some of the newest versions of embroidery .	53.674297
one such , in fact , is a rug .	55.77478
though not actually crewel embroidery , it has that look with its over-stitched raised pattern in blue , pink , bronze and gold and a sauterne background .	44.46026
the twirled , stylized design of winding stems and floral forms strongly suggests the embroidered patterns used so extensively for upholstery during the jacobean period in england .	30.481718
traditional crewel embroidery which seems to be appearing more frequently this fall than in the past few years is still available in this country .	39.966457
the work is executed in england ( by hand ) and can be worked in any desired design and color .	27.932459
among some recent imports were seat covers for one series of dining room chairs on which were depicted salad plates overflowing with tomatoes and greens and another set on which a pineapple was worked in naturalistic color .	27.920599
for a particularly fabulous room which houses a collection of fine english chippendale furniture , fabric wall panels were embroidered with a typically chinese-inspired design of this revered eighteenth century period .	21.812008
since the work is done by hand , the only limitation , it is said , `` is that of human conception ' ' .	16.552286
modern embroidered panels , framed and meant to be hung on the wall , are another aspect of this trend .	17.971468
these have never gone out of style in scandinavian homes and now seem to be reappearing here and there in shops which specialize in handicrafts .	36.686832
an amateur decorator might try her hand at a pair during the long winter evenings , and , by picking up her living room color scheme , add a decorative do-it-yourself note to the room .	57.945732
california democrats this weekend will take the wraps off a 1962 model statewide campaign vehicle which they have been quietly assembling in a thousand district headquarters , party clubrooms and workers ' backyards .	67.531815
and they ' re confident that the gop , currently assailed by dissensions within the ranks , will be impressed by the purring power beneath the hood of this grassroots-fueled machine .	21.855207
their meeting at san francisco is nominally scheduled as a conference of the california democratic council directorate .	26.60463
but it will include 200-odd officeholders , organization leaders and `` interested party people ' ' .	37.21088
-- plans for a dramatic , broad-scale party rally in los angeles next december that would enlist top-drawer democrats from all over the country .	47.850307
-- blueprints for doubling the cdc ' s present 55 , 000 enrollment .	27.373693
-- arrangements for a statewide pre-primary endorsing convention in fresno next jan . 26-28 .	17.12539

at the head of the cdc is an unorthodox , 39-year-old amateur politico , thomas b . carvey jr . , whose normal profession is helping develop hughes aircraft ' s moon missiles .	50.91158
he ' s approached his democratic duties in hard-nosed engineering fashion .	13.040527
viewed from afar , the cdc looks like a rather stalwart political pyramid its elected directorate fans out into an array of district leaders and standing committees , and thence into its component clubs and affiliated groups -- 500 or so .	78.61545
much of its strength stems from the comfortable knowledge that every `` volunteer ' ' democratic organization of any consequence belongs to the aj .	70.74044
moreover , the entire state democratic hierarchy , from gov . brown on down to the county chairmen , also participates in this huge operation .	74.480576
contrarily , republican `` volunteers ' ' go their separate ways , and thus far have given no indication that they ' d be willing to join forces under a single directorate , except in the most loose-knit fashion .	72.361946
carvey believes that reapportionment , which left many democratic clubs split by these new district boundaries , actually will increase cdc membership .	101.02321
where only one club existed before , he says , two will flourish henceforth .	27.747086
biggest organizational problem , he adds , is setting up cdc units in rock-ribbed democratic territory .	76.217674
paradoxically the council is weakest in areas that register 4- and 5-to-1 in the party ' s favor , strongest where democrats and republicans compete on a fairly even basis .	67.71713
like most democratic spokesmen , carvey predicts 1962 will be a tremendously `` partisan year ' ' .	48.46535
hence the attention they ' re lavishing on the aj .	39.680992
in all probability , the council will screen and endorse candidates for the assembly and for congress , and then strive to put its full weight behind these pre-primary favorites .	56.41047
this bodes heated contests in several districts where claims have already been staked out by democratic hopefuls who don ' t see eye-to-eye with the aj .	35.994656
naturally , the statewide races will provide the major test for the expanding council .	44.836823
shunted aside by the rampant organizers for john f . kennedy last year , who relegated it to a somewhat subordinate role in the presidential campaign , the cdc plainly intends to provide the party ' s campaign muscle in 1962 .	19.541094
there is evidence that it will be happily received by gov . brown and the other constitutional incumbents .	32.46983
carvey considers that former vice president nixon would be brown ' s most formidable foe , with ex-gov . knight a close second .	46.45871
but the rest of the gop gubernatorial aspirants don ' t worry him very much .	23.721756

( significantly , bitter echoes of the 1960 power struggle that saw mosk moving into the national committee post over ziffren are still audible in party circles .	63.24382

aug . 4 , 1821 , nearly a century after benjamin franklin founded the pennsylvania gazette -- a century during which it had undergone several changes in ownership and a few brief suspensions in publication -- this paper made its first appearance as the saturday evening post .	86.3456
the country was now full of gazettes and samuel c . atkinson and charles alexander , who had just taken over franklin ' s old paper , desired a more distinctive name .	51.342346
when founded by franklin the gazette was a weekly family newspaper and under its new name its format remained that of a newspaper but its columns gradually contained more and more fiction , poetry , and literary essays .	90.17127
in the middle of the century , with a circulation of 90 , 000 , the post was one of the most popular weeklies in the country .	19.13685
but during the second half of the century its fortunes reached a low point and when in 1897 cyrus h . k . curtis purchased it -- `` paper , type , and all ' ' -- for $1 , 000 it was a 16-page weekly filled with unsigned fiction and initialed miscellany , and with only some 2 , 000 subscribers .	39.417175
little more than a fine old name , valuable principally because of the franklin tradition , the saturday evening post was slow to revive .	88.118454
but curtis poured over $1 million into it and in time it again became one of the most popular weeklies of the country .	22.809149

the 350th anniversary of the king james bible is being celebrated simultaneously with the publishing today of the new testament , the first part of the new english bible , undertaken as a new translation of the scriptures into contemporary english .	16.913326
since it was issued in the spring of 1611 , the king james version has been most generally considered the most poetic and beautiful of all translations of the bible .	25.38434
however , biblical scholars frequently attested to its numerous inaccuracies , as old manuscripts were uncovered and scholarship advanced .	23.45703
this resulted in revisions of the king james bible in 1881-85 as the english revised version and in 1901 as the american standard version .	28.302498
then in 1937 america ' s international council of religious education authorized a new revision , in the light of expanded knowledge of ancient manuscripts and languages .	36.34344
undertaken by 32 american scholars , under the chairmanship of rev . dr . luther a . weigle , former dean of yale university divinity school , their studies resulted in the publishing of the revised standard version , 1946-52 .	11.596592
the new english bible ( the old testament and apocrypha will be published at a future date ) has not been planned to rival or replace the king james version , but , as its cover states , it is offered `` simply as the bible to all those who will use it in reading , teaching , or worship ' ' .	59.700462
time , of course will testify whether the new version will have achieved its purpose .	70.64077
bible reading , even more so than good classical music , grows in depth and meaning upon repetition .	105.6474
if this new bible does not increase in significance by repeated readings throughout the years , it will not survive the ages as has the king james version .	85.24073
however , an initial perusal and comparison of some of the famous passages with the same parts of other versions seems to speak well of the efforts of the british biblical scholars .	50.286766
one is impressed with the dignity , clarity and beauty of this new translation into contemporary english , and there is no doubt that the meaning of the bible is more easily understandable to the general reader in contemporary language in the frequently archaic words and phrases of the king james .	27.313534
for example , in the third chapter of matthew , verses 13-16 , describing the baptism of jesus , the 1611 version reads	10.336797
`` then cometh jesus from galilee to jordan unto john , to be baptized of him .	31.876202
`` but john forbad him , saying , i have need to be baptized of thee , and comest thou to me ? ?	26.032595
`` and jesus answering said unto him , suffer it to be so now for thus it becometh us to fulfill all righteousness .	177.08394
`` and jesus , when he was baptized went up straightway out of the water and lo , the heavens were opened unto him , and he saw the spirit of god descending like a dove , and lighting upon him ' ' .	36.11738
certainly , the meaning is clearer to one who is not familiar with biblical teachings , in the new english bible which reads `` then jesus arrived at jordan from galilee , and he came to john to be baptized by him .	32.799225
' do you come to me ' ? ?	1.0520387
' i need rather to be baptized by you .	84.23994
jesus replied , ' let it be so for the present	91.6038
we do well to conform this way with all that god requires .	142.36607
after baptism jesus came up out of the water at once , and at that moment heaven opened	87.37916
he saw the spirit of god descending like a dove to alight upon him ' '	17.116531
( the paragraphing , spelling and punctuation are reproduced as printed in each version .	49.811783
among the most frequently quoted biblical sentences are the beatitudes and yet so few persons , other than scholars , really understand the true meaning of these eight blessings uttered by jesus at the beginning of the sermon on the mount .	53.62784
to illustrate , the first blessing in the king james bible reads `` blessed are the poor in spirit	34.452515
for their ' s is the kingdom of heaven ' ' .	4.0201473
the new version states `` how blest are those who know that they are poor	77.90523
the kingdom of heaven is theirs ' ' .	1.3688306
some of the poetic cadence of the older version certainly is lost in the newer one , but almost anyone , with a fair knowledge of the english language , can understand the meaning , without the necessity of interpretation by a biblical scholar .	61.736847
in the second and third chapters of revelation the new version retains , however , the old phrase `` angel of the church ' ' which biblical scholars have previously interpreted as meaning bishop .	40.10664
for the most part , however , the new version is contemporary and , as such , should be the means for many to attain a clearer comprehension of the meaning of those words recorded so many hundreds of years ago by the first followers of christ .	66.19519
originally recorded by hand , these words have been copied and recopied , translated and retranslated through the ages .	11.443245
discoveries recently made of old biblical manuscripts in hebrew and greek and other ancient writings , some by the early church fathers , in themselves called for a restudy of the bible .	32.943443
to have the results recorded in everyday usable english should be of benefit to all who seek the truth .	113.821236
with contemporary english changing with the rapidity that marks this jet age , some of the words and phrases of the new version may themselves soon become archaic .	92.44326
the new testament offered to the public today is the first result of the work of a joint committee made up of representatives of the church of england , church of scotland , methodist church , congregational union , baptist union , presbyterian church of england , churches in wales , churches in ireland , society of friends , british and foreign bible society and national society of scotland .	31.303505
prof . c . h . dodd , 76 , a congregational minister and a leading authority on the new testament , is general director of the project and chairman of the new testament panel .	29.394915
sizzling temperatures and hot summer pavements are anything but kind to the feet .	37.99422
that is why it is important to invest in comfortable , airy types of shoes .	58.98386
there are many soft and light shoe leathers available .	98.02712
many styles have perforations and an almost weightlessness achieved via unlined leathers .	11.526643

heels place emphasis on the long legged silhouette .	3.5772307

an electric toothbrush ( broxodent ) may soon take its place next to the electric razor in the american bathroom .	38.94943
the brush moves up and down and is small enough to clean every dental surface , including the back of the teeth .	82.572464
in addition , the motor has the seal of approval of the underwriters laboratories , which means it is safe .	31.923197
the unit consists of a small motor that goes on as soon as it is plugged in .	51.209595
the speed is controlled by pressing on the two brake buttons located where the index finger and thumb are placed when holding the motor .	105.27668
the brushes can be cleaned and sterilized by boiling and are detachable so that every member of the family can have his own .	47.94168
most of us brush our teeth by hand .	5.361561
the same can be said of shaving yet the electric razor has proved useful to many men .	36.302204
the electric toothbrush moves in a vertical direction , the way dentists recommend .	77.668144
in addition , it is small enough to get into crevices , jacket and crown margins , malposed anteriors , and the back teeth .	26.396708
the bristles are soft enough to massage the gums and not scratch the enamel .	18.37967
it is conceivable that broxodent could do a better job than ordinary brushing , especially in those who do not brush their teeth properly .	35.57155
several dentists and patients with special dental problems have experimented with the device .	19.6377
the results were good although they are difficult to compare with hand brushing , particularly when the individual knows how to brush his teeth properly .	85.476845
the electric gadget is most helpful when there are many crowned teeth and in individuals who are elderly , bedfast with a chronic disease , or are handicapped by disorders such as cerebral palsy or muscular dystrophy .	34.989834
but for many of us , it will prove an enjoyable luxury .	27.335867
it is not as convenient as the old type toothbrush and the paste tends to shimmy off the bristles .	11.12571
since the apparatus is new , it requires experimentation and changes in technique .	52.514076
writes does numbness in the left hand at night , which awakens the person , indicate brain tumor ? ?	79.80356
this is a common symptom and the cause usually is pressure on the nerve leading to the affected hand .	134.79211
the pressure may come from muscles , tendons , or bones anywhere from the neck to the hand .	38.138023
writes do steam baths have any health value ? ?	3.3006384
no , other than cleaning out the pores and making the sweat glands work harder .	51.889812

writes what makes my hands numb when sewing ? ?	3.4266245

writes does the cholesterol go down when most of the thyroid gland is removed ? ?	10.91209
the cholesterol level in the blood is influenced by the glands of the body .	7.586586
it is low when the thyroid is overactive and high when the gland is sluggish .	8.876641
the latter is likely to occur when the thyroid is removed .	12.963338

as a contemporary bonus , the set includes carl sandburg ' s address at a joint session of congress , delivered on lincoln ' s birthday two years ago .	26.29704

in an effort to fortify himself against the unforseen upsets sure to arise in the future , herbert a . leggett , banker-editor of the phoenix `` arizona progress ' ' , reflects upon a few of the depressing experiences of the feverish fifties .	22.423452
one of the roughest was the tv quiz shows , which gave him inferiority complexes .	37.076496
though it was a great relief when the big brains on these shows turned out to be frauds and phonies , it did irreparable damage to the ego of the editor and many another intelligent , well-informed american .	40.219673
but the one that upset the financially wise was the professional dancer who related in a book how he parlayed his earnings into a $2 , 000 , 000 profit on the stock market .	39.88402
every man who dabbles in the market to make a little easy money on the side and suffers losses could at the time hardly face his wife who was wondering how her husband could be so dumb .	51.86892
investors breathed more freely when it was learned that this acrobatic dancer had turned magician and was only doing a best seller book to make some dough .	65.84406
people who take us for suckers are like the westerner who had on exhibit his superior marksmanship in the form of a number of bull ' s-eye achievements .	29.516521
the promoter who wanted to sign him up for the circus asked him how he was able to do it .	31.16839
he just shot at the board and then drew circles around the holes to form a bull ' s-eye .	24.280664
one of the obstacles to the easy control of a 2-year-old child is a lack of verbal communication .	32.665012
if his mother loves him , he clings to that love as a ballast .	38.880188
he wants mommy to think him a good boy .	31.730223
he doesn ' t want her to look frowningly at him , or speak to him angrily .	31.161013
he wants to be called sweet , good , considerate and mother ' s little helper .	15.760174
but even mother ' s loving attitude will not always prevent misbehavior .	24.280642
his desires are so strong that he needs constant reassurance of his mother ' s love for him and what she expects of him , in order to overcome them .	32.856125
his own inner voice , which should tell him what not to do , has not developed .	76.2685
it won ' t develop until he has words with which to clothe it .	117.2953
what can a mother do then to prevent misbehavior ? ?	4.241772
the fewer nos she has to utter the more effective they will be .	221.3032
she should offer substitutes for the temptations which seem overwhelmingly desirable to the child .	50.893486
if he can ' t play with mommy ' s magazines , he should have some old numbers of his own .	71.88988
if daddy ' s books are out of bounds his own picture books are not .	60.035976
toys he has can be made to act as substitutes for family temptations such as refrigerator and gas stove .	51.22012
during this precarious period of development the mother should continue to influence the growth of the child ' s conscience .	25.021318
she tells him of the consequences of his behavior .	9.249148
if he bites a playmate she says , `` danny won ' t like you ' ' .	8.460352
if he snatches a toy , she says , `` caroline wants her own truck just as you do ' ' .	26.011505
there is no use trying to `` explain ' ' to a 2-year-old .	18.84204
remove the child from the scene of his misbehavior .	9.703276
substitute approved objects for forbidden ones and keep telling him how he is to act .	36.37778
he won ' t submit to his natural desires all the time , and it ' s mother ' s love that is responsible for his good behavior .	44.18402
this is the period during the melancholy days of autumn when universities and colleges schedule what they call `` homecoming day ' ' .	58.904736
they seek thereby to lure the old grad back to the old scenes .	51.77123
the football opponent on homecoming is , of course , selected with the view that said opponent will have little more chance than did a christian when thrown to one of the emperor ' s lions .	80.50671
it is true , of course , the uncertainties of life being what they are , that as now and then the christian killed the lion , homecoming days have been ruined by a visiting team .	83.59027
even with all possible precaution , homecomings are usually rather cruel and sad , and only the perpetually ebullient and the continually optimistic are made happy by them .	53.886543
more often than not , as the old grad wanders along the old paths , his memory of happy days when he strolled one of the paths with a coed beside him becomes an ache and a pain .	23.214283
he can smell again the perfume she wore and recall the lilting sound of laughter , and can smell again the aroma of autumn -- fallen leaves , the wine of cool air , and the nostalgia of woodsmoke which blows through all the winds of fall .	28.63148
it is at precisely such moments that he encounters a couple of undergraduates , faces alight , holding hands and talking happily as they come along , oblivious of him , or throwing him the most fleeting and casual of glances , such as they would give a tethered goat .	43.692673
usually , they titter loudly after they have passed by .	220.74052
he feels , suddenly , the weight of the fat that is on him .	71.03679
his bridgework or his plates feel loose and monstrous .	35.198727
his legs suddenly feel heavy and unaccountably weary , as if he had walked for miles , instead of strolling a few hundred yards along the old campus paths .	30.584333
bitterness comes over him and the taste of time is like unripe persimmons in his mouth .	45.269917
it is not much better if he meets with old classmates .	30.656622
too often , unless he hails them , they pass him by .	414.16965
he recalls with a wry smile the wit who said , on returning from a homecoming reunion , that he would never go again because all his class had changed so much they didn ' t even recognize him .	64.31201
if they do meet and recognize one another , slap backs and embrace , the moment soon is done .	57.46355
after all , when one has asked whatever became of old joe and charlie when one has inquired who it was sue brown married and where it is they now live when questions are asked and answered about families and children , and old professors when the game and its probable outcome has been exhausted that does it .	137.90094
by then one begins to notice the middle-age spread	491.44992
the gray hairs , the eyeglasses , bodies that are too thin or too heavy	136.82759
the athlete of by-gone years who wears a size 46 suit and puffs when he has finished a sentence of any length then , it is time to break it up and move on .	72.16884
it is , if anything , worse on the old player	168.29037
he sits in the stands and he doesn ' t like that .	10.796584
enough of his life was spent there on the field for him never to like watching the game as a spectator in the crowd .	87.69689
on a team a man feels he is a part of it and akin to the men next to him .	72.69201

and so , he squirms with each play , remembering his youth .	56.430325
no matter how often a man goes back to the scenes of his youth and strength , they can never be recaptured again .	30.377832
since the obvious is not always true , the republican national committee wisely analyzed its defeat of last autumn and finds that it occurred , as suspected , in the larger cities .	55.45702
of 40 cities with populations of 300 , 000 and more , mr . kennedy carried 26 and mr . nixon 14 .	37.056488
there are eight states in which the largest urban vote can be the balance of power in any close election .	111.59021
these are new york , pennsylvania , michigan , maryland , missouri , new jersey , illinois and minnesota .	13.119845
in 1952 mr . eisenhower won all but missouri .	55.978313
yet , in 1960 all eight gave majorities to mr . kennedy .	13.50633

yet , the gop breakdown discovered that in philadelphia mr . nixon received but 21 per cent of the so-called `` polish ' ' vote	35.37802
30 per cent of the `` irish ' ' vote , and 18 per cent of the `` negro ' ' vote .	18.107544
a gop `` task force ' committee will seek to find out how its party may win support from the ethnic and minority groups in cities .	70.917015
the task force might make a start in washington with republican congressional leaders .	96.073135
these gentlemen already have done the party harm by their seeming reluctance to vote aid for the depressed areas and by their criticism of mr . kennedy for talking about a recession and unemployment .	35.392418
this error was compounded by declaring the recession to be `` a statistical one ' ' , and not a reality .	35.013847
the almost six million persons without jobs and the two million working part-time do not consider themselves and their plight as statistical .	117.61516
they did not view the tour of the distressed cities and towns by secretary of labor goldberg as politics , which the gop declared it to be .	40.42702
the people visited were glad to have a government with heart enough to take an interest in their misery .	102.68159
senator mundt ' s gross distortion of president eisenhower ' s conversation into a denunciation of president kennedy as too left wing , a statement mr . eisenhower declared to be entirely false , is another case in point .	40.21299
if the republicans and southern democrats join to defeat medical care for the old under the social security program , they will thereby erect still another barrier to gop hopes in the cities .	111.69252
the present republican leadership as practiced by mundt , goldwater , bridges , dirksen , et al , is repeating the errors of the party leadership of the 1930s .	11.193921
in that decade the partisan zeal to defend mr . hoover , and the party ' s failure to anticipate or cope with the depression , caused a great majority of americans to see the republican party as cold and lacking in any sympathy for the problems of human beings caught up in the distress and suffering brought on by the economic crash .	42.374573
the republican party was not lacking in humanity , but it permitted its extremely partisan leadership to make it appear devoid of any consideration for people in trouble .	54.06021
farmers called their mule-drawn pickup trucks `` hoover carts ' ' .	1.5402098
smokers reduced to `` the makings ' ' , spoke of the sack tobacco as `` hoover dust ' ' .	28.048763
one may be sure the present republican congressional leadership hasn ' t meant to repeat this error .	11.023311
but it is in the process of so doing because it apparently gives priority to trying to downgrade john f . kennedy .	72.81479
that this is not good politics is underscored by the latest poll figures which show that 72 per cent of the people like the way in which the new president is conducting the nation ' s business .	24.853033
the most articulate republicans are those who , in their desire to get back at mr . kennedy , already have created the image of a republican leadership which is reluctant to assist the distressed and the unemployed , and which is even more unwilling to help old people who need medical care .	62.74962

but when former gov . marvin griffin and lt . gov . byrd accepted the invitations of the georgia state chamber of commerce to join the tour next november , the situation was aggravated .	34.985386
neither had a choice other than to accept the invitation .	40.830593

the providence journal editorial ( jan . 25 ) entitled `` east greenwich faces a housing development problem ' ' points to a dilemma that faces communities such as ours .	66.60817
your suggested solution , it seems to me , is grossly oversimplified and is inconsistent with your generally realistic attitude toward , and endorsement of , sound planning .	104.41303
first of all there is ample area in east greenwich already zoned in the classification similar to that which petitioner requested .	97.32328
this land is in various stages of development in several locations throughout the town .	27.169518
the demand for these lots can be met for some time to come .	21.88167
this would seem to indicate that we are trying neither `` to halt an influx of migrants ' ' nor are we `` setting up such standards for development that only the well-to-do could afford to buy land and build in the new sites ' ' .	82.435715
what we are attempting to do is achieve and maintain a balance between medium density and low density residential areas and industrial and commercial development .	29.77113
it is in fact entirely consistent with your suggestion of modest industrial development to help pay governmental costs .	89.93394
bostitch , inc . is approximately half way through a 10-year exemption of their real estate tax .	60.71085
the wisdom of granting such tax exemptions is another matter , but this particular instance is , in my opinion , completely satisfactory .	69.0576
the 1960 tax book for east greenwich indicates a valuation for this property in excess of two million dollars .	30.919111
with our current $3 per hundred tax rate , it is safe to assume that this will qualify when you suggest a community should `` try to develop a modest industrial plant ' ' as the best way to meet these problems .	49.065403
in order to attract additional industry that is compatible with this community it is all the more important to present to the industrial prospect an orderly balance in the tax structure .	51.002373
as this tax base grows so then can your medium and low density residential areas grow .	109.04816
mr . richard preston , executive director of the new hampshire state planning and development commission , in his remarks to the governors conference on industrial development at providence on october 8 , 1960 , warned against the fallacy of attempting to attract industry solely to reduce the tax rate or to underwrite municipal services such as schools when he said `` if this is the fundamental reason for a community ' s interest or if this is the basic approach , success if any will be difficult to obtain ' ' .	45.4328
he went on to say `` in the first place , industry per se is not dedicated to the role of savior of foundering municipalities .	53.97077
it is not in business for the purpose of absorbing increased municipal costs no matter how high a purpose that may be ' ' .	76.45639
while councilman olson cited the anticipated increase in school costs in answer to a direct question from a taxpayer , the impact upon a school system does not have to be measured only in increased taxes to find alarm in uncontrolled growth .	119.25343
we in east greenwich have the example of two neighboring communities , one currently utilizing double sessions in their schools , and the other facing this prospect next year .	78.66859
it has already been reported in your newspapers that the east greenwich school committee is considering additions to at least one elementary school and to the high school to insure future accommodations for a school population that we know will increase .	67.62001
if they are to be commended for foresight in their planning , what then is the judgment of a town council that compounds this problem during the planning stage ? ?	89.89737
where then is the sound planning and cooperation between agencies within the community that you have called for in other editorials ? ?	132.68394
i submit that it cannot be dismissed simply by saying we are not facing the facts of life .	43.123135
the `` fruitful course ' ' of metropolitanization that you recommend is currently practiced by the town of east greenwich and had its inception long before we learned what it was called .	60.83691
the east greenwich police department utilizes the radio transmission facilities of the warwick police department , thereby eliminating duplication of facilities and ensuring police coordination in the cowessett-east greenwich-potowomut area of the two communities .	21.606152
the east greenwich fire district services parts of warwick as well as east greenwich .	27.3952
the taxpayers of east greenwich appropriate sums of money , as do other kent county communities , for the support of the kent county memorial hospital , a regional facility .	29.51508
the east greenwich free library receives financial support from the town of east greenwich and the city of warwick to supplement its endowment .	26.83011
feelers were put out last year to the city of warwick , as reported in your newspapers , suggesting investigation of a common rubbish disposal area to service the potowomut and cowessett areas of warwick along with east greenwich .	41.66611
east greenwich was one of the first rhode island towns to enter into contract agreement with the rhode island development council for planning services we could not provide for ourselves .	50.594902
the education program for retarded children conducted by the east greenwich school system has pupils from at least one neighboring community .	64.78039
i feel compelled to write this because i am greatly concerned with the problem of community growth rate and the relation between types of growth in a town such as east greenwich .	46.729042
i believe it is an area in which professional planners have failed to set adequate guide posts	221.2145
and yet they cannot ignore this problem because it concerns the implementation of nearly all the planning programs they have devised .	41.659172
these programs are volumes of waste paper and lost hours if the citizens of a community must stand aside while land developers tell them when , where , and in what manner the community shall grow .	178.1289
we have far less to fear in the migrant family than we have in the migrant developer under these conditions .	28.044699
until professional planners meet this situation squarely and update the concepts of zoning in a manner acceptable to the courts , i hope we in east greenwich can continue to shape our own destiny .	53.220524
i would like very much , on behalf of my husband and myself , to send our eternal thanks to all the wonderful people responsible for the gabrielle fund .	81.88856

every man is a piece of the continent , a part of the main ' ' .	25.208073

i am a sophomore at mount pleasant high school .	3.1317158
my future plans are to become a language teacher .	25.806047
of course , having this desire , i am very interested in education .	28.733665
a few weeks ago , i read in the bulletin that there were to be given chinese classes in cranston .	54.683113
the article also said that a person had to be 18 years old or over , and must not be going to high school to attend these classes .	78.649155
the following week , i read in the sunday paper that the students of russia begin european and asian languages in the seventh grade .	51.692307
i wish you could see the situation as i see it .	15.57554
if russian pupils have to take these languages , how come american students have a choice whether or not to take a language , but have to face so many exceptions ? ?	124.78311
i do not think that america is like russia , not in the least ! !	40.41856

then people wonder why russian pupils are more advanced than american students .	15.500705
at the height of the first snowstorm we had , it was impossible for me to get medical attention needed during an emergency .	80.76132
however , the east providence rescue squad made its way through to my home in time of desperation .	105.66317
words cannot tell of the undivided attention and comfort their service gave to me .	78.23506
the concern they felt for me was such as i shall never forget and for which i will always be grateful .	32.889072
the rescue squad is to be praised immensely for the fine work they do in all kinds of weather .	40.04001
had they not gotten me to the hospital when they did , perhaps i would not be here to commend them at this time .	36.33533
the providence sunday journal article ( jan . 29 ) asking whether american taxpayers are being victimized by a gigantic giveaway to pay for the care of war veterans who have non-service-connected disabilities sounds as though the providence journal is desperate for news .	36.375107
usually a veteran has to hang himself to get space on the front page .	50.629944
on the question of admission to veterans administration hospitals of service-connected and non-service-connected disabled veterans , it must be recognized that there are many men who are greatly affected by war service .	29.864468
it can manifest itself before discharge from service , or it can come out years later .	58.223083
there is one other point we should never lose sight of many veterans who enter va hospitals as non-service cases later qualify as service-connected .	94.255264
no psychiatrist could tell me that the experience in a war can not have its effect in the ensuing years .	36.890884
the arguments advanced by those individuals and groups who oppose the system in force and who would drastically curtail or do away entirely with hospital care for the non-service-connected case , seem to be coldly impractical and out-of-step with the wishes of the general public .	49.17263
i believe in priority for service-connected disabled veterans in admission to va hospitals .	11.14314
but i don ' t believe we should close the door on non-service-connected patients .	100.010735
this matter is of great importance , and the outcome may mean the difference between life or death , or at least serious injuries , for many veterans .	32.619366
some critics say that the length of stay in a hospital is too long .	96.80564
there ' s a reason for this length of stay .	71.083145
first of all , the admitting physician in the va hospital gets the patient as a new patient .	19.924929
he has no experience with this veteran ' s previous medical record .	158.28238
if the doctor is conscientious , he wants to study the patient .	34.320553
as a result , it takes a little longer than it would on the outside where the family physician knows about the patient .	52.573933
secondly , the va physician knows that when the patient leaves the hospital , he is no longer going to have a chance to visit his patient .	35.67382
so he keeps the veteran in until he can observe the effects of treatment or surgery .	27.862188
the american public must be presented with the facts concerning va hospitalization .	41.7349
the public should understand that whether they support a state hospital or a va hospital , the tax dollar has to be paid one way or the other .	43.11426
the responsibility is still going to be there whether they pay for a va hospital or the tax dollar is spent for the state hospital .	37.652466
an adequate system of va hospitals is better equipped to care for the veterans than any 50 state hospitals .	138.57283
it seems that open season upon veterans ' hospitalization is once more upon us .	154.92049
the american medical association is once again grinding out its tear-soaked propaganda based upon the high cost of the veterans administration medical program to the american taxpayer .	34.81759
do they , the a . m . a . , offer any solution other than outright abolition of a medical system unsurpassed anywhere in the world ? ?	78.41781
we veterans acknowledge the fact that as time passes the demand for medical care at va hospitals will grow proportionately as age fosters illness .	73.64519
nevertheless , we wonder at the stand of the a . m . a . on the health problem confronting the aged .	46.097263
they opposed the forand bill , which would have placed the major burden of financial support upon the individual himself through compulsory payroll deduction	94.813
yet they supported the eisenhower administration which will cost a small state like ours approximately five million dollars ( matched incidentally by a federal grant ) to initiate .	91.11428

but no president ever before referred to his as a `` lousy job ' ' ( as walter trohan recently quoted president kennedy as doing in conversation with sen . barry goldwater ) .	50.888935

the scientists have also warned that no life above ground or underground , sheltered or unsheltered could be expected to survive in an area at least 50 miles in diameter .	45.83745

-- in reply to a letter in today ' s `` voice ' ' urging the sale of meat after 6 p . m . , i wish to state the other side of the story .	35.593452
i am the wife of the owner of a small , independent meat market .	126.11076
my husband ' s hours away from home for the past years have been from 7 a . m . to 7 p . m . the early part of the week , and as late as 8 or 9 on week-ends .	38.400368
now he is apparently expected to give up his evenings -- and sundays , too , for this is coming .	58.76214
there is a trend to packaging meat at a central source , freezing it , and shipping it to outlying stores , where meat cutters will not be required .	31.11213
if a customer wishes a special cut , it will not be available .	12.939848
we are slowly being regimented to having everything packaged , whether we want it or not .	67.03801
most women , in this age of freezers , shop for the entire week on week-ends , when prices are lower .	48.174774
also , many working wives have children or husbands who take over the shopping chores for them .	40.06805
and my husband hasn ' t had a vacation in 14 years .	97.73868
but if we closed the store for a vacation , we would lose our customers to the chain stores in the next block .	58.44221
the meat cutters ' union , which has a history of being one of the fairest and least corrupt in our area , represents the little corner markets as well as the large supermarkets .	96.54665
what it is trying to do is to protect the little man , too , as well as trying to maintain a flow of fresh meat to all stores , with choice of cut being made by the consumer , not the store .	72.18257

had i been granted the floor on a point of personal privilege , the matter she raised would have been clarified .	102.25342
the resolution under discussion at the convention was to require the boards of election to instruct judges to properly display the american flag .	72.25451
judges under the jurisdiction of the chicago board of election commissioners are instructed to do this .	52.166016
the resolution further asked that polling place proprietors affix an attachment to their premises for the display of the flag .	12.33772
it was my desire to advise the membership of the legion that the majority of polling places are on private property and , without an amendment to the law , we could not enforce this .	40.743443
my discussion with reference to the resolution was that we should commend those citizens who serve as judges of election and who properly discharge their duty and polling place proprietors who make available their private premises , and not by innuendo criticize them .	45.36671
at no time did i attempt to seek approval or commendation for the members of the chicago board of election commissioners for the discharge of their duties .	23.037672

( editorial comment on this letter appears elsewhere on this page ) .	94.918816
-- your july 26 editorial regarding the position of attorney general robert f . kennedy on prospective tax relief for dupont stockholders is based on an erroneous statement of fact .	26.524107
as a result , your criticism of attorney general robert f . kennedy and the department of justice was inaccurate , unwarranted and unfair .	13.860381
the editorial concerned legislative proposals to ease the tax burden on dupont stockholders , in connection with the united states supreme court ruling that dupont must divest itself of its extensive general motors stock holdings .	20.465668
these proposals would reduce the amount of tax that dupont stockholders might have to pay -- from an estimated 1 . 1 billion dollars under present law to as little as 192 million dollars .	43.468662
congressman wilbur d . mills , chairman of the house ways and means committee , asked the department of justice for its views on these legislative proposals as they related to anti-trust law enforcement .	66.13282
the attorney general responded by letter dated july 19 .	3.5510747
copies of this letter were made avaliable to the press and public .	36.478893
in this letter , mr . kennedy made it clear that he limited his comment only to one consideration -- what effect the legislative proposals might have on future anti-trust judgments .	91.747185
there are a number of other considerations besides this one but it is for the congress , not the department of justice , to balance these various considerations and make a judgment about legislation .	70.70648
yet your editorial said `` now the attorney general writes that no considerations ' justify any loss of revenue of this proportion ' ' ' .	56.7483
what mr . kennedy , in fact , wrote was `` it is the department ' s view that no anti-trust enforcement considerations justify any loss of revenue of this proportion ' ' .	49.04243
the editorial , by omitting the words anti-trust enforcement , totally distorted mr . kennedy ' s views .	20.337902
the headline is offensive , particularly in view of the total inaccuracy of the editorial .	13.550051

sir -- we are writing in reference to a recent `` suggestion ' ' made to the staff of the public health nursing service of jersey city ( registered professional nurses with college background and varying experiences ) .	81.28101
the day before election day , to which we are entitled as a legal holiday , we were informed to report to our respective polls to work as `` workers of the party ' ' .	35.373745
being ethical and professional people interested in community health and well-being , we felt this wasn ' t a function of our position .	43.57923
as we understand , this directive was given to all city and county employes .	76.41385
to our knowledge no nurse in our agency has been employed because of political affiliation .	43.12567
we , therefore , considered the `` suggestion ' ' an insult to our intelligence , ethics , bill of rights , etc . .	18.091068

this is our duty -- not as nurses or city employes -- but as citizens of the united states .	31.23979
sir -- i read of a man who felt he should not build a fallout shelter in his home because it would be selfish for him to sit secure while his neighbors had no shelters .	82.684715
does this man live in a neighborhood where all are free loaders unwilling to help themselves , but ready to demand that `` the community ' ' help and protect them ? ?	34.117516
community shelters are , of course , necessary for those having no space for shelter .	107.04316
if in a town of 2 , 000 private homes , half of them have shelters , the need for the community shelters will be reduced to that extent .	59.83683
in designing his home fallout shelter there is nothing to prevent a man from planning to shelter that home ' s occupants , `` plus-one ' ' -- so he will be able to take in a stranger .	52.57012
i hope the man who plans to sit on his hands until the emergency comes will have a change of heart , will get busy and be the first member of our `` plus-one ' ' shelter club .	54.976486

sir -- when the colonies decided upon freedom from england , we insisted , through the declaration of independence , that the nations of the world recognize us as a separate political entity .	25.695581
it is high time the united states began to realize that the god-given rights of men set forth in that document are applicable today to katanga .	55.196682

sir -- permit me to commend your editorial in which you stress the fact that a program of county colleges will substantially increase local tax burdens and that taxpayers have a right to a clear idea of what such a program would commit them to .	73.04312
the bill which passed the assembly last may and is now pending in the senate should be given careful scrutiny .	60.89072
the procedure for determining the amounts of money to be spent by county colleges and raised by taxation will certainly startle many taxpayers .	89.90539
under the proposal the members of the board of trustees of a county college will be appointed	33.616333
the trustees will prepare an annual budget for the college and submit it to the board of school estimate .	20.30572
this board will consist of two of the trustees of the college , and the director and two members of the board of freeholders .	17.442131
it will determine the amount of money to be spent by the college and will certify this amount to the board of freeholders , which `` shall appropriate in the same manner as other appropriations are made by it the amount so certified and the amount shall be assessed , levied and collected in the same manner as moneys appropriated for other purposes ' ' .	33.522236
the approval of only three members of the board of school estimate is required to certify the amount of money to be allotted to the college .	19.14848
since two of these could be trustees of the college , actually it would be necessary to have the consent of only one elected official to impose a levy of millions of dollars of tax revenue .	35.749546

sir -- i hasten to join in praise of the men in the toll booths on the garden state parkway .	22.933586

the viewers of the `` deep peep show ' ' at 15th and m streets nw have an added attraction -- the view of a fossilized cypress swamp .	31.439768
twenty feet below the street level in the excavation of the new motel to be constructed on this site , a black coal-like deposit has been encountered .	29.712008
this is a black swamp clay in which about one hundred million years ago cypress-like trees were growing .	88.62163
the fossilized remains of many of these trees are found embedded in the clay .	55.13534
some of the stumps are as much as three feet long , but most of them have been flattened by the pressure of the overlying sediments .	21.20521
although the wood has been changed to coal , much of it still retains its original cell structure .	114.271034
in the clay are entombed millions of pollen grains and spores which came from plants growing in the region at the time .	22.03221
these microfossils indicate the swamp was `` formed during the lower cretaceous period when dinosaurs were at their heyday and when the first flowering plants were just appearing .	25.751963
the 15th street deposit is not to be confused with the nearby famous mayflower hotel cypress swamp on 17th street reported in the washington post , august 2 , 1955 , which was probably formed during the second interglacial period and is therefore much younger .	72.53177
recently the secretary of the friends committee on national legislation was interviewed on the air .	75.0029
while i respect his sincere concern for peace , he made four points that i would like to question .	50.0703
he said , `` let ' s work for peace instead of protection from aggression ' ' .	77.18291
i would ask , `` why not do both ' ' ? ?	15.524975
war is the result of mistrust and lack of understanding between people .	32.84788
are we not late , especially those of us who call ourselves friends , in doing enough about this lack of understanding ? ?	73.57969
as to protection , the speaker disapproved of shelters , pointing out that fallout shelters would not save everyone .	56.143757
is this a reason for saving no one ? ?	30.653452
would the man with an empty life boat row away from a shipwreck because his boat could not pick up everyone ? ?	40.54661
the speaker suggested that the desolation of a post-attack world would be too awful to face .	17.870632
if the world comes to this , wouldn ' t it be the very time when courage and american know-how would be needed to help survivors rebuild ? ?	35.950966
many of our young people think it would .	201.50684
lastly , the speaker decried our organized program of emergency help calling it `` civilian defense ' ' .	27.107552
in 1950 , public law 920 created civil defense ( different from civilian-groups of world war 2 ) , a responsibility of the government at all levels to help reduce loss of life and property in disaster , natural or manmade .	60.71288
far from creating fear , as the speaker suggests , preparedness -- knowing what to do in an emergency -- gives people confidence .	56.961147
civil defense has far to go and many problems to solve , but is it not in the best spirit of our pioneer tradition to be not only willing , but prepared to care for our own families and help our neighbors in any disaster -- storm , flood , accident or even war ? ?	88.62146
it seems rather peculiar that residents of apartments are denied the right of providing themselves with the protection and companionship of dogs .	34.8055
i feel that few burglars would be prone to break and enter into someone ' s apartment if they were met with a good hardy growl that a dog would provide .	50.40896
in addition , would not the young female public of washington be afforded a greater degree of protection at night when they are on the streets if they were accompanied by a dog on a leash ? ?	56.51342
i grant that the dog may not be really protective , based on his training , but if you were roaming the streets looking for a purse to snatch or a young lady to molest , how quick would you be to attack a person strolling with a dog ? ?	54.199837
i would like to suggest that the landlords and commissioners get together and consider liberalizing the practice of prohibiting dogs in apartments .	75.27829

for the first time in history the entire world is dominated by two large , powerful nations armed with murderous nuclear weapons that make conventional warfare of the past a nullity .	54.572235
the united states and soviet russia have enough nuclear weapons to destroy all nations .	16.432182
recent statements by well-known scientists regarding the destructive power of the newest nuclear bombs and the deadly fall-outs should be sufficient to still the voices of those who advocate nuclear warfare instead of negotiations .	37.829765
president kennedy was right when he said , `` we shall never negotiate out of fear and we never shall fear to negotiate ' ' .	23.397505
i have just returned from a seven-week trip to europe and the far east .	58.824715
it is quite evident that the people of western europe are overwhelmingly opposed to participation in a nuclear war .	16.69871
the fact is that the italians , french and british know that they have no defense against nuclear bombs .	45.25919
we have no right to criticize them , as they realize they would be sitting ducks in a nuclear war .	32.66538
