the big question is whether , in the name of a restored chinese-soviet solidarity , the chinese will choose to persuade the albanians to present their humble apologies to khrushchev -- or get rid of enver hoxa .	21.137924
these seem about the only two ways in which the `` unhappy incident ' ' can now be closed .	35.602753
but albania is merely a symptom of a real malaise between china and russia .	54.950146
khrushchev , for all his bombastic prophecies about the inevitable decay of capitalism , is genuinely favorable to `` peaceful coexistence ' ' and would like , above all , the berlin and german problems to be settled peacefully	50.502728
he knows that he was never more popular than at the time of the russo-american `` honeymoon ' ' of 1959 .	21.037876
but it seems that pressures against him are coming from somewhere -- in the first place from china , but perhaps also from that `` china lobby ' ' which , i was assured in moscow nearly two years ago , exists on the quiet inside the party .	84.05015
to these people , solidarity and unity with china should be the real basis of russia ' s future policy .	40.176266
and the chinese , as the albanian incident shows , have strong suspicions that khrushchev is anxious to secure a `` shameful ' ' peace with the west .	24.496208
the fact that china ( which is obsessed by formosa -- to khrushchev a very small matter ) should be supported by north korea and north vietnam is highly indicative .	44.545883
and one cannot but wonder whether marshal malinovsky , who was blowing hot and cold , exalting peace but also almost openly considering the possibility of preventive war against the west , wasn ' t trying to keep the chinese quiet .	40.6099
and this brings us inevitably to the 30- or 50-megaton bomb .	86.28748
was not this dropped primarily in order to `` appease ' ' the chinese -- especially after `` khrushchev ' s `` humiliating ' ' surrender to the west in canceling the german peace-treaty deadline of december 31 ? ?	25.7168
what does it all add up to ? ?	1.0303637
indications are that khrushchev ( and , with him , the bulk of the soviet people ) favor peaceful coexistence and ( with the exception of berlin ) the maintenance of the status quo in the world .	34.639336
the chinese , north vietnamese and north koreans , on the other hand , feel that , militarily , russia is strong enough to support them in the `` just wars of liberation ' ' they would like to embark on before long with china attacking formosa and the north koreans and north vietnamese liberating the southern half of their respective countries .	36.858173
perhaps khrushchev is in a more difficult position than any since 1957 , when the `` anti-party group ' ' nearly liquidated him .	57.70859
he seems strong enough inside the party to cope with any internal opposition	27.839306
but if he is up against china ' s crusading spirit in world affairs , he is going to be faced with the most agonizing choice in his life .	27.234041
he may support china ( but he won ' t )	6.1707797
he may break with china ( which would be infernally difficult and perhaps disastrous ) , or he may succeed , by all kinds of dangerous concessions , in persuading china to be patient .	56.944687
the next days may show where things stand .	31.299492
on a misty sunday morning last month , a small band of militant anti-communists called the minutemen held maneuvers in a foggy field about fifteen miles east of here .	33.875004
eleven men , a woman and a teen-age boy tramped over cold , damp , fog-enshrouded ground during a two-hour field drill in the problems of guerrilla warfare .	43.45499
to the average american , this must sound like an incredible tale from a saturday night tv movie .	71.80437
but to the minutemen , this is a serious business .	121.69675
they feel that the united states is engaged in a life-and-death struggle with communism for survival and world supremacy .	18.073666
they feel that world war 3 , has already begun , and they are setting themselves up as a `` last line of defense ' ' against the communist advance .	51.47807
their national leader , robert bolivar depugh of norborne , mo . , says the minutemen believe that guerrilla tactics are best suited to defeat the red onslaught .	16.051407
in their maneuvers last month , they wore world war 2 , camouflage garb and helmets , and carried unloaded m-1 rifles .	10.251261
the maneuvers were held `` in secret ' ' after a regional seminar for the minutemen , held in nearby shiloh , ill . , had been broken up the previous day by deputy sheriffs , who had arrested regional leader richard lauchli of collinsville , ill . , and seized four operative weapons , including a browning machine gun , two browning automatic rifles and an m-4 rifle .	26.806927
undismayed by this contretemps , a small band of the faithful gathered at lauchli ' s home at 6 30 a . m . the next day , put on their uniforms , and headed for a farm several miles away .	22.425104
a 60 mm . mortar and a 57 mm . recoilless rifle owned by lauchli were brought along .	15.20214
the mortar was equipped with dummy shells and the recoilless rifle was deactivated .	4.793579
after a tortuous drive in an open truck and a world war 2 , army jeep down soggy trails , the band arrived at a small clearing squeezed between a long , low ridge and a creek-filled gully .	37.18174
here the two leaders , depugh and lauchli , hastened to put the group through its paces .	51.633892
the minutemen were instructed in the use of terrain for concealment .	32.21192
they were shown how to advance against an enemy outpost atop a cleared ridge .	14.787649
they practiced movement behind a smoke screen laid by smoke grenades	6.8815775
and they attempted a skirmish line of advance against a camouflaged enemy encampment .	19.32892
eleven dummy rounds were fired by lauchli in a demonstration of rapid-fire mortar shooting .	13.326444
mrs . depugh , the mother of five children and an active member of her husband ' s organization , participated in all the exercises .	37.622826
there were no `` casualties ' ' , but the `` guerrillas ' ' admitted to being `` a little tired ' ' when the leaders called a halt at 9 a . m . to enable out-of-town members to catch a plane .	24.660507
i would like to add one more practical reform to those mentioned by russell kirk ( dec . 16 ) .	67.060005
it has to do with teachers ' salaries and tenure .	13.778647
next september , after receiving a degree from yale ' s master of arts in teaching program , i will be teaching somewhere -- that much is guaranteed by the present shortage of mathematics teachers .	66.758125
the amazing thing is that this too is caused by the dearth of teachers .	16.031862
as a result buyers , the public , must be satisfied with second-rate teachers .	40.081272
the rub arises from the fact that teachers are usually paid on the basis of time served rather than quality .	40.44996
hence all teachers , good and bad , who have been teaching for a given number of years are paid the same salary .	41.49281
i am firmly convinced that considering the average quality of teachers in this country , the profession is grossly overpaid .	13.440298
it follows that teachers as a group cannot expect any marked salary increases	476.34573
there is a limit to how much the public will pay for shoddy performance .	25.582745
the only hope which good teachers have for being paid their due is to stop dragging the dead weight of poor teachers up the economic ladder with them .	159.26105
the only hope which the public has for getting good teachers is to pay teachers on the basis of merit rather than tenure .	46.689632
here , as in all sectors of the economy , quality and justice are both dependent on the right of the individual to deal directly with his employer if he so chooses .	89.36211
on the eve of the `` great debate ' ' on the proposal to give the president broad powers to make across-the-board tariff concessions which could practically bring us into the atlantic community , we should face the alternatives on this proposition .	32.177963
what we will be sacrificing in any such arrangement will be our power to be selective which is contained in the reciprocal trade principle under which we now operate .	107.46267
without this power we lay open any american industry which the europeans may find it economically profitable to destroy to the will of others .	74.20234
it is this loss of initiative in how we conduct our economy which may lead to the loss of initiative in how we conduct our political affairs .	39.80952
i disagree with mr . burnham ' s position on the common market ( nov . 18 ) as a desirable organization for us to join .	39.897526
for him to ignore the political consequences involved in an atlantic union of this kind is difficult to understand .	50.892467
the pressure for our entry to the common market is mounting and we will proceed towards this amalgamated trade union by way of a purely `` economic thoroughfare ' ' , or garden path , with the political ramifications kept neatly in the background .	64.83248
the appeal is going to be to the pocketbook and may be very convincing to those who do not see its relation to political and legal , as well as economic , self-rule .	51.033314
in entering this union we will be surrendering most , if not all , of our economic autonomy to international bodies such as the atlantic institute ( recently set up ) or the o . e . c . d . , i . m . f . and others .	46.428013
to think that we can merely relinquish our economic autonomy without giving up our political or legal autonomy is wishful thinking .	84.8725
if it is not enough that all of our internationalist one worlders are advocating that we join this market , i refer you to an article in the new york times ' magazine section ( nov . 12 , 1961 ) , by mr . eric johnston , entitled `` we must join the common market ' ' .	47.291782
he says `` it has swept aside petty nationalisms , age-old rivalries , and worn-out customs ' ' .	5.9292974
referring to britain , he says , `` we see a nation that traditionally values sovereignty above all else willing to give up its economy , placing this authority in continental hands ' ' .	169.72557
since the goal of our international planners is a world government , this atlantic community would mark a giant step in that direction for , once american economic autonomy is absorbed , a larger grouping is a question of time .	127.36765
frankly , it is being very cleverly done for , in a sense , they have us over a barrel .	70.09548
listen to what mr . johnston has to say `` consider the savage wounds that isolationism would inflict .	35.931026
we would lose our export markets and deny ourselves the imports we need .	101.68867
we would be crippled by reduced output , industrial decline , widespread unemployment ' ' .	55.17279
but the solution to this dilemma is not the incorporation of the united states into an atlantic community or `` economic empire ' ' , but merely what libertarians like henry hazlitt and ludwig von mises have been arguing for years an end to government regulations , an end to government competition in industry , and a realistic depreciation allowance for industry .	36.170113
create a free market here , give us a sound , debt-free money system , and we ' ll compete with anyone , europe and asia combined .	60.205692
in short , get this governmental monstrosity off our backs and we won ' t have to worry about european competition or communism either .	71.56591
if we want to preserve our sovereignty , this is the way to do it	28.533197
if we go into this common market , we might just as well stop talking about constitutional guarantees , connally amendments or , for that matter , conservatism in general .	114.94819
we welcome this able brief for the negative as part of a many-sided discussion of the atlantic common market which jnr will be continuing in our pages .	37.591434
the peiping chinese were the only major silver seller in the world markets who stopped selling the metal on monday morning , november 27 , anticipating by two days the announcement of the u . s . treasury that the pegged offering price will be removed .	23.999727
in 1954 i was drafted and after serving two years honorably on active duty i was not required to participate in any further army reserve activities .	83.61384
now , more than five years later , i cannot in any realistic sense be called a trained soldier .	258.08267
but , in spite of this , i , at present a man 31 years of age and a college professor , have been recalled `` by direction of the president ' ' to report on november 25th to fort devens , massachusetts , for another twelve months of active duty as an sp 4 ( the equivalent of a pfc ) .	41.68221
today , seven years after the date of my initial induction as a draftee , i am assistant professor of philosophy and science at st . michael ' s college .	21.216177
for , after leaving the army in 1956 , i spent five years in graduate school first at boston college and then at the university of toronto .	44.25796
this time , added to that which i had already spent in school prior to my induction in 1954 , makes a total of twenty-two ( 22 ) years of education .	61.10893
the possibility of recall into the army is part of the price that a modern american has to pay for the enviable heritage of liberty which he enjoys .	65.8744
however , it seems axiomatic that the government has an obligation `` to exercise its mandate reasonably , equitably and with full regard for the disruptions which it inevitably causes ' ' .	58.88261
in my own case , i submit that such reasonable and fair exercise is woefully lacking .	90.03525
taken back into the army now as an sp 4 , i am leaving 110 college students whose teacher i am .	77.60165
( a wry sidelight on this is that most of my students have deferments from the draft in order to attend my classes .	30.114603
) at this late date , it is impossible for st . michael ' s college to find a suitable replacement for me .	27.592005
even apart from the fact that now at the age of 31 my personal life is being totally disrupted for the second time for no very compelling reason -- i cannot help looking around at the black leather jacket brigades standing idly on the street corners and in the taverns of every american city and asking myself if our society has gone mad .	54.142788
in news broadcasts i consistently hear the foreign volunteers fighting in the katanga army referred to as mercenaries .	47.698906
if the hessian troops sent here willy-nilly by the hessian government to fight for england in the 1770 ' s were mercenaries , what shall we call the un troops sent to the congo willy-nilly by their governments to fight for the united nations ? ?	19.816708
if the un troops are not mercenaries then the hessians were not mercenaries either .	25.318134
and if the foreigners fighting in the katanga army are mercenaries then lafayette and von steuben were mercenaries too , as were also the members of the lafayette escadrille in the early part of world war 1 , and of chennault ' s flying tigers in the early days of world war 2 .	24.707418
it doesn ' t take a gore vidal to tell you what ' s wrong with cherokee textile ' s slogan ( pitney-bowes objects ' ' , july 1 ) .	24.361979
it ' s an eighteenth-century negative , man ! !	109.20343
suggest the following twenty-first-century amendment by moving the term `` republic ' ' to lower case , substituting the modern phrase , `` move ahead ' ' for the stodgy `` keep ' ' , and by using the postmaster ' s name on every envelope ( in caps , of course , with the `` in spite ' ' as faded as possible ) , the slogan cannot fail .	45.27942

lester markel is on the right track in his article `` interpretation of interpretation ' ' ( sr , mar . 11 ) .	11.816614
the current stereotype of straight news reporting was probably invaluable in protecting the press and its readers from pollution by that combination of doctored fact , fancy , and personal opinion called yellow journalism which flourished in this country more than a generation ago .	76.11649
we don ' t need this type of protection any more .	220.20857
the public is now armed with sophistication and numerous competing media .	197.44113
besides , there are no longer enough corruptible journalists about .	26.707827
the accepted method of writing news has two major liabilities .	10.338439
a reporter restricted to the competing propaganda statements of both sides in a major labor dispute , for instance , is unable to tell his readers half of what he knows about the causes of the dispute .	41.01848
second , it subjects the news to distortion by the unscrupulous .	38.86384
the charges by the late junior senator from wisconsin not only destroyed innocent people but misled the nation .	167.03807
yet the press was powerless to put these charges in perspective in its news columns .	98.151024
despite several years of front-page stories , the average citizen was unable to get a complete picture of mccarthy until he saw on the television screen what the reporters had been seeing all along but had no effective way of communicating .	73.72114
the senator had boxed them in with their own restrictions .	64.61146
it seems to me the time has come for the american press to start experimenting with ways of reporting the news that will do a better job of communicating and will be less subject to abuse by those who have learned how to manipulate the present stereotype to serve their own ends .	62.018475
the objective should be to provide a method of getting into print a higher percentage than is now possible of the relevant information in the possession of reporters and editors .	78.59034
i would like to see you devote some space in an early issue to the news blackout concerning president kennedy ' s activities , so far as southern california is concerned .	64.52352
you have on more than one occasion praised the idea of a televised press conference and the chance it gives the people to form intelligent opinions .	57.443794
to begin with , the all-powerful los angeles times does not publish a transcript of these press conferences .	29.658537
i am sure that they did when eisenhower was president .	128.3077
next , because of the time differential , the conferences come on the networks during the middle of the day .	50.84005
up until now , the networks have grudgingly run half-hour tapes at 5 p . m . or sometimes 7 or 10 30 p . m . .	25.854763
even then , a few of the `` less interesting ' ' questions are edited out and glibly summarized by a commentator .	27.314322
however , last night the tapes were not run at all during the evening hours and all we got on tv were a few snatches which douglas edwards and huntley and brinkley could squeeze into their programs .	64.4681
this is no criticism of them , as they obviously cannot get a half-hour program into a fifteen-minute news summary .	100.97264
the radio stations did run `` transcripts ' ' ( i thought ) during the evening hours .	56.341915
however , by comparing the tv snatches , two different radio station re-runs , and the censored los angeles times version , i found that the radio stations had edited out questions ( abc removed the one regarding laos ) or even a paragraph out of the middle of the president ' s answer .	54.111897
i am interested to know he is getting mail from all over the country about the `` abuse ' ' he is being subjected to .	63.404976
we out here don ' t see enough of the conference to know he is being abused .	61.44287
i don ' t know if this is the situation in other parts of the country	26.847176
it also happened with the inauguration , which was not re-run at all during the evening hours , and i wrote to the tv editor of the times .	25.232725
he did mention in his column the fact that he had received many letters about this and he himself did not understand the networks and the independent local stations ' not doing this -- but nothing happened .	84.15257
can you bring the networks ' attention to this ? ?	10.749316
i was interested in james webb young ' s madison avenue column in which he raised the question `` do we need a college of propaganda ' ' ? ?	42.965057
and the sad part of it is that we had one , which was rounding into excellent shape , and we let it disintegrate and die .	66.83448
during the war , we set up schools for the teaching of psychological warfare , which included the teaching of propaganda , both black and white and the various shades of grey in between .	48.764492
we had a couple of schools in this country , the principal one being on the marshall field estate out in lloyd ' s neck .	69.756645
there were also a couple in canada , and several in england .	33.853546
the english schools preceded ours , and by the time we got into it they had learned a lot about the techniques of propaganda and its teaching .	36.902576
four of us here in the united states attended , first as students , then as instructors , almost every one of these schools , in england , canada , and the united states .	39.84604
we set up the lloyd ' s neck school , worked out its curriculum , and taught there .	70.37037
toward the end of the war , we really felt that we had learned something about propaganda and how to teach it .	72.30211
when the end did come , and the schools were disbanded and abandoned , we felt and hoped that the machinery of psychological warfare would not be allowed to rust .	49.40197
we hoped that its practitioners and teachers might be put on some sort of reserve list and called back for refresher courses each year or so .	185.84573
there apparently is no school of propaganda or psychological warfare .	7.360971
a study at the pentagon and at the service academies revealed that nothing was being done there .	72.03744
and not one of the four men who attended all the schools has ever been called on to apply any of his knowledge in any way .	60.789646
congratulations on the article `` do we need a college of propaganda ' ' ? ?	6.7462187
this is one of the most constructive suggestions made in this critical field in years , and i certainly hope it sparks some action .	90.86467

it is not news that nathan milstein is a wizard of the violin .	8.770178
certainly not in orchestra hall where he has played countless recitals , and where thursday night he celebrated his 20th season with the chicago symphony orchestra , playing the brahms concerto with his own slashing , demon-ridden cadenza melting into the high , pale , pure and lovely song with which a violinist unlocks the heart of the music , or forever finds it closed .	40.039944
there was about that song something incandescent , for this brahms was milstein at white heat .	64.65673
not the noblest performance we have heard him play , or the most spacious , or even the most eloquent .	45.24453
those would be reserved for the orchestra ' s great nights when the soloist can surpass himself .	45.821156
this time the orchestra gave him some superb support fired by response to his own high mood .	103.427284
but he had in walter hendl a willing conductor able only up to a point .	80.66275
that is , when mr . milstein thrust straight to the core of the music , sparks flying , bow shredding , violin singing , glittering and sometimes spitting , mr . hendl could go along .	19.284014
but mr . hendl does not go straight to any point .	49.60302
there was in the brahms none of the mysterious and marvelous alchemy by which a great conductor can bring soloist , orchestra and music to ultimate fusion .	73.26864
so we had some dazzling and memorable milstein , but not great brahms .	24.346098

hindemith ' s joust with weber tunes was a considerably more serious misfortune , for it demands transluscent textures , buoyant rhythms , and astringent wit .	16.435823
it got the kind of scrambled , coarsened performance that can happen to best of orchestras when the man with the baton lacks technique and style .	110.783806

but barring a miracle , and don ' t hold your breath for it , chicago will not see the leningrad-kirov ballet , which stems from the ballet cradle of the maryinsky and is one of the great companies of the world .	35.12789
before you let loose a howl saying we announced its coming , not once but several times , indeed we did .	311.26938
the engagement was supposed to be all set for the big theater in mccormick place , which sol hurok , ballet booker extraordinary , considers the finest house of its kind in the country -- and of course he doesn ' t weep at the capacity , either .	43.732952
allied arts corporation first listed the chicago dates as dec . 4 thru 10 .	15.991282
later the hurok office made it dec . 8 thru 17 , a nice , long booking for the full repertory .	20.576971
but if you keep a calendar of events , as we do , you noticed a conflict .	80.817444
allied arts had booked marlene dietrich into mccormick place dec . 8 and 9 .	25.641195
allied arts then notified us that the kirov would cut short its los angeles booking , fly here to open nov . 28 , and close dec . 2 .	49.389675
a couple of days later a balletomane told me he had telephoned allied arts for ticket information and was told `` the newspapers had made a mistake ' ' .	41.88908
so i started making some calls of my own .	78.82614
the kirov ballet is firmly booked into the shrine auditorium , los angeles , nov . 21 thru dec . 4 .	6.495631
not a chance of opening here nov . 28 -- barring that miracle .	25.14565
then why not the juicy booking hurok had held for us ? ?	48.20307
well , dietrich won ' t budge from mccormick place .	21.92677
then how about the civic opera house ? ?	1.0079149
well , allied arts has booked lena horne there for a week starting dec . 4 .	41.140316
queried about the impasse , allied arts said `` better cancel the kirov for the time being .	39.770058
it ' s all up in the air again ' ' .	26.98087
so the kirov will fly back to russia , minus a chicago engagement , a serious loss for dance fans -- and for the frustrated bookers , cancellation of one of the richest bookings in the country .	23.160576
paintings and drawings by marie moore of st . thomas , virgin islands , are shown thru nov . 5 at the meadows gallery , 3211 ellis av . , week days , 3 p . m . to 8 p . m . , sundays 3 p . m . to 6 p . m . , closed mondays .	16.277521
an exhibition of evelyn cibula ' s paintings will open with a reception nov . 5 at the evanston community center , 828 davis st . .	43.082172
abstractions and semi-abstractions by everett mcnear are being exhibited by the university gallery of notre dame until nov . 5 .	10.273815
in the line of operatic trades to cushion the budget , the dallas civic opera will use san francisco ' s new leni bauer-ecsy production of `` lucia di lammermoor ' ' this season , returning the favor next season when san francisco uses the dallas `` don giovanni ' ' , designed by franco zeffirelli .	29.965374
h e . bates has scribbled a farce called `` hark , hark , the lark ' ' ! !	5.759813
it is one of the most entertaining and irresponsible novels of the season .	32.773506
if there is a moral lurking among the shenanigans , it is hard to find .	25.477127
perhaps the lesson we should take from these pages is that the welfare state in england still allows wild scope for all kinds of rugged eccentrics .	50.322437
anyway , a number of them meet here in devastating collisions .	6.6316085
one is an imperial london stockbroker called jerebohm .	3.6247568
another is a wily countryman called larkin , whose blandly boisterous progress has been chronicled , i believe , in earlier volumes of mr . bates ' comedie humaine .	24.603418
well , jerebohm and his wife pinkie have reached the stage of affluence that stirs a longing for the more atrociously expensive rustic simplicities .	22.58241
they want to own a junior-grade castle , or a manor house , or some modest little place where shakespeare might once have staged a pageant for great elizabeth and all her bearded courtiers .	67.38565
they are willing to settle , however , in anything that offers pheasants to shoot at and peasants to work at .	109.37655
and of course larkin has just the thing they want .	91.812744
the name of it is gore court , and it is surrounded by a wasteland that would impress t . s . eliot .	20.635843
that ' s not precisely the way larkin urges them to look at it , though .	59.67914
he conjures herds of deer , and wild birds crowding the air .	13.487936
he suggests that gore court embodies all the glories of tudor splendor .	3.6795075
the stained-glass windows may have developed unpremeditated patinas , the paneling may be no more durable than the planks in a political platform .	11.26187
the vast , dungeon kitchens may seem hardly worth using except on occasions when one is faced with a thousand unexpected guests for lunch .	146.93822
the spaciousness of the tudor cooking areas , for example , will provide needed space for the extra television sets required by modern butlers , cooks and maids .	52.45964
also , perhaps , table-tennis and other indoor sports to keep them fit and contented .	39.435318
it ' s a wonder , really , to how much mendacious trouble larkin puts himself to sell the jerebohms that preposterous manse .	43.7341
he doesn ' t really need the immense sum of money ( probably converted from american gold on the london exchange ) he makes them pay .	129.55429
for larkin is already wonderfully contented with his lot .	34.64537
he has a glorious wife and many children .	6.9340296
when he needs money to buy something like , say , the rolls-royce he keeps near his vegetable patch , he takes a flyer in the sale of surplus army supplies .	42.310413
one of those capital-gains ventures , in fact , has saddled him with gore court .	106.84651
he is willing to sell it just to get it off his hands .	47.634766
and the jerebohms are more than willing to buy it .	9.077833
they plan to become county people who know the proper way to terminate a fox ' s life on earth .	34.543427
if , in larkin ' s eyes , they are nothing but piccadilly farmers , he has as much to learn about them as they have to learn about the ways of truly rural living .	62.421196
mr . bates shows us how this mutual education spreads its inevitable havoc .	128.95706
oneupmanship is practiced by both sides in a total war .	184.06232
first the larkins are ahead , then the jerebohms .	28.958845
after larkin has been persuaded to restock his tangled acres with pheasants , he poaches only what he needs for the nourishment of his family and local callers .	24.590376
one of the local callers , a retired brigadier apparently left over from kipling ' s tales of india , does not approve of the way larkin gets his birds .	53.471985
he doesn ' t think that potting them from a deck chair on the south side of the house with a quart glass of beer for sustenance is entirely sporting .	19.603363
but the brigadier dines on the birds with relish .	10.143683
it is truly odd and ironic that the most handsome and impressive film yet made from miguel de cervantes ' `` don quixote ' ' is the brilliant russian spectacle , done in wide screen and color , which opened yesterday at the fifty-fifth street and sixty-eighth street playhouses .	37.53656
more than a beautiful visualization of the illustrious adventures and escapades of the tragi-comic knight-errant and his squire , sancho panza , in seventeenth-century spain , this inevitably abbreviated rendering of the classic satire on chivalry is an affectingly warm and human exposition of character .	15.257071
nikolai cherkasov , the russian actor who has played such heroic roles as alexander nevsky and ivan the terrible , performs the lanky don quixote , and does so with a simple dignity that bridges the inner nobility and the surface absurdity of this poignant man .	40.22087
his addle-brained knight-errant , self-appointed to the ridiculous position in an age when armor had already been relegated to museums and the chivalrous code of knight-errantry had become a joke , is , as cervantes no doubt intended , a gaunt but gracious symbol of good , moving soberly and sincerely in a world of cynics , hypocrites and rogues .	34.08276
cherkasov does not caricature him , as some actors have been inclined to do .	22.906744
he treats this deep-eyed , bearded , bony crackpot with tangible affection and respect .	14.575177
directed by grigory kozintsev in a tempo that is studiously slow , he develops a sense of a high tradition shining brightly and passing gravely through an impious world .	34.65111
the complexities of communication have been considerably abetted in this case by appropriately stilted english language that has been excellently dubbed in place of the russian dialogue .	30.57506
the voices of all the characters , including that of cherkasov , have richness , roughness or color to conform with the personalities .	34.498882
and the subtleties of the dialogue are most helpfully conveyed .	4.9296165
since russian was being spoken instead of spanish , there is no violation of artistry or logic here .	29.492035
splendid , too , is the performance of yuri tolubeyev , one of russia ' s leading comedians , as sancho panza , the fat , grotesque `` squire ' ' .	10.70456
though his character is broader and more comically rounded than the don , he gives it a firmness and toughness -- a sort of peasant dignity -- too .	40.574047
it is really as though the russians have seen in this character the oftentimes underlying vitality and courage of supposed buffoons .	101.65119
the episode in which sancho panza concludes the joke that is played on him when he is facetiously put in command of an `` island ' ' is one of the best in the film .	33.29533
true , the pattern and flow of the drama have strong literary qualities that are a bit wearisome in the first half , before don quixote goes to the duke ' s court .	46.696823
but strength and poignancy develop thenceforth , and the windmill and deathbed episodes gather the threads of realization of the wonderfulness of the old boy .	13.786457
there are other good representations of peasants and people of the court by actors who are finely costumed and magnificently photographed in this last of the russian films to reach this country in the program of joint cultural exchange .	52.931515
also on the bill at the fifty-fifth street is a nice ten-minute color film called `` sunday in greenwich village ' ' , a tour of the haunts and joints .	18.9672
television has yet to work out a living arrangement with jazz , which comes to the medium more as an uneasy guest than as a relaxed member of the family .	50.41219
there seems to be an unfortunate assumption that an hour of chicago-style jazz in prime evening time , for example , could not be justified without the trimmings of a portentous documentary .	24.683771
at least this seemed to be the working hypothesis for `` chicago and all that jazz ' ' , presented on nbc-tv nov . 26 .	31.776897
the program came out of the nbc special projects department , and was slotted in the du pont show of the week series .	57.33097
perhaps special projects necessarily thinks along documentary lines .	4.481365
if so , it might be worth while to assign a future jazz show to a different department -- one with enough confidence in the musical material to cut down on the number of performers and give them a little room to display their talents .	85.19433
as a matter of fact , this latter approach has already been tried , and with pleasing results .	67.81355
a few years ago a `` timex all-star jazz show ' ' offered a broad range of styles , ranging from lionel hampton ' s big band to the free-wheeling dukes of dixieland .	18.162167
an enthusiastic audience confirmed the `` live ' ' character of the hour , and provided the interaction between musician and hearer which almost always seems to improve the quality of performance .	51.23541
about that same time john crosby ' s tv series on the popular arts proved again that giving jazz ample breathing space is one of the most sensible things a producer can do .	80.57453
in an hour remembered for its almost rudderless movement , a score of jazz luminaries went before the cameras for lengthy periods .	32.94341
the program had been arranged to permit the establishment of a mood of intense concentration on the music .	43.960304
cameras stared at soloists ' faces in extreme closeups , then considerately pulled back for full views of ensemble work .	71.27552
`` chicago and all that jazz ' ' could not be faulted on the choice of artists .	45.70289
some of the in-person performers were jack teagarden , gene krupa , bud freeman , pee wee russell , johnny st . cyr , joe sullivan , red allen , lil armstrong , blossom seeley .	9.510825
the jazz buff could hardly ask for more .	27.513702
furthermore , garry moore makes an ideal master of ceremonies .	14.262376
( he played host at the timex show already mentioned .	53.84465
one of the script ' s big problems was how to blend pictures and music of the past with live performances by musicians of today .	91.39403
nbc had gathered a lot of historical material which it was eager to share .	38.883
for example , there was sheet music with the word `` jazz ' ' in the title , to illustrate how a word of uncertain origin took hold .	60.989983
samples zoomed into closeup range in regular succession , like telephone poles passing on the highway , while representative music reinforced the mood of the late teens and 1920 ' s .	55.805958
however well chosen and cleverly arranged , such memorabilia unfortunately amounted to more of an interruption than an auxiliary to the evening ' s main business , which ( considering the talent at hand ) should probably have been the gathering of fresh samples of the chicago style .	63.186157
another source of nbc pride was its rare film clip of bix beiderbecke , but this view of the great trumpeter flew by so fast that a prolonged wink would have blotted out the entire glimpse .	24.173857
similarly , in presenting still photographs of early jazz groups , the program allowed no time for a close perusal .	83.941086
`` chicago and all that jazz ' ' may have wound up satisfying neither the confirmed fan nor the inquisitive newcomer .	84.959435
by trying to be both a serious survey of a bygone era and a showcase for today ' s artists , the program turned out to be a not-quite-perfect example of either .	23.74587
still , the network ' s willingness to experiment in this musical field is to be commended , and future essays happily anticipated .	57.306812
even joan sutherland may not have anticipated the tremendous reception she received from the metropolitan opera audience attending her debut as lucia in donizetti ' s `` lucia di lammermoor ' ' sunday night .	19.227303
the crowd staged its own mad scene in salvos of cheers and applause and finally a standing ovation as miss sutherland took curtain call after curtain call following a fantastic `` mad scene ' ' created on her own and with the help of the composer and the other performers .	48.256897
her entrance in scene 2 , act 1 , brought some disconcerting applause even before she had sung a note .	80.483025
thereafter the audience waxed applause-happy , but discriminating operagoers reserved judgment as her singing showed signs of strain , her musicianship some questionable procedure and her acting uncomfortable stylization .	73.01178
as she gained composure during the second act , her technical resourcefulness emerged stronger , though she had already revealed a trill almost unprecedented in years of performances of `` lucia ' ' .	39.964046
each high note had the crowd in ecstasy so that it stopped the show midway in the `` mad scene ' ' , but the real reason was a realization of the extraordinary performance unfolding at the moment .	26.730831
miss sutherland appeared almost as another person in this scene a much more girlish lucia , a sensational coloratura who ran across stage while singing , and an actress immersed in her role .	44.068382
what followed the outburst brought almost breathless silence as miss sutherland revealed her mastery of a voice probably unique among sopranos today .	71.306625
this big , flexible voice with uncommon range has been superbly disciplined .	36.50722
nervousness at the start must have caused the blemishes of her first scene , or she may warm up slowly .	62.886208
in the fullness of her vocal splendor , however , she could sing the famous scene magnificently .	41.540775
technically it was fascinating , aurally spell-binding , and dramatically quite realistic .	31.797426
many years have passed since a metropolitan audience heard anything comparable .	879.77264
her debut over , perhaps the earlier scenes will emerge equally fine .	97.72623
the performance also marked the debut of a most promising young conductor , silvio varviso .	26.785013
he injected more vitality into the score than it has revealed in many years .	51.31096
he may respect too much the italian tradition of letting singers hold on to their notes , but to restrain them in a singers ' opera may be quite difficult .	63.49471
his bel canto style gave the performance a special distinction .	45.325928
the remainder of the cast fulfilled its assignments no more than satisfactorily just as the old production and limited stage direction proved only serviceable .	134.38416
miss sutherland first sang lucia at covent garden in 1959 .	60.988472
( the first metropolitan opera broadcast on dec . 9 will introduce her as lucia .	26.675468
) she has since turned to bellini , whose opera `` beatrice di tenda ' ' in a concert version with the american opera society introduced her to new york last season .	42.20955
she will sing `` la sonambula ' ' with it here next week .	123.63631
it ' s really quite fun -- as long as you like games .	81.48607
you will need a stereo music system , with speakers preferably placed at least seven or eight feet apart , and one or more of the new london `` phase 4 ' ' records .	58.855183
there are 12 of these to choose from , all of them of popular music except for the star release , pass in review ( sp-44001 ) .	132.64093
this features the marching songs of several nations , recorded as though the various national bands were marching by your reviewing stand .	111.43021
complete with crowd effects , interruptions by jet planes , and sundry other touches of realism , this disc displays london ' s new technique to the best effect .	51.817253
all of the jackets carry a fairly technical and detailed explanation of this new recording program .	30.56242
no reference is made to the possibility of recording other than popular music in this manner , and it would not seem to lend itself well to serious music .	111.08543
but when the sounds of the two speakers are allowed to mix , there is excellent depth and dimension to the music .	30.532663
you definitely hear some of the instruments close up and others farther back , with the difference in placement apparently more distinct than would result from the nearer instruments merely being louder than the ones farther back .	116.8047
this is a characteristic of good stereo recording and one of its tremendous advantages over monaural sound .	21.260815
london explains that the very distinct directional effect in the phase 4 series is due in large part to their novel methods of microphoning and recording the music on a number of separate tape channels .	60.31313
these are then mixed by their sound engineers with the active co-operation of the musical staff and combined into the final two channels which are impressed on the record .	66.44198
in some of the numbers the instrumental parts have even been recorded at different times and then later combined on the master tape to produce special effects .	101.88037
some clue to the character of london ' s approach in these discs may be gained immediately from the fact that ten of the 12 titles include the word `` percussion ' ' or `` percussive ' ' .	31.860634
drums , xylophones , castanets , and other percussive instruments are reproduced remarkably well .	9.396619
only too often , however , you have the feeling that you are sitting in a room with some of the instruments lined up on one wall to your left and others facing them on the wall to your right .	54.862045
they are definitely in the same room with you , but your head starts to swing as though you were sitting on the very edge of a tennis court watching a spirited volley .	50.38089
the percussive twenties ( sp-44006 ) stirs pleasant memories with well-known songs of that day , and johnny keating ' s kombo gives forth with tingling jazz in percussive moods ( sp-44005 ) .	19.8549
big band percussion ( sp-44002 ) seemed one of the least attractive discs -- the arrangements just didn ' t have so much character as the others .	55.75181
there is an extraordinary sense of presence in all of these recordings , apparently obtained at least in part by emphasizing the middle and high frequencies .	64.008026
the penalty for this is noticeable in the big , bold , brilliant , but brassy piano sounds in melody and percussion for two pianos ( sp-44007 ) .	31.089046
all of the releases , however , are recorded at a gratifyingly high level , with resultant masking of any surface noise .	32.153606
pass in review practically guarantees enjoyment , and is a dramatic demonstration of the potentialities of any stereo music system .	32.007114
many hollywood films manage somehow to be authentic , but not realistic .	22.549118
strange , but true -- authenticity and realism often aren ' t related at all .	96.580086
almost every film bearing the imprimatur of hollywood is physically authentic -- in fact , impeccably so .	46.595608
in any given period piece the costumes , bric-a-brac , vehicles , and decor , bear the stamp of unimpeachable authenticity .	15.424493
the major studios maintain a cadre of film librarians and research specialists who look to this matter .	38.934666
during the making recently of an important biblical film , some 40 volumes of research material and sketches not only of costumes and interiors , but of architectural developments , sports arenas , vehicles , and other paraphernalia were compiled , consulted , and complied with .	44.882526
but , alas , the authenticity seems to stop at the set ' s edge .	69.15126
the drama itself -- and this seems to be lavishly true of biblical drama -- often has hardly any relationship with authenticity at all .	60.333664
the storyline , in sort , is wildly unrealistic .	2.336586
thus , in `` the story of ruth ' ' we have ruth , naomi , and boaz and sets that are meticulously authentic .	27.188316
but except for a vague adherence to the basic storyline -- i . e . , that ruth remained with naomi and finally wound up with boaz -- the film version has little to do with the bible .	38.03583
and in the new `` king of kings ' ' the plot involves intrigues and twists and turns that cannot be traced to the gospels .	19.357777
earlier this month edward r . murrow , director of the united states information agency , came to hollywood and had dinner with more than 100 leaders of the motion picture industry .	52.801826
he intimated that they weren ' t doing the country much good in the cold war .	42.82544
and to an industry that prides itself on authenticity , he urged greater realism .	126.306465
`` in many corners of the globe ' ' , he said , `` the major source of impressions about this country are in the movies they meet .	33.273293
would we want a future-day gibbon or macaulay recounting the saga of america with movies as his prime source of knowledge ? ?	28.78148
yet for much of the globe , hollywood is just that -- prime , if not sole , source of knowledge .	132.9341
if a man totally ignorant of america were to judge our land and its civilization based on hollywood alone , what conclusions do you think he might come to ? ?	162.49864
francois d ' albert , hungarian-born violinist who made his new york debut three years ago , played a return engagement last night in judson hall .	25.294899
he is now president of the chicago conservatory college .	61.404385
his pianist was donald jenni , a faculty member at depaul university .	7.26025
the acoustics of the small hall had been misgauged by the artists , so that for the first half of the program , when the piano was partially open , mr . jenni ' s playing was too loud .	38.081264
in vying with him , mr . d ' albert also seemed to be overdriving his tone .	18.339622
this was not an overriding drawback to enjoyment of the performances , however , except in the case of the opening work , mozart ' s sonata in a ( k . 526 ) , which clattered along noisily in an unrelieved fashion .	14.665705
brahm ' s sonata in a , although also vigorous , stood up well under the two artists ' strong , large-scale treatment .	189.69312
mr . d ' albert has a firm , attractive tone , which eschews an overly sweet vibrato .	16.510859
he made the most of the long brahmsian phrases , and by the directness and drive of his playing gave the work a handsome performance .	72.60492
a sonata for violin and piano , called `` bella bella ' ' , by robert fleming , was given its first united states performance .	24.949108
the title refers to the nickname given his wife by the composer , who is also a member of the national film board of canada .	30.331928
the work ' s two movements , one melodically sentimental , the other brightly capricious , are clever enough in a ravel-like style , but they rehash a wornout idiom .	19.90652
they might well indicate conjugal felicity , but in musical terms that smack of hollywood .	38.193146
works by dohnanyi , hubay , mr . d ' albert himself and paganini , indicated that the violinist had some virtuoso fireworks up his sleeve as well as a reserved attitude toward a lyric phrase .	32.98903
standard items by sarasate and saint-saens completed the program .	19.46914
in recent years anna xydis has played with the new york philharmonic and at lewisohn stadium , but her program last night at town hall was the greek-born pianist ' s first new york recital since 1948 .	27.79711
miss xydis has a natural affinity for the keyboard , and in the twenty years since her debut here she has gained the authority and inner assurance that lead to audience control .	64.373276
and the tone she commands is always beautiful in sound .	35.129868
since she also has considerable technical virtuosity and a feeling for music in the romantic tradition , miss xydis gave her listeners a good deal of pleasure .	42.839916
she played with style and a touch of the grand manner , and every piece she performed was especially effective in its closing measures .	130.31642
the second half of her program was devoted to russian composers of this century .	37.72415
it was in them that miss xydis was at her best .	16.334154
the rachmaninoff prelude no . 12 , op . 32 , for instance , gave her an opportunity to exploit one of her special facilities -- the ability to produce fine deep-sounding bass tones while contrasting them simultaneously with fine silver filagree in the treble .	35.68282
the four kabalevsky preludes were also assured , rich in color and songful .	49.638622
and the prokofieff seventh sonata had the combination of romanticism and modern bravura that prokofieff needs .	32.53903
miss xydis ' earlier selections were mendelssohn ' s variations serieuses , in which each variation was nicely set off from the others	26.74286
haydn ' s sonata in e minor , which was unfailingly pleasant in sound , and chopin ' s sonata in b flat minor .	26.684086
a memory lapse in the last somewhat marred the pianist ' s performance .	19.680098
so , what was the deepest music on her program had the poorest showing .	108.30561
miss xydis was best when she did not need to be too probing .	30.042467
all the generals who held important commands in world war 2 , did not write books .	44.526176
and the best books by generals were not necessarily the first ones written .	198.43025
one of the very best is only now published in this country , five years after its first publication in england .	44.37227
it is `` defeat into victory ' ' , by field marshal viscount slim .	11.753083
a long book heavily weighted with military technicalities , in this edition it is neither so long nor so technical as it was originally .	88.33225
field marshal slim has abridged it for the benefit of `` those who , finding not so great an attraction in accounts of military moves and counter-moves , are more interested in men and their reactions to stress , hardship and danger ' ' .	75.77301
the man whose reactions and conclusions get the most space is , of course , the field marshal himself .	67.28563
william joseph slim , first viscount slim , former governor general of australia , was the principal british commander in the field during the burma war .	50.640156
he had been a corps commander during the disastrous defeat and retreat of 1942 when the ill-prepared , ill-equipped british forces `` were outmaneuvered , outfought and outgeneraled ' ' .	20.622051
he returned in command of an international army of gurkhas , indians , africans , chinese and british .	31.446455
and in a series of bitterly fought battles in the jungles and hills and along the great rivers of burma he waged one of the most brilliant campaigns of the war .	22.251917
`` the forgotten war ' ' his soldiers called the burma fighting because the war in africa and europe enjoyed priorities in equipment and in headlines .	76.08561
parts of `` defeat into victory ' ' are a tangle of burmese place names and military units , but a little application makes everything clear enough .	133.18439
on the whole this is an interesting and exceptionally well-written book .	5.7775035
field marshal slim is striking in description , amusing in many anecdotes .	48.35599
he has a pleasant sense of humor and is modest enough to admit mistakes and even `` a cardinal error ' ' .	43.71742
he himself seems to be tough , tireless , able and intelligent , more intellectual and self-critical than most soldiers .	110.16247
`` defeat into victory ' ' is a dramatic and lively military narrative .	30.318163
but it is most interesting in its account of the unending problems of high command , of decisions and their reasons , of the myriad matters that demand attention in addition to battle action .	83.323326
before he could return to burma , field marshal slim had to rally the defeated remnants of a discouraged army and unite them with fresh recruits .	36.992622
his remarks about training , discipline , morale , leadership and command are enlightening .	30.878359
he believed in making inspiring speeches and he made a great many .	31.133736
he believed in being seen near the front lines and he was there .	99.61931
for general morale reasons and to encourage the efforts of his supply officers , when food was short for combat troops he cut the rations of his headquarters staff accordingly .	116.79534
other crucial matters required constant supervision labor and all noncombatant troops , whose morale was vital , too	55.7618
administrative organization and delicate diplomatic relations with top brass -- british , american and chinese	163.72841
health , hygiene , medical aid and preventive medicine	10.431182
hospitals ( inadequate ) and nurses ( scanty )	2.1053166
commenting on these and other matters , field marshal slim makes many frank and provocative remarks	55.489925
`` when in doubt as to two courses of action , a general should choose the bolder ' ' .	45.072086
`` the commander has failed in his duty if he has not won victory -- for that is his duty ' ' .	50.17307
`` it only does harm to talk to troops about new and desirable equipment which others may have but which you cannot give them .	311.0762
so i made no mention of air transport until we could get at least some of it ' ' .	28.007086
field marshal slim is more impressed by the courage of japanese soldiers than he is by the ability of their commanders .	48.738365
of the japanese private he says `` he fought and marched till he died .	23.655722
if 500 japanese were ordered to hold a position , we had to kill 495 before it was ours -- and then the last five killed themselves ' ' .	47.050068
brooding about future wars , the field marshal has this to say `` the asian fighting man is at least equally brave ( as the white ) , usually more careless of death , less encumbered by mental doubts , less troubled by humanitarian sentiment , and not so moved by slaughter and mutilation around him .	50.351578
he is , by background and living standards , better fitted to endure hardship uncomplainingly , to demand less in the way of subsistence or comfort , and to look after himself when thrown on his own resources ' ' .	53.90271
a bunch of young buckaroos from out west , who go by the name of texas boys choir , loped into town hall last night and succeeded in corralling the hearts of a sizable audience .	43.132996
actually , the program they sang was at least two-thirds serious and high-minded , and they sang it beautifully .	45.05268
under the capable direction of the choir ' s founder , geroge bragg , the twenty-six boys made some lovely sounds in an opening group of renaissance and baroque madrigals and motets , excerpts from pergolesi ' s `` stabat mater ' ' and all of the britten `` ceremonial of carols ' ' .	16.68239
their singing was well-balanced , clear and , within obvious limitations , extremely pleasing .	54.148792
the limitations are those one expects from untrained and unsettled voices -- an occasional shrillness of almost earsplitting intensity , an occasional waver and now and then a bleat .	29.383871
but mr . bragg is a remarkably gifted conductor , and the results he has produced with his boys are generally superior .	85.425705
most surprising of all , he has accomplished some prodigies in training for the production of words .	45.36594
the latin , for example , was not only clear	69.1648
furthermore , there were solid musical virtues in the interpretation of the music .	15.610923
lines came out neatly and in good balance .	9.69002
the piano accompaniments by istvan szelenyi were stylish .	7.63189
a boy soprano named dixon boyd sang a durante solo motet and a few other passages enchantingly .	13.389126
other capable soloists included david clifton , joseph schockler and pat thompson .	15.01156
the final group included folk songs from back home , stomped out , shouted and chanted with irresistible spirit and in cowboy costume .	21.223352
boys will be boys , and texans will be texans .	6.9795136
the polish song and dance company called mazowsze , after the region of poland , where it has its headquarters , opened a three-week engagement at the city center last night .	32.53704
a thoroughly ingratiating company it is , and when the final curtain falls you may suddenly realize that you have been sitting with a broad grin on your face all evening .	97.97109
not that it is all funny , by any means , though some of it is definitely so , but simply that the dancers are young and handsome , high-spirited and communicative , and the program itself is as vivacious as it is varied .	33.43213
there is no use at all in trying to follow it dance by dance and title by title , for it has a kind of nonstop format , and moves along in an admirable continuity that demands no pauses for identification .	56.298656
the material is all basically of folk origin , gleaned from every section of poland .	44.8664
but under the direction of mira ziminska-sygietynska , who with her late husband founded the organization in 1948 , it has all been put into theatrical form , treated selectively , choreographed specifically for presentation to spectators , and performed altogether professionally .	110.24418
under the surface of the wide range of folk movements is apparent a sound technical ballet training , and an equally professional sense of performing .	115.291504
since the organization was created thirteen years ago , it is obvious that this is not the original company	16.435839
it is more likely the sons and daughters of that company .	127.69154
the girls are charming children and the men are wonderfully vital and engaging youngsters .	43.282375
indeed , there are never fewer than eight of them on stage , and that is only for the more intimate numbers .	53.816658
they can be exuberant or sentimental , flirtatious or funny , but the only thing they seem unable to be is dull .	53.195877
to pick out particular numbers is something of a problem , but one or two identifiable items are too conspicuously excellent to be missed .	30.906887
there is , for example , a stunning krakowiak that closes the first act	74.812096
the mazurka choreographed by witold zapala to music from moniuszko ' s opera , `` strasny dwor ' , may be the most beautiful mazurka you are likely ever to see	26.445662
and the dances and songs from the tatras contain a magnificent dance for the men .	65.591835
everywhere there are little touches of humor , and the leader of the on-stage band of musicians is an ebullient comedian who plays all sorts of odd instruments with winning warmth .	45.689953
the theatre-by-the-sea , matunuck , presents `` king of hearts ' ' by jean kerr and eleanor brooke .	6.663434
producer john holmes has chosen a delightful comedy for his season ' s opener at matunuck in jean kerr ' s `` king of hearts ' ' .	15.557347
the dialogue is sharp , witty and candid -- typical `` don ' t eat the daisies ' ' material -- which has stamped the author throughout her books and plays , and it was obvious that the theatre-by-the-sea audience liked it .	50.094326
the story is of a famous strip cartoonist , an arty individual , whose specialty is the american boy and who adopts a 10-year-old to provide him with fresh idea material .	53.319042
this is when his troubles begin , not to mention a fledgling artist who he hires , and who turns out to have ideas of his own , with particular respect to the hero ' s sweetheart-secretary .	34.660812
john heffernan , playing larry larkin , the cartoonist , carries the show in marvelous fashion .	59.037857
his portrayal of an edgy head-in-the-clouds artist is virtually flawless .	11.547948
this may be unfortunate , perhaps , from the standpoint of david hedison , providence ' s contribution to hollywood , who is appearing by special arrangement with 20th century-fox .	33.561428
not that mr . hedison does not make the most of his role .	20.784636
but the book is written around a somewhat dizzy cartoonist , and it has to be that way .	17.713388
a word should be said for gary morgan , a broadway youngster who , as the adopted son , makes life miserable for nearly everybody and larkin in particular .	102.80706
and for his playmate , francis coletta of west warwick , who has a bit part , billy .	49.830357
on the whole , audiences will like this performance .	43.50379
it is a tremendous book , lively , constantly moving , and the matunuck cast does well by it .	106.36558
the newport playhouse presents `` epitaph for george dillon ' ' by john osborne and anthony creighton , directed by wallace gray .	8.749581
the angriest young man in newport last night was at the playhouse , where `` epitaph for george dillon ' ' opened as the jazz festival closed .	47.978443
for the hero of this work by john osborne and anthony creighton is a chap embittered by more than the lack of beer during a jam session .	24.21876
he ' s mad at a world he did not make .	18.97094
furthermore , he ' s something of a scoundrel , an artist whose mind and feelings are all finger-tips .	29.885614
this is in contrast to the family with whom he boards .	50.272827
they not only think and feel cliches but live cliches as well .	65.53631
it is into this household , one eroded by irritations that have tortured the souls out of its people , that george dillon enters at the beginning of the play .	67.75208
an unsuccessful playwright and actor , he has faith only in himself and in a talent he is not sure exists .	223.5338
by the end of the third act , the artist is dead but the body lingers on , a shell among other shells .	42.817047
not altogether a successful play , `` epitaph for george dillon ' ' overcomes through sheer vitality and power what in a lesser work might be crippling .	60.718353
it is awfully talky , for instance , and not all of the talk is terribly impressive .	45.974743
but it strikes sparks on occasion and their light causes all else to be forgotten .	74.641914
there is a fine second act , as an example , one in which samuel groom , as dillon , has an opportunity to blaze away in one impassioned passage after another .	43.314613
this is an exciting young actor to watch .	4.1158586
just as exciting but in a more technically proficient way is laura stuart , whose complete control of her every movement is lovely to watch .	97.79023
miss stuart is as intensely vibrant as one could wish , almost an icy shriek threatening to explode at any moment .	32.8794
also fine are sue lawless , as a mother more protective and belligerent than a female spider and just as destructive , harold cherry , as her scratchy spouse , and hildy weissman , as a vegetable in human form .	43.053345
wallace gray has directed a difficult play here , usually well , but with just a bit too much physical movement in the first act for my taste .	70.49732
still , his finale is put together with taste and a most sensitive projection of that pale sustenance , despair .	50.790913
the warwick musical theater presents `` where ' s charley ? ?	1.841717
' ' with music and lyrics by frank loesser , directed by christopher hewett , choreography by peter conlow , musical direction by samuel matlowsky .	14.506534
everybody fell in love with amy again last night at the warwick musical theater , and shelley berman was to blame .	16.575274
one of the finest soft shoe tunes ever invented , `` once in love with amy ' ' is also , of course , one of the most tantalizingly persistent of light love lyrics to come out of american musical comedy in our era .	28.058187
so the audience last night was all ears and eyes just after act 2 , got a rousing opening chorus , `` where ' s charley ? ?	56.574677
' ' , and berman sifted out all alone on the stage with the ambling chords and beat of the song just whispering into being .	33.59016
it is greatly to berman ' s credit that he made no attempt to outdo ray bolger .	18.661257
he dropped his earlier and delightful hamming , which is about the only way to handle the old war horse called `` charley ' s aunt ' ' , and let himself go with as appealing an `` amy ' ' as anybody could ask .	71.56612
in brief , berman played himself and not bolger .	16.762243
the big audience started applauding even before he had finished .	63.227722
the whole production this week is fresh and lively .	20.500078
the costumes are stunning evocations of the voluminous gowns and picture hats of the gibson girl days .	39.161755
the ballet work is on the nose , especially in the opening number by `` the new ashmolean marching society and students ' conservatory band ' ' , along with a fiery and sultry brazilian fantasia later .	40.108017
berman , whose fame has rested in recent years on his skills as a night club monologist , proved himself very much at home in musical comedy .	83.48038
sparrow-size virginia gibson , with sparkling blue eyes and a cheerful smile , made a suitably perky amy , while melisande congdon , as the real aunt , was positively monumental in the very best gibson girl manner .	29.021992
all told , `` where ' s charley ? ?	3.166013
it has a fast pace , excellent music , expert direction , and not only a good comedian , but an appealing person in his own right , mr . berman .	24.036827
the broadway theater league of rhode island presents c . edwin knill ' s and martin tahse ' s production of `` fiorello ! !	15.019411
the book is by jerome weidman and george abbott , music by jerry bock , lyrics by sheldon harnick , choreography by peter gennaro , scenery , costumes and lighting by william and jean eckart , musical direction by jack elliott , and the production was directed by mr . abbott .	15.5677595
this is one of the happier events of the season .	28.599024
the company which performed the pulitzer prize musical here last night and will repeat it twice today is full of bounce , the politicians are in fine voice , the chorines evoke happy memories , and the little flower rides to break a lance again .	41.89956
' ' performed in new york by the original cast and i think this company is every bit as good , and perhaps better .	92.99875
certainly in the matter of principals there is nothing lacking .	21.803932
bob carroll may not bear quite as close a physical resemblance to laguardia as tom bosley does , but i was amazed at the way he became more and more fiorello as the evening progressed , until one had to catch one ' s self up and remember that this wasn ' t really laguardia come back among us again .	57.304134
then rudy bond was simply grand as ben , the distraught republican party district chieftain .	19.5506
and paul lipson , as morris , the faithful one who never gets home to his shirley ' s dinner , was fine , too .	66.340805
as for the ladies , they were full of charm , and sincerity , and deep and abiding affection for this hurrying driving , honest , little man .	56.831112
charlotte fairchild was excellent as the loyal marie , who became the second mrs . laguardia , singing and acting with remarkable conviction .	50.418514
jen nelson , as thea , his first wife , managed to make that short role impressive .	206.348
and little zeme north , a dora with real spirit and verve , was fascinating whether she was singing of her love for floyd , the cop who becomes sewer commissioner and then is promoted into garbage , or just dancing to display her exuberant feelings .	45.775494
such fascinating novelties in the score as the fugual treatment of `` on the side of the angels ' ' and `` politics and poker ' ' were handled splendidly , and i thought rudy bond and his band of tuneful ward-heelers made `` little tin box ' ' even better than it was done by the new york cast	42.923122
all the words of its clever lyrics came through with perfect clarity .	110.10727
the party at floyd ' s penthouse gave the `` chorines ' ' a chance for a nostalgic frolic through all those hackneyed routines which have become a classic choreographic statement of the era ' s nonsense .	20.009035
laguardia ' s multi-lingual rallies , when he is running for congress , are well staged , and wind up in a wild jewish folk-dance that is really great musical theater .	96.690445
martin tahse has established quite a reputation for himself as a successful stager of touring productions .	26.669546
not a corner has been visibly cut in this one .	44.66219
the sets are remarkably elaborate for a road-show that doesn ' t pause long in any one place , and they are devised so that they shift with a minimum of interruption or obtrusiveness .	30.489605
( several times recently i have wondered whether shows were being staged for the sake of the script or just to entertain the audience with the spectacle of scenery being shifted right in front of their eyes .	41.08707
i ' m glad to say there ' s none of that distraction in this `` fiorello ! !	24.745642
it has all been done in superb style , and the result is a show which deserves the support of every person hereabouts who enjoys good musical theater .	65.82463
loew ' s theater presents `` where the boys are ' ' , an mgm picture produced by joe pasternak and directed by henry levin from a screenplay by george wells .	23.773952
since the hero , a sterling and upright fellow , is a rich brown senior , while two yalies are cast as virtual rapists , i suppose i should disqualify myself from sitting in judgment on `` where the boys are ' ' , but i shall do nothing of the sort .	48.75202
instead -- and not just to prove my objectivity -- i hasten to report that it ' s a highly amusing film which probably does a fairly accurate job of reporting on the easter vacation shenanigans of collegians down in fort lauderdale , and that it seems to come to grips quite honestly with the moral problem that most commonly vexes youngsters in this age group -- that is to say , sex .	27.45956
the answers the girls give struck me as reasonably varied and healthily individual .	142.16072
if most of them weren ' t exactly specific -- well , that ' s the way it is in life , i guess .	74.58047
but at least it ' s reassuring to see some teenagers who don ' t profess to know all the answers and are thinking about their problems instead .	40.81078
`` where the boys are ' ' also has a juvenile bounce that makes for a refreshing venture in comedy .	52.463833
there are some sharp and whipping lines and some hilariously funny situations -- the best of the latter being a mass impromptu plunge into a nightclub tank where a `` mermaid ' ' is performing .	25.669106
most of the female faces are new , or at least not too familiar .	123.26885
dolores hart , is charming in a leading role , and quite believable .	10.135362
i was delighted with paula prentiss ' comedy performance , which was as fresh and unstilted as one ' s highest hopes might ask .	93.29314
a couple of the males made good comedy , too -- jim hutton and frank gorshin .	15.317501
the only performance which was too soft for me was that of yvette mimieux , but since someone had to become the victim of despoilers , just to emphasize that such things do happen at these fracases , i suppose this was the attitude the part called for .	55.882862
i must say , however , that i preferred the acting that had something of a biting edge to it .	111.99641
to anyone who remembers newport at its less than maximum violence , this view of what the boys and girls do in the springtime before they wing north for the jazz festival ought to prove entertaining .	52.5411
the second feature , `` the price of silence ' ' , is a british detective story that will talk your head off .	50.106415
the superb intellectual and spiritual vitality of william james was never more evident than in his letters .	38.77168
here was a man with an enormous gift for living as well as thinking .	69.342766
to both persons and ideas he brought the same delighted interest , the same open-minded relish for what was unique in each , the same discriminating sensibility and quicksilver intelligence , the same gallantry of judgment .	54.149994
for this latest addition to the great letters series , under the general editorship of louis kronenberger , miss hardwick has made a selection which admirably displays the variety of james ' s genius , not to mention the felicities of his style .	30.546513
his famous criticism of brother henry ' s `` third style ' ' is surely as subtly , even elegantly , worded an analysis of the latter ' s intricate air castles as henry himself could ever have produced .	51.314335
his letter to his daughter on the pains of growing up is surely as trenchant , forthright , and warmly understanding a piece of advice as ever a grown-up penned to a sensitive child , and with just the right tone of unpatronizing good humor .	66.63876
most of all , his letters to his philosophic colleagues show a magnanimity as well as an honesty which help to explain whitehead ' s reference to james as `` that adorable genius ' ' .	39.47865
miss hardwick speaks of his `` superb gift for intellectual friendship ' ' , and it is certainly a joy to see the intellectual life lived so free from either academic aridity or passionate dogmatism .	33.160065
this is a virtue of which we have great need in a society where there seems to be an increasing lack of communication -- or even desire for communication -- between differing schools of thought .	71.09629
it holds an equally valuable lesson for a society where the word `` intellectual ' ' has become a term of opprobrium to millions of well-meaning people who somehow imagine that it must be destructive of the simpler human virtues .	41.913353
to his harvard colleague , josiah royce , whose philosophic position differed radically from his own , james could write , `` different as our minds are , yours has nourished mine , as no other social influence ever has , and in converse with you i have always felt that my life was being lived importantly ' ' .	64.72944
of another colleague , george santayana , he could write `` the great event in my life recently has been the reading of santayana ' s book .	45.097717
although i absolutely reject the platonism of it , i have literally squealed with delight at the imperturbable perfection with which the position is laid down on page after page ' ' .	28.908379
writing to his colleague george herbert palmer -- `` glorious old palmer ' ' , as he addresses him -- james says that if only the students at harvard could really understand royce , santayana , palmer , and himself and see that their varying systems are `` so many religions , ways of fronting life , and worth fighting for ' ' , then harvard would have a genuine philosophic universe .	85.18359
`` the best condition of it would be an open conflict and rivalry of the diverse systems .	84.287796
the world might ring with the struggle , if we devoted ourselves exclusively to belaboring each other ' ' .	68.4015
the `` belaboring ' ' is of course jocular , yet james was not lacking in fundamental seriousness -- unless we measure him by that ultimate seriousness of the great religious leader or thinker who stakes all on his vision of god .	46.789062
to james this vision never quite came , despite his appreciation of it in others .	61.410355
but there is a dignity and even a hint of the inspired prophet in his words to one correspondent `` you ask what i am going to ' reply ' to bradley .	49.70552
but why need one reply to everything and everybody ? ?	32.05084
i think that readers generally hate minute polemics and recriminations .	4.3672867
all polemic of ours should , i believe , be either very broad statements of contrast , or fine points treated singly , and as far as possible impersonally .	100.87384
as far as the rising generation goes , why not simply express ourselves positively , and trust that the truer view quietly will displace the other .	51.83104
here again ' god will know his own ' ' ' .	25.838488
the collected works of james thurber , now numbering 25 volumes ( including the present exhibit ) represent a high standard of literary excellence , as every schoolboy knows .	45.831295
the primitive-eclogue quality of his drawings , akin to that of graffiti scratched on a cave wall , is equally well known .	24.848679
about all that remains to be said is that the present selection , most of which appeared first in the new yorker , comprises ( as usual ) a slightly unstrung necklace , held together by little more than a slender thread cunningly inserted in the spine of the book .	30.83125
the one unifying note , if any , is sounded in the initial article entitled `` how to get through the day ' ' .	51.024494
it is repeated at intervals in some rather sadly desperate word-games for insomniacs , the hospitalized , and others forced to rely on inner resources , including ( in the p ' s alone ) `` palindromes ' ' , `` paraphrases ' ' , and `` parodies ' ' .	19.181995
`` the tyranny of trivia ' ' suggests arbitrary alphabetical associations to induce slumber .	14.612853
and new vistas of hairshirt asceticism are opened by scholarly monographs entitled `` friends , romans , countrymen , lend me your ear-muffs ' ' , `` such a phrase as drifts through dream ' ' , and `` the new vocabularianism ' ' .	19.709011
