the average reader of this magazine owns more than one gun ( we ran a survey to find out ) but he ' s always on the lookout for new and better arms .	82.318146
he ' s more than a reader of outdoor articles	196.63106
he ' s a real hunter and shooter , eager to improve his sport .	13.278991
well , if you ' re that kind of sportsman we ' re here to help you .	52.83235
you ' ve probably given a lot of christmas-season thought to the guns in your rack , but it ' s not easy to decide on a new one .	37.120773
you still have time to drop a few hints about the gifts you ' d appreciate most	73.213425
the time to decide on them is now .	12.35301
as a christmas service , i ' ve taken a close look at this year ' s crop of new models .	35.84
here they are , with my comments and judgments .	13.237788
read on , take your pick -- and start dropping those hints .	182.33842
first on my own list would be two arms -- a rifle and a handgun -- that qualify as new in the strictest sense .	55.459797
for me , a changed barrel length or an improved stock doesn ' t constitute a truly new design .	32.061974
such modifications are all for the best but it takes something as different as a deerstalker or a jet to change arms-making concepts .	68.45025
bill ruger ' s long-awaited deerstalker ( under $110 ) is a new rifle action in a caliber that upsets all the modern theory of high-velocity fans	27.946795
it ' s a short , light , quick-handling , fast-firing little timber gun designed to push a heavy slug at modest velocity but with lots of killing power and ample range for our most popular big game -- whitetail .	77.39386
ruger reports that on his recent african safari the little magnum cartridge was a real work horse .	125.07084
small antelope were generally grassed with one shot , and the magnum carbine also bagged reedbuck , kob and wart hog with deadly efficiency	12.8937645
the deadliness of the magnum in a rifle comes as no surprise to me .	149.69426
at least five years ago , tom robinson of marlin made up an over/under double rifle for me in this caliber , using the now defunct model 90 action in 20-gauge size .	101.57671
after figuring out how to regulate the barrels so that they shot to the same point of impact , we fired this little 20-inch-barrel job on my home range and in marlin ' s underground test gallery .	115.14008
we quickly ran into the same trouble that plagued bill ruger in his first experiments three or four bullets would be placed well in a six-inch bull at 100 yards and then , unaccountably , one could stray far out of the group .	76.015366
ruger learned that this was because the higher velocity achieved in a long barrel was upsetting the shape of the unjacketed revolver bullet .	17.26538
the new , jacketed slug in magnum corrected this .	65.623146
but even without jacketed bullets , i had enough faith in my double to take it on an opening-day deer hunt that first year .	83.94249
within half an hour i jumped a six-point buck that hop-skipped through a rhododendron thicket , and i caught him just behind the left foreleg at 60 yards .	27.847918
he moved only about 30 feet after the 240-grain slug hit him -- and this was after the bullet had passed through a sapling .	40.186394
three more deer have fallen to this same gun , and all were one-shot kills .	55.535007
my double was made with standard-weight revolver barrels ( before cutting to revolver length ) , and although it compares well in other respects , it ' s considerably heavier than the deerstalker , which only scales about 6-1/2 pounds .	30.155828
if ever a rifle met the needs of the whitetail hunter , this is it .	20.179188
the deerstalker points with the ease , speed and precision of a fine imported double shotgun , and its trigger pull is light and sharp .	30.821445
the 240-grain bullet leaves the muzzle at 1 , 850 fps , which gives it all the smash needed at woods ranges .	22.675282
with five shots at the immediate command of the hunter ' s trigger finger , the gun and load are a deadly combination .	23.705952
the second really new development this year was a revolver handling a different sort of varmint load -- the	44.71824
at present it ' s available in one model , the fine and familiar smith & wesson magnum revolver ( about $110 ) , long a top-quality handgun among target arms .	25.605751
, 40-grain bullet is rated at a very hot 2 , 460 fps , and it ' s the flattest shooting of any revolver cartridge , with a mid-range rise of about an inch over a 100-yard range .	18.306171
this is a varmint load , pure and simple	2241.9348
it ' s much too explosive for small edible game .	11.364493
it can cut a red squirrel neatly in two or burst a crow into a flurry of feathers .	15.680548
the most intriguing aspect of the s & w magnum chambered for the new jet is that it can also fire standard	168.4503
rim-fires by means of adapter sleeves in the chambers .	8.044318
you may therefore convert the gun into a small-game and plinking arm , although the difference in the point of impact ( jet vs . rim-fire ) can be somewhat disconcerting .	37.11374
i tested it in my scoped s & w and it was good enough to allow me to hit a chuck with every shot at 100 yards if i did my part by holding the handgun steadily .	82.125916
the fact that the deerstalker and the jet were the only completely new designs this year doesn ' t mean that 1961 didn ' t see changes in models , actions and calibers .	71.50325
aside from the ruger carbine , a number of hunting rifles have been introduced for the first time .	17.934856
here are the brands ( in alphabetical order ) and the new models .	23.303991
newcomers to the american hunter are the browning group of bolt-action , high-power rifles .	14.240867
they have fine fn actions and a better-than-average finish on both the metal and the stock wood .	64.03529
barrel weights vary sensibly with the various calibers available , and these include the standard bores ( about $165 ) plus the magnums ( around $170 )	20.168406
shotgun-type rubber recoil pads are standard on all of the magnums except the	13.691844
stock designs are excellent for use with scopes .	24.149202
colt ' s center-fire 1961 rifles are all made with sako actions , regardless of caliber .	27.622671
, af and the magnums , the long action ( about $135 for the standard coltsman and $200 for the custom version ) .	55.859123
previously , fn actions were used for the larger cartridges .	23.330198
auto , the sport-king , in two grades -- field and special ( less than $45 and just over $45 , respectively ) .	116.05842
it ' s a streamlined rifle , fast and well-made .	5.174093
magnum rim-fire rifles , 1961 ' s lone newcomer was the kodiak model 260 autoloader ( around $60 ) .	16.78562
previously known as jefferson arms , kodiak has given this 11-shot hammerless job an exceptionally fine stock design , and the 260 is the first autoloader to handle	30.05739
marlin has made two contributions to the harvest of new offerings .	16.721794
the model 99 ( under $45 ) is a light-weight , streamlined	7.9844666
rim-fire auto with a tubular magazine that holds 18 long rifles .	866.35156
it ' s extremely accurate for an auto , and the test rifle i tried was completely trouble-free in functioning .	85.322754
the 989 ( about $40 ) is an even newer	624.49066
auto , this one with a seven- or 12-shot clip .	4.053555
once again the mossberg targo outfit has appeared , but this time as a bolt-action rifle-shotgun combination .	47.779446
the bore is unrifled but is provided with an insert tube which is rifled and which , surprisingly , gives pretty fair accuracy even though it ' s only 3-1/2 inches long .	76.299706
you can unscrew this tube and replace it with a smoothbore insert for use with	19.038656
shotshells -- to break the little targo clay targets .	238.9416
a trap for throwing these miniature clays fastens to the barrel so that the shooter can throw his own targets .	26.770494
a spring trap for solid mounting and a regular hand trap are also available .	94.591095
you can have your choice of a seven-shot repeater , the 340tr ( about $40 ) or a single-shot , the 320tr ( $10 less ) .	26.209747
the targo is a good outfit for fun shooting or for economic wing-shooting practice , but it ' s tougher than it looks to run up a score on the clay birds .	53.90952
they ' ll travel 50 feet or more when thrown from the spring trap but it ' s almost impossible to break one after it passes the 35-foot mark .	51.685772
the combination of thin pattern and very tiny pellets makes it necessary to get on the birds , right now ! !	73.64898
big magnum calibers appeared in the remington line for 1961 , with the addition of the and to the list of model 725 ' s .	53.97609
these are made on special order only , in kodiak grade ( about $310 ) , with integral muzzle brakes and heavy rubber recoil pads	16.36808
a shortened version of the highly regarded remington 742 autoloader also appeared in 1961 .	11.15091
this carbine ( under $140 , about $15 more for a deluxe grade ) has an 18-1/2-inch barrel and was obviously inspired by the popularity of last year ' s model 760 pump with a short-barrel .	38.82872
this design is hard to beat for timber hunting or for packing in a saddle scabbard .	38.317234
presently , the 742c is available in af .	2.2846532
the latest versions of the famous savage model 99 are the 99 featherweight ( about $125 ) and the 99 deluxe ( under $135 ) , which have a top-tang safety and improved trigger design .	15.999981
the replacement of the slide-lock side safety catch will make this lever-action favorite more appealing than ever since the new safety is easier and faster to operate .	85.686516
a fresh crop of beginners ' guns showed up in 1961 , and they ' re good bets for your christmas gift list if you ' re wondering what to get for a youngster .	38.351635
the most unusual of them is the ithaca 49 ( about $20 , $5 for a saddle scabbard ) -- a lever-action single-shot patterned after the famous winchester lever-action and featuring the western look .	21.266973
because of its traditional lines , it probably has more kid appeal than any other model .	219.49591
the action is a drop-block , handling all the standard	58.547928
marlin ' s latest is also designed for the beginning shooter , although it ' s a full-sized rifle with plenty of barrel weight and ample stock .	33.079327
this is the model 122 ( about $20 )	1.1911147
it ' s a single-shot bolt-action with an automatic safety -- i . e . , the safety goes on every time the bolt is lifted and the gun cocked for the next shot .	22.231104
stock design is excellent , and this model is a good first gun .	37.949524
single-shot remington 514c ( around $20 ) , which comes with a 21-inch barrel and a short -- 12-1/2-inch -- stock	18.230225
it ' s just right for a boy of 12-1/2 .	6.9425917
a beginner ' s shotgun has also been introduced this year .	46.6743
the single-barrel stevens 940y ( under $35 ) is made with a side lever rather than a top-tang lever because many youngsters aren ' t strong enough to operate a top tang to open a gun -- and the side lever does indeed open very easily .	85.33887
this gun has a 12-1/2-inch stock and is available in either 20 or gauge .	52.30621
there ' s another addition to the stevens line , the pump-action model 77 in ( under $75 ) , which you may or may not consider a kid ' s gun	41.09753
many experienced hunters like this gauge and type of scattergun too .	25.010563
although there were no startling developments in shotgun design this year , a number of new models and variations of existing models did hit the market .	75.261925
for example , a browning trap version of the superposed over/under , the broadway ( from $350 up , depending on grade ) , differs from standard models in that it is equipped with a full beavertail fore end , a cushion recoil pad and a barrel-wide ventilated rib for fast sighting .	20.084665
the colt line now includes a new scattergun , the standard or custom pump model ( about $90 and $150 , respectively ) in 12 , 16 and 20 .	49.58363
firearms international has introduced another import , this one from finland .	37.222874
it ' s the valmet ( about $170 ) , a 12-gauge over/under very much like the old remington 32 -- which was so fine a gun that today a used one still brings high prices .	123.78702
high standard has also added two models to its line .	96.42671
the supermatic trophy ( prices begin at less than $135 and depend on grade and optional features ) is a 12-gauge auto .	36.005238
the flite-king trophy ( beginning at just over $85 ) is a pump gun in 12 or 16 .	21.926298
either model is a very good dollar value .	3.408328
mossberg ' s latest contribution to the field is the model 500 ( from $73 . 50 )	39.810127
this is an improved version of the old model 200 , a pump-action 12-gauge shotgun .	15.854346
see page 24 for a complete report on it .	51.717762
jet -- which i coupled with the deerstalker carbine as one of the year ' s two biggest developments -- few significant innovations appeared among 1961 ' s handguns .	56.7552
livery stable -- j . vernon , prop . ' ' .	11.207675
coaching had declined considerably by 1905 , but the sign was still there , near the old wells fargo building in san francisco , creaking in the fog as it had for thirty years .	34.64172
john vernon had had all the patronage he cared for -- he had prospered , but he could not retire from horsedom .	14.881982
he had two interests in life the pleasures of the table and driving .	41.725967
twice a week he drove his tallyho over the santa cruz road , upland and through the redwood forest , with orchards below him at one hand , and glimpses of the pacific at the other .	37.907265
the journey back he made along the coast road , traveling hell-for-leather , every lantern of the tallyho ablaze .	58.750793
the southward route was the classic run in california , and the most fashionable .	28.824701
his patronage on this stretch was made up largely of san franciscans -- regulars , most of them , and trenchermen like himself .	52.879887
they did not complain at the inhuman hour of starting ( seven in the morning ) , nor of the tariff , which was reasonable since it covered everything but the tobacco .	85.47154
breakfast was at the palace hotel , luncheon was somewhere in the mountain forest , and dinner was either at boulder creek or at santa cruz .	58.414967
gazing too long at the scenery could be tiring , so halts were contrived between meals .	62.133236
then the chinese hostler , who rode with vernon on the box , would break open a hamper and produce filets of smoked bass or sturgeon , sandwiches , pickled eggs , and a rum sangaree to be heated over a spirit lamp .	16.304928
in spring and in autumn the run was made for a group of botanists which included an old friend of mine .	49.79848
they gathered roots , bulbs , odd ferns , leaves , and bits of resin from the rare santa lucia fir , which exists only on a forty-five mile strip on the westerly side of these mountains .	26.249977
in the spanish days franciscan monks roamed here to collect the resin for incense .	14.875964
it yields a fragrance as orphic as that of the pastilles of malabar .	13.639212
vernon was serviceable on the botanical field trips , but he could arrange no schedule with the cooks , and he was glad when the trips dropped off , and the botanists began to motor out by themselves .	34.814594
my friend often breakfasted with vernon on the morning of the regular tallyho run .	26.246847
this was an honor , like dining with a captain at his private table .	83.21528
vernon ' s office adjoined the stable , and the walls were adorned with brightly colored lithographs , the folk art of the period .	13.670801
they advertised harness polish , liniments , ball ' s rubber boots , green river whiskey , hood ' s sarsaparilla , patent medicines , shoe blacking , and chewing tobacco .	9.216951
the hostler would have the table ready and a pot of coffee hissing on the stove	19.262568
then a porter from manning ' s fish house would trot in with a tray on his head .	40.14198
it was draped with snowy napkins that kept hot a platter of oyster salt roast and a mound of corn fritters .	14.198776
vernon was consummately fond of oysters , and manning ' s had been famous for them since the civil war .	32.93165
oyster salt roast -- oysters on the half shell , cooked on a bed of coarse salt that kept them hot when served -- was a standby at manning ' s .	35.96324
its early morning patrons were coachmen , who fortified themselves for the day with that delicacy .	63.89185
in the 1890 ' s the palace hotel began serving an oyster dish named after its manager , john c . kirkpatrick .	38.664116
this dish much resembles the oysters rockefeller made famous by antoine ' s in new orleans , though the palace chef announced it as a variant of manning ' s roast oysters .	19.403004
( gastronomes have long argued about which came first , the palace ' s or antoine ' s .	60.926647
antoine ' s held as mandatory a splash of absinthe or pernod on the parsley or spinach which was used for the underbedding .	14.606025
) vernon , however , held out for plain oyster roast , and plenty of it , unadorned by herbs or any seasoning but salt , though he did fancy a bit of lemon .	41.272987
after the meal , he and his guests went out to inspect the rig	22.30742
this was merely a ritual , to please all hands concerned .	242.18599
the tallyho had cost vernon $2 , 300 .	11.245316
a replica of two coaches made in england for the belmont club in the east , and matchless west of the rockies , it was the despair of whips on the santa cruz run .	18.048641
one could shave in the reflection of its french-polished panels , and its axles were greased like those of roulette wheels .	27.121967
departing , they stepped solemnly with knees lifted to the jaw , for they had been trained to drag at important funerals .	36.61505
but for the start of the santa cruz run , the whip fell .	23.071733
the clients boarded the tallyho at the palace promptly at seven .	71.03655
they had been fed a hunting breakfast , so called because a kedgeree , the dish identified with fox hunting , was on the bill .	55.22941
there are many ways of making a kedgeree , every one of which is right .	58.87882
here is an original kedgeree recipe from the family club ' s kitchen	30.500214
flake ( for three ) a cupful of cold boiled haddock , mix with a cupful of cooked rice , two minced hard-boiled eggs , some buttery white sauce done with cream , cayenne , pepper , salt , a pinch of curry , a tablespoonful of minced onion fried , and a bit of anchovy .	9.7303095
the omelet named for ernest arbogast , the palace ' s chef , was even more in demand .	50.830807
for decades it was the most popular dish served in the ladies ' grill at breakfast , and it is one of the few old palace dishes that still survive .	46.14972
native california oysters , salty and piquant , as coppery as delawares and not much larger than a five-cent piece , went into it .	31.274195
fry in butter a small minced onion , rub with a tablespoonful of flour , add half a cup of cream , six beaten eggs , pepper , celery salt , a teaspoonful of minced chives , a dash of cayenne , and a pinch of nutmeg .	9.514806
a jigger of dry sherry follows , and as the mixture stiffens , in go a hundred of the little oysters .	63.28835
louis sherry once stayed a fortnight at the palace , and he was so pleased with omelet arbogast that he introduced it at his restaurant in new york j . pierpont morgan had come in his private train to san francisco , to attend an episcopal convention , and brought the restaurateur with him .	37.902027
as things happened , morgan was installed in the nob hill residence of a magnate friend , whose kitchen swarmed with cooks of approved talent .	30.28621
sherry remained in his hotel suite , where he amused himself as best he could .	70.67008
twice he left everything to his entourage , and fled to make the santa cruz tour under vernon ' s guidance .	27.436548
in the grand court of the palace , notable for its tiers of moorish galleries that looked down on the maelstrom of vehicles below , vernon ' s station was at the entrance .	33.846046
it was a post of honor , held inviolate for him	68.762566
of majestic build , rubicund and slash-mouthed , he resembled the late general winfield scott , who was said to be the most imposing general of his century , if not of all centuries .	41.570866
vernon wore a gray tall hat , a gardenia , and maroon wellington boots that glistened like currant jelly .	10.313445
promptly at seven he would clatter out of the court with twelve in the tallyho .	86.956985
he had style he held his reins in a loose bunch at the third button of his checked epsom surtout , and when the horses leaned at a curve , as if bent by the force of a gale , he leaned with them .	28.294226
they cantered down the peninsula , not slackening until the coach reached woodside where the santa cruz uplands begin .	33.983143
the road maps of the region have changed since 1905	12.692422
inns have burned down , moved elsewhere , or taken other names .	258.25967
once on the road ( and especially if the passengers were all regulars and masculine ) , the schedule meant nothing .	69.57677
an agreeable ease suffused vernon and the passengers of the tallyho , from which there issued clouds of smoke .	52.43687
vernon would tilt his hat over one ear as he lounged with his feet on the dashboard , indulging in a huge cigar .	11.773523
they were no more on parade than was their driver	172.12616
one fork of the road was as good as another .	11.561181
the santa cruz mountains sprawl over three counties , and the roads twist through sky-tapping redwoods down whose furrowed columns ripple streams of rain , even when heat bakes the santa clara valley below at the left .	35.569214
the water splashes into shoulder-high tracts of fernery .	4.5067
you arrive there in seersucker , and feel you were half-witted not to bring a mackintosh .	42.85855
vernon kept an account book with a list of all the establishments that he thought worthy of patronage .	40.942707
a number of them must have fallen into disfavor	1.5229936
they were struck out with remarks in red ink , denouncing both the cooks and the management .	40.138985
he was copious in his praise of those that served food that was good to eat .	67.68037
the horses seemed to know these by instinct , he used to say such places invariably had stables with superior feed bins .	46.54654
there was wright ' s , for one , lost amongst trees , its wide verandas strewn with rockers .	33.845062
many of its sojourners were devoted to seclusion and quiet , and lived there to the end of their days .	41.82122
it was the haunt of writer ambrose bierce , who admired its redwoods .	12.76376
acorns from the great oaks fed the small black pigs ( akin to berkshires ) , whose `` carcass sweepstakes ' ' were renowned .	11.050605
their ham butts , cured in oak-log smoke , were also esteemed when roasted or boiled , and served with this original sauce	29.0017
put into a saucepan a cupful of the baked ham gravy , or of the boiled ham liquor , with a half stick of butter , three teaspoonfuls of made mustard , and two mashed garlic cloves .	14.151978
contribute also an onion , a peeled tomato and two pickled gherkins , and a mashed lime .	7.4958067
after this has simmered an hour , add two tablespoons each of worcestershire , catsup , and chutney , two pickled walnuts , and a pint of sherry .	8.2868395
every winter a kegful of this sauce was made and placed at the end of a row of four other kegs in the cellar , so that when its turn came , it was properly mellowed .	34.858856
vineyards and orchards also grew around wright ' s , and deer were rather a nuisance	43.031315
they leaped six-foot fences with the agility of panthers .	3.016468
but no one complained when they wound up , regardless of season , in venison pies .	47.344425
no one complained of the white wine either at this altitude of two thousand feet , grapes acquire a dryness and the tang of gunflint .	20.692284
( the almaden vineyards have now climbed to this height .	20.533806
though creeks in the santa cruz mountains flow brimful the year round and it is forever spring , the apples that grow there have a wintry crackle .	62.648987
dwellers thereabouts preferred to get their apple pies at the local bakery , which had a brick oven fired with redwood billets .	15.432905
the merit of the pie , vernon believed , was due more to its making than to the waning heat of the oven .	54.558434
the recipe , which he got from the baker , and wrote down in his ledger , is basically this	61.67044
peel , core , and slice across enough apples to make a dome in the pie tin , and set aside .	19.272577
in a saucepan put sufficient water to cover them , an equal amount of sugar , a sliced lemon , a tablespoonful of apricot preserve or jam , a pinch each of clove and nutmeg , and a large bay leaf .	16.76162
let this boil gently for twenty minutes , then strain .	79.99516
poach the apples in this syrup for twelve minutes , drain them , and cool .	22.56274
set the apples in the pastry-lined tin , spread over them three tablespoonfuls of softened butter , with as much brown sugar , a sprinkling of nutmeg , and a fresh bay leaf , then lay on a cover of pastry , and gild it with beaten yolk of egg .	20.557627
those who have never traveled the width and length of this land cannot conceive , on the basis of textbook description alone , the overwhelming space and variety of this country held together under one government .	71.22809
the miracle of democratic america comes home to one most strongly only when one has seen the endless great plains of the midwest	104.0219
the smoke-filled , art-filled , drama-filled life of the great cities of the east	45.923832
the lush and historic charm of the south .	3.637377
now , to add to the already unbelievable extremes found in one nation , we have the two new states of hawaii and alaska .	53.904892
to hope to cover just one region of this land and to enjoy all of its sights and events and , of course , to bring back pictures of your experiences , requires advance planning .	103.580734
for this reason , u . s . camera has prepared this special u . s . a . vacation feature .	41.77881
we divided the country into five regions plus hawaii and alaska and in each is included a general description of the area plus specific recommendations of places and events to cover .	112.58276
use this section to plan now to make the most of your vacation in photogenic america .	46.488956
birthplace of the nation , the northeast offers historic battlefields	17.861795
lovely old villages and a rugged seashore among its many worthwhile sights .	36.76953
the rolling farms of maryland , the peerless metropolis of new york city , the verdant mountains of vermont can all be included in your northeast vacation .	28.816534
by automobile from new york , for example , you can take a one or two-day tour to annapolis , maryland to see the colonial homes and the u . s . naval academy ( where you can shoot the dress parade on wednesdays )	42.896225
to washington , d . c . , for an eye-filling tour of the city	28.10581
or to lancaster , pa . , the center of the pennsylvania dutch country	72.6284
philadelphia with its historic buildings and nearby valley forge	1.8412111
to west point , n . y . , the famous military academy in a beautiful setting on the hudson river .	58.54293
new england deserves as much of your vacation time as you can afford with such areas as cape cod providing wonderful beaches , artists ' colonies and quaint townships .	30.332096
from here you can easily include a side trip to the old whaling port of nantucket , massachusetts , which looks just as it must have two centuries ago .	44.168076
at sturbridge village , massachusetts , you ' ll find a completely-restored new england town .	28.255499
north to acadia national park , maine , with views of a rockbound coast and dark , magnificent forests .	82.90849
one of the most exciting ways to end a northeast vacation would be with a week in new york city .	52.730396
return through new england , stopping for a visit to lake champlain where you can take a boat ride and go to ethan allen park .	22.562025
there you ' ll witness a view which includes the adirondack mts . and the winooski river .	9.4897585
now you ' re ready for a whirlwind sightseeing tour of america ' s most exciting city .	12.414085
the skyline , the bridges , broadway , and the staten island ferry are only a few of the spots to put on your `` must ' ' list for new york city .	33.790672
some tips for shooting in northeastern locales in new york city don ' t miss coverage of the united nations .	20.515652
these striking , modernistic buildings on the east river are open to the public and every weekday guided tours are available .	23.304926
pictures can be taken in the public areas and when on tours .	118.27327
however , the use of tripods is not allowed .	82.22051
photos of conference rooms and the general assembly hall can be made when these rooms are not being used for meetings .	80.81583
flash is allowed , subject to above restrictions .	3.290086
around new england , you ' ll no doubt want a color shot of one of the picturesque lighthouses .	66.06153
be careful here not to overexpose this subject since they are extremely bright and light-reflecting .	24.213778
in color , 1/50th of a second between af and af will do for bright , frontal sunlight .	31.069721
the southern united states , extending from florida in the east to texas in the west , still maintains its unique flavor of gracious living and historical elegance .	35.194042
it encompasses in its expanse areas where the natural beauty encourages a vacation of quiet contemplation , on the one hand , to places where entertainment and spectacles of all sorts have been provided for the tourist with camera .	34.080776
of special interest this anniversary year of the war between the states are the many civil war battlefields where , likely as not , you ' ll catch some memorial re-enactments .	75.42719
among the locales to visit are shiloh , tennessee	30.071177
petersburg , virginia , and fredericksburg , virginia .	14.165096
florida provides tropical scenes unequalled in the united states .	1.7311974
at cypress gardens special bleachers are set up for photographers at water-ski shows and lovely models pose for pictures in garden settings .	41.19264
silver springs features glass-bottom boat rides and in everglades national park there are opportunities to photograph rare wildlife .	34.29218
miami beach and surroundings feature fabulous `` hotel row ' ' , palm-studded beaches plus the miami seaquarium and parrot jungle .	13.333522
one of the most delightful spots in a southern tour is the city of new orleans .	40.69534
the famous old french and spanish buildings with their elaborate wrought iron balconies and the narrow streets of the latin quarter present an old world scene .	72.09561
for restoration of early american life the places to visit are williamsburg , jamestown and yorktown , virginia .	12.053403
another virginia sight and a photographic adventure are the luray caverns , lit by photofloodlights .	4.8059735
the great state of texas offers metropolitan attractions such as the dallas fair park with its art and natural history museums .	76.141975
in contrast are the vast open stretches of ranch country and oil wells .	76.68148
in san antonio visit the famous alamo and photograph 18th century spanish buildings and churches .	28.451178
the great smoky mountains is another area of the south well worth a visit .	67.38552
along the 127-mile route through great smoky mountains national park you can photograph the breath-taking peaks , gorges and valleys which come into view at every turn .	23.742027
gatlinburg , tennessee , is the center of this area .	42.582165
another scenic spot in tennessee is chattanooga where the rock city gardens are not to be missed .	45.56418
beautiful homes and gardens are trademarks of the south and cities particularly noted for them are charleston , s . c . , natchez , miss . , and savannah , ga . .	33.66977
at charlottesville , va . , shoot monticello and the beautiful buildings of the university .	21.75313
foliage is the outstanding photo subject in many of the southern locales mentioned above and some specific tips on how and where to shoot it are in order .	72.81031
for example , the chamber of commerce of gatlinburg , tennessee , sponsors special camera tours into the great smoky mountains to get pictures of the profusion of wild flowers flourishing in these wooded regions .	18.81147
exposure problems may occur in these forest areas where uneven lighting results from shafts of sunlight filtering through the overhead branches .	31.15434
best solution is to find an area that is predominantly sunlight or shade .	21.054817
in any instance , you should determine the exposure according to the type of light which falls on most of the subject area .	85.97657
try some closeups on southern blossoms to provide a welcome contrast with the many long-view scenics you ' ll be making .	60.083
for shooting the interiors of the famous ante-bellum southern mansions make sure your equipment includes a tripod .	133.44675
enough daylight is usually available from the windows , but if you have synchronized flash -- use it .	40.5505
for some unusual photographic subjects , if your vacation takes you nearby , try these events the 600-mile auto race in charlotte , n . c . , , on may 27	34.183586
the florida folk festival , white springs , may 5-7	25.869604
singing on the mountain in linville , north carolina , on june 25 .	9.325971
peak action photography is your goal at miami ' s seaquarium and the cypress gardens waterskiing events .	9.351439
a pleasant start to your midwestern vacation is a few days spent in cosmopolitan chicago .	36.57039
lake michigan offers swimming and pictures which combine cityscapes with beaches .	4.818886
a visit to chicago ' s museums and a stroll around broad michigan avenue will unfold many photogenic subjects to the alert photographer .	80.43725
wisconsin dells , where fantastically scenic rocks carved by the wisconsin river are overgrown with fern and other foliage , rates a stopover when traveling from chicago .	30.450333
the farmlands forming the heart of america stretch out across the midwest from chicago .	21.116085
in north dakota the strangely beautiful badlands will challenge you to translate its wonder on to film .	165.6605
while here , visit theodore roosevelt national park for its spectacular scenery .	20.798222
another spot with an image-provoking name is the black hills where you can visit the old frontier mining town of deadwood .	60.504677
the black hills passion play is produced every summer and is a pageant worth seeing and shooting .	41.928276
of course , while in this vicinity you won ' t want to miss a visit to mount rushmore national memorial where on the side of a mountain are the famous sculptures of presidents washington , lincoln , jefferson and theodore roosevelt .	32.752346
in missouri ( which we are including in our general midwest region ) you can glance into mark twain ' s birthplace at hannibal , see the landmarks of his life and writings and visualize where huck finn hatched his boyish mischief .	31.194529
similarly in illinois there is lincoln country to be seen -- his tomb and other landmarks .	28.846785
minnesota , fabled land of waters , is in itself , ideal vacationland , having within its borders 10 , 000 lakes ! !	78.45094
itasca state park , where the mississippi river begins , is one of the outstanding tourist spots in minnesota .	16.722885
mementoes of the old west recall the days of wyatt earp in dodge city , nebraska , where present-day cowboys add a colorful human interest note to your vacation shooting .	53.734734
of current interest is abilene , kansas , the birthplace of ex-president eisenhower .	20.328604
there ' s a museum here and also old abilene town , a reconstruction of the cattle boomtown of the 70 ' s and 80 ' s .	50.882603
for a resort area , mackinack island , michigan , is the place to visit .	24.2443
it truly relives another age for the inhabitants use carriages rather than autos and old british and french forts are left intact for tourists to visit and record .	47.085785
night scenes will add an exciting touch to your vacation travelogue and what better place to take them then along chicago ' s lake shore drive ? ?	85.20887
just after sunset is a good time to record the city lights in color since you get a `` fill-in ' ' light from the sky .	65.79196
another memo for sightseers bring your camera along to museums .	17.410585
photos of historic dioramas of the area you visit will add depth and background to your vacation photo story .	78.29238
again , be sure your tripod is handy for those sometimes-necessary time exposures .	53.84084
special events and their dates which will make interesting shooting in the midwest area , include the following	171.40883
a re-enactment of the battle of lexington , may 18th at lexington , missouri	24.535217
the world-renowned 500-mile auto race at indianapolis , indiana , plus a festival from may 27-30	75.83435
`` song of hiawatha ' ' , in elgin , illinois , from june 20 to 24th .	12.642961
michigan offers the lovely tulip festival in holland , michigan , may 12-14	17.80742
and the international freedom festival in detroit , june 29 thru july 4 .	29.416725
for early vacationers there ' s the fun-filled fishing derby in hot springs , arkansas , april 19-23 , and the arkansas band festival in hot springs , april 20-22 .	20.4252
a western vacation is practically synonymous with a visit to at least one of the magnificent national parks in this area .	20.765045
a tour of several of them is possible in a two-week vacation while a stay at just one of these natural beauty spots can be of equal reward .	61.37403
in california is located one of the most popular of the national parks -- yosemite .	18.5239
among its most spectacular features are its falls , the highest being upper yosemite which drops 2 , 425 feet .	59.093735
the sequoia grove presents another unique aspect of yosemite , for these ancient giant trees are a sight never to be forgotten .	67.19781
in the utah area are zion national park and bryce canyon national park .	15.405403
fantastic colors are to be seen in the fanciful formations of eroded rock which loom out of the semiarid country in both parks .	22.3432
colorado ' s grand canyon , probably the most famous landmark of the united states , can be the highpoint of your western vacation .	17.996273
built upon seven hills , istanbul , like rome , is one of the most ancient cities in the world , filled with splendor and contrast .	25.551226
it is an exotic place , so different from the ordinary that the casual tourist is likely to see at first only the contrast and the ugliness of narrow streets lined with haphazard houses .	44.15123
at the moment , many of these are being pulled down .	95.45298
whole blocks are disappearing and more are scheduled to vanish to make room for wide boulevards that will show off its treasures to better advantage -- the great domes and graceful spires of its mosques , the panorama of the bosphorus and the golden horn .	29.943714
even when they are finished , however , the contrast will remain , for istanbul is the only city in the world that is built upon two continents .	84.614136
for almost 3 , 000 years europe and asia have rubbed shoulders in its streets .	45.961197
founded in the ninth century b . c . it was called byzantium 200 years later when byzas , ruler of the megarians , expanded the settlement and named it after himself .	36.90306
about a thousand years after that , when the roman empire was divided , it became capital of the eastern section .	53.65027
on may 11 , 330 , a . d . , , its name was changed again , this time to constantinople after its emperor , constantine .	52.212852
in 1453 when the last vestige of ancient roman power fell to the turks , the city officially shifted religions -- although the patriarch , or pope , of the orthodox church continued to live there , and still does -- and became the capital of the ottoman empire .	44.677708
when that was broken up after the first world war , its name was changed once more .	63.754322
rich in christian and moslem art , istanbul is today a fascinating museum of east and west that recently became a seaside resort as well with the development of new beaches on the bosphorus and the sea of marmara only a short distance from the center of town .	36.571907
easy to get to , and becoming more popular every year , it is only fourteen hours from new york by pan american world airways jet , four hours from rome .	70.5838
most of the sights lie in the old section across the golden horn from the modern hotels .	73.163414
i started my tour of them at the turkish government tourist office , next to pan american ' s office on the left as you enter the driveway that leads to the hilton hotel .	77.603905
from there i turned left along cumhuriyet cadesi past more hotels and a park on the left , republic gardens , and came in a few moments to taksim square , one of the hubs of the city , with the monument of the republic , erected in 1928 , in its center .	37.779804
directly across from the gardens i found a bus stop sign for t 4 and rode it down to the bosphorus , with the sports center on my left just before i reached the water and the entrance to dolmabahce palace immediately after that .	60.60346
there the bus turned right along the bosphorus , past ocean liners at anchor , to galata bridge over the entrance to the golden horn , a brown sweep of water that empties into the bosphorus .	21.900469
across the bridge on the left i saw st . sophia with its sturdy brown minarets and to the right of them the slenderer spires of the blue mosque .	20.602322
on the other side of the golden horn i rode through eminonu square , with yeni cami , or the new mosque , which dates from the seventeenth century , just across from the entrance to the bridge .	18.731735
passing it , the bus climbed a hill , with the covered spice bazaar on the right and pandelli ' s , a famous and excellent restaurant , above it .	37.42791
at the top of the hill the buildings on the left gave way to a park .	68.001526
i got off there , crossed the street , walked ahead with st . sophia on my left , the blue mosque on my right , and in a moment came to the entrance of st . sophia .	22.660543
erected on the site of pagan temples and three previous st . sophias , the first of which was begun by constantine , this fourth church was started by justinian in 532 and completed twenty years later .	33.987083
on his first trip to the finished structure he boasted that he had built a temple grander than solomon ' s in jerusalem .	15.038768
a few years later the dome fell in .	533.9387
nevertheless , it remained one of the most splendid churches of the eastern empire , where the byzantine emperors were crowned .	17.048727
after the turks conquered the city in 1453 they converted it to a mosque , adding the stubby minarets .	18.10522
in the second half of the sixteenth century , sinan , the great architect who is the michelangelo of the east , designed the massive buttresses that now help support the dome .	33.56675
with the birth of the turkish republic after the first world war , st . sophia became a museum , and the ancient mosaics , which were plastered over by the moslems , whose religion forbids pictures in holy places , have been restored .	33.118916
inside over the first door i saw one of these , which shows constantine offering the city to the virgin mary and justinian offering the temple .	36.395355
on the columns around the immense dome are round plaques with arabic writing .	60.031452
the eight green columns , i learned , came from the temple of artemis at ephesus , the others , red , from the temple of the sun at heliopolis .	25.562824
beneath the dome i saw the spot where the byzantine emperors were crowned , a bit of floor protected now by a wooden fence .	31.20722
behind this is a minber or moslem pulpit and near it a raised platform with golden grillwork , where the emperors and , after them , the sultans , sat .	44.40179
directly opposite is the emperor ' s door , through which they entered the building .	46.275345
outside st . sophia i walked through the flower garden in front of it , with the blue mosque ahead on my left .	36.81478
across the street on my right i saw the hippodrome , now a park .	25.171707
it was laid out in 196 for chariot races and other public games .	70.58676
statues and other monuments that stood there were stolen , mostly by the waves of crusaders .	19.290161
at the beginning of the hippodrome i saw the kaiser ' s fountain , an ugly octagonal building with a glass dome , built in 1895 by the german emperor , and on my left , directly across from it , the tomb of sultan ahmet , who constructed the blue mosque , more properly known by his name .	31.210674
just before coming to the mosque entrance i crossed the street , entered the hippodrome , and walked ahead to the obelisk of theodosius , originally erected in heliopolis in egypt about 1 , 600 b . c . by thutmose , who also built those now in new york , london and rome at the lateran .	19.430117
this one was set up here in 390 a . d . on a pedestal , the faces of which are carved with statues of the emperor and his family watching games in the hippodrome , done so realistically that the obelisk itself is included in them .	30.876062
beyond it i noted a small green column , about twelve feet below the present ground level -- the serpentine column , three entwined serpents , which once stood at the temple of apollo at delphi , greece .	18.14311
near the end of the hippodrome i came upon the built column , a truncated obelisk of blocks , all that remains of a monument that once rivalled the colossus of rhodes .	51.101986
retracing my steps to the mosque of sultan ahmet , only one with six minarets , i entered the courtyard , with a gallery supported by pointed arches running around it and a fountain in the middle .	31.62587
one of the most beautiful buildings in istanbul , it was constructed in the early years of the seventeenth century , with a huge central dome , two half domes that seem to cascade down from it , and smaller full domes around the gallery .	28.74983
the round minarets , tall and graceful , rise from rectangular bases and have three platforms from which the muezzin can chant his call to prayer .	55.006355
inside , the walls are covered with blue and white tile , the floor with red and cream carpets .	18.832523
back at the kaiser ' s fountain , i walked left to the streetcar stop and rode up the hill -- any car will do -- past the column of constantine , also known as the burnt column , at the top on my right .	58.281
it stands in the middle of what was once the forum of constantine , who brought it from rome .	36.525227
i stayed on the car for a few minutes until , turning right , it entered a huge square , bayezit , with the bayezit mosque on the right and the gate to the university just beyond it .	52.89023
there i got off , crossed the square , and on the side directly opposite the gate found a good restaurant , hard to come by in this part of the city .	52.49928
called the marmara gazinosu , it is on the third floor , with signs pointing the way there , and has a terrace overlooking the sea of marmara .	30.613834
after lunch , in the arcade on my left just before reaching the street i found a pastry shop that sells some of the best baklava -- a sweet , flaky cake -- in istanbul .	33.98893
it ' s a great favorite of the university students , and i joined them there for dessert .	112.07804
taking the streetcar back to kaiser ' s fountain , i walked ahead , then left down the street opposite st . sophia and just beyond the corner came to a small , one-story building with a red-tile roof , which is the entrance to the sunken palace .	29.107199
actually an underground cistern , its roof supported by rows and rows of pillars , it was built by justinian in the sixth century to supply the palace with water .	33.853416
i found it fairly depressing and emerged almost immediately .	44.849598
outside i walked past the entrance to st . sophia , turned left at the end of it , and continued toward a gate in the wall ahead .	36.31035
just before reaching it i came to a grey and brown stone building that looks somewhat like an oriental pagoda , with arabic lettering in gold and colored tile decorations -- the fountain of sultan ahmet .	25.461514
going through the imperial gate in the wall , i entered the grounds of topkapi palace , home of the sultans and nerve center of the vast ottoman empire , and walked along a road toward another gate in the distance , past the church of st . irene , completed by constantine in 330 a . d . on my left , and then , just outside the second gate , i saw a spring with a tap in the wall on my right -- the executioner ' s spring , where he washed his hands and his sword after beheading his victims .	29.657484
passing through the gate , with towers on either side once used as prisons , i entered a huge square surrounded by buildings , and on the wall to my right found a general plan of the grounds , with explanations in english for each building .	96.94427
at one time about 10 , 000 people lived there .	471.33383
following arrowed signs , i veered right toward the former kitchens , complete with chimneys , which now house one of the world ' s greatest collections of chinese porcelain and a fabulous array of silver dinner services .	37.34247
next to it is a copper section , with cooking utensils and a figure of the chief cook in an elaborate , floor-length robe .	40.618877
in the court once more , i went right toward the reception house , a long one-story building with a deep portico .	43.0538
going through a door into another small court , i had the throne room directly in front .	27.778708
i walked to the right around it to buildings containing illuminated manuscripts and came to the treasury , which houses such things as coffee cups covered with diamonds , jewelled swords , rifles glittering with diamonds and huge divan-like thrones as large as small beds , on which the sultans sat cross-legged .	49.68756
they are made of gold and covered with emeralds , pearls and other jewels .	6.9424543
taking the path behind the throne room to the building directly beyond it , the portrait gallery , i went right at the end of it , through a garden to a small building at the back -- a sitting room furnished with low blue divans , its floor covered with carpets , its ceiling painted with gold squares and floral designs .	40.554657
( do start fires one or two hours ahead of time to obtain a lasting bed of glowing coals .	25.832365
keep ashes from one barbecue to the next to sprinkle over coals if they are too hot , and to stop flames that arise from melting grease .	58.052563
do line barbecue fire bowl with heavy foil to reflect heat .	70.98329
don ' t forget to buy a plastic pastry brush for basting with sauces .	11.805536
clean it meticulously in boiling water and detergent , rinse thoroughly .	6.089718
do build a wall of glowing coals six to eight inches in front of meat that is barbecued on an electric spit .	41.36023
make use of the back of the barbecue or of the hood for heating vegetables , sauces and such .	56.866863
don ' t fail to shorten cooking time by the use of aluminum foil cut slightly larger than the surface of steaks and chops .	16.97209
sear on both sides then cover meat loosely with heat reflecting foil for juiciest results .	30.678484
do avoid puncturing or cutting into meats to test them .	39.229343
if doubtful about a steak , boldly cut it in half .	28.261528
if necessary to replace both halves on grill , sear cuts and allot extra time .	9.842012
for roasts , insert meat thermometer diagonally so it does not rest on bone .	44.925694
also make sure thermometer does not touch the revolving spit or hit the coals .	73.05176
don ' t practice a new recipe on guests .	64.469795
have a test-run on the family first , to be sure timing and seasoning are right .	47.424057
do buy meat the day or the day before you intend to cook it .	34.659607
keep it no longer than 36 hours before cooking , and keep it in the coldest ( but non-freezing ) compartment of the refrigerator .	13.909123
don ' t plan meals that are too complicated .	20.374645
limit yourself to good meat and drink , with bread , salad , corn or potatoes as accessories .	18.314545
do whatever kitchen work , such as fixing a salad , preparing garlic bread , or making a marinade sauce , ahead of time .	33.707703
when you start the outdoor performance , you can stay outdoors without a dozen running trips into the kitchen .	24.954807
( this goes for getting a drink tray ready , and for having a big cooler full of ice on hand long before the party begins .	129.61082
don ' t think you have to start with the most expensive equipment in the world .	32.405804
the simplest grill ( pan type ) or inexpensive hibachi can make you a chef .	17.581516
do keep the grill high enough above the fire so that when fat from meat drips down and flares up , flames cannot reach the meat .	112.36217
don ' t forget to have a supply of melamine plates , bowls , cups , saucers , and platters for outdoor use .	5.336281
made of the world ' s toughest unbreakable plastic , melamine dinnerware comes in almost 400 different patterns and dozens of colors .	47.737156
there is even one set that has `` barbecue ' ' written on it .	37.379005
it ' s cheaper to buy wall-tex and cover your outdoor table .	88.86338
or buy half a dozen lengths of oilcloth and change patterns for different kinds of barbecues .	53.63426
oilcloth only costs about 79-cents a yard for the very best .	30.998075
don ' t forget -- when you take to the hills or the beach -- that your cooler , which you might have used for wine- or beer-cooling on your terrace or back yard , is indispensable for carrying liquid refreshments .	47.95285
there are many varieties of coolers and they serve many purposes .	54.336884
with them , you can carry steaks and hamburgers at refrigerator temperatures , and also get your frozen food for stews and chowders , to the marina or picnic , in a-1 condition .	32.41063
except when you prepare `` do it yourself ' ' shish kebob or a lobster roast .	12.408493
then you ' ll want terry cloth towels for mopping up .	13.100194
don ' t think barbecue cooking is just sometimes , or seasonal .	61.582134
in the winter , hibachi in the kitchen or grill over the logs of the fireplace .	9.933468
even use your portable electric or gas grill in the winter , inside .	118.356834
summertime supper , outside , is a natural .	228.7995
you ' ll find , once your technique is perfected , that you can cook on a boat with a simple bernz-o-matic .	22.919586
get copper or earthenware mugs that keep beer chilled or soup hot .	10.550389
be sure to get a few more than you need .	61.60454
you will discover you keep the sauce for basting meat in one , use six for drinks , serve soup or coffee in another half-dozen -- and need one more to mix the salad dressing .	64.07512
don ' t forget the joys of a meal on the road .	26.766026
if you travel over the vast u . s . a . you will , no doubt , discover that feeding is an expensive business .	53.532757
decide in the beginning to put your barbecue equipment to work .	32.42108
a picnic bag , a grill , a cooler for soft drinks and beer , and for frozen convenience foods .	17.553497
eat in a restaurant or motel mornings and evenings	1.5297986
turn off at any one of the marked picnic areas ( gasoline companies have touring service bureaus that issue booklets on national parks to tell you where you have barbecue facilities ) and -- with soft drinks cooled from morning loading up , hamburger , buns , an array of relishes , and fresh fruit -- your lunch is 75% cheaper than at a restaurant , and 100% more fun .	54.827473
you need a little stove , a coffee pot and a stew pot	11.692378
maybe a skillet , a basket of essentials like salt , pepper , plates , forks , knives and a can opener .	29.205973
as you pull out of your motel or national park home-for-the-night , visit a market and buy just what you need for the next meal .	66.405716
for 25-cents load up the cooler with ice and keep cool pop in the car .	33.009903
spice is a fact of life in the u . s . a . .	8.861434
you only have to think of franks and sausages to know what i mean .	50.963036

threaded on a skewer with new boiled potatoes , a bit of green pepper , a fresh white mushroom -- any one of these spiced meats makes a man a cook , and a meal a feast .	31.578861
sure , for the most of us , a frankfurter is the favorite .	131.1781
a story goes that a certain herr feuchtwanger of st . louis , around 1883 served his sausages ( grilled ) and mustard to his fancy customers .	53.279167
so that his customers should not soil their hands , feuchtwanger issued white gloves .	79.13832
discovery that the gloves frequently left with the customers made the wise peddler of spiced sausage-meat come upon a compromise .	111.739395
he had a bakery make buns sized to fit his franks .	19.521648
years later , franks-in-buns were accepted as the `` first to go ' ' at the new york polo grounds .	24.237118
the nation ' s number one picnic treat is the skinless frankfurter -- toasted over a bonfire on the beach or , more sedately , charcoal broiled on a portable grill .	17.075706
either way it ' s hard to beat in flavor as well as ease of preparation .	53.96624
to make the picnic frank come close to perfection , remember these tips	365.40027
-- score each frankfurter in four or five places about a third of the way through .	89.589
this permits the juices to permeate the meat during cooking .	31.311491
-- relishes are as vital to the success of the frank as are buns .	124.2657
bring along the conventional ones -- catsup , pickle relish , mustard , mayonnaise -- plus a few extras , such as tangy barbecue sauce , chive cream cheese , or horse-radish for the brave ones in the crowd .	14.363908
-- using a portable grill permits you to toast the buns , too .	17.444082
watch closely while browning them , as it doesn ' t take long .	10.888654
-- an unusual flavor can be achieved by marinating the franks in french dressing or a mixture of honey , lemon juice and brown sugar prior to the picnic .	14.5714655
contrary to popular opinion , `` a la mode ' ' doesn ' t mean `` with ice cream ' ' -- it just means , in the latest style .	36.08148

directions are written for those who have had previous experience in making pottery .	282.6829
instructions for preparing clay , drying , glazing and firing are not given .	51.316235
ceramic modeling clay red , white or buff .	32.023476
glazes , one-stroke ceramic colors , stains , cones as indicated in the individual instructions .	17.125315
use well-wedged clay , free of air bubbles and pliable enough to bend without cracking .	20.229668
they must be free of oil , wax and dust .	36.088146
the size of wooden mold will determine the amount of clay needed .	29.388195
roll clay to thickness indicated in individual instructions .	4.410293
whenever possible , use the wooden mold as a pattern for cutting clay .	11.50681
when mold has more than one design cavity , make individual paper patterns .	439.26736
place mold or paper pattern on rolled clay and cut clay by holding knife in vertical position ( cut more pieces than required for project to make allowance for defects	51.44059
experiment with defects for decoration techniques of glazes and colors ) .	42.90733
place the cut clay piece loosely over the carved cavity design side of wooden mold .	92.56029
to obtain clear impression of mold , press clay gently but firmly into mold cavity , starting at center and working to outer edges .	61.475693
check thickness of clay and build up thin areas by moistening surface with a little water and adding small pieces of clay .	37.885494
be sure to press the additional clay firmly into place without locking in air bubbles .	49.497833
allow project to stand for about five minutes ( if wooden press mold is a good antique , do not leave clay in too long as the dampness may cause mold to crack ) .	82.33189
to release clay from mold , place hands in a cupped position around project	128.402
gently lift the edge on far side , then continue to release edge completely around mold .	118.151405
slight tapping on the underside of mold will help release the clay , but too much agitation will cause the clay to become soft and will interfere with removal of clay from mold .	52.818184
place a piece of plaster wall board or plaster bat on clay and reverse bat , clay and mold in one action .	23.123085
this will prevent the clay from twisting or bending , causing warping when fired .	35.457287
place project on table and carefully lift the mold off .	48.019997
study surface of clay for defects or desired corrections .	4.090079
if clay is slightly out of shape , square straight sides with guide sticks or rulers pressed against opposite sides , or smooth round pieces with damp fingers .	62.32281
if the background of design is too smooth , or you wish to create a wood-grained effect , it may be added at this time with a dull tool such as the handle of a fine paintbrush .	38.518642
make slight , smooth grooves rather than cuts for the texture ( cuts could cause air pockets under the glaze creating pinholes or craters in the glaze during firing ) .	83.577484
leave the clay on plaster board to dry slowly , covered lightly with a loose piece of plastic or cloth to prevent warping .	20.802864
( opposite page , right top ) stoneware clay was used .	15.148087
clay was rolled to 1/4 ' ' ' ' thickness .	2.603325
back of clay scored or roughened for proper gripping surface .	5.5536637

decorated on unfired glaze with one coat of one-stroke ceramic colors	4.63665

hotei is 23 feet long with an 8-1/2-foot beam and every inch a family boat .	105.711395
menfolk can ride in the forward cockpit where the helmsman has a clear view .	14.308502
youngsters can sleep or amuse themselves safely in the large cabin which has 5-foot 11-inch headroom , bunks for three , galley and marine toilet .	14.176559
the gals can sun themselves in the roomy aft cockpit .	5.157286
all are well distributed , not crowded together near the stern .	57.62412

the 80-hp motor drives her at 25 mph with six aboard ! !	89.39799
with only two aboard , hotei does better than 27 mph -- and she gives a comfortable ride at this speed even in a three-foot chop .	48.078262
she also banks into a turn like a fine runabout -- not digging in on the outside to throw passengers all over the boat like many a small cabin cruiser .	68.313034
we ' ve been out in five-foot waves and stayed dry .	101.21511
a lot of thought went into storage space construction .	53.082207
there ' s a large compartment in the forward cockpit for charts and other items .	44.48131
the cabin has several shelves for small items and storage under the bunks for water skiis , life jackets , etc . .	31.63018
the aft cockpit has a af storage bin over six feet long that doubles as a seat .	41.19802
on each side of the motor well there ' s storage for battery , bumpers , line and spare props with six-gallon gas tanks below .	63.19984
the well itself is designed to take two merc 800 ' s or 500 ' s if you wish and there ' s room for a 25-gallon long-cruise gas tank below it .	57.77892
needless to say , you can ' t build hotei in a couple of weeks .	38.713837
our building time was slightly over 400 hours -- but the total cost for the hull with fiberglas bottom , sink , head and hardware was under $800 .	30.399843
a comparable manufactured boat would cost close to $3 , 000 .	12.024039
consider what you have to earn to be able to spend the $3 , 000 and your building time is well worth it .	42.54894
a gator trailer , model 565 , is used to transport the boat to the waterways .	16.46288
this piece of equipment costs a little over $600 but it will save you that in mooring and hauling fees in a few years .	20.048813
all framing in hotei is one-inch mahogany which , in the dressed state you buy it , is about the 13/16-inch thickness specified in the drawings .	55.307865
therefore , the lumber is bought in planks and ripped to size for battens , etc . , on a table saw .	61.474785
besides flathead bronze screws , silicon bronze stronghold nails ( made by independent nail & packing co . , bridgewater , mass . ) are used extensively in assembly and weldwood resorcinol glue is used in all the joints .	25.41736
construction follows a thorough study of the drawings .	2.3196893
start by laying out the six frames and the transom on a level floor .	31.348856
draw each outline in a different-color chalk , one on top of the other .	53.813824
in this way you will be able to detect any obvious mistakes .	54.515915
the transom frame is made first with the joints lapped , glued and fastened with one-inch , no . 12 stronghold nails .	18.369116
after notching it for the keelson , chines and battens , the half-inch plywood transom is secured to it with glue and the same type nails .	25.702028
all frames are butted at the joints and 3/8-inch plywood gussets are glued and nailed on each side of each joint , again using the one-inch , no . 12 nails .	26.80252
the frames are notched only for the keelson and the chines .	3.56019
if notched for the battens , they would require more work , be weakened and limber holes would have to be bored so that bilge water could flow through .	69.65222
nowhere in the boat do the frames come in contact with the plywood planking .	16.950281
the jig is erected after the frames and transom are complete .	33.954685
this is an important step because any misalignment would cause progressively worse misalignment in the hull as you advance in construction .	42.30653
be sure all members are parallel , vertical and level as required .	93.16249
after the frames and transom are set up on the jig and temporarily braced , a piece of three-inch-wide mahogany ( only widths will be given since the 13/16-inch thickness is used throughout ) is butted between frames one and two below the line of the keelson .	24.532953
the frames are glued and screwed to this piece .	3.62855
the joints are also reinforced on each side with small blocks set in resin-saturated fiberglas cloth and nailed .	22.368145
it is over this piece that the laminated stem and keelson are spliced .	15.590743
the keelson , made of two three-inch widths , is next installed .	162.57838
the first piece is glued and screwed to the frames and transom and the piece butted between frames one and two .	15.103885
the second piece is in turn glued and screwed to the first .	13.103965
note , however , that it is six inches shorter at the forward end .	49.26128
one-inch , no . 10 screws are used in both cases .	17.946129
a stem jig is next cut to the proper shape and temporarily fastened to frame one .	80.13604
take two three-inch-wide pieces and rip them down the center of the thickness to make the four .	68.08381
then spread a generous amount of glue on the four pieces and bend them into place on the jig .	44.095257
the first two pieces butt against the inner member of the keelson and are glued and screwed to the brace between the first two frames .	14.995692
the second two pieces lap over the inner member of the keelson and butt against the outer member .	42.756115
they ' re glued and screwed to the inner member of the keelson .	7.600108
a number of c clamps hold the pieces together on the jig until the glue sets .	44.36586
the battens are carefully fastened in place after some necessary fairing on all frames .	73.88905
glue and 1-1/2-inch , no . 10 screws are used .	14.223755
placement is important because the rear seat , bunks and front jump seats rest on or are fastened to many of the side battens .	110.661835
with the exception of two battens , all run to the stem where they are glued and screwed after careful beveling .	33.87044
the chines go in the same way except that they are made of two pieces of two-inch wood for strength and easier bending .	39.45982
fairing is always a tedious job but the work can be cut down considerably with a skill planer and a simple jig .	54.910072
i clamped a 30-inch piece of aluminum to the base of the planer with a pair of sure grips .	25.528841
the aluminum , flush against the battens , acted as a fairing stick and enabled me to plane the chines and keelson to the proper bevels easily .	47.363426
if you don ' t own a planer and don ' t want to buy one , it ' s well worth renting .	24.749672
the planking is five-ply , 3/8-inch-thick weldwood royal marine plywood .	3.4244566
this can be obtained in 42-inch widths 24 feet long .	11.499392
plank the sides first , using glue and one-inch , no . 12 stronghold nails at all battens , the stem and the transom .	26.0695
another person inside with a weight against each batten will help in the fastening .	14.15426
the best procedure is to have a few friends hold the planking in place while you mark it off .	199.0617
i used a homemaster routo-jig made by porter cable for this job .	26.838964
it ' s good for cutting all the planking because it cuts with a bit-like blade at high rpm and does not chatter the plywood like a saber saw .	28.535933
when cut , the planking is clamped in place for a final and careful trimming .	46.069016
then it is marked on the inside where it comes in contact with the transom , frames , keelson and all the battens .	38.57576
it may then be pre-drilled for the fastenings .	3.8250778
the next step is to remove it and spread glue where it has been marked at the contact points .	69.034164
the bottom planking is applied in the same manner .	6.655253
after planking , the bottom gets a layer of fiberglas .	4.786182
the spray rails are first glued on the outside and fastened from the inside with screws .	24.529577
then the chines are rounded off and the bottom is rough-sanded in preparation .	25.595232
since the sides are also covered up to the spray rails , they are also rough-sanded in that area .	14.382265
the cloth is laid on one half of the bottom at a time .	19.389256
a 50-inch width is used on each side and it laps the keel line by about three inches .	82.90802
lay the cloth in place and trim it to size .	84.841995
then remove it and give the whole bottom a coat of resin .	22.8787
when the resin has hardened , mix up another batch with a pigment added if you wish .	64.74926
i used bright red , mixing the pigment in thoroughly before adding the hardener .	47.53097
using a cheap brush , coat one side of the bottom with the resin and then apply the cloth .	20.95481
when the cloth is smooth , apply another coat of resin , spreading it with a paint roller .	16.249828
be sure it is well saturated and then allow it to harden .	14.145444
when the whole bottom has hardened , use a disk sander to feather the edges of the cloth at the keel line and near the spray rail .	19.365759
then lay a three-inch-wide strip of cloth along the keel line from the transom to the point of the stem .	9.267557
before the resin has hardened , screw a one-inch mahogany keel strip along the centerline .	6.30728
fiberglas materials are available from glass plastic supply co . , 1605 w . elizabeth ave . , linden , n . j . .	11.814819
the hull is now turned over ( with the help of about seven friends ) and placed in a level , well-braced position .	65.972
i laid three layers of glass cloth on the inside of the stem , also installing a bow eye at this time .	30.194902
for added strength , i also fastened a small block on each side of every frame and batten joint .	33.755974
again , these blocks were set in resin-saturated glass cloth and nailed .	27.832624
after trimming off the excess on the frames and transom which was used to fasten them to the jig at a working height , the top of the side planking is installed .	29.410337
this is made up of scraps left over from the sides and bottom .	38.019665
these flaring parts really help to keep the boat dry .	39.44083
when they ' re on , the top edges are planed even with the sheer batten .	37.458485
the sides of the motor well run from the bottom battens to the top and from frame six to the transom , forming a real strong transom brace .	47.191936
note another piece of wood six inches wide is fastened to the transom between these pieces .	64.0705
all the flooring and the storage bin is half-inch exterior fir plywood .	2.2141879
most floor battens are glued and screwed to the flooring .	5.9788885
these battens are glued and screwed to the frames .	1.8365006
with all deck battens in place , the bilge is cleaned and painted up to the floor line .	14.02692
use one coat of firzite and one coat of marine paint .	13.601387
bottoms of the floorboards are also painted and the flooring is then screwed in place .	23.938099
after the decking is on , the cabin sides are installed .	82.97366
they ' re followed by the front and rear bulkheads as illustrated .	27.780376
the windshield glass is shatterproof and plexiglas is used in the cabin .	11.253718
inside , bunks are framed up and installed as indicated .	73.091934
a head is a handy thing to have and i installed one under a removable section of the port bunk .	30.72114
the sink in the hinged panel above the bunk drains into the head and a five-gallon water tank is mounted on the bulkhead above the sink .	16.62901
for padding the seats and bunks , i used ensolite , type aj .	66.32916
lightweight , non-absorbent , fire resistant and dimensionally stable , it is easily bonded to the wood with contact cement .	33.929153
available in af sheets , it costs about a dollar a square foot .	133.72026
it is a full scale , small , but efficient house that can become a year ' round retreat complete in every detail .	217.04135
because of the unique design by the architect egils hermanovski , you can build most of it in your own home workshop in your spare time .	21.510267
most of it is panelized and utilizes standard materials , and requires the use of only simple tools .	38.399853
on the following pages and in the following issues we take you every step of the way to your vacation cottage , from choosing the proper site to applying the final trim .	75.7228
in recognition of the growing trend for second homes , or vacation cottages , we have designed this one specifically with the family handyman in mind .	74.87223
it is a big project , not to be taken lightly .	41.80191
but each step has been broken down into easy stages , utilizing standard materials and simple tools , well within the capabilities of the handyman .	27.235598
the idea behind our design is modular units , or panelization .	6.674744
everything possible has been scaled to standard sizes and measurements of materials .	34.146233
wall panels and structural timbers are standard as are windows and doors , making for a minimum of cutting .	75.999565
we have developed an ingenious method of interlocking these so that you can make the major part of your house in your own workshop , panel by panel , according to plan .	70.07874
thus , when you have prepared your foundation and laid the floor , these can be trucked to the site and erected with a small crew of friends in a weekend .	31.75145
the roof timbers are precut and the panels standard so that the house can be completely enclosed in a matter of three or four days .	71.0707
then you can do the finishing touches at your leisure .	19.107248
due to the fact that building codes and regulations vary so much throughout the country , the first thing to do is to find out what , if any , they are .	39.236618
close to a large city they might even specify the size of the nails used	23.614529
in a remote section there might be no restrictions at all .	41.376514
this can usually be found out at the nearest town hall .	68.209526
at the same time check the electrical , plumbing , and sanitary requirements , as well as possible zoning regulations .	8.992549
whether electricity and public water and sewers are available or not , check the local customs in the use of bottled or l-p gas ( we give you alternatives later on ) .	64.44908
be sure that this information is reasonably official and not just an unfounded opinion .	62.04261
if there are any major restrictions , they usually can be obtained in printed form .	98.03876
where a building permit is required , find out what you must present when applying for one .	211.02606
in many cases , you must file a complete set of plans with the local building inspector .	58.27108
these will be available at cost from our plans department .	177.0039
some general things to look for in a site , if you haven ' t already bought one , are accessibility , water drainage , and orientation .	45.91852
how are the roads , and how will they stand up ? ?	96.803795
a visit in the early spring after a thaw will be very informative .	19.226482
note where the sun rises and sets , and ask which direction the prevailing winds and storms come from .	83.1822
will the view be something you can live with ? ?	41.1859
don ' t worry too much about rocky or sloping terrain	8.005533
we will take up alternative foundations later on .	171.46033
with this first issue we give you a list of the materials needed to build the basic ( aja version ) and the expandable ( ajb version ) .	17.722843
this will be for the shell of the house only ( roof , walls , and floor ) , and does not include the carport or balcony .	32.90299
this will permit you to get a rough estimate of how much the materials for the shell will cost .	85.82195
bear in mind that this does not include interior panels for partitions , fancy flooring , appliances and fixtures , electrical wiring , and plumbing , all of which will be taken up in detail in later issues .	29.95618
the wall panels are constructed of a framework of standard af and af of a good grade , free from structural faults .	44.60697
they should be as straight as possible , as this will effect their ability to mesh properly when the walls are erected .	56.58264
the outside surface of the solid units shall be of an exterior grade of panel board such as plywood , plastic coated panel board , high density particle board , asbestos-cement board , or any other product locally obtainable upon recommendation of your building supply dealer .	95.83114
the inner panels do not have to be weatherproof , and the choice will depend on the quality of finish desired .	40.189518
all panel board comes in standard af foot size .	186.2517
it is recommended that panels be both glued as well as nailed to the frame .	11.985583
the fixed window panels with louvers should have a good grade of 1/8-inch double-strength glass set in a mastic glazing compound .	16.072008
the louvers are constructed as shown in the detail , with a drop door for ventilation .	53.978916
there are standard sliding glass windows in wood or aluminum frames for those panels requiring them .	122.74103
the door panels are designed to accommodate standard doors which should be of exterior grade .	37.900543
the filler panels for the gable ends are cut from full af sheets as shown , leaving no wastage .	114.97352
the battens covering the joints are of af stock and are applied after the walls are erected .	67.92455
all nails should be rustproof , and aluminum is highly recommended .	63.36112
