note if 1/2-inch panel board is used inside and out , or 5/8-inch one side and 3/8-inch the other , and 1/8-inch glass is used , stock lumber in af , af , and af can be used in making the glass panels .	49.020103
other thicknesses may necessitate ripping a special size lumber for the glass trim .	42.525623
in any case , there is no special milling or rabbeting required for the panels .	27.627907
with modern techniques of woodworking and the multitude of cutting tools , fixtures , and attachments available , the drill press has become a basic home workshop tool .	38.80202
the drill press consists of a vertical shaft ( spindle ) which is tapered or threaded on one end to hold a drill chuck , a tubular housing ( quill ) in which the spindle is mounted , a head in which the quill is mounted , a feed lever which moves the quill up or down , a power source , and a movable table upon which the work is placed .	40.371323
there is often a means of locking the quill and , on larger presses , the table can be tilted .	30.507027
the size of the press is usually expressed in terms of chuck capacity ( the maximum diameter tool shank it will hold ) or distance between the spindle center and the column .	94.44391
a press with an 11 inch capacity lets you drill to the center of a 22 inch board or circle .	62.393078
a new radial drill press with a 16 inch capacity has a tilting head that allows drilling to be done at any angle .	40.22839
the head is mounted on a horizontal arm that swivels on the supporting column to position the drill bit instead of the work .	55.9627
the drill press should be leveled and , depending on whether it is a bench or floor model , bolted securely to a sturdy bench or stand or screwed to the floor with lag or expansion screws .	56.263123
a coat of paste wax or a rubdown with a piece of wax paper will protect the polished surface of the table	18.559572
wiping with a slightly oiled cloth will discourage rusting of the column and quill .	15.7038145
presses not fitted with sealed spindle bearings will need a drop of oil now and then in the lubrication holes in the quill .	60.37015
the rest of the press should be kept clean by dusting with a clean rag or brush .	24.891317
be careful to keep the drive belt free of oil and grease .	59.26895
belt tension is adjusted by manipulation of two locking bolts and a movable motor mount .	20.27972
keep the belt just tight enough so the pulleys won ' t slip when pulled by hand	96.32387
excess tension will only cause undue wear on the motor and spindle bearings .	10.261091
most drill presses have a quill return spring that raises the spindle automatically when the feed lever is released and holds the quill in the raised position .	35.305264
the return spring tension may be adjusted to suit individual requirements by gripping the spring housing with a pair of pliers ( to prevent the spring from unwinding when it is released ) , loosening the lock nut or screw , and rotating the housing until the desired tension is achieved .	64.37282
turning the housing clockwise will reduce tension , counter-clockwise will increase it .	71.57455
some manufacturers have had the foresight to provide a socket for the chuck key	9.696297
otherwise , you ' ll have to spend a few minutes to either attach a suitable spring clip somewhere on the press head or fit the key to a length of light chain and fasten to the bottom of the motor mount so that the key is out of the way when not in use .	74.52978
drill speeds are important if you want a good job .	11.694181
each cutting tool will operate best at a given speed , depending on the material worked .	99.88539
on most drill presses , it is impossible to get the exact speed , but you can come close by adjusting the drive belt on the step-cone pulleys .	28.171972
you will find a chart giving the various speed ratios available with your particular drill press somewhere in the instruction booklet that came with the tool .	129.59636
see the table on page 34 for exact recommended speeds .	42.402676
generally , the larger the tool and the harder the material , the slower the speed .	204.16612
too much pressure will force the tool beyond its cutting capacity and result in rough cuts and jammed or broken tools .	161.84274
too light a feed , particularly with metal or other hard material , causes overheating of the tool and burning of the cutting edge .	44.84036
the best results will be obtained by matching the correct speed with a steady feed pressure that lets the tool cut easily at an even rate .	70.15223
there are numerous types and styles of tools to drill holes .	52.02047
the most common are the twist drill , the solid center shaft with interchangeable cutting blades , the double spur bit , and the power wood bit .	48.564617
all will do a good job if sharp , but the twist drills don ' t cut quite as smoothly as the others , since they do not have the outlining spurs that sever the fibers before actual boring starts .	37.800213
the adjustable fly cutter is very useful for cutting large diameter holes and can be used to cut exact-size discs by reversing the cutter blade .	28.47394
since fly cutters are one sided and not balanced , they should be used at the slowest speed available , and fed very slowly to avoid binding .	63.95144
fly cutters can fool you into putting your hand too close to the tool , so if you want to avoid nicked fingers , keep your hands well out of the way .	36.915897
when drilling all the way through a workpiece , always place a piece of scrap wood underneath .	29.21162
this will not only protect the work table , but also assure a clean breakthrough .	34.677135
another method of assuring a clean hole is to first drill a small pilot hole all the way through , then drill half way with the dimensional bit , turn the piece over , and finish from the other side .	102.68903
in soft woods with pronounced grain , there is sometimes a tendency for the hole to wander , due to the varying hardness of the wood .	32.610386
in this case , drilling a small pilot hole or clamping the work will do much to improve accuracy .	45.026524
when a hole is to be bored to a predetermined depth , mark the depth on the side of the stock , then run the bit down so that it is even with the mark .	55.18092
the depth gauge rod can now be set , and any number of holes bored to exact and identical depth .	59.33617
the old-time bridges over the merrimac river in massachusetts are of unusual interest in many respects .	23.830952
for their length , their types of construction , their picturesque settings , and their literary associations , they should be known and remembered .	29.567417
in this sequence i shall write about them in the order of their erection .	14.179957
the first bridge known to have been covered wholly or in part , -- and perhaps the most interesting one , connected newbury ( now newburyport ) with salisbury point .	63.929268
its building was first proposed in 1791 , when a group of citizens , mostly newburyport men , petitioned the general court for an act of incorporation .	27.427816
this document began `` no . 1 newbury port , may 30th , 1791	25.128666
`` whereas , a bridge over merrimack river , from the land of hon ' ble jonathan greenleaf , esquire , in newbery , to deer island , and from said island to salisbury , would be of very extensive utility , by affording a safe conveyance to carriages , teams and travellers at all seasons of the year , and at all times of tide .	22.408989
`` we , the subscribers , do agree , that as soon as a convenient number of persons have subscribed to this , or a similar writing , we will present a petition to the hon ' ble general court of the commonwealth of massachusetts , praying for an act incorporating into a body politic the subscribers to such writing with liberty to build such a bridge , and a right to demand a toll equal to that received at malden bridge , and on like terms , and if such an act shall be obtained , then we severally agree each with the others , that we will hold in the said bridge the several shares set against our respective names , the whole into two hundred shares being divided , and that we will pay such sums of money at such times and in such manners , as by the said proposed corporation , shall be directed and required ' ' .	72.832535
this paper was signed by forty-five persons , subscribing a total of two hundred shares .	11.873013
a month later the general court served notice to the town of newbury that the bridge was to be built .	20.832966
the matter was considered and reconsidered , and finally opposed , but in spite of many objections , the court granted a charter on january 9 , 1792 .	68.03746
on november 26 of that year the bridge was completed and opened .	27.409082
timothy palmer , who invented and later patented the arch type of construction for wooden bridges , was the genius who planned and supervised the building of the essex , or `` deer island ' ' bridge although the actual work was carried out under the direction of william coombs , who received $300 as recompense .	33.139587
this two-part bridge is best described by rev . timothy dwight , president of yale college , in his `` travels in new-england and new-york ' ' , published in new haven in 1821 .	12.44279
`` it consists of two divisions , separated by an island at a small distance from the southern shore .	37.311188
the division between the island and this shore , consists principally of an arch	231.78337
whose chord is one hundred and sixty feet , and whose vortex is forty feet ( it was actually 37 feet ) above the high-water mark .	26.588238
in appearance and construction it resembles the pascataqua bridge .	22.077703
the whole length of essex bridge is one thousand and thirty feet and its breadth thirty-four .	21.77349
i have already mentioned that mr . timothy palmer of newburyport was the inventor of the arched bridges in this country .	12.094945
as mr . palmer was educated to house-building only , and had never seen a structure of this nature	67.28874
he certainly deserves not a little credit for the invention ' ' .	13.752319
it is hardly necessary to remind students of covered bridges that timothy palmer was born in 1751 in nearby rowley	66.92361
that he moved with his parents to west boxford when he was sixteen years old	28.16488
and was there apprenticed to a builder and architect , moody spofford .	14.937674
it was indeed a remarkable feat that a man who had had no experience of bridge building should have applied the principle of the arch , which appears in his famous bridges at portsmouth , haverhill , and philadelphia .	51.179546
the essex merrimack bridge when first built was not covered .	61.36215
as far as we know , no american bridge had been thus protected in 1792 .	68.49563
richard s . allen is the authority for the statement that the northern section was probably roofed by 1810 .	31.011288
its original appearance is shown in an engraving published in the `` massachusetts magazine ' ' in may 1793 , which is reproduced herewith ( fig . 1 ) .	14.597705
a brief description accompanying the picture says that the bridge contained more than 6000 tons of timber .	28.527994
between the abutments on the newbury shore and the south bank of deer island there was one span or arch measuring 160 feet	37.442772
between the north shore of deer island and the salisbury side there was an arch of 113 feet and a series of piers with a draw forty feet long .	20.974916
a dinner and celebration in honor of this piece of engineering took place july 4 , 1793 , in a tavern erected by the corporation on the island .	44.9386
it is said that the eccentric timothy dexter , who was one of the first share-holders , stood on the table and made a speech worthy of the occasion .	32.89407
the `` essex journal ' ' says that he `` delivered an oration on the bridge , which for elegance of style , propriety of speech or force of argument , was truly ciceronian ' ' .	47.546635
the reporter must have written this with tongue in cheek , because dexter ' s oration could hardly be understood	21.870136
and , although he later explained that he was talking french , it seems rather more likely that he had succumbed to the joys of the evening .	28.08054
the north portion of the essex bridge was well worth the cost of construction , although it proved to be twice what was estimated in the beginning .	78.8157
it stood in its original form until 1882 .	10.23495
the southern half , however , on account of its underbracing , was considered by boat owners a menace to navigation .	40.965908
in 1810 it was torn down and replaced by a chain suspension bridge .	24.362118
this was built by john templeman from plans submitted by james finley of fayette county , pennsylvania .	31.727333
timothy palmer had general supervision of the work .	7.3064013
an advertisement in the `` newburyport herald ' ' , december 21 , 1810 , shows palmer in a new light as an expert on chain bridges .	60.87446
information is hereby given that mr . timothy palmer of newburyport , mass . has agreed to take charge of the concerns of the patentees of the chain bridge , in the states of massachusetts , new hampshire , vermont , rhode island , and connecticut , so far as relates to the sale of patent rights and the construction of chain bridges .	20.176868
`` mr . palmer will attend to any applications relating to bridges and if desired will view the proposed site , and lay out and superintend the work , or recommend a suitable person to execute it .	49.569057
this chain bridge proved less durable than the wooden arch on the salisbury end .	29.568333
it fell , february 6 , 1827 , carrying with it a horse and wagon , two men and four oxen .	77.72701
the horse and men were saved , but the oxen drowned .	4.2880597
in spite of this catastrophe , the bridge was rebuilt on the same plan and opened again on july 17 , 1827 .	24.673445
this second chain bridge was 570 feet long , had two thirty-foot towers and a draw , and a double roadway .	22.932013
the essex bridge was a toll crossing until 1868 , when the county commissioners laid out all the merrimack bridges as highways .	25.686222
sturdy and strong after more than a century of continuous use , the old covered , wooden bridge that spans the tygartis valley river at philippi will have a distinctive part in the week-long observance of the first land battle of the civil war at its home site , may 28th to june 3rd .	46.875137
colonel frederick w . lander , impersonated , will again make his break-neck ride down the steep declivity of talbott ' s ( now college ) hill and thunder across the bridge to join colonel benjamin f . kelley ' s ( west ) virginia infantry , then swarming through the streets in pursuit of the retreating confederates .	34.414227
he was closely followed by the ohio and indiana troops -- thus the old bridge has another distinction	237.9794
that of being the first such structure secured by force of arms in the war of the ' 60s .	52.564857
the bridge has survived the natural hazards of the elements , war , fire , and floods , as well as injuries incident to heavy traffic , for more than a hundred years .	45.598183
twice during the civil war it was saved from destruction by the opposing armies by the pleas and prayers of a local minister .	31.207205
it still stands as a monument to the engineering skills of the last century and still serves in the gasoline age to carry heavy traffic on u . s . route 250 -- the old beverly and fairmont turnpike .	49.18401
it is one of the very few , if not the only surviving bridge of its type to serve a main artery of the u . s . highway system , thus it is far more than a relic of the horse and buggy days .	39.07178
this covered , wooden bridge is so closely identified with the first action in the early morning of june 3 , 1861 , and with subsequent troop movements of both armies in the philippi area that it has become a part and parcel of the war story .	37.05875
so frequently have pictures of the bridge appeared in books and in national publications that it vies with the old john brown fort at harpers ferry as the two nationally best known structures in west virginia .	88.70652
completed and opened for traffic in 1852 , the bridge was designed and built by lemuel chenoweth and his brother , eli , of beverly .	21.672161
the chenoweth brothers were experienced bridge builders , and against the competition of other , and better known , bridge designers and builders they had constructed nine of the covered , wooden bridges on the parkersburg and staunton turnpike a dozen years before , as well as many other bridges for several counties .	62.1085
the philippi bridge , however , was the chenoweth master piece , with its 139-foot , dual lane , span -- and it stands today as a monument to its builders .	52.08596
never rebuilt , the bridge was strengtened in 1938 by two extra piers , a concrete floor , and a walk-way along the upper side in order to care for modern traffic .	35.62082
during the war it was in constant use by the wagon trains transporting supplies from the railhead at grafton to the troops operating in the interior .	22.64033
union soldiers at times used it for sleeping quarters to escape from the rain or other inclement weather , and some of them left momentoes of their stay by carving their names and small tokens on its walls and beams .	29.348066
but what the elements could not do was seriously threatened when brigadier general william e . ( grumble ) jones reached philippi while on the famous jones-imboden raid in may , 1863 .	46.032455
general jones was fresh from a long series of bridge burnings , including the long bridge at fairmont , and , after seeing a great drove of horses and cattle he had collected safely across the bridge , he sent his men to work piling combustibles in and around it .	45.200645
reverend joshual corder , a baptist minister , gathered a few citizens of southern sympathies , to call on jones and plead with him to spare the structure	50.782608
he reasoned and argued , pointing out that jones or other confederate commanders would need it should troops pass that way in retreat .	144.32352
jones relented , he did not order his men to apply the torch -- the drove of livestock was driven up the valley , via beverly , and across the mountains to feed and serve the confederate army , while jones and his raiders turned toward buckhannon to join forces with imboden .	56.086014
again reverend corder saved the bridge when union soldiers planned to destroy it , after filling its two lanes with hay and straw -- but for what reason is not recorded nor remembered , certainly not because of pressure from an opposing confederate force .	99.82178
on the second occasion it took prayers as well as reason to dissuade the soldiers from their purpose .	44.297054
centering around this historic old structure , a group of public-spirited barbour county citizens have organized and planned a week-long series of events , beginning on may 28th and continuing through june 3rd , to observe most appropriately the centennial of the first land engagement of the civil war at philippi .	44.406906
it is a good eight years now since each of us acquired a swimming pool -- eight enlightening , vigorous , rigorous , not wholly unrewarding years .	75.86595
we have learned a lot -- a dash of hydrochemistry here , a bit about plumbing and pump-priming there .	27.312212
we have had sound grounding in the principles of the mailed-fist-in-velvet-glove school of diplomacy .	24.14093
we have become amateur insurance experts and fine-feathered yard birds .	76.09631
true , our problems have lessened a bit as more and more of our neighbors have built their own pools , thereby diluting our spectacular attractions .	51.269455
but problems cling to pools , as any pool owner knows .	154.39821
so our innate generosity of spirit prompts us to share our trials , errors and solutions with any who are taking the pool plunge for the first time -- in the pious hope that some may profit from our experience .	97.70438
position may not be everything , but in the case of a pool it can certainly contribute difficulties , social and/or physical .	163.13751
one of us has a pool set in a wooded area very near the house .	61.07971
the other has his pool far away from the house in a field high on a hill .	85.43573
if you are dreaming of a blue , shimmering pool right outside your living room windows , close your eyes firmly and fill in the picture with lots and lots of children , damp towels , squashed tubes of suntan oil and semi-inflated plastic toys .	53.276535
you are likely to be nearer the truth .	7.8499455
you can also see that the greater the proximity of the pool to your main living quarters , the greater the chance for violation of family privacy , annoying noise and the let ' s-make-your-house-our-club attitude .	68.63445
on the other hand , out-of-sight does not lead to out-of-mind when children cannot be easily observed and you have to make a long trek to reach the pool .	53.37129
another dilemma as picturesque as a sylvan pond in the forest may be , trees offer a leaf and root hazard to the well-being of a pool .	30.112444
yet a grassy approach can turn a pool into a floating lawn every time the grass is mowed .	19.761019
as in choosing a wife , it is only sensible to consider also how appealing a pool is likely to be in bad weather as well as in good .	73.54496
in the colder climes , for instance , you will have to live through the many unglamorous winter months when your pool will hardly look its best .	48.269012
it may be a big hole in the ground filled with salt hay , or an ice floe studded with logs .	44.035336
even a neat , plastic-covered plunge is not exactly a joy to behold .	69.97526
( we do , however , recommend those patented covers to prevent both people and junk -- flora and fauna generally -- from accidentally wintering in the pool .	34.174744
probably no location for a pool is perfect on all counts .	60.737637
naturally it will be dictated to a large extent by the shape and size of your land .	17.297283
but if space and money are no problem and small children are not on hand every day , it is certainly more restful to have your pool and entertainment area removed from the immediate environs of the house .	43.402893
and a good several feet around the pool should be neither greensward nor woods , but good hard pavement .	57.35509
the placement of your pool , however , will not of itself solve the two major problems of pool owning -- those that involve your social life and those pertaining to safety .	96.55227
coping with them demands stern discipline -- of yourself as well as of your family , neighbors , friends and anyone you ever talked to on a transoceanic jet .	78.3419
eight years ago while we were going through the mud-sweat-and-tears construction period , we were each solaced by the vision of early morning dips and evening home-comings to a cool family collected around the pool with a buffet table laid out nearby for the lord and master ' s delectation .	49.83073
but not even our first pool-side gatherings came anywhere near those rosy fantasies .	49.545994
we seemed to be witnessing the population explosion right in our own backyards .	31.861134
our respective families looked as if they had quadrupled .	12.138152
had we taken a lien on a state park ? ?	81.35213
we had merely been discovered by the pool sharks .	3.4730835
from proud pool-owners to perpetual hosts and handymen was a short step -- no more than the change from city clothes to trunks .	64.15137
naive of us , maybe , but the results of our impulsive invitations to `` come over next summer and swim in our new pool ' ' were both unexpected and unsettling .	66.403114
after the first few weeks , it was obvious that rules had to be made , laid down and obeyed -- even if our popularity ratings became subnormal as a result .	60.140587
so rules we made , in unabashed collusion .	5.3968744
since our viewpoints in this respect coincided precisely , we present the fruits of our efforts herewith as a single social code for pool owners .	37.78403
first and foremost no one -- no , not anyone -- in the family is allowed to issue blanket invitations to his or her own circle .	151.76411
just short of forty lashes we finally managed to coerce our children to this view .	25.95124
their friends and ours are welcome to share the pool , but on our terms and at our times .	78.58285
no friends are to arrive without an invitation or without at least telephoning beforehand .	13.085856
no ringers , either -- even if they are trailing legitimate invitees .	3.8886106
we want to know when the potlatches telephone exactly how many they are planning to bring , so that we won ' t end up with a splashing mob that looks like coney island in august .	46.308037
no young children may come without adults except for a specific , organized , chaperoned party .	68.12408
and accompanying adults are urged to keep an alert and sensible eye on their responsibilities .	31.394361
a gaggle of gabbling mothers , backs to the pool , is no safeguard .	36.860027
no bottle pool is tolerated -- bottle pool being our lingo for those who come to swim and sink into our bar while protesting that they can only dunk and run .	48.186775
( sanity , solvency and relations with our wine merchant took a beating that first summer as we inadvertently became the neighborhood free-drink stop .	129.88657
we designated one day a week as the time when neighborhood teen-agers might swim at definite hours .	125.39241
this has saved us from constant requests seven days a week and made us feel less brutal to the young `` less fortunate ' ' than ours .	71.470634
we also worked out logistics for sunday afternoon swimmers who arrive two hours early with their weekend guests while we are still enjoying an alfresco lunch en famille .	69.01257
we gently usher them to an island of tables and chairs strategically placed on the far side of the pool where they can amuse each other until we get ready to merge sides .	32.77429
all dressing ( undressing to be more exact ) must be done in our small bath house or at the swimmers ' homes .	58.670193
( to avoid any possible excuse for a dripping parade through your house , it is a good idea to have a telephone extension near the pool as well as a direct outdoor route between the pool , and the parking area .	39.529087
) we do , however , provide a limited number of extra suits , mainly for children , and we stock extra towels and a few inexpensive bathing conveniences .	39.159565
life-preservers , the buckle-on kapok-filled kind , are held in readiness , too , for the very young .	47.544014
safety rules , of course , are more important than all the others put together .	61.84147
in many localities , now , the law requires all pools to be fenced , usually to a minimum height of 5 feet .	50.16959
but fenced or unfenced , no pool-side is the place for running or horseplay .	26.517279
we allow no underwater endurance contests , either , or inexpert versions of water polo .	24.577394
diving boards must have non-skid surfaces ( coco matting takes an awful beating from chlorine and rots quickly , but grit-impregnated paints are excellent ) .	59.929775
and divers must be enjoined to look before they leap , either on top of someone else or onto a pool edge .	69.50272
our pools also have wide , shallow steps -- for the benefit of the littlest swimmers who can thus be introduced to the water with far greater safety than a ladder affords .	45.0733
all bottles must be kept a safe distance away from the pool and drinking glasses are banned in favor of plastic or metal cups .	16.780697
when you first acquire a pool , we earnestly recommend -- for your own mental health -- a good long chat with your insurance agent .	36.310616
you should be prepared to cope with any pitfall such as plunges into empty pools or shallow ends and all manner of winter as well as summer lawsuits .	34.013397
soignee pools , alas , do not just happen .	22.937891
they are the result of a constant and careful contest with the elements .	87.18222
unless you want to make your wife a pool widow and to spend a great many of your leisure hours nursing your pool ' s pristine purity , its care and feeding -- from ph content to filtering and vacuuming -- is best left to a weekly or bi-monthly professional service .	44.23214
of course , if your pool is close to the house , your wife can always add it to her housekeeping chores ( you hope ) .	33.21025
or you can make pool care the price of swimming for teen-agers .	22.916216
even so , every pool owner , in case of emergency , should have some idea of what makes things work .	97.38177
a brief course in hydraulics from the pool builders may well be appreciated in a future crisis .	44.481853
a sudden high rise in temperature will turn your pool poison green overnight .	65.217705
with or without professional help , you will have to be able to do some of these jobs yourself unless you have a full-time pool nurse .	24.376238
you should see to it that the trap , the dirt-catcher in front of the filter , is always clean .	15.782331
a pool is no place for a shut trap .	10.745547
you should firmly insist that no bobby pins or hair pins be worn in the water .	44.82151
you can hope against hope that come spring cleaning , your fair-weather friends will lend a hand at scrubbing and furbishing .	49.894554
many hours of spring cleaning will be saved , however , if you remove the main drain grate when you close the pool season in the fall .	35.840317
as the pool is emptied , stand by to brush down the walls and bottom while they are still wet .	91.41713
much of the dirt and leaf stain is easily removed when damp , but requires dynamite if allowed to dry .	58.773346
if you have a 6- to 8-inch drain pipe , you may easily wash out all the debris when the grate is out .	41.324146
of course , when your 6-inch torrent of water is released , it may cause a lot of comment as it passes through or by neighboring properties .	77.59259
if your pool is located on or near sloping ground , it may have natural drainage which is certainly more desirable than to be faced with the annual expense and labor of first pumping out the water and then scooping out all the debris .	40.099
it may be true that pool lighting dramatizes an evening scene , but lights also attract all the insect life for miles around .	149.9037
once on the water , these little visitors seldom leave , and this adds to your filtering and vacuuming problems as well as providing a slapping good time for all those present .	70.44144
often one floodlight high in a tree will provide all the light you need at much less expense .	113.67003
our experience has taught us that it pays to buy the best equipment possible , from pipes to brushes .	93.14734
follow pool-care instructions to the letter , and be sure that one person ( in the family or not ) is regularly responsible for each aspect of the job , with no chance for claiming , `` it wasn ' t my turn ' ' .	32.530502
never let anyone not in the know take a turn at the valves -- even if the little boys do want to play space ship .	112.4711
you may find yourself hitting bottom , literally , as you discover that water is running out even while you are putting it in .	126.845985
draw a line across the country at the latitude of lower pennsylvania .	30.30991
any house built now below that line without air conditioning will be obsolete in 10 years .	27.888607
fortunately , it is the fha which has arrived at this conclusion , for it means that cooling equipment of all kinds may now be included in a mortgage , and thus acquired with a minimum of financial stress .	71.464424
even if you live above that line , the fha will back you , for they have decided that the inclusion of air conditioning in all new homes is a good thing and should be encouraged .	51.762737
new simplified packaged units , recently devised prefabricated glass-fiber ducts , and improved add-on techniques make it possible to acquire a system for an 1800-square-foot house for as little as $600 to $900 .	25.371944
two men can often do the installation in a day .	83.106155
you can install it yourself -- this is a central system that will cool every part of your house .	37.64936
no less an authority than the fha concurs that the savings air conditioning makes possible more than offset its operating costs .	51.914314
home air conditioning has come a long way from the early days of overcooled theaters and the thermal shock they inflicted .	32.62977
we know now that a 15-degree differential in temperature is the maximum usually desirable , and accurate controls assure the comfort we want .	112.16529
we know , too , that health is never harmed by summer cooling .	105.65697
on the contrary , there are fewer colds and smaller doctor bills .	39.996452
the filtered air benefits allergies , asthma , sinus , hay fever .	4.0137553
control of temperature and humidity is a godsend to the aged and the invalid .	27.671597
heart conditions and high blood pressure escape the stresses brought on by oppressive heat .	186.48149
the cleaner air means less time spent pushing a vacuum , fewer trips to the dry cleaners , lighter loads for the washing machine .	21.37123
the need for reupholstering , redecorating , repainting becomes more infrequent .	29.841293
clothes hold their shape better , and mildew and rust become almost forgotten words .	252.00932
when you ' re less fatigued , things just naturally look brighter .	321.1154
the children can have their daytime naps and hot meals , and be put to bed on schedule in shade-darkened rooms .	57.001957
you ' ll sleep longer and better , too , awake refreshed and free of hot weather nerves .	39.486652
you can forget about screens , and leave the storm windows up all year around .	82.51798
best of all , central air conditioning is something you can afford .	62.32219
like its long-lived cousin , the refrigerator , a conditioner can be expected to last 20 to 25 years or more .	45.76257
that brings its per-year cost down mighty low .	4.745138
no matter what style your home is , ranch , two-story , colonial or contemporary , central air conditioning is easily installed .	31.296782
the equipment won ' t take up valuable space either .	85.83955
but there ' s no denying that the easiest and most economical way to get year- ' round whole-house air conditioning is when you build .	37.896233
if that ' s done , the house can be designed and oriented for best operation , and this can mean savings both in the size of equipment and in the cost of the house itself .	76.41549
if you can ' t see your way clear to have summer cooling included when building , by all means make provision for its easy adding later .	432.6564
manufacturers have designed equipment for just such circumstances , and your savings over starting from scratch will be substantial .	77.366516
if your house is to have a forced warm air system , cooling can be a part of it .	78.7685
this costs less than having a completely separate cooling system , for your regular heating ductwork , filters and furnace blower do double duty for cooling .	16.438042
you can get year- ' round air conditioners in the same variety of styles in which you buy a furnace alone -- high or low boy , horizontal or counterflow .	72.23536
the units can be installed in basement , attic , crawlspace , or in a closet located in the living area .	15.202959
the cooling coil is located in the furnace ' s outlet .	29.815626
from the coil small copper pipes connect to a weatherproof refrigeration section set in the yard , garage , carport , or basement .	15.176103
if you plan to add cooling later to your heating system , there are things to watch for .	59.27879
be sure ducts that require insulation get it when they are installed .	35.89005
be sure your ducts and blower are big enough to handle cooling .	12.619059
this is especially important if you live in a mild-winter zone .	7.3187857
be sure you get a perimeter heating system , and diffusers that will work as well for cooling as they do for heating .	42.965633
you can get a hot water system that will also work for cooling your house .	72.42985
for cooling , chilled water is circulated instead of hot water .	23.14169
instead of radiators you ' ll have cooling-heating units , each with its own thermostat .	39.83942
these systems are more expensive than year- ' round forced air systems .	258.75964
the minimum cost for an average one-story , 7-room house with basement , is likely to run $1500 above the cost of the heating alone .	34.823685
if the problems of combining cooling with your heating are knotty , it may be cheaper to plan on a completely separate cooling system .	17.592546
the simplest kind of separate system uses a single , self-contained unit .	11.485768
it is , in effect , an oversize room conditioner equipped with prefab glass-fiber ducts to distribute the cooled , cleaned , dehumidified air where it is wanted .	22.526974
in a long , rambling ranch , two such units can be installed , one serving the living area , the other the sleeping zone .	73.36989
in a two-story house , one unit may be installed in the basement to serve the first floor , another in the attic to cool the second .	23.708998
in each case , having separate systems for living and sleeping areas has the advantage of permitting individual zone control .	65.96763
one of the more remarkable of the new cooling systems is one that can be switched to heating .	103.34835
as you know , a conditioner makes indoor air cool by pumping the heat out of it and then releasing this heat outdoors .	51.44761
a relatively simple switching arrangement reverses the cycle so that the machine literally runs backward , and the heat is extracted from outdoor air and turned indoors .	41.00384
up until recently , this heat pump method of warming air was efficient only in areas of mild winters and when outside temperatures were above 40 degrees .	63.857674
now , the machine has been improved to a point where it is generally more economical than oil heat at temperatures down to 15 degrees .	48.98357
you can get this added heating feature for as little as $200 more than the price of cooling alone .	47.10466
consider it as a standby setup , at negligible cost , for those emergencies when the furnace quits , a blizzard holds up fuel delivery , or for cool summer mornings or evenings when you don ' t want to start up your whole heating plant .	31.33351
how large a cooling unit you need , and the method of its installation , depends on a variety of factors .	30.102142
among other things , besides the nature of your house and how much heat finds its way into its various rooms from the outside , it will depend upon your personal habits and the makeup of your family .	57.69764
families with children usually don ' t want the house quite so cool .	177.51144
if you are a party thrower , you may need added capacity .	464.52084
the body is a heat machine , and 20 to 25 guests can easily double your cooling load .	198.06696
cooling requirements are best expressed in terms of aj .	64.60283
a btu is a unit of heat , and the btu rating of a conditioner refers to how much heat your machine can pump out of your house in an hour .	39.8945
a very rough rule of thumb is that , under favorable conditions , you ' ll need 15 btu ' s of cooling for every square foot of your house .	68.578995
this is if outdoor temperatures have a high average of 95 degrees .	8.86673
you ' ll need more if the high average is above that , less if it ' s below .	105.627045
a ton of cooling compares to the cooling you get by melting a ton of ice .	93.9096
by accepted definition , a 1-ton conditioner will provide 12 , 000 btu of cooling in one hour .	37.282864
you may find a conditioner rated by horsepower .	2.6371884
it is generally an inaccurate method of rating , for the horsepower is that of the compressor motor , and many other components beside it determine how much cooling you ' ll get .	48.77304
a 1-hp conditioner , for example , may vary in effectiveness from under 8 , 000 btu to well over 10 , 000 aj .	39.838802
the safest procedure is to let your builder estimate the size of the unit you need , rather than trying to do this yourself .	46.629944
don ' t urge your builder to give you a little extra cooling capacity just to be sure you have enough .	54.493305
better to have your equipment slightly undersized than too big .	200.11371
reducing humidity is often as important as cooling .	4.0505786
an oversize unit will cool off your house quickly , then shut down for a long period .	56.544044
before it cycles on again , humidity can build up and make you uncomfortable even though the temperature is still low .	110.37
with a unit of the right size , a compressor will run continuously during hot weather , reducing humidity as evenly as it does temperature .	54.30492
attention to details can cut in half the size unit you need and pare operating expense proportionately .	119.72337
a well-designed , 1200-square-foot house can be comfortably cooled and heated for as little as $128 a year , or $11 a month .	32.240593
if you have a house which heat doesn ' t penetrate easily , your unit will have less heat to remove .	57.212723
keep the direct sun from reaching the house and you ' ve won the first battle .	31.33294
in a new house , generous roof overhangs are a logical and effective solution .	49.18606
if the house you plan to buy or build won ' t have big overhangs , you can still do a fair job of keeping the sun off walls and windows with properly designed trellises , fences and awnings .	47.31373
shade trees , too , are a big help , so keep them if you can .	174.09386
drawn blinds and draperies do some good , but not nearly as much as shading devices on the outside of the house .	35.301292
the more directly the sun strikes walls and roof , the greater its heat impact .	100.25568
the way a house is set on its lot can therefore influence how much cooling you ' re going to need .	136.90448
a shift in the walls , or a change in the roof slope , so the sun hits them more obliquely , can save you money .	41.063038
you can use heat-absorbing glass to stop the sun , double glass and insulated glass to combat condensation .	41.55049
restrict large glass areas to the north and south sides of the house .	29.903482
an attic space above insulation makes a house easier to cool .	17.947248
you ' ll even gain by putting your water heater outside the conditioned space , and using an electric range instead of a gas one .	70.52533
insulate , weatherstrip , double-glaze to the maximum .	407.59964
in insulation , the numbers to remember are 6-4-2 .	2.5877972
they stand for 6 inches of mineral wool insulation in the ceiling , 4 inches in the side walls , 2 inches in the floors .	22.75065
such extra-thick insulation not only permits a much smaller cooling installation , but will continue to reduce operating expenses both in heating and cooling .	37.243237
a light-colored roof will reduce sun heat by 50 per cent .	12.22136
it costs two to three times as much to remove a btu in summer as it does to add one in winter , so every solitary btu is worth attention .	68.99296
you ' ll foil them in droves , along with their pal humidity , by having and using a kitchen range exhaust fan , a bathroom ventilator for when you shower , and an outside vent for the clothes drier .	37.85686
it ' s no use pretending that all conditioners are quiet , but the noise they produce can be kept to a minimum .	66.838715
good workmanship is important in the installation , so if you ' re doing your own contracting , don ' t award the job on the basis of price alone .	24.85596
most recreation work calls for a good deal of pre-planning .	7.4596667
you must know before you start what the needs and objectives of your organization are	61.588745
you must have a list of requirements on where , how many , and what type sites are needed .	94.566025
with such a program you can make constructive selections of the best sites available .	25.708334
begin the examination of a site with a good map and aerial photos if possible .	77.86274
these are becoming more and more available through the work of counties and other government agencies .	42.18797
the new editions of topographic maps being made by the federal government are excellent for orienting yourself to the natural features of the site .	27.708975
these are inexpensive and available from the u . s . geological society , washington 25 , d . c . .	5.3223586
in recent years many counties and the u . s . forest service have taken aerial photos which show features in detail and are very good for planning use .	27.233482
most counties also have maps available from the county engineer showing roads and other features and from the assessor ' s office showing ownerships of land .	95.21083
inspect the site in the field during the time of the year when the area will be most heavily used for recreation .	37.916603
this gives you a better opportunity to get the feel of the climate conditions , the exposure to the sun and wind , the water interests , etcetera , which vary greatly with the seasons .	24.934582
it is usually helpful to make a sketch map in the field , showing the size and location of the features of interest and to take photographs at the site .	33.66428
these are a great aid for planning use back at the office .	88.2864
for site planning work , it is best to have a qualified and experienced park planner to carry through the study .	52.574284
however , there is also much to be gained by making use of the abilities of the local people who are available and interested in recreation .	46.462296
county judges , commissioners , engineers , assessors , and others who have lived in the area for a long time may have valuable knowledge regarding the site or opinions to offer from their varied professional experiences .	57.43498
a visit to the site by a group of several persons can usually bring out new ideas or verify opinions most helpful to the planning study of any recreation area .	164.83023
this , of course , depends on the character of the site itself , the previous experience of the investigator , and the number of factors needed to arrive at a good decision .	46.56452
it is too easy for the inexperienced person to make a quick judgment of a few values of the area and base a decision on these alone .	65.36098
usually there are more factors to good site planning than first impressions .	264.76068
a site may be a rundown slum or a desolate piece of desert in appearance today but have excellent potentials for the future with a little development or water .	104.567635
the same is true of areas which at first look good because of a few existing recreation features but may actually be poor areas to develop for general public use .	138.29665
in looking for the best sites available that meet the requirements , you need information to compare the site with others .	124.45706
how well can the site be developed ? ?	1.0153359
how useful will it be to the public ? ?	11.133704
check the quantity and quality of all of the recreation interests already existing at the site .	95.7635
naturally , a park site with scenic views , a good lake , trees , and sand dunes , will attract more people than a nearby area with only trees and dunes .	40.435642
frontage on a body of clear , clean water will be vastly different from the same amount of frontage on polluted water .	19.910114
some recreation features , such as scenic values and water interest , also have greater overall value than other interests .	112.81077
one of the most desirable features for a park are beautiful views or scenery .	157.98024
it may be distant views of a valley or the mountains or natural features such as a small lake , colorful rock formations , or unusual trees .	43.108368
a site which overlooks a harbor or river may offer interest in the activities of boating traffic .	31.452183
an area on the coast may have relaxing views of the surf rolling in on a beach .	18.37075
a site may also be attractive just through the beauty of its trees and shrubs .	14.335292
note extent of these interests and how available they will be for the public to enjoy .	76.68788
water interest is one of the most valuable factors you can find for a recreation site .	62.951252
most park planners look to water frontage for basic park areas .	119.99039
this follows naturally since frontage on an ocean , stream , or lake provides scenic values and opportunities for the very popular recreation activities of bathing , fishing , boating , and other water sports .	29.025133
a body of water is usually the center of interest at parks which attract the greatest picnic and camping use .	49.438488
it also cools the air in summer and nourishes the trees and wild life .	10.733379
the amount of water frontage , the quantity and quality of the water , and the recreation afforded by it are important .	23.107054
a restricted frontage may be too crowded an area for public use .	38.479073
a stream or pond which is attractive in the springtime may become stagnant or dry in late summer .	40.713623
if the site is on a reservoir , the level of the water at various seasons as it affects recreation should be studied .	28.06995
a stream which has all of its watershed within a national forest or other lands under good conservation practices is less likely to be affected by pollution than one passing through unrestricted logging or past an industrial area .	70.5149
other factors , such as water temperature , depth of water , the fish life it supports , wave action , flooding , etcetera , will affect its recreation value .	35.88927
other natural features which can be of high interest are the forests , canyons , mountains , deserts , seacoast , beaches , sand dunes , waterfalls , springs , etcetera with which the area is blessed .	19.45695
just as the national and state parks place emphasis on features which are of national or state significance , counties should seek out these features which are distinctive of their area .	200.03854
although the site may not contain the features themselves , there are often opportunities to include them as additional interest to the site .	102.90942
the route to the park may lead people past them or display views of them .	134.84966
a group of native trees or plants which are outstanding in a particular county can be featured at the site .	63.617085
the fish , animals , and birds which may be found at the site are another interest .	66.49428
fishing interest calls for a check of the species found , quantity and size , the season they are available , and the stocking program of the fish commission .	59.90332
animals may be present at the site or provide hunting in nearby areas .	27.314432
the site may be on one of the major flyways of migratory birds or have its own resident bird life .	30.892668
clams , crabs , and other marine life may add interest at coastal areas .	82.41783
each area has its own historical interests with which much can be done .	64.26131
park visitors are always eager to learn more about the area they are in .	62.09014
the historical sign tells its story , but nothing gets interest across as well as some of the original historical items or places themselves which still have the character of the period covered .	143.60402
notice should be taken of unusual rock formations , deposits , or shapes of the earth ' s crust in your region .	21.9905
those which tell a story of the earth ' s formation in each area can add geological interest to the recreation sites .	25.182417
an old shipwreck , a high dam , an old covered bridge , a place to find agates or other semi-precious stones or a place to pan gold , etcetera may be of interest .	33.559483
some areas may provide archeological values such as ancient indian village sites or hunting areas , caves , artifacts , etcetera .	13.9236965
how well can the site be developed ? ?	1.0153359
look at the physical features of the land to determine how desirable it is for use , what can be done to correct the faults , and what it will cost to make the area meet your needs in comparison to other sites .	56.764374
-- the size of the area alone can be a determining factor .	21.54204
an area may be too small for the needs of the project .	27.8222
areas should be large enough to include the attractions , have ample space for the use of facilities needed , and have room around the edges to protect the values of the area from encroachment by private developments .	67.65145
acreage in excess of the minimum is good practice as recreation areas are never too large for the future and it is often more economical to operate one large area than several small ones .	67.60299
shape of the area is also related to the use attractions and needs of the development .	54.420776
a large picnic area or camping development is most efficient in shape as a square or rectangle several hundred feet in width in preference to a long narrow area less than one hundred feet wide .	68.78779
this is true because of savings in utility lines and the fact that your buildings have a useful radius equal in all directions .	36.795288
however , a narrow strip may be very practical for small developments , or to provide additional stream frontage for a fisherman ' s trail , or include scenic strips within the park unit .	61.832092
-- the values of the site may be affected by the appearance of the adjoining lands , ownership and use of the land , and the utilities available there .	27.759089
for instance , a site adjoining other publicly owned lands , such as a national forest or a public road , may be desirable , whereas a site next to an industrial plant might not .	60.37917
the utilities available nearby may provide a savings in the cost of extending electricity or water to the site .	45.809444
check the elevation of the ground , degree and direction of slopes , drainage , rock outcrops , topsoil types and quality , as well as subsoil .	15.642665
nearly level areas are required for parking areas , beaches , camp areas , ballfields , etcetera .	9.481384
determine how much topography limits useful area or what the costs of earth moving or grading might be .	105.0418
-- in addition to its recreation interests , water is needed for drinking , sanitation , and irrigation .	19.555515
the quantity and quality of water sources is often a big factor in site selection .	45.37113
the area may provide good springs or opportunities for a well or be near to municipal water lines .	124.25337
figure the cost of providing water to the use areas .	247.9528
-- the existing plant growth calls for thorough checking .	5.5419545
look at the trees as to size and interest , the amount of shade they provide , how healthy they are , the problems of maintenance , fire hazards , wind throw , etcetera .	93.19439
an area may have been partially logged and requires removal of stumps or clean-up .	30.409891
some shrubs may be of good landscaping value , other areas of brush may need to be cleared .	47.937214
the extent and location of open areas is noted .	228.69327
-- how much will wind , rain , sun , and temperature affect the use ? ?	76.06671
an area sheltered from strong winds may be highly desirable for recreation use .	28.563425
the direction , velocity , and season of these winds should be noted as to just how they will affect the recreation use and your maintenance and operation of the area .	79.46284
lack of rainfall and extreme temperatures may call for the development of shade and irrigation of a site to make it useable .	23.127506
sometimes , you have a choice of exposure for sites where the topography or trees of the area will provide afternoon shade , morning sun , or whatever may be most desirable for the use intended .	54.095528
-- some areas may already have been improved and contain buildings , roads , utilities , cleared land , etcetera which may raise the cost of the site .	30.26915
your invitation to write about serge prokofieff to honor his 70th anniversary for the april issue of sovietskaya muzyka is accepted with pleasure , because i admire the music of prokofieff	36.336422
and with sober purpose , because the development of prokofieff personifies , in many ways , the course of music in the union of soviet socialist republics .	19.334364
the serge prokofieff whom we knew in the united states of america was gay , witty , mercurial , full of pranks and bonheur -- and very capable as a professional musician .	33.24499
these qualities endeared him to both the musicians and the social-economic haute monde which supported the concert world of the post-world war 1 , era .	17.462671
prokofieff ' s outlook as a composer-pianist-conductor in america was , indeed , brilliant .	94.70072
prokofieff ' s classical symphony was hailed as an ingenious work from a naturally gifted and well-trained musician still in his twenties .	56.73918
to the traditionalists , it was a brilliant satire on modernism	14.619101
to the neo-classicists , it was a challenge to the pre-war world .	13.90915
a trial balloon to test the aesthetic climate of the times	21.659506
certainly its composer was an ascending star on a new world horizon .	28.20475
i heard the classical symphony for the first time when koussevitzky conducted it in paris in 1927 .	41.855816
i myself was one of the skeptics ( 35 years ago ) .	7.9696507
i remember ernest bloch in the foyer , shouting in his high-pitched voice `` it may be a tour de force , mais mon dieu , can anyone take this music seriously ' ' ? ?	41.2443
the answer is , `` yes ' ' ! !	15.362758
certainly , america took prokofieff and his classical symphony seriously , and with a good deal of pleasure .	45.32434
his life-long friend , serge koussevitzky , gave unreservedly of his praise and brilliant performances in boston , new york , and washington , d . c . , , to which he added broadcastings and recordings for the whole nation .	24.529577
chicago was also a welcome host there , in 1921 , prokofieff conducted the world premiere of the love for three oranges , and played the first performance of his third piano concerto .	43.985516
`` uncle sam ' ' was , indeed , a rich uncle to prokofieff , in those opulent , post-war victory years of peace and prosperity , bold speculations and extravaganzas , enjoyment and pleasure `` the golden twenties ' ' .	41.193043
we attended the premieres of his concertos , symphonies , and suites	4.879911
we studied , taught , and performed his piano sonatas , chamber music , gavottes , and marches	12.086773
we bought his records and played them in our schools and universities .	73.832985
we unanimously agreed that prokofieff had won his rights as a world citizen to the first ranks of twentieth-century composers .	41.23097
nevertheless , prokofieff was much influenced by paris during the twenties the paris which was the artistic center of the western world -- the social paris to which russian aristocracy migrated -- the chic paris which attracted the tourist dollars of rich america -- the avant-garde paris of diaghileff , stravinsky , koussevitzky , cocteau , picasso -- the laissez-faire paris of dadaism and ultramodern art -- the paris sympathique which took young composers to her bosom with such quick and easy enthusiasms .	22.331911
so young prokofieff was the darling of success in his motherland	7.6766186
in the spacious hunting grounds of `` uncle sam ' '	5.3993506
in the exciting salons of his lovely , brilliant paris -- mistress of gaiety -- excess and abandon -- world theatre of new-found freedoms in tone , color , dance , design , and thought .	52.46616
meanwhile , three great terrible forces were coagulating and crystallizing .	10.9223995
in this world-wide conscription of men , minds , and machines , prokofieff was recalled to his native land .	40.315395
the world exploded when fascism challenged all concepts of peace and liberty , and the outraged , freedom-loving peoples of the capitalist and socialist worlds combined forces to stamp fascist tyranny into cringing submission .	23.27832
after this holocaust , a changing world occupied the minds of men	36.022186
a world beset with new boundaries , new treaties and governments , new goals and methods , and the age-old fears of aggression and subjugation -- hunger and exposure .	46.112564
in this changed world , prokofieff settled to find himself , and to create for large national purpose .	117.348724
here , this happy , roving son of good fortune proved that he could accept the disciplines of a new social-economic order fighting for its very existence and ideals in a truculent world .	58.20504
here , prokofieff became a workman in the vineyards of socialism -- producing music for the masses .	76.13965
it is at this point in his life that the mature prokofieff emerges .	34.565132
one might have expected that such a violent epoch of transition would have destroyed the creative flair of a composer , especially one whose works were so fluent and spontaneous .	54.51269
he accepted the environment of his destiny -- took root and grew to fulfill the stature of his early promise .	45.273804
by 1937 he had clarified his intentions to serve his people `` i have striven for clarity and melodious idiom , but at the same time i have by no means attempted to restrict myself to the accepted methods of harmony and melody .	31.100128
this is precisely what makes lucid , straightforward music so difficult to compose -- the clarity must be new , not old ' ' .	44.651306
how clearly he saw the cultural defection of experimentation as an escape for those who dare not or prefer not to face the discipline of modern traditionalism .	60.578526
and with what resource did prokofieff back up his credo of words -- with torrents of powerful music .	88.03807
compare the vast difference in scope and beauty between his neat and witty little classical symphony and his big , muscular , passionate , and eloquent fifth symphony	38.456734
or the love for three oranges ( gay as it is ) with the wonderful , imaginative , colorful , and subtle tenderness of the magnificent ballet , the stone flower .	50.52437
this masterpiece has gaiety , too , but it is the gaiety of dancing people earthy , salty and humorous .	18.985155
of course , these works are not comparable , even though the same brain conceived them .	104.05404
the early works were conceived for a sophisticated , international audience	370.22473
the later works were conceived to affirm a way of life for fellow citizens .	28.346205
however , in all of prokofieff ' s music , young or mature , we find his profile -- his `` signature ' ' -- his craftsman ' s attitude .	52.20464
prokofieff never forsakes his medium for the cause of experimentation per se .	12.188372
in orchestration , he stretches the limits of instrumentation with good judgment and a fine imagination for color .	65.11311
his sense for rhythmic variety and timing is impeccable .	6.4362917
his creative development of melodic designs of slavic dance tunes and love songs is captivating witty , clever , adroit , and subtle .	25.911438
his counterpoint is pertinent , skillful , and rarely thick .	117.293846
also , it should be noted that the polytonal freedom of his melodies and harmonic modulations , the brilliant orchestrations , the adroitness for evading the heaviness of figured bass , the skill in florid counterpoint were not lost in his mature output , even in the spectacular historical dramas of the stage and cinema , where a large , dramatic canvas of sound was required .	46.463673
that prokofieff ' s harmonies and forms sometimes seem professionally routine to our ears , may or may not indicate that he was less of an `` original ' ' than we prefer to believe .	81.56623
need for novelty may be a symptom of cultural fatigue and instability .	18.938177
prokofieff might well emerge as a cultural hero , who , by the force of his creative life , helped preserve the main stream of tradition , to which the surviving idioms of current experimentalism may be eventually added and integrated .	40.876354
at this date , it seems probable that the name of serge prokofieff will appear in the archives of history , as an effective traditionalist , who was fully aware of the lure and danger of experimentation , and used it as it served his purpose	41.948612
yet was never caught up in it -- never a slave to its academic dialectics .	47.94409
certainly , it is the traditional clarity of his music which has endeared him to the western world -- not his experimentations .	31.186876
so prokofieff was able to cultivate his musical talents and harvest a rich reward from them .	33.64507
nor can anyone be certain that prokofieff would have done better , or even as well , under different circumstances .	34.766136
his fellow-countryman , igor stravinsky , certainly did not .	22.120762
why did prokofieff expand in stature and fecundity , while stravinsky ( who leaped into fame like a young giant ) dwindled in stature and fruitfulness ? ?	31.970427
i think the answer is to be found in prokofieff ' s own words `` the clarity must be new , not old ' ' .	61.49217
when prokofieff forged his new clarity of `` lucid , straightforward music , so difficult to compose ' ' , he shaped his talents to his purpose .	17.541761
when stravinsky shaped his purpose to the shifting scenes of many cultures , many salons , many dialectics , many personalities , he tried to refashion himself into a stylist of many styles , determined by many disparate cultures .	22.857426
prokofieff was guided in a consistent direction by the life of his own people -- by the compass of their national ideas .	58.73785
but stravinsky was swayed by the attitudes of whatever culture he was reflecting .	69.69159
in all his miscalculations , stravinsky made the fatal historical blunder of presuming that he could transform other composers ' inspirations -- representing many peoples , time periods and styles -- into his own music by warping the harmony , melody , or form , to verify his own experiments .	39.243282
because of the authentic homogeneity of his early nationalistic materials , and his flair for orchestrations -- his brilliant petruchka , his savage sacre du printemps , his incisive les noces -- the world kept hoping that he could recapture the historical direction for which his native talents were predisposed .	28.747574
but time is running out , and many of stravinsky ' s admirers begin to fear that he will never find terra firma .	27.080105
his various aesthetic postulates remain as landmarks of a house divided against itself supra-expressionism , neo-paganism , neo-classicism , neo-romanticism , neo-jazz , neo-ecclesiasticism , neo-popularism , and most recently , post-serialism -- all competing with each other within one composer ! !	35.04226
what a patchwork of proclamations and renunciations ! !	1.1172913
meager and shabby by-products linger to haunt our memories of a once mighty protagonist	73.69506
a maladroit reharmonization of our national anthem ( the star-spangled banner )	3.2360332
a poor attempt to write an idiomatic jazz concerto	75.25385
his hopes that the tunes from his old music might be used for popular american commercial songs ! !	77.21236
stravinsky , nearing the age of eighty , is like a lost and frantic bird , flitting from one abandoned nest to another , searching for a home .	50.637043
prokofieff was able to adjust his creative personality to a swiftly changing world without losing his particular force and direction .	64.85069
in the process , his native endowments were stretched , strengthened and disciplined to serve their human purpose .	79.466286
with a large and circumspect 20th-century technique , he wove the materials of national heroes and events , national folklore and children ' s fairy tales -- slavic dances and love songs -- into a solid musical literature which served his people well , and is providing much enjoyment to the world at large .	49.5446
of course , it must not be forgotten that in achieving this historical feat , prokofieff had the vast resources of his people behind him	48.34112
it must be conceded that his native land provided prokofieff with many of the necessary conditions for great creative incentive economic security and cultural opportunities , incisive idioms , social fermentations for a new national ideology -- a sympathetic public and a large body of performers especially trained to fulfill his purpose .	93.1911
thus in prokofieff the union of soviet socialist republics produced one of the great composers of the twentieth century .	15.430415
that his moods , even in his early years , are those of his people , does him honor , as his music honors those who inspired it .	93.2147
that he mastered every aspect of his medium according to his own great talents and contemporary judgments , is a good and solid symbol of his people under the tremendous pressures of proclaiming and practising the rigors of a new culture	32.76914
and perhaps of even greater significance -- his music is strong 20th-century evidence of the effectiveness of evolution , based on a broad traditionalism for the creative art of music .	41.944324
april 10 marked a memorable date in new york ' s musical history -- indeed in the musical history of the entire eastern united states .	22.645163
on that date the musicians emergency fund , organized to furnish employment for musicians unable to obtain engagements during the depression and to provide relief for older musicians who lost their fortunes in the stock market crash , observed its 30th anniversary .	42.533005
roy mason is essentially a landscape painter whose style and direction has a kinship with the english watercolorists of the early nineteenth century , especially the beautifully patterned art of john sell cotman .	25.008871
and like this english master , mason realizes his subjects in large , simplified masses which , though they seem effortless , are in reality the result of skilled design born of hard work and a thorough distillation of the natural form that inspired them .	77.722496
as a boy roy mason began the long process of extracting the goodness of the out-of-doors , its tang of weather , its change of seasons , its variable moods .	47.831005
his father , a professional engraver and an amateur landscape painter , took his sons on numerous hunting expeditions , and imparted to them his knowledge and love of nature .	45.45254
out of this background of hunting and fishing , it was only natural that roy first painted subjects he knew best hunters in the field , fishermen in the stream , ducks and geese on the wing -- almost always against a vast backdrop of weather landscape .	52.023083
it is this subject matter that has brought mason a large and enthusiastic following among sportsmen , but it is his exceptional performance with this motif that commends him to artists and discerning collectors .	64.981445
mason had to earn the privilege of devoting himself exclusively to painting .	34.274654
like many others , he had to work hard , long hours in a struggling family business which , though it was allied to art of a kind -- the design and production of engraved seals -- bore no relation to the painting of pictures .	85.66409
but it did teach roy the basic techniques of commercial art , and later , for twelve years , he and his sister nina conducted an advertising art studio in philadelphia .	35.159992
on the death of their father , they returned to their home in batavia , new york .	14.355197
after more years of concentrated effort , roy and his brother max finally established a thriving family business at the old stand .	67.218704
during all this time roy continued to paint , first only on weekends , and then , as the family business permitted , for longer periods .	67.03242
gradually he withdrew from the shop altogether , and for the past thirty years , he has worked independently as a painter , except for his continued hunting and fishing expeditions .	36.229176
but even on these , the palette often takes over while the shotgun cools off ! !	47.18569
except for a rich friendship with the painter , chauncey ryder who gave him the only professional instruction he ever had -- and this was limited to a few lessons , though the two artists often went on painting trips together -- roy developed his art by himself .	98.93408
in the best tradition , he first taught himself to see , then to draw with accuracy and assurance , and then to paint .	46.940083
he worked in oil for years before beginning his work in watercolor , and his first public recognition and early honors , including his election to the academy , were for his essays in the heavier medium .	91.41813
gradually watercolor claimed his greater affection until today it has become his major , if not exclusive , technique .	178.47911
it has been my privilege to paint with roy mason on numerous occasions , mostly in the vicinity of batavia .	11.191645
more often than not i have found easy excuse to leave my own work and stand at a respectable distance where i could watch this man transform raw nature into a composed , not imitative , painting .	84.07155
what i have observed time and time again is a process of integration , integration that begins as abstract design and gradually takes on recognizable form	77.34314
color patterns that are made to weave throughout the whole composition	28.761595
and that over-all , amazing control of large washes which is the mason stylemark .	26.001295
finally come those little flicks of a rigger brush and the job is done .	36.801178
but for the technical fact , we have the artist ' s own testimony	46.358143
`` of late years , i find that i like best to work out-of-doors .	89.087814
first i make preliminary watercolor sketches in quarter scale ( approximately af inches ) in which i pay particular attention to the design principles of three simple values -- the lightest light , the middle tone , and the darkest dark -- by reducing the forms of my subject to these large patterns .	86.01533
if a human figure or wild life are to be part of the projected final picture , i try to place them in the initial sketch .	66.21161
for me , these will belong more completely to their surroundings if they are conceived in this early stage , though i freely admit that i do not hesitate to add or eliminate figures on the full sheet when it serves my final purpose .	45.89673
`` i am thoroughly convinced that most watercolors suffer because the artist expects nature will do his composing for him	111.17545
as a result , such pictures are only a literal translation of what the artist finds in the scene before him .	64.96441
just because a tree or other object appears in a certain spot is absolutely no reason to place it in the same position in the painting , unless the position serves the design of the whole composition .	41.839615
if the artist would study his work more thoroughly and move certain units in his design , often only slightly , finer pictures would result .	63.078957
out of long experience i have found that incidental figures and other objects like trees , logs , and bushes can be traced from the original sketch and moved about in the major areas on the final sheet until they occupy the right position , which i call clicking .	55.50649
`` speed in painting a picture is valid only when it imparts spontaneity and crispness , but unless the artist has lots of experience so that he can control rapid execution , he would do well to take these first sketches and soberly reorder their design to achieve a unified composition .	52.718956
`` if i have seemed to emphasize the structure of the composition , i mean to project equal concern for color .	50.973145
often , in working out-of-doors under all conditions of light and atmosphere , a particular passage that looked favorable in relation to the subject will be too bright , too dull , or too light , or too dark when viewed indoors in a mat .	52.63228
when this occurs , i make the change on the sketch or on the final watercolor -- if i have been working on a full sheet in the field .	31.646612
`` when working from one of my sketches i square it up and project its linear form freehand to the watercolor sheet with charcoal .	77.22013
when this linear draft is completed , i dust it down to a faint image .	39.235348
from this point , i paint in as direct a manner as possible , by flowing on the washes with as pure a color mixture as i can manage .	90.3738
however , first i thoughtfully study my sketch for improvement of color and design along the lines i have described .	78.39717
then i plan my attack the parts i will finish first , the range of values , the accenting of minor details -- all in all , mechanics of producing the finished job with a maximum of crispness .	66.2399
the longer i work , the more i am sure that for me , at least , a workmanlike method is important .	36.598686
trial and error are better placed in the preliminary sketch than in hoping for miracles in the final painting .	113.343925
`` as for materials , i use the best available .	23.322021
i work on a watercolor easel in the field , and frequently resort to a large garden umbrella to protect my eyes from undue strain .	51.390514
in my studio i work at a tilt-top table , but leave the paper unfixed so that i can move it freely to control the washes .	59.748817
i have used a variety of heavy-weight hand-made papers , but prefer an english make , rough surface , in 400-pound weight .	99.51434
after selecting a sheet and inspecting it for flaws ( even the best sometimes has foreign ' nubbins ' on its surface ) , i sponge it thoroughly on both sides with clean , cold water .	66.845764
then i dry the sheet under mild pressure so that it will lie flat as a board .	53.371075
`` in addition to the usual tools , i make constant use of cleansing tissue , not only to wipe my brushes , but to mop up certain areas , to soften edges , and to open up lights in dark washes .	46.235123
the great absorbency of this tissue and the fact that it is easier to control than a sponge makes it an ideal tool for the watercolorist .	36.435112
i also use a small electric hand-blower to dry large washes in the studio .	42.338852
`` my brushes are different from those used by most watercolorists , for i combine the sable and the bristle .	25.07441
and a very large , flat wash brush .	5.3090115
the bristles are a fitch 2 and a one-half inch brush shaved to a sharp chisel edge .	10.8661375
`` my usual palette consists of top-quality colors alizarin crimson , orange , raw sienna , raw umber , burnt sienna , sepia , cerulean blue , cobalt blue , french ultramarine blue , winsor green , hooker ' s green 2 , cadmium yellow pale , yellow ochre , payne ' s gray , charcoal gray , davy ' s gray , and ivory black ' ' .	9.334803
in analyzing the watercolors of roy mason , the first thing that comes to mind is their essential decorativeness , yet this word has such a varied connotation that it needs some elaboration here .	96.638596
true , a mason watercolor is unmistakably a synthesis of nature rather than a detailed inventory .	50.704792
unlike many decorative patterns that present a static flat convention , this artist ' s pictures are full of atmosphere and climate .	54.191128
long observation has taught mason that most landscape can be reduced to three essential planes a foreground in sharp focus -- either a light area with dark accents or a dark one with lights	104.55787
and a background , usually a silhouetted form foiled against the sky .	3.9026604
in following this general principle , mason provides the observer with a natural eye progression from foreground to background , and the illusion of depth is instantly created .	27.674288
