this has been the aim of the director of the shooting development program , the new york staff of the sportsmen ' s service bureau , and the saami shooting preserve field consultants since the start of the program in 1954 .	18.785233
following the kick-off of saami ' s shooting development program in 1954 , a most interesting meeting took place in washington , d . c . .	19.018137
the group known as the american association for health , , physical education , and recreation ( a division of the national education association ) initiated a conference which brought together representatives of the national rifle association , saami and the american fishing tackle manufacturers .	40.64793
this meeting was called to determine how these groups might cooperate to launch what is known as the outdoor education project .	80.93214
the outdoor education project took cognizance of the fact , so often overlooked , that athletic activities stressed in most school programs have little or no relationship to the physical and mental needs and interests of later life .	114.360374
the various team sports assuredly have their place in every school , and they are important to proper physical development .	47.645874
but with the exception of professional athletes , few contact sports and physical education activities in our schools have any carryover in the adult life of the average american man or woman .	78.0808
following a vigorous campaign of interpretation and leadership development by oep director dr . julian smith , today thousands of secondary schools , colleges and universities have shooting and hunting education in their physical education and recreation programs .	72.86835
saami ' s financial support since 1955 has contributed to the success of this project in education .	16.124249
personnel assigned through the shooting development program have proudly participated in over 53 state and regional workshops , at which hundreds of school administrators , teachers , professors , and recreational leaders have been introduced to outdoor education .	30.766851
considering that the current school-age potential is 23 million youths , the project and its message on hunting and shooting education have many more to reach .	92.37109
in 1959 saami ' s shooting development program announced a new activity designed to expose thousands of teen-age boys and girls to the healthy fun enjoyed through the participation in the shooting sports .	90.70069
this program is now nationally known as `` teen hunter clubs ' ' .	4.2949767
teen hunter clubs were initially sponsored by affiliated members of the allied merchandising corporation .	18.499638
the first program was sponsored by abraham & strauss , hempstead , new york , under the direction of special events director jennings dennis .	25.339857
other pilot programs were conducted by a & s , babylon , new york	10.823341
other thc activities followed , conducted by shopping centers , department stores , recreation equipment dealers , radio-tv stations , newspapers , and other organizations interested in the need existing to acquaint youngsters with the proper use of sporting firearms and the development of correct attitudes and appreciations related to hunting and wise use of our natural resources .	35.530987
saami ' s field men have served as consultants and/or have participated in 75 teen hunter club activities which have reached over 40 , 000 enthusiastic young americans .	75.40914
through the efforts of saami ' s shooting development program these shooting activities , and many others , including assists in the development of public and privately financed shooting parks , trap and skeet leagues , rifle and pistol marksmanship programs have been promoted , to mention only a few .	36.553654
the continuation and expansion of the shooting development program will assure to some degree that national and community leaders will be made aware of the ever-growing need for shooting facilities and activities for hunting and shooting in answer to public demand .	67.14563
while individual sportsmen are aware of this situation , too many of our political , social , educational and even religious leaders too often forget it .	97.24363
help is needed from dealers , at the grass-roots level .	9.479395
the american gun and ammunition producers sponsor a successful promotional program through their industry trade association .	76.85675
since saami ' s conception in 1926 , and more specifically since the adoption of the shooting development program in 1954 , millions of dollars and promotional man-hours have gone into the development of more places to shoot for more youths and adults .	30.481356
we trust that you , as a gun and ammunition dealer , have benefited through additional sales of equipment .	40.43993
are you getting top dollar from the shooting sports ? ?	10.599114
are you looking ahead to the exploding market of millions of american boys and girls , who will grow up to enjoy a traditional american way of life -- ranging the fields with a fine american gun and uniformly excellent ammunition ? ?	53.385914
is your sporting firearms and ammunition department primed for the expanding horizons ? ?	6.0213747
would you like to organize teen hunters clubs , shooting programs , and have information on seasons including six months of hunting with unlimited game bags on shooting preserves ? ?	73.59709
we were camping a few weeks ago on cape hatteras campground in that land of pirates , seagulls and bluefish on north carolina ' s famed outer banks .	27.08793
this beach campground with no trees or hills presents a constant camping show with all manner of equipment in actual use .	291.99268
with the whole camp exposed to view we could see the variety of canvas shelters in which americans are camping now .	126.05359
there were umbrella tents , wall tents , cottage tents , station wagon tents , pup tents , pop tents , baker tents , tents with exterior frames , camper trailers , travel trailers , and even a few surplus parachutes serving as sunshades over entire family camps .	13.020108
moving around camp we saw all kinds of camp stoves , lanterns , coolers , bedding , games , fishing tackle , windbreaks and sunshades .	7.17634
we saw similar displays in the other three campgrounds in this 70-mile-long national seashore recreation area .	20.581142
dealers would do well to visit such a campground often , look at the equipment and talk with the campers .	56.612865
here you begin to appreciate the scope of the challenges and possibilities facing the industry .	25.003332
almost every official who reflects on it thinks this movement of americans to canvas dwellings opens one of the most promising of all outdoor markets .	112.45228
you read various guesses on how many americans are camping .	6.505018
the number depends on who is talking at the moment .	13.133666
the figures range as high as 15 million families .	15.926499
i ' ve heard 10 million mentioned often , but i ' m more inclined to think there may be a total of some five to seven million families camping .	85.99391
seven million families would total 30 million americans or more .	82.24827
consider the equipment needed to protect this many from the weather , to make their cooking easy and their sleeping comfortable .	57.858704
harassed state park officials often have more campers than they know what to do with .	53.991955
they are struggling to meet the demand for camping space , but families are being turned away , especially on holiday weekends .	114.59127
the national parks , always popular camping places , are facing the same pressure .	64.30091
the national park service hopes by 1966 to have 30 , 000 campsites available for 100 , 000 campers a day -- almost twice what there are at present .	92.20066
the u . s . forest service cares for hundreds of thousands of campers in its 149 national forests and is increasing its facilities steadily .	36.516937
they bring their families and tents and camp kitchens and bedding .	4.894062
they bring their fishing rods and binoculars and bathing suits .	36.22658
they come prepared for family fun because americans in ever-growing numbers are learning that here is the way to a fine economical vacation that becomes a family experience of lasting importance .	67.05745
there are a half dozen reasons helping to account for the migration to the campgrounds .	18.965422
among them , according to the u . s . department of commerce , are ( 1 ) shorter work weeks , ( 2 ) higher pay , ( 3 ) longer paid vacations , ( 4 ) better transportation , ( 5 ) earlier retirement , and ( 6 ) more education .	58.63887
the more people learn about their country , the more they want to learn .	56.716564
camping is family fun , and it is helping more americans see more of the country than they ever saw before .	124.60599
but make no mistake about it , the first reason people turn to camping is one of economy .	170.86624
here is the promise of a vacation trip they can afford .	56.97956
the american automobile association , computing the cost for two people to vacation by automobile , comes up with an average daily expenditure figure of $29 .	89.02251
the aaa then splits it down this way $10 . 50 for meals , $9 . 50 for lodging , $7 for gas and oil , and $2 for tips and miscellaneous .	39.69826
what does the camping couple do to this set of figures ? ?	167.83183
the $9 . 50 for lodging they save .	114.9733
because they prepare their own meals they also keep in their pockets a good portion of that $10 . 50 food bill along with most of the tip money .	139.72015
the automobile expenses are about the only vacationing cost they can ' t either eliminate or pare down drastically by camping along the way .	71.71985
where americans used to think of a single vacation each summer , they now think about how many vacations they can have .	100.547
long weekends enable many to get away from home for three or four days several times a year .	63.135983
and even if they stay in resorts part of the time , they might , if the right salesman gets them in tow , develop a yearning to spice the usual vacation fare with a camping trip into the wide open spaces .	41.186707
it would be a mistake to sell those thousands of beginning campers on the idea they ' re buying the comforts of home .	59.330112
home is the place to find the comforts of home .	16.532248
they ' re buying fun and adventure and family experiences .	55.959766
but it would also be a mistake for them not to realize how comfortable camping has become .	171.89035
this is no longer a way of life for the bearded logger and the wandering cowboy .	11.785861
today ' s campers want comforts , and they have them .	70.973236
and this helps explain why so many people are now going camping .	40.924244
it ' s fun , and it ' s easy -- so easy that there is time left after cooking , and tent keeping , for the women to get out and enjoy outdoor fun with their families .	66.773605
neither are beds , thanks to air mattresses and sleeping bags .	9.121341
neither are shelters , because there is one to meet the needs of every camper or prospective camper .	42.6809
but there is still the sometimes complex problem of helping campers choose the best equipment for their individual needs .	97.82908
throughout history , the man who showed superior performance has become the commander of others -- for good or bad .	156.08873
since the industrial revolution , when factories emerged , this classical pattern has been followed .	100.2814
there have always been tales of disillusionment -- the competent technician who became an administrator , willingly or not , and found he didn ' t like it	33.892914
the scientist who rebelled against the personnel and paper work	891.7138
and much more commonly in recent years , the engineer who found that other duties interfered with -- or eliminated -- his engineering contributions .	88.16604
there have been many extremely competent men who have been converted into very incompetent managers or submerged in paper work , to their own and the public ' s dissatisfaction and loss .	54.139267
this has been more evident since our products have incorporated astronomically increased technology .	61.338245
the remedies have been many and varied -- attempts to teach management techniques -- either in plant , at special schools , or in university `` crash ' ' courses -- provision of management-trained assistants or associates .	70.382385
but the realization has been growing that these are not the complete answer .	58.672432
some men have no talent for or interest in management	56.29425
forcing them into management can only create trouble .	5.485322
the old shop adage still holds `` a good mechanic is usually a bad boss ' ' .	46.091858
yet our economy clings inexorably to recognition of managerial status as the gage of success .	77.50173
labor fights to change its collar from blue to white .	32.167652
all grades of management seek more resounding titles and incomes because of social pressures .	32.30056
as several recent books have over-emphasized , we have become the most status-conscious nation in the world .	17.206583
what can be done for the `` individual contributor ' ' who is extremely important -- and likely to be more so -- in the operation of the technically oriented company ? ?	26.02305
he is usually conscious of the social pressures at home and outside	299.54575
usually concerned about america ' s belief that attainment and success are measured in dollars and titles .	96.36779
yet titles are traditionally given only to management men , and income tends to rise with title .	169.1188
even the college professor in america has been affected .	25.093336
it is , as one engineer says , `` indeed a difficult thing for the engineer to accept that he can go as far on his technical merit as he could employing managerial skills .	72.250305
this difficulty arises even though we can give examples of men who have actually followed this course .	62.06057
this leads one to conclude , as you have , that there is inevitably more prestige in a management position in the minds of our people ' ' .	37.750668
nobody should be more able to answer the questions on this score than engineering vice-presidents and chief engineers .	34.6744
so we asked such men in major companies in the design field to offer their opinions on the `` dual-road-up ' ' problem -- and more importantly -- their solutions .	43.058285
in the paragraphs that follow , we quote from 32 men who are identified on the final page .	32.348827
among the more familiar plans for dual-channel advancement is that of general electric .	86.52856
there is no one point in a man ' s career at which he must select either the technical or the managerial path upward .	81.509735
further , the management path does not open the door to higher opportunities than are offered by the more technical path .	113.099846
it is common to shift back and forth , working up through a number of supervisory and individual-contributor positions .	33.39625
actually , there are a number of individual-contributor positions in both operating departments and in the company-wide `` services ' ' operation that are filled by men with successful managerial experience who are currently broadening their capabilities .	48.533886
also , moving into a managerial position does not necessarily end a man ' s recognition as a technical expert .	35.17632
as examples at ge glen b . warren , formerly manager of the turbine division , widely recognized as a turbine designer .	13.105642
the late w . r . g . baker , a pioneer in television design and long-time vp & gm of the electronics division , and later , by his own choice , an individual consultant .	35.857204
harold e . strang , expert in switchgear design , for a long period vp & gm of the measurements & industrial products division , and who currently , approaching retirement , is vice-president and consulting engineer in the switchgear & control division .	49.42493
in the ge plan , a number of individual contributors have positions and compensation higher than those of many managers .	80.014084
westinghouse has a similar system , with two classifications representing various levels of competence on the strictly technical side consulting engineer or scientist , as the case may be , and advisory engineer or scientist .	51.762566
many companies have systems , particularly in r & d , which work more or less well , depending upon size and actual belief in the policy on the part of administration , as will be abundantly apparent in subsequent quotations .	63.54578
another factor that may hold hope is for parallel recognition is , as one man says it `` that the fad for educating top people along managerial lines is yielding to the technically trained approach ' ' .	51.620453
one company instituted , early in 1959 , a vertical classification system consisting of four levels .	59.258186
there is no formal equivalence to the supervisory ranks	2.5928056
the top non-supervisory level , senior staff engineer , enjoys status and pay ranging up to that for the second level of engineering supervision .	101.69555
the second level , senior engineer , rates slightly below first-level supervision .	16.75847
the expectation is that first-level supervisors will be selected in approximately equal numbers from the second and third engineering level , with very few coming from the first level .	65.524185
the company expects to extend upward both compensation and status for non-supervisory engineers , but probably not into executive levels .	195.0432
in this organization , about half of the engineers with 15 or more years of employment are in supervision , engineering or elsewhere .	87.10858
this reflects the very heavy engineering content of the products -- which are not military .	100.52016
`` we have over 20 divisions -- each of which has an engineering department headed by a chief engineer .	73.35793
we have set up a central r & d department , as well as engineering-management departments -- about 80 people working on problems related to those of our plants .	83.90515
a separate research department is , of course , confined to new or future designs .	58.693787
part of this headquarters staff , however , are engineering managers who work between divisional chief engineers and headquarters management .	78.039825
these headquarters engineers , headed by the vice-president -- engineering , counsel and advise divisional managers and chief engineers on product problems as well as aid with design	50.3744
and many are engineers who have been advanced from the divisions .	42.180676
they must learn to wear several hats , so to speak , working with management , sales and engineering problems related to the product .	59.851868
`` we do not have people in our organization termed ' consultants ' or ' fellows ' , who are specialists in one particular technical subject .	69.46631
i suppose it is because we are just not big enough .	112.96321
we have a few ' consultants ' -- retired engineers retained and called in on certain problems .	311.8229
the only ' fellows ' in our company are those who have been honored by asme , aiee or aiche .	18.962538
i am sure that the engineer who enters management is nearly always opening the door to greater possibilities than he would have as a technical specialist -- because of his wider accountability ' ' .	58.39168
`` we have tried to make both paths attractive , so that good men could find opportunity and satisfaction in either .	137.23132
one way to formalize this is in the job structure .	204.83574
we have these positions , which compare directly af	378.2414
`` above these jobs we have chief engineer for the company and vice-president of engrg , r & aj .	33.414154
the latter jobs include major management responsibilities and have been filled by those who have come up primarily through the engineering-management side .	77.81657
we have not yet succeeded in establishing recognition of technical specialization comparable to our higher levels of management , but i believe we will trend in this direction but not to exceed vice-president ' ' .	49.409508
approximately four years ago , we initiated a dual ladder of advancement for technical persons .	22.502522
the highest position is known as a ' research scientist .	23.638237
the primary deterrent appears to lie with the technical people themselves , and their concept of what constitutes status in present-day society .	115.94646
scientists who agitate hardest for technical recognition are often the most reluctant to accept it .	29.526045
we have discovered that the outward trappings such as private offices and private secretaries are extremely important	76.02446
and although we have attempted to provide these status symbols , support of the ' dual-ladder ' plan has been half-hearted despite the creation of a salary potential for a research scientist commensurate with that of men in top managerial positions .	59.03127
`` a serious problem accompanying the technical-ladder approach is the difficulty of clearly defining responsibilities and standards of performance for each level .	101.2856
with no set standards , there is the tendency to promote to the next highest level when the top of a salary band is reached regardless of performance .	78.98164
promotion is too often based on longevity and time in salary grade instead of merit .	228.9429
if no specific organization plan exists limiting the number of scientists at each salary level , the result is a department top-heavy with high-level , high-salaried personnel ' ' .	41.21153
`` we have two approaches for the technical man the position of staff engineer , which is rated as high in salary as department manager	166.69806
and an administrative organization to take the routine load away from department managers and project engineers as much as possible , thus allowing them more time for strictly technical work .	161.26466
these are only halfway measures , and the answer will come when some way is found to allow the technical man in industry to progress without limit in salary and prestige ' ' .	114.20589
`` we have made limited application of the ' parallel ladder ' plan .	150.24046
the highest rated non-supervisory engineering title is ' research engineer .	13.744983
the salary schedule permits remuneration greater than the average paid to the first level of engineering supervision ( engineering section head ) .	54.890778
we also have an ' engineering section head -- research engineer ' classification which has salary possibilities equivalent to that of a research engineer .	130.82417
above this point there is no generally used parallel ladder .	88.03471
`` we also do a number of things to build up the prestige of the engineer as a ' professional ' and also to give public recognition to individual technical competence .	80.67818
these include encouragement of , and assistance to , the engineer in preparation and publication of technical papers .	143.06299
we have two media for publicizing individual technical activity , a magazine widely distributed both within and without the company , and an information bulletin for engineering personnel distributed to the homes of all engineers .	80.776566
publicity is given to the award of patents to our engineers and financial support is provided for individual membership in technical societies .	69.821915
`` a recent , and more pertinent action , has been the establishment of a technical staff reporting to the vice-president for engineering .	22.828289
this function is staffed by engineers chosen for their technical competence and who have the title , member of the technical staff .	46.537
salaries compare favorably with those paid to the first two or three levels of management .	47.865322
additional symbols of status are granted , such as reserved parking , distinctive badge passes authorizing special privileges , and a difference in the treatment of financial progress through merit .	62.972088
`` we presently are involved in inaugurating a new development center .	62.5401
operations of this nature offer the best opportunity to recognize scientific status .	30.837572
all scientific staff members will have the title , ' research-staff member .	121.73371
the salary level of an individual within the group will reflect the scientific community ' s acceptance of him as an authority in his scientific field .	63.369972
contrary to usual organization-position evaluations , the position to which research-staff members report administratively will not necessarily encompass the duties of the research-staff member , therefore , are not necessarily evaluated as highly .	42.46711
`` these recent steps do not offer the possibility of extension to the great number of senior engineers who have displayed technical competence .	26.327133
it is doubtful that the complete solution to the over-all problem can result entirely from company efforts .	207.72935
fundamental to the difficulty of creating the desired prestige is the fact that , in the business community , prestige and status are conferred in proportion to the authority that one man has over others and the extent of which he participates in the management functions ' ' .	51.520542
sixty miles north of new york city where the wooded hills of dutchess county meet the broad sweep of the hudson river there is a new home development called `` oakwood heights ' ' .	28.678665
as a matter of fact you could probably find a new home development in every populated county in the country with three-bedroom ranch style cottages in the $14 , 000 range .	82.528336
but oakwood heights is unique in one particular .	4.798975
its oil for heating is metered monthly to each home from a line that starts at a central storage point .	107.69767
this is a pilot operation sponsored by a new entity chartered in delaware as the tri-state pipeline corporation , with principal offices in new york state .	27.191519
its president is otis m . waters , partner in the law firm of timen & waters , 540-k chrysler bldg . , new york city .	47.600513
vice-president is louis berkman and the secretary-treasurer is mark ritter .	11.765187
ritter is the builder of oakwood heights and president of kahler-craft distributors , inc . , newburgh , n . y . .	4.525101
the idea of a central tank with lines to each house is not in itself a novelty .	66.524086
not a year goes by but what several local companies in the u . s . and canada , even overseas , write to fueloil & oil heat to inquire if it ' s feasible and where it is being done .	40.054955
its editors only knew of one example to point to , a public housing development of 278 homes in new haven described by john schulz in the march , 1950 issue .	64.56458
this has survived the years but there has been considerable concern among the tenants over the fact that the oil was not metered .	26.420471
rather the monthly total consumption was divided and charged on the basis of number of rooms and persons in the family .	42.294743
common complaints included `` mrs . murphy ' ' leaving her windows open all the time , a fresh air fan , or the family was visiting `` aunt minnie ' ' with the house shut up but they still paid the same rate for oil .	53.69571
as a result of that attitude , others have been discouraged from trying central distribution .	341.21893
a new low capacity meter is the key that unlocks the situation at oakwood heights .	20.199757
called a `` slo-flo ' ' meter it was designed for this job by power plus industries of los angeles , a key individual being don nelson .	148.63654
tri-state has acquired its exclusive distribution for the northern , principal heating states .	254.81172
there ' s an advantage in having a firm like tri-state headed by a lawyer .	145.02855
the earlier new haven development was public housing , so it easily leaped over the problems met in a private venture .	85.25866
these have to do with property rights , municipal official attitudes and a host of others .	116.36774
in working out the practical legal conclusions president waters was not thinking only of this pilot project , for it is planned to duplicate this program or system in other builder developments nationally .	123.11277
it is always difficult , or at least time-consuming , to get approval of any kind of line under a public street , as one example .	74.49297
to overcome this , the builder lays and completes the street himself , then deeds it to the community while retaining a perpetual easement for the oil lines .	46.16368
when a family buys a home the title is subject to a perpetual easement to tri-state .	28.33078
for the central storage , tri-state buys one acre , buries its tanks and simply holds permanent title to that piece .	77.95606
in other words , the whole storage and pipeline system does not belong to the homeowners nor to the town but rather to tri-state .	51.666725
how does tri-state get its revenue from this plan ? ?	25.497335
it leases the whole facility to a large oil company , at least large enough to have a strong credit position .	57.756054
this first test is being leased for ten years but future projects will require at least 15 years .	45.905674
the amount paid by the oil company to tri-state for the use of its oil distribution system and the privilege of supplying all the homes , is subject to negotiation but naturally must be profitable to both parties .	44.332127
on this first venture the central storage is 20 , 000 gallons , in two tanks , or an average of 400 gallons for each of the 50 homes .	43.64697
the supplier delivers at his convenience in transport loads , so as to maintain two-to-three weeks reserve supply against weather contingencies .	90.22701
however , that is not all he has to do .	16.679626
he must undertake complete servicing of the oilheating equipment to assure fine heating .	119.178566
in the present project the heating is by circulating hot water from paragon boiler-burner units with summer-winter domestic hot water hookups .	30.85941
again , the oil man must read the meters at such intervals as he finds best .	51.440872
for this first development the supplier signing the lease is a major oil company but in turn the deal is being transferred for operation to its local fueloil distributor .	52.96527
the major gets the assured gallonage for the life of the lease and the distributor apparently can do well because delivery cost is low .	73.91047
the officers of the new corporation have naturally explored many angles , as well as personalities that might be affected .	39.549496
for example , the officials of poughkeepsie town ( township ) where the project is located think highly of it because it simplifies their snow clearing problem .	192.62054
the central storage is near a main artery quite easy to reach with large transports on a short crescent swing , with fewer trucks in the residential streets .	23.051786
the public service commission has ruled that this is not a public utility , subject to their many regulations .	44.040913
several financial institutions , both banks and insurance companies , have been sounded out .	35.472557
they like it and would supply most of the capital because of the long term leases by strong oil companies .	72.61687
the government housing agencies consider it feasible with one special stipulation .	45.48539
there must be a restriction in the deed to provide that the customer may not be charged more than the current market price for the oil , an obvious precaution , since the account is permanently wedded , just like with gas or electricity .	45.666386
for a few details of the system the lines are 1-1/4 ' ' ' ' x-tru-coat , a product of republic steel corp . , and all lines are welded .	24.129547
they are laid a minimum of 24 ' ' ' ' deep and in some areas four feet down , particularly under roads , to stay clear of all other piping such as water and sewers and to minimize shocks from heavy trucking .	61.002693
the meter is mounted high on the basement wall .	7.366337
its figures are a half inch high and very easy to read , even into tenth gallons .	44.670532
it will accommodate firing rates as low as a half gallon an hour .	26.245886
ritter , the builder , is convinced that the total cost of all the heating systems plus the oil distribution system is no greater than would be gas heating systems in the houses plus their lines and meters .	91.89044
he believes that this is a sound approach to gas competition in builder developments where gas is available .	100.390915
it would be pretty difficult to install a tri-state system in old neighborhoods , and that ' s an understatement .	23.96919
the job of getting property easements and street easements and the acre for the tanks would become pretty discouraging .	49.690746
but in a new development where everything starts from scratch the solutions are simple .	71.03475
what does tri-state actually want to do , now that it has the meters under franchise and certain phases of its piping system in the `` patent applied for ' ' stage ? ?	53.96057
it wants to interest builders and oil companies in the idea of including its facility in their new home projects , by financing and installing the storage , piping and meters , and leasing these for 15 years , with renewal options , to a strong oil company .	55.771988
it may also work in one other way -- by licensing its system patents and supplying the meters , letting the oil company or even the builder install the facilities .	96.9979
this whole development is certain to be of interest to the readers , for the idea has so often been mentioned , somewhat wistfully .	70.11681
but it ' s too early yet to go visit oakwood heights .	57.067093
only eight of the 50 houses were completed at the time of the editor ' s visit on june 8th	37.051975
the big tanks were at the site but still sunning themselves .	18.639042
a big mechanical ditcher was running the trenches , and the town building inspector was paying a friendly , if curious , visit .	40.96457
the oilheating industry is looking up , led by a revival of research and development .	25.816092
a primary ingredient in these fields is imagination , and tri-state pipeline corporation deserves a very good mark .	74.0423
every year about this time national gargle your cooling system week rolls around .	171.54227
it pays in the long ( hot ) run to take good care of the water works .	150.6108
first , drain that old coolant down the storm sewer .	31.202682
don ' t save the anti-freeze , even if it the expensive `` permanent ' ' type .	58.53606
the word means it won ' t boil away easily , nothing else .	63.658928
the rust inhibitors in the fluid are used up after one year , and you don ' t want to risk the rust that two years ' use could mean .	103.49294
if a lot of rust shows in the drain , use a good flushing cleaner .	20.018555
then fill the system and add a rust inhibitor .	2.8722363
of course , you ' ll want to use the softest water you can in your radiators .	31.11983
now , check for leaks in your hoses and hose connections , around the freeze-out plugs , gaskets , water pump seals and heater fittings .	8.840078
next , run the engine and let it heat up so the thermostat opens , and then look for leaks again .	48.248615
be sure the bugs and dirt are blown out of the radiator fins .	18.62854
check the temperature gage and be sure it is working .	25.915045
if you use one of the new year-round cooling system fluids such as `` dowguard ' ' be sure to check it .	31.873327
dow says that the fluid can be used now for two years .	92.66473
check its inhibitor effectiveness before leaving it in during the summer .	78.1947
take precautions now , to be sure you avoid those unpleasant and costly heat breakdowns when the temperature zooms this summer .	39.801056
don ' t let your mechanics pull the thermostats out of those fueloil delivery trucks or installation rigs of yours .	39.654716
spring and summer may be here officially , but those thermos stay in .	151.42993
the fact is that removing and leaving out a thermostat from any water cooled vehicle , will greatly increase the fuel consumption , reduce power and contribute to spark plug fouling due to an accumulation of excessive carbon deposits on the insulators .	37.55219
if you run into excess plug fouling on one truck , check to be sure that the rig has a thermostat .	25.937132
the thermostat is important to get your engine up to operating temperature quickly , and to keep it running at its most efficient temperature through the proper circulation of the coolant .	82.90019
are you paying too much for your truck insurance ? ?	6.4358196
there ' s a good chance you are doubling on some coverage , not taking discounts coming to you and not cutting some corners that can be cut .	107.34611
be careful that you keep adequate coverage , but look for places to save money .	71.61398
first go over the type of coverage you now have .	59.43123
look for these features which may mean you can save	40.33527
for example , don ' t pay in a truck policy for medical coverage that you may be paying for in a health and accident policy .	56.21287
does your policy have a lay-up clause ? ?	1.0596746
this means that if your insured vehicle is laid up for more than 30 days , insurance can be suspended and a proportionate return of your premium made to you .	41.23667
this applies to repair work of winter storage .	2.4880118
with many company policies you get a fleet discount if you insure five or more rigs .	31.213842
usually premium reductions can be obtained by applying deductibles to your liability plan .	18.854567
for example if your bodily injury claims start payment after the first $250 , a 25% premium saving is often made .	41.285397
in the period since the end of world war 2 , -- a period coinciding with merchandising demands for the colorful , the unusual , and the original in signs and displays -- plastics have come on so strong that today they are the acknowledged leaders in the field .	72.121544
the importance of the sign industry to the plastics industry , however , is not in terms of volume alone .	32.82184
designers of signs and displays have shown a refreshing approach to the adaptation of plastics that has influenced the workings of other industries .	24.768658
many of today ' s developments in thermoforming stem from original work done with signs and displays	72.597824
the art of preprinting in distortion was similarly perfected by the sign makers	22.37055
and the reverse-surface decorating techniques now used for escutcheons , medallions , etc . , owes much to the field , as does the technology of designing with the light-transmitting properties of the transparent plastics .	15.062476
there is much that many industries can continue to learn from some of the more recent developments described below .	50.418488
the concept of trans-illumination ( as shown by the photo on p . 92 ) , as just one example , offers an entirely new approach to lighting problems -- no matter what industry is involved .	56.366936
according to a recent wall street journal survey , plastics units now account for more than 50% of all sign sales .	151.5773
five years ago , they had only 10% of the market , with the remainder firmly entrenched in the stronghold of neon tubing .	16.938517
and it ' s far from the end for plastics .	91.712585
industry sources are now estimating that 75% of the signs made during the 1960 ' s will be of plastic construction .	91.88439
evidence of this trend can best be seen in the recent activities of such leading companies in the field as advance neon sign co . , los angeles , calif . .	20.40807
four years ago , the company ' s entire line was devoted to neon signs	30.57839
from the volume standpoint , the total market represented by the sign industry is impressive .	79.8036
aggregate sales during 1960 reached approximately $500 million .	7.3305187
currently , there are some 6000 companies in the field , ranging from small firms with a handful of employees to major concerns having complete facilities for production of metal , electrical , and plastic components .	41.667465
what accounts for the rapid growth of plastics in the sign and display field ? ?	19.878267
out of many factors which might be cited , five are most important 1 .	130.1737
plastics combine such properties as built-in color , light weight , optional transparency or translucency , resistance to corrosion , as well as the ease of fabrication .	18.13061
according to one major producer , materials for a typical plastic sign are approximately 25% less costly than for a comparable neon unit .	78.61144
a 3-by-6-ft . plastic sign weighs about 120 lb . , compared to 275-300 lb . for neon .	14.189751
the weight advantage , plus greater durability of the plastic unit , yields a saving of about one-fifth in shipping .	44.376987
the lighter weight also means less costly supports and mountings are needed .	35.9393
finally , maintenance costs on plastic signs are much lower than on fragile neon signs .	29.434195
they offer exceptional design freedom , making it possible to incorporate contours and details which give free range to the talents of the designer .	36.23559
vacuum- and pressure-formed sheet plastics fill the gap between cardboard and molded plastics .	4.228922
pre-decoration , low-cost molds , and the freedom to form large and small , thick and thin materials make plastics tailor-made for the industry .	86.84382
internal illumination , protected from the elements , gives them powerful visual appeal at night	212.93474
during daylight hours their brilliant colors command attention and interest .	64.3336
advances in equipment and fabrication techniques give the sign or display manufacturer an extremely wide choice of production techniques , ranging from injection molding for intricate , smaller-size , mass-production signs ( generally 5000 units is the minimum ) to vacuum and pressure forming for larger signs of limited runs .	78.32046
among the newest fabrication methods to enter the display field are expandable styrene molding and blow molding .	29.964146
for outdoor signs and displays , acrylic , with its outstanding optical characteristics , weather resistance and formability , strongly dominates the picture .	65.04202
at present , both the familiar cast acrylic and the newer extruded sheets are being used by sign manufacturers , with extruded now representing an estimated 10% of the total .	29.315918
( see panel , p . 166 , for a comparison .	173.57684
of interest is a recent announcement by du pont ' s polychemicals dept . of a new methyl methacrylate monomer designated as monocite h 100 , which was developed specifically for production of cast acrylic sheets for the sign and lighting industry .	24.503712
sheeting cast from this material reportedly weighs only one-third as much as glass , is impervious to all kinds of weather , and will not yellow .	42.5371
its high impact strength , even at low temperatures , resists chipping , cracking , and crazing , according to du pont .	6.790561
cellulose acetate butyrate is used extensively for vacuum-formed signs , background panels , and molded or formed letters because of its exceptional toughness , ease of forming , and excellent weathering properties .	43.852158
its clarity and good optical properties are other important factors .	14.564488
new to the field is a duplex type butyrate laminate in which the two sheets of the laminate are of different color .	30.712471
thermoforming the laminate and then sanding away the top layer is a quick and economical way to produce a two-color sign .	24.39881
( see mpl , mar . 1961 , p . 98 ) .	8.521927
for specialized types of displays , such as large three-dimensional units reproducing a product , package , human or animal figures , etc . , reinforced plastics and rotationally molded vinyl plastisols are other materials frequently used .	43.791904
a relative newcomer in outdoor signs is mylar polyester film , now used as a printed overlay for trans-illuminated signs ( see below ) .	22.89964
for outdoor signs and displays , where the problem of weathering resistance is no longer a factor , the choice of plastics is almost unlimited .	45.03346
here may be found regular and impact styrene , cellulose acetate , cellulose butyrate and cellulose propionate , acrylic , vinyl , expandable styrene foam , and polyethylene .	3.741712
the final choice of material depends upon such factors as costs , method of fabrication , degree of complexity , number of units required , time available for tooling , and projected life expectancy of the unit .	64.34265
often , the finished sign or display incorporates several types of plastics and two or more fabricating techniques .	17.339296
one of the most significant advancements in design of plastics signs is the so-called trans-illuminated billboard , now being produced by several large sign manufacturers such as advance neon sign co . , los angeles , and industrial electric inc . , new orleans , la . .	36.764275
the essential difference between the new trans-illuminated boards and existing billboards is that the former , constructed of translucent plastic panels , are lighted from within .	62.380165
with the source of light behind the copy , there is no loss of lumen output , as with conventional boards illuminated by means of reflected light .	35.217026
also , the light sources are shielded from dirt and weather exposure and cannot obstruct the view of the sign .	29.96151
the copy itself , including any text or illustrations , is reproduced in full color directly on a thin mylar polyester film by a photo screen process .	48.96083
the film has an adhesive on the back which permits it to be stripped onto the acrylic panels forming the sign , and also to be stripped off for replacement by new copy as required .	38.63395
spare sets of face panels simplify the change from one copy or message to another	203.98735
new panels are exchanged for the old right in the field on a single trip .	42.492218
panels with outdated copy are returned to the sign shop so a new message can be applied .	87.885025
signs of this type have already made their appearance in several larger cities , and others are on the way .	38.832893
it is believed that these boards will , within the next few years , replace many of the conventional flood-lighted boards now in use .	51.2371
trans-illuminated signs also show versatility in other directions .	3.2040672
as used by industrial electric inc . , the film panels are printed one at a time , as are 24-sheet posters .	31.508173
thus the film can be applied to back-lighted translucent plastics faces	169.16647
they can also be applied to opaque panels for use on cutouts , or they can be applied directly to painted bulletin faces .	78.87261
in this way , the sign maker has an economical means for displaying uniform copy on different sign media .	90.262344
recently industrial electric unveiled another new development made possible by modern plastic materials -- a revolving spectacular sign .	85.13938
comprised of 16 triangular trans-illuminated plastic sections , it makes it possible to combine three different signs in a single unit .	91.384834
the triangles automatically revolve in a cycle which permits 9 sec . of viewing time for each poster subject .	131.5811
sixteen panels , each slightly more than 1-1/2 ft . wide , make up the 25-ft . length of the sign .	49.563515
perhaps the best way to indicate the versatility of design that characterizes the use of plastics in signs and displays would be to look at what is happening in only one of the areas in this complex field -- changeable signs .	49.48936
signs are meant to convey a message , and in most cases , this requires words and letters .	70.531685
frequently , the message must be changed at intervals to feature new products , price changes , etc . .	81.67093
the huge market for changeable signs has spurred a universal demand for individual plastic letters , in all shapes and sizes -- and a number of companies are set up to supply them .	41.835052
here are some of the newer items currently available	4.7077446
poster products inc . , chicago , ill . a changeable copy and display sign which consists of an extruded impact styrene background in choice of colors , onto which are mounted snap-in letters , figures , or words screened on acetate or other types of sheet stock .	85.398544
the background , which is available in various widths and continuous lengths , is extruded with parallel undercut grooves which grip the flexible letters securely .	15.990203
the adaptaplex co . , beaverton , ore . letters molded of butyrate , available in several sizes in either red or black .	89.83922
ideal for merchandising use , they are weather-resistant , and have mounting pegs on the back which fit into openings in a vacuum-formed waffle-pattern background panel .	35.223793
for large letters , e . g . thermoformed of acrylic or butyrate , there are other techniques .	31.99328
for example , in a typical store installation , fifty 24-in . and six 36-in . red acrylic letters were mounted against a white painted wood background .	50.753582
the fact that even the larger letters weighed only 5 lb . each made it possible to secure the letters to the building through clear acrylic angle brackets cemented to the letters .	42.10833
stainless steel screws were used to minimize corrosion stains .	18.633812
for mounting to corrugated plastic backgrounds , very small holes may be drilled in the sides of the letters and stainless steel wire threaded through the openings , its ends twisted behind the panels .	16.091839
large injection-molded letters are also available for sign installations .	4.122105
wagner sign service inc . , chicago , for example , supplies them in several colors , in heights of 4 , 6 , 8 , 10 , and 17 inches .	43.38069
they are molded of a special weather-resistant formulation of tenite butyrate .	5.3354893
also available from this company are snug-grip plasti-bars , extruded of transparent acrylic material , which may be cemented to any corrugated acrylic background material .	12.139991
made in lengths from 3 to 10 ft . , the bars are shaped in cross section to provide a secure fit for the tapered slots molded in back of the letters .	54.982147
still another approach to the changeable letter type of sign is a modular unit introduced by merritt products , azusa , calif . .	23.482674
this vacuum formed sign is comprised of 27-in . ( or smaller ) panels formed of 0 . 080-in . clear butyrate sheet stock , masked and sprayed on the rear side .	43.94362
finished signs are produced by sliding the separate letter panels into channels of 0 . 025-in . aluminum , which may be mounted to various surfaces .	44.293186
the sheets are extruded of tenite butyrate by jet specialties co . , los angeles , calif . .	9.154738
on large-area units , where additional structural requirements are imposed , one recent approach utilizes modular extruded or formed channels ( e . g . right-angled corrugations ) of the acrylic or butyrate .	17.017483
joined side by side , such channels make possible construction of continuous two-dimensional luminous areas up to 50 ft . high and of unlimited width .	54.08285
letters may be wired to the face of the combined channels , painted on the first surface , or handled in other ways .	44.61733
don ' t build from the outside in -- try to build from the inside out	45.773724
don ' t insert your components into fixed openings , they may or may not fit	76.2095
position your components before you close them in .	559.63715
don ' t wall in your kitchen before you hang the wall cabinets and set the appliances .	21.75142
it ' s a lot quicker and easier to dimension the kitchen to fit the cabinets and erect the end wall after they are all in place .	46.368973
set your bathtub before you close in the end of the bathroom .	13.287744
don ' t try to wrestle a 400-lb . tub af through a narrow doorway .	29.816322
finish your plumbing before you frame it in ( most economical framing is a thin non-bearing partition on either side of the pipes ) .	36.47581
finish installing and connecting up your furnace and your water heater before you wall them in .	72.76956
there is no better way to waste time than trying to install a furnace in a finished af closet .	57.7218
don ' t position your studs before you insert your windows in conventional construction	181.63092
that way you may pay more to shim the window into place than you paid for the window .	104.914856
you can save all that shimming time if you set your windows in one , two , three order -- first the stud on one side , then the window , then the stud on the other side .	40.47752
install your disappearing stair ( or stairs ) to the attic and finish your overhead ducts before you drywall the ceiling .	26.663074
don ' t close in your house until everything has been carried in .	127.08398
last wall bob schmitt erects is the wall between the house and garage .	9.179468
that way he can truck his parts right indoors and unload them under the roof .	26.038143
no auto maker would dream of putting the head on the engine before he fitted the pistons in the block .	50.86081
and trailer makers , those most industrialized and therefore most efficient of homebuilders , say they save hundreds of dollars by always building from the inside out .	80.245285
new rule no . 3 rethink everything to get all the big savings the revolution in materials handling offers you	252.71233
this revolution is the biggest build-better-for-less news of all , because 1 .	256.92282
it makes it easy to handle much heavier units , so you can plan to build with much bigger and heavier prefabricated components like those shown in the pictures alongside .	52.59064
it makes materials handling the only construction cost that ( like earthmoving and roadbuilding ) should be lower today than in 1929 .	38.206287
it changes the answers to `` who should do what , and where ' ' ? ?	14.135603
it lessens the need for costly on-site fabrication and increases the chance for shop fabrication , where almost everything can be made better and cheaper .	70.46334
it changes the answers on when to do what at the site .	31.500257
for example , instead of putting in your driveways last ( as many builders do ) you can now save money by putting them in first .	157.50922
instead of closing the house in first ( as most builders do ) you can now cut your costs by not closing it in until you have to ( see p 121 ) .	101.93966
not so long ago many builders were finding they could cut their costs by `` buying direct ' ' and short-cutting the dealer .	55.41536
but now many of these same builders are finding they can cut their costs more by teaming up with a dealer who has volume enough to afford the most efficient specialized equipment to deliver everything just where it is needed -- drywall inside the house , siding along the sides , trusses on the walls , roofing on the roof , etc . .	36.265446
says clarence thompson `` we dealers must earn our mark-up by performing a service for the builder cheaper than he could do it himself ' ' .	38.620033
the revolution now under way in materials handling makes this much easier .	131.72072
the revolution is well under way , but much more remains to be done	124.25781
five years ago a house & home round table cosponsored by the lumber dealers ' research council reported unhappily	25.133898
`` only one lumber dealer in ten is equipped to handle unit loads	4.625271
only one box car in eight has the wide doors needed for unit loads	193.76892
only one producer in a hundred is equipped to package and ship unit loads	81.78827
only one builder in a thousand is equipped to receive unit loads .	16.722979
`` so from raw materials to finished erection the costs of materials handling ( most of it inefficient ) add up to one-fourth of the total construction cost of housing ' ' .	53.465534
`` that house & home round table was the real starting point for today ' s revolution in materials handling ' ' , says clarence thompson , long chairman of the lumber dealers ' research council .	34.5001
`` it made our whole industry recognize the need for a new kind of teamwork between manufacturer , carrier , equipment maker , dealer , and builder , all working together to cut the cost of materials handling .	39.465862
before that we lumber dealers were working almost single-handed on the problem ' ' .	13.54186
almost all of the 3 , 000 lumber dealers who cater primarily to the new-house market and supply 90% of this year ' s new houses are mechanized .	30.129025
there are few areas left where a builder cannot find a dealer equipped to save him money by delivering everything at lower cost just where his workmen will need it .	208.97209
practically all bulky housing products can now be ordered in standard units palletized or unitized for mechanical handling -- including lumber , asphalt shingles , glass block , face brick , plaster , lime , hardboard , gypsum wallboard and sheathing , cement , insulation sheathing , floor tile , acoustical tile , plaster base , and asbestos shingles .	18.204977
truck and materials-handling equipment makers now offer specialized units to meet almost every homebuilding need .	53.860058
for some significant new items see the pictures .	44.320724
an nlrda survey found that at least 492 lumber mills will strap their shipments for mechanized handling .	26.053667
of these , 376 said they make no extra charge for strapping in standard units , because they save enough on mechanized carloading to offset their strapping cost .	44.53335
most of the others will swallow their $ . 50 to $3 charge rather than lose a good customer .	84.7084
`` with a 15 , 500-lb . fork-lift , dealers can unload unitized lumber from wide-door box cars for $ . 30/mbf compared with $1 . 65 or more to unload loose lumber one piece at a time ' ' , says james wright of aj .	36.39771
lumber dealers and lumber manufacturers have agreed on a standard unit for unitized shipments -- 48 ' ' ' ' wide by a nominal 30 ' ' ' ' high ( or six mccracken packets 24 ' ' ' ' wide by nominal 7 ' ' ' ' high ) .	21.46787
these units make it easy to load as much as 48 , 000 bd/ft ( say 120 , 000 lb in a 50 ' box car ) much more than the average for loose-loaded cars .	32.39618
the railroads have responded by adding 20 , 000 more box cars with doors 12 ' or wider for forklift unloading ( a 21% increase while the total number of box cars was falling 6% ) and by cutting their freight rates twice on lumber shipped in heavily loaded cars .	62.043144
first was a 1958 cut of more than 50% on that portion of the load in excess of 40 , 000 lb	15.340351
later came a 1961 cut on the west coast ( still pending elsewhere ) of $ . 07/cwt on 70 , 000 lb-plus carloads ( which works out to more than $4/mbf on that portion of the load in excess of 70 , 000 lb .	29.107683
more unitized lumber is being shipped on flat cars , and nlrda studies show that flat cars loaded with the new type 6-b floating-load method can be unloaded for as little as $ . 054/mbf .	33.598835
for long hauls these shipments should be protected with water-proof paper .	78.89022
this costs from $ . 75 to $2 . 30/mbf , but the cover can pay off if the lumber is to be stored in the open .	45.949974
these carriers cut handling costs for the dealer -- and the builder	77.60843
says nrlda ' s james wright `` since 1958 carriers that move material from the yard to the job site have undergone more radical changes than any of the dealer ' s other equipment ' ' .	104.48256
the reason today ' s components and lumber packages are far too bulky to be handled by a truckdriver and a helper .	7.845148
so manufacturers have pioneered a new type of vehicle -- the self-unloading carrier .	29.954796
it cuts the lumber dealer ' s cost because it takes only one man -- the driver -- to unload it , and because it unloads in a fraction of the time and at a fraction of the cost of hand unloading .	40.7368
and it helps the builder because it can handle a more efficiently packaged load , can deliver it to the best spot ( in some cases , right on the roof or inside the house ) , and never takes any of the builder ' s high-priced labor to help unload it .	45.206596
says wright `` our survey shows that one third of the retail dealers plan to increase the mechanization of their materials handling in the coming two years .	43.317772
and most of the gain will be in self-unloading vehicles ' ' .	34.359158
restudy what your men do , to help them waste less of the time you pay for	95.592545
half the manhours you pay for on most jobs are wasted because the job was not planned right , so the right tools were not handy at the right place at the right time , or the right materials were not delivered to the handiest spots or materials were not stacked in the right order for erection , or you bought cheap materials that took too long to fit , or your workmen had to come back twice to finish a job they could have done on one trip .	88.08069
even `` america ' s most efficient builder ' ' , bob schmitt of berea , hopes to cut his labor costs another $2 , 000 per house as a result of the time-&-motion studies now being completed on his operation by industrial efficiency engineers from the stanley works .	63.37357
already this study has suggested ways to cut his foundation manhours from 170 to 105 by eliminating idle time and wasted motion .	42.78927
builder eddie carr of washington , past president of nahb , cut his bricklaying costs $150 a house by adopting the `` scr masonry process ' ' worked out after careful time-&-motion studies by the structural clay products research foundation to help bricklayers do better work for less .	40.527996
a midwestern builder cut his labor costs per thousand bricks from $81 to $43 . 50 by adopting this same process , cut them another $7 . 50 to $36 by buying his bricks in convenient , easy-to-spot 100-brick packages .	38.003307
the scr process , with its precision corner-posts , its precision guide lines , its working level scaffold , and its hand-level brick supply takes eight manhours to get set , but once ready it makes it easy for bricklayers to lay a thousand bricks a day .	77.36253
one good way to cut your labor waste is to make sure you are using just the right number of men in each crew .	70.76629
reports jim lendrum `` by studying men on the job , we found that two men -- a carpenter and a helper -- can lay a floor faster than three .	46.327026
we found that three men -- two carpenters and a helper -- can put up wall panels or trusses more economically than four men -- because four men don ' t make two teams	62.19243
we found that wherever you can use two teams on a job , five men , not four , is the magic number ' ' .	66.20997
no house was ever built that could not have been built better for less if the work had been better planned and the work better scheduled .	124.581924
don ' t waste any $ . 10-a-minute time on green lumber to save $ . 03 a stud	24.9481
this is the most penny-wise , pound-foolish chisel a builder can commit .	135.50151
green lumber was all very well back in the days of wet plaster , when the framing lumber was bound to swell and then shrink as tons of water dried out the gypsum .	35.192
but now that all production builders build with drywall and all smart builders build with panels , green lumber is an anachronism you cannot afford .	54.03534
dry studs cost less than $ . 03 more .	237.47067
so if a green stud makes a carpenter or a drywall finisher or anybody else waste even 20 seconds , the green stud becomes more expensive than a dry stud .	26.275305
there comes a time in the lives of most of us when we want to be alone .	68.57749
not necessarily to be off all by ourselves , but away from the crowds and common happenstance .	55.4658
if you ' ve travelled in europe a time or two , it is quite certain that you ' ve had that wanting-to-be-alone feeling or that you will get it on your next visit across the atlantic .	78.52519
following a guide , and gratefully so , is an excellent way to see all the important places when everything is strange and new .	133.02332
however , after you ' ve seen all the historical piazzas and plazas , the places and forums , the churches and museums , the palaces and castles , and begin to feel at home in the capitals of europe , you ' ll want to change your course and follow the by-roads at will , far from the market places .	32.61318
the champagne at troyes , the traditional capital of the champagne country , has more ambrosial taste somehow than it has at a sidewalk cafe on the rue de la paix or at tour d ' argent .	25.733519
you can relive history and follow , in fancy , the crusaders in their quest for the holy grail as they sail out from brindisi , an ancient town in the heel of italy ' s boot .	26.108406
and you don ' t meet the folks from home in northwest spain which has remained almost untouched by time and tourists since the middle ages .	77.92745
time stands still as you climb the narrow , stone stairways in tiny villages clinging to steep mountain slopes or wander through story-book towns , perched atop lofty crags , their faces turned to the sea .	20.453888
they ' ve been there since the days of the moors and the saracens .	8.347826
and what better way to end a day than by dining with artists and gourmets in a squat but charming fisherman ' s village on the mediterranean ? ?	29.189558
an almost too-simple-to-be-true way to set forth on such adventures is just to put yourself behind the wheel of a car and head for the open road .	72.70224
for those who need or want and can afford another car , buying one and driving it on the grand tour , then shipping it home , is one popular plan for a do-it-yourself pilgrimage .	89.20514
then , of course , there are those of us who either do not want or need or cannot afford another car .	116.77546
the answer to this diathesis is to pick up a telephone and arrange to rent one .	36.727783
almost any travel agent will reserve a car for you .	42.8663
you can call one of the car rental services directly ( hertz , avis , auto-europe nationalcar rental , and others ) and ask them to reserve a car of your choice , and some transportation lines offer this service as well .	48.858772
with few exceptions , your car will be waiting for you at dockside , airport , railroad station or hotel when you arrive , oftentimes at no additional cost .	59.31334
you can wait , of course , until you arrive in europe before renting your car .	49.77657
the disadvantages to this method are that you may not have as great a choice of models readily available or you may have to wait a few days or , during the busy tourist season , when cars are in great demand , you might find it fairly difficult to get a car at all .	68.8264
since charges are relatively the same , reserving a car before you leave for europe will assure you of having one on tap when you want it .	119.38868
for those who plan to travel to europe by one route and return by another some agencies offer a service whereby you can pick up a car in one city on arrival and leave it in another city , or even another country , when you are ready to return home .	101.43853
at some cities , this pick-up and delivery service is without additional charge , and , if you are budget-wise , when you are planning your itinerary , you will take advantage of these free delivery and collection stations in major cities within the larger european countries .	44.728504
international touring documents are usually provided with the car as are road maps and touring data .	511.0363
a valid american driving license is accepted in all countries except portugal , spain , yugoslavia and eastern europe .	18.199665
if you plan to visit any of these countries , you can obtain your international driving permit before you leave at a nominal fee -- around $3 . 00 .	63.32672
your insurance , too , with most agencies , is provided with the car , covering comprehensive fire , theft , liability and collision with a deductible clause which varies in different countries .	49.59742
if you would feel happier with full collision insurance , there is a small additional charge , again varying from country to country and depending on the term of such insurance .	76.2204
the average charge for this additional insurance coverage is roughly $1 . 00 a day .	23.4585
the charge is variable , however , and goes as low as $ . 50 a day in ireland and as high as $2 . 00 a day in greece .	63.4425
rental fees are variable , too , throughout the countries of europe .	8.921822
there are as many rates as there are countries and models of cars available .	94.69878
as in the united states , there is a flat fee-per-day rental charge plus a few cents per kilometer driven , and the per-day rate drops if the car is retained for a week .	29.787489
it drops again after fifteen and/or twenty-one days .	3.9260333
it is well to bear in mind that gasoline will cost from $ . 80 to $ . 90 for the equivalent of a united states gallon and while you might prefer a familiar ford , chevrolet or even a cadillac , which are available in some countries , it is probably wiser to choose the smaller european makes which average thirty , thirty-five and even forty miles to the gallon .	40.17276
your choice of model will undoubtedly be governed by the number of people travelling in your group .	11.208691
with the exception of the sports cars , even the quite tiny sedans will seat four passengers if you are willing to sacrifice comfort and luggage space for really economical transportation .	108.44458
there is a large variety of models to choose from in most countries , however , including 6-passenger sedans and station wagons and the rental fee isn ' t all that much greater than for the wee sedans .	50.196243
the basic costs are generally pretty much the same regardless of the agency through which you reserve your car , but some of them offer supplementary advantages .	55.438408
there is the free intra-city `` rent it here , leave it there ' ' service , as an example , the free delivery and collection at the airport , dockside or your hotel , luggage racks , touring documents and information and other similar services .	52.14504
a little investigation by telephone or reading the travel ads in the newspapers and magazines will give you these pertinent details on the additional money-saving benefits .	43.32174
the investigation will be well worth your time .	7.947143
all model cars are not available in all countries .	3.4622896
quite naturally , there is a greater availability of those models which are manufactured within a specific country .	53.43787
if you would like to start your tour in italy , where the rental fees are actually the lowest in europe , fiats in all sizes are available , as are alfa romeo giulietta models .	29.328054
if you wish to budget closely on transportation , saving your extra dollars to indulge in luxuries , one agency lists the small fiat 500 at only $1 . 26 a day plus $ . 03 a kilometer and the fiat 2100 station wagon , seating six , at just $1 . 10 a day and $ . 105 a kilometer .	62.697666
if you will be using your car more than fifteen days , which isn ' t all unlikely , the daily rates drop quite sharply to $ . 86 a day for the fiat 500 and to an infinitesimal $ . 30 a day for the fiat 2100 station wagon .	45.696632
with six in the group , the cost comes to just a nickel a day per person on the daily fee .	99.564125
in the majority of countries , however , the rates range from $3 . 00 to $3 . 50 a day for the smaller sedans and graduate up to $7 . 00 and $8 . 00 a day for the larger , luxury european models , with the rate per kilometer driven starting at $ . 03 and going up as high as $ . 12 .	36.944904
the same model car might be available in six or eight countries , yet not two countries will have the same rate either for the daily rate or rate per kilometer driven .	68.33555
rates for american cars are somewhat higher , ranging from about $8 . 00 a day up to $14 . 00 a day for a chevrolet convertible , but the rate per kilometer driven is roughly the same as for the larger european models .	24.394552
rates in greece and finland are fairly high , actually the highest in europe , and , surprisingly enough , they are also quite high in ireland .	68.31072
if you are planning to tour europe for longer than a month , it might be wise for you to lease a car .	34.878857
the actual over-all cost , for the first month , will perhaps not be too much lower than the rental charges for the same period of time , but you will receive a new car .	44.323673
you will be entitled to all the advantages of a new car owner , which includes the factory guarantee and the services valid at authorized dealers throughout europe .	75.75144
further , there is no mileage charge or mileage limitations when you lease a car , and you pay only the flat monthly rate plus a nominal charge for documents and insurance since the car is registered and insured individually for your trip .	49.504044
there is a fairly wide selection of models of english , german and french manufacture from which you can choose from the very small austin 7 , citroen 2 cv , volkswagens , renaults to the 6-passenger simca beaulieu .	26.611666
leasing a car is not as common or as popular as renting a car in europe , but for long periods it will be unquestionably more economical and satisfactory .	57.616535
after the first month , rates are considerably less , averaging only about $60 a month for most 4- and 5-passenger models .	34.400806
there are reasons for some people not wanting to rent cars and going on the do-it-yourself plan .	72.60042
for one thing , the driver usually sees less and has less fun than his passengers since it becomes pretty necessary for him to keep at least one eye on the road .	92.4114
then , too , european drivers have reputations for being somewhat crazy on the road and some americans are not particularly keen on getting mixed up with them .	104.11648
still there is a way for those who want to see some of the back country of europe by car .	91.2649
the way is to rent a chauffeur-driven car .	6.7301884
it isn ' t as expensive as most people believe it to be .	45.050922
your chauffeur ' s expenses will average between $7 . 00 to $12 . 00 a day , but this charge is the same whether you rent a 7-passenger cadillac limousine or a 4-passenger peugeot or fiat 1800 .	17.606398
the big spread is in the charge for each kilometer driven , being governed by the rate at which gasoline is consumed .	28.556356
since most european cars average more miles per gallon of gasoline than american cars , it naturally follows that the cost per kilometer for these models will be less , but the greater seating capacity of the large american cars will equalize this , provided your group is sufficiently large to fill a 7-passenger limousine .	59.653168
the fees for the rental of chauffeur-driven cars vary in the different countries in the same manner as they do for the drive-yourself cars .	28.619139
however , whether you arrange to have a european or american model , if you rent a car with the proper seating capacity in relation to the number of people in your party , your transportation expense will average very close to $10 . 00 per day per passenger .	60.603226
this will include your helpful , english-speaking chauffeur and a drive of an average of 150 kilometers in any one day .	44.11803
if you drive greater distances than that , you ' ll just be skimming the surface and will never discover the enchantment , fascination and beauty which lured you in the first place to explore the hinterlands .	19.313622
of course , if you want to throw all caution to the winds and rent an imperial or cadillac limousine just for you and your bride , you ' ll have a memorable tour , but it won ' t be cheap , and it is not recommended unless you own a producing oil well or you ' ve had a winner in the irish sweepstakes .	50.990093
in american romance , almost nothing rates higher than what the movie men have called `` meeting cute ' ' -- that is , boy-meets-girl seems more adorable if it doesn ' t take place in an atmosphere of correct and acute boredom .	27.752266
just about the most enthralling real-life example of meeting cute is the charles macarthur-helen hayes saga reputedly all he did was give her a handful of peanuts , but he said simultaneously , `` i wish they were emeralds ' ' .	64.43833
aside from the comico-romantico content here , a good linguist-anthropologist could readily pick up a few other facts , especially if he had a little more of the conversation to go on .	35.837643
the way macarthur said his line -- if you had the recorded transcript of a professional linguist -- would probably have gone like this af primary stresses on emeralds and wish	97.826515
note pitch 3 ( pretty high ) on emeralds but with a slight degree of drawl , one degree of oversoftness .	21.34326
conclusions the people involved ( and subsequent facts bear me out here ) knew clearly the relative values of peanuts and emeralds , both monetary and sentimental .	59.296543
and the drawling , oversoft voice of flirtation , though fairly overt , was still well within the prescribed gambit of their culture .	46.025047
in other words , like automation machines designed to work in tandem , they shared the same programming , a mutual understanding not only of english words , but of the four stresses , pitches , and junctures that can change their meaning from black to white .	52.92666
at this point , unfortunately , romance becomes a regrettably small part of the picture	36.482414
but consider , if you can bear it , what might have happened if macarthur , for some perverse , undaunted reason , had made the same remark to an eskimo girl in eskimo .	30.723251
to her peanuts and emeralds would have been just so much blubber .	21.701117
the point -- quite simply -- is this words they might have had	208.61
this basic principle , the first in a richly knotted bundle , was conveyed to me by dr . henry lee smith , jr . , at the university of buffalo , where he heads the world ' s first department of anthropology and linguistics .	18.737309
a brisk , amusing man , apparently constructed on an ingenious system of spring-joints attuned to the same peppery rhythm as his mind , smith began his academic career teaching speech to barnard girls -- a project considerably enlivened by his devotion to a recording about `` a young rat named arthur , who never could make up his mind ' ' .	43.6027
later , he became one of the central spirits of the army language program and the language school of washington ' s foreign service institute .	114.12847
it was there , in the course of trying to prepare new men for the `` culture shock ' ' they might encounter in remote overseas posts , that he first began to develop a system of charting the `` norms of human communication ' ' .	46.509567
to the trained ear of the linguist , talk has always revealed a staggering quantity of information about the talker -- such things as geographical origin and/or history , socio-economic identity , education .	51.173164
it is only fairly recently , however , that linguists have developed a systematic way of charting voices on paper in a way that tells even more about the speakers and about the success or failure of human communication between two people .	75.071495
this , for obvious reasons , makes their techniques superbly useful in studying the psychiatric interview , so useful , in fact , that they have been successfully used to suggest ways to speed diagnosis and to evaluate the progress of therapy .	28.07847
