as for me , i am holding in reserve two huge puzzles ( i love puzzles ) to put together when time hangs heavy on my hands .	97.42376
so far , the covers have never been off the boxes .	57.349346
i just don ' t have time to do half the things i want to do now .	37.68059
so in closing , fellow retired members , i advise you to make the most of each day , enjoy each one to the n ' th degree .	57.56466
keep occupied to the point you are not bored with life and you will truly find these final days and years of your lives to be sunshine sweet .	108.63395
to one and all -- good days ahead ! !	11.328856
what does it mean to be creative , a term we hear with increasing frequency these days ? ?	223.05763
when we turn to noah webster we find him helpful as usual .	105.820335
`` to be creative is to have the ability to cause to exist -- to produce where nothing was before -- to bring forth an original production of human intelligence or power ' ' .	114.66544
we are creative , it seems , when we produce something which has not previously existed .	113.019295
thus creativity may run all the way from making a cake , building a chicken coop , or producing a book , to founding a business , creating a league of nations or , developing a mature character .	55.427917
all living creatures from the lowest form of insect or animal life evidence the power of creativity , if it is only to reproduce a form like their own .	59.870277
while man shares this procreative function with all his predecessors in the evolutionary process , he is the only animal with a true non-instinctive and conscious creative ability .	33.364597
an animal , bird or insect creates either a burrow , or nest or hive in unending sameness according to specie .	15.528203
man ' s great superiority over these evolutionary forbears is in the development of his imagination .	16.407703
this gives him the power to form in his mind new image combinations of old memories , ideas and experiences and to project them outside of himself into his environment in new and ever-changing forms .	101.11757
it has been truly said that anything man can imagine he can produce or create by projecting this inner image into its counterpart in the objective world .	106.28857
in our own time we have seen the most fantastic imagery of a jules verne come into actuality .	20.481764
the vision of a lord tennyson expressed in a poem 100 years ago took visible form over london in the air blitzes of 1941 .	82.51925
in fact all of our civilized world is the resultant of man ' s projection of his imagination over the past 60 centuries or more .	58.564262
it is in this one aspect , at least , that man seems to be made in the image of his creator .	24.65477
not only can man project his imagination out into his environment in concrete forms , but even more importantly , he can turn it inward to help create new and better forms of himself .	82.46033
we recognize that young people through imaginative mind and body training can become athletes , acrobats , dancers , musicians and artists , developing many potentialities .	51.88402
we know that actors can learn to portray a wide variety of character roles .	32.381912
by this same combination of the will and the imagination , each one of us can learn to portray permanently the kind of character we would like to be .	51.383644
we must realize with prof . charles morris in his the open self that `` man is the being that can continually remake himself , the artisan that is himself the material for his own creation ' ' .	81.4506
so far in history man has been too greatly over-occupied with projecting things into his environment rather than first creating the sort of person who can make the highest use of the things he has created .	72.71642
is not the present world crisis a race between things we have created which can now destroy us and between populations of sufficient wisdom and character to forestall the tragedy .	80.299675
is it not the obligation of us older citizens to lend our weight to being creative on the character side and to hasten our own maturing process ? ?	45.812134
sir julian huxley in his book uniqueness of man makes the novel point that just as man is unique in being the only animal which requires a long period of infancy and childhood under family protection , so is he the only animal who has a long period after the decline of his procreativity .	85.17117
some recent writings assume that the ignorant young couples are a thing of the remote , victorian past	48.906715
that nowadays all honeymooners are thoroughly familiar with the best sex-manuals and know enough from talk with friends and personal experimentation to take all the anxiety and hazards out of the situation .	69.296326
perhaps -- but extensive discussions with contemporary practitioners , family doctors and gynecologists indicate that this is still an area of enormous ignorance .	49.456226
joking and talking may be freer and easier , but the important factual information is still lacking for far too many newly-married men and women .	84.729
various factors in the setting can still be of great advantage in making the first intercourse a good rather than a bad memory for one or both .	81.01708
privacy must be highly assured both in time and place .	74.90987
that is , locking the room or stateroom door gives privacy of location , but it is equally important to be sure there is time enough for an utterly unhurried fulfillment .	53.09537
if the wedding party lasted late , and the travel schedule means there are only a few hours before resuming the trip or making an early start , the husband may forestall tensions and uncertainties by confiding to his bride that lying in each other ' s arms will be bliss enough for these few hours .	60.315945
the consummation should come at the next stopping place when they have a long private time ( day or night ) for that purpose .	132.34373
first intercourse for the bride brings with it the various problems connected with virginity and the hymen .	25.263805
one thing should be clear to both husband and wife -- neither pain nor profuse bleeding has to occur when the hymen is ruptured during the first sex act .	53.04791
ignorance on this point has caused a great deal of needless anxiety , misunderstanding and suspicion .	23.07235
the hymen is , in essence , a fragile membrane that more or less completely covers the entrance to the vagina in most female human beings who have not had sex relations .	67.460495
( hymen , in fact , is the greek word for membrane .	35.683296
often it is thin and fragile and gives way readily to the male organ at the first attempt at intercourse .	92.796364
as might be expected , girls in this situation bleed very little and perhaps not at all in the process of losing their virginity .	47.852814
it is also important to realize that many girls are born without a hymen or at most only a tiny trace of one	75.6736
so that the absence of the hymen is by no means positive proof that a girl has had sex relations .	35.118916
but there is a basis in fact for the exaggerations of the folk-lore beliefs .	8.437891
some hymens are so strongly developed that they cannot be torn without considerable pain to the girl and marked loss of blood .	57.74713
more rarely , the hymen is so sturdy that it does not yield to penetration .	32.433704
extreme cases are on record in which the doctor has had to use instruments to cut through the hymen to permit marital relations to be consummated .	40.106354
these cases , for all their rarity , are so dramatic that friends and relations repeat the story until the general population may get an entirely false notion of how often the hymen is a serious problem to newly-weds .	99.911255
in recent times , when sexual matters began to be discussed more scientifically and more openly , the emotional aspects of virginity received considerable attention .	48.539036
obviously , the bridal pair has many adjustments to make to their new situation .	44.510166
is it necessary to add to the other tensions the hazard of making the loving husband the one who brought pain to his bride ? ?	64.9122
gynecologists and marriage manuals began to advise that the bride should consult a physician before marriage .	43.6435
if he foresaw any problem because of the quality of the hymen , it was recommended that simple procedures be undertaken at once to incise the hymen or , preferably , to dilate it .	29.909416
as a natural outgrowth of this approach it was often suggested that the doctor should complete the preparation for painless intercourse by dilating the vagina .	23.811459
this recommendation was based on the fact that the hymen was not the only barrier to smooth consummation of the sex act .	22.109772
the vagina is an organ capable of remarkable contraction and dilation .	2.952375
this is obvious when it is remembered that , during childbirth , the vagina must dilate enough to permit the passage of the baby .	26.653612
the intricate system of muscles that manage the contraction and dilatation of the vagina are partly under voluntary control .	51.128773
but an instinctive reflex may work against the conscious intention of the woman .	49.845722
that is , when first penetration takes place , the pressure and pain signals may involuntarily cause all the vaginal muscles to contract in an effort to bar the intrusion and prevent further pain .	47.858624
the advantages of dilatation by the physician are both physical and psychological .	57.467358
since it is a purely professional situation , none of the pain is associated with love-making or the beloved .	64.02848
by using instruments of gradually increasing size , the vagina is gently , and with minimum pain at each stage , taught to yield to an object of the appropriate shape .	62.77958
in this process the vaginal muscles come under better conscious control by the girl .	44.77148
she learns how to relax them to accept -- instead of contracting them to repel -- the entering object .	86.41809
apart from the standard problem of controlling the vaginal muscles , other serious barriers may exist that need special gynecological treatment .	39.2055
it is far better to have such conditions treated in advance than to have them show up on the honeymoon where they can create a really serious situation .	163.8371
when no medical problems exist , the newly married couple generally prefer to cope with the adjustments of their new relationship by themselves .	79.0676
special information and guidance about the possible difficulties are still of great value .	54.34375
folk-lore , superstition and remembered passages from erotic literature can create physical and emotional problems if blindly taken as scientific facts and useful hints .	137.43512
the long , unhurried approach and the deliberate prolongation of fore-play work on several levels .	25.717327
under the excitement of caresses and sexual stimulation the vagina relaxes and dilates and the local moisture greatly increases , providing an excellent lubricant to help achieve an easier penetration .	40.71691
extensive observations by physicians during vaginal examinations have established the fact that a single finger inserted along the anterior wall ( the top line of the vagina as the woman lies on her back ) may cause a great deal of distress in a virgin .	53.759846
but during the same examination , two fingers may be inserted along the posterior wall ( the bottom of the vagina in the same position ) without any pain	22.120256
and in fact without any difficulty if the pressure is kept downward at all times .	51.66398
these regional differences of sensitivity to pain may be of crucial significance during the earliest intercourse .	18.496439
the husband and wife should start with this anatomical information clearly in mind .	67.88052
they may then adjust their positions and movements to avoid too much pressure on the urethra and the anterior wall of the vagina	13.131681
at least until repeated intercourse has dilated it and pain is no longer a possible threat against the full pleasure of love-making .	53.829826
in fact , the technical procedure in medical examinations may be wisely adapted to his romantic purposes by the husband during the honeymoon .	21.787128
locker-room talk often stresses the idea that a man is doing the girl a favor if he is forceful and ruthless during the first penetration .	68.852264
the false reasoning is that a gradual advance prolongs the pain while a swift powerful act gets it over with and leaves the girl pleased with his virility and grateful for his decisiveness in settling the problem once and for all .	183.8226
ruthlessness at this time can be a very severe shock to the bride , both physically and psychologically .	70.95432
the insistent , forceful penetration may tear and inflame the vaginal walls as well as do excessive damage to the hymen .	18.692974
the pain and distress associated with the performance may easily give the wife a deep-seated dread of marital relations and cause her , unconsciously , to make the sex act unpleasant and difficult for both by exercising her vaginal muscles to complicate his penetration instead of relaxing them to facilitate it .	50.05994
serious attention must also be given to the husband ' s problems in the honeymoon situation .	27.070963
the necessity for keeping alert to his bride ' s hazards can act as an interference with the man ' s spontaneous desire .	43.130894
the emotional stimulation may be so great that he may experience a premature climax .	42.795788
this is a very common experience and should in no way discourage or dishearten either husband or wife .	97.93414
or the frequent need to check and discipline himself to the wisest pace of the consummation can put him off stride and make it impossible for him to be continuously ready for penetration over a long period .	53.19783
the signals to proceed may therefore come when he is momentarily not able to take advantage of them .	50.005165
the best course is to recover his physical excitement by a change of pace that makes him ardent again .	99.19583
this may require imagination and reminding himself that now he can be demanding and self-centered .	37.648678
he can take security from the fact that the progress he has made by his gentle approach will not be lost .	65.06603
now while he uses talk , caresses or requires caresses from her , his bride will sympathetically understand the situation and eagerly help him restore his physical situation so they can have the consummation they both so eagerly desire .	74.85762
the accumulated information on this point shows that first intercourse , even when it is achieved with minimum pain or difficulty , is seldom an overwhelming sexual experience to a woman .	71.128746
too many new things are happening for it to be a complete erotic fulfillment .	16.501925
only under rare circumstances would a bride experience an orgasm during her first intercourse .	15.942843
both man and wife should be aware of the fact that a lack of climax , and even the absence of the anticipated keen pleasure are not a sign that the wife may be cold or frigid .	42.537933
if the early approaches are wise , understanding and patient , the satisfactions of marital fulfillment will probably be discovered before the marriage is much older .	40.947052
writing in a large volume on the nude in painting and sculptures , titled the nude a study in ideal form , kenneth clark declares `` the human body , as a nucleus , is rich in associations .	38.08788
it is ourselves and arouses memories of all the things we wish to do with ourselves ' ' .	35.43078
perhaps this is a clue to the amazing variety and power of reactions , attitudes , and emotions precipitated by the nude form .	65.468376
the wide divergence of reactions is clearly illustrated in the kinsey studies in human sexuality .	18.716467
differences were related to social , economic , and educational backgrounds .	11.45374
whereas persons of eighth grade education or less were more apt to avoid or be shocked by nudity , those educated beyond the eighth grade increasingly welcomed and approved nudity in sexual relations .	66.86501
such understanding helps to explain why one matron celebrating thirty-five years of married life could declare with some pride that her husband had `` never seen her entirely naked ' ' , while another woman , boasting an equal number of years of married life , is proud of having `` shared the nudist way of life -- the really free , natural nude life -- for most of that period ' ' .	52.27817
attempts at censorship always involve and reveal such complex and multiple individual reactions .	56.70464
the indignant crusader sees the nude or semi-nude human form as `` lewd and pornographic , a threat and danger ' ' to all the young , or good , or religious , or moral persons .	52.881927
the equally ardent proponent of freedom from any kind of censorship may find the nude human form the `` natural , honest , free expression of man ' s spirit and the epitome of beauty and inspiration ' ' .	41.840878
one is always a little surprised to bump into such individual distinctions when it is unexpected .	73.549164
i still recall the mild shock i experienced in reading material of an enthusiastic advocate of the `` clean , healthful , free way of natural life in nudism ' ' , who seemed to brave much misunderstanding and persecution in fine spirit .	48.909492
in tradition and in poetry , the marriage bed is a place of unity and harmony .	15.563425
the partners each bring to it unselfish love , and each takes away an equal share of pleasure and joy .	68.01245
at its most ecstatic moments , husband and wife are elevated far above worldly cares .	68.76926
but marriage experts say that such mutual contribution and mutual joy are seldom achieved .	75.4068
instead one partner or the other dominates the sexual relationship .	42.508663
in the past , it has been the husband who has been dominant and the wife passive .	58.149895
but today there are signs that these roles are being reversed .	28.442646
in a growing number of american homes , marriage counselors report , the wife is taking a commanding role in sexual relationships .	80.49335
it is she who decides the time , the place , the surroundings , and the frequency of the sexual act .	29.5774
it is she who says aye or nay to the intimate questions of sexual technique and mechanics -- not the husband .	91.79562
the whole act is tailored to her pleasure , and not to theirs .	21.07359
beyond a certain point , of course , no woman can be dominant -- nature has seen to that .	136.39662
but there is little doubt that in many marriages the wife is boss of the marital bed .	17.63208
of course , there remain many `` old-fashioned ' ' marriages in which the husband maintains his supremacy .	17.301052
yet even in these marriages , psychologists say , wives are asserting themselves more strongly .	27.512815
the meekest , most submissive wife of today is a tiger by her mother ' s or grandmother ' s standards .	14.406212
to many experts , this trend was inevitable .	4.0810313
they consider it simply a sign of our times .	97.648865
our society has `` emancipated ' ' the woman , giving her new independence and new authority .	102.4892
it is only natural that she assert herself in the sexual role .	25.560387
`` the sexual relationship does not exist in a vacuum ' ' , declares dr . mary steichen calderone , medical director of the planned parenthood federation of america and author of the recent book , release from sexual tensions .	30.258629
`` it reflects what is going on in other areas of the marriage and in society itself .	79.551094
a world in which wives have taken a more active role is likely to produce sexual relationships in which wives are more self-assertive , too ' ' .	38.124058
yet many psychologists and marriage counselors agree that domination of the sex relationship by one partner or the other can be unhealthy and even dangerous .	39.859554
it can , in fact , wreck a marriage .	205.74219
when a husband is sexually selfish and heedless of his wife ' s desires , she is cheated of the fulfillment and pleasure nature intended for her .	44.64093
and she begins to regard him as savage , bestial and unworthy .	5.303826
on the other hand , wifely supremacy demeans the husband , saps his self-respect , and robs him of his masculinity .	9.598803
he is a target of ridicule to his wife , and often -- since private affairs rarely remain private -- to the outside world as well .	139.614
`` a marriage can survive almost any kind of stress except an open and direct challenge to the husband ' s maleness ' ' , declares dr . calderone .	38.37045
this opinion is supported by one of the nation ' s leading psychiatrists , dr . maurice e . linden , director of the mental health division of the philadelphia department of public health .	10.995878
`` when the roles of husband and wife are reversed , so that the wife becomes leader and the husband follower ' ' , dr . linden says , `` the effects on their whole relationship , sexual and otherwise , can be disastrous ' ' .	39.880085
in one extreme case , cited by a pittsburgh psychologist , an office worker ' s wife refused to have sexual relations with her husband unless he bought her the luxuries she demanded .	39.209766
to win her favors , her husband first took an additional job , then desperately began to embezzle from his employer .	62.336098
caught at last , he was sentenced to prison .	6.6188684
while he was in custody his wife divorced him .	23.112122
more typical is the case of a suburban long island housewife described by a marriage counselor .	42.511513
this woman repeatedly complained she was `` too tired ' ' for marital relations .	6.552161
to please her , her husband assumed some of the domestic chores .	19.88014
finally , he was cooking , washing dishes , bathing the children , and even ironing -- and still his wife refused to have relations as often as he desired them .	55.7934
one wife , described by a new york psychologist , so dominated her husband that she actually placed their sexual relationship on a schedule , writing it down right between the weekly pta meetings and the thursday-night neighborhood card parties .	65.726425
after every money argument , she rebuffed her husband ' s overtures until the matter was settled in her favor .	23.2628
experts say the partners in marriages like these can almost be typed .	151.9271
the wife is likely to be young , sophisticated , smart as a whip -- often a girl who has sacrificed a promising career for marriage .	35.45608
she knows the power of the sex urge and how to use it to manipulate her husband .	53.517216
the husband is usually a well-educated professional , preoccupied with his job -- often an organization man whose motto for getting ahead is `` don ' t rock the boat ' ' .	42.698948
sometimes this leads to his becoming demandingly dominant in marriage .	60.999462
hemmed in on the job and unable to assert himself , he uses the sex act so he can be supreme in at least one area .	82.15028
more often , though , he is so accustomed to submitting to authority on the job without argument that he lives by the same rule at home .	69.94554
some psychologists , in fact , suggest that career-bound husbands often are more to blame for topsy-turvy marriages than their wives .	49.102077
the wife ' s attempt at control , these psychologists contend , is sometimes merely a pathetic effort to compel her husband to pay as much attention to her as he does to his job .	57.015167
naturally no woman can ever completely monopolize the sexual initiative .	21.990137
unless her husband also desires sex , the act cannot be consummated .	35.142323
generally , however , in such marriages as those cited , the husband is at his wife ' s mercy .	47.64645
`` the pattern ' ' , says dr . morton schillinger , psychologist at new york ' s lincoln institute for psychotherapy , `` is for the husband to hover about anxiously and eagerly , virtually trembling in his hope that she will flash him the signal that tonight is the night ' ' .	24.771408
no one seriously contends , of course , that the domineering wife is , sexually speaking , a new character in our world .	27.598198
after all , the henpecked husband with his shrewish wife is a comic figure of long standing , in literature and on the stage , as dr . schillinger points out .	58.53567
there is no evidence that these milquetoasts became suddenly emboldened when they crossed the threshhold of the master bedroom .	18.947437
furthermore , dr . calderone says , a certain number of docile , retiring men always have been around .	61.155773
they aren ' t `` frigid ' ' and they aren ' t homosexual	8.54664
they ' re just restrained in all of life .	58.0725
one such man once confided to dr . theodor reik , new york psychiatrist , that he preferred to have his wife the sexual aggressor .	11.703208
asked why , he replied primly `` because that ' s no activity for a gentleman ' ' .	25.616692
but such cases were , in the past , unusual .	348.26477
society here and abroad has been built around the dominating male -- even the bible appears to endorse the concept .	54.443623
family survival on our own western frontier , for example , could quite literally depend on a man ' s strength and ability to bring home the bacon	48.109257
and the dependent wife seldom questioned his judgment about anything , including the marriage bed .	132.76085
this carried over into the more urbanized late 19th and early 20th centuries , when the man ruled the roost in the best bull-roaring life with father manner .	53.40976
in those days , a wife had mighty few rights in the domestic sphere and even fewer in the sexual sphere .	82.7805
`` grandma wasn ' t expected to like it ' ' , dr . marion hilliard , the late toronto gynecologist , once summed up the attitude of the ' 90s .	15.27118
wives of the period shamefacedly thought of themselves as `` used ' ' by their husbands -- and , history indicates , they often quite literally were .	71.207375
when did women begin to assert themselves sexually ? ?	11.503162
some date it from woman suffrage , others from when women first began to challenge men in the marketplace , still others from the era of the emancipated flapper and bathtub gin .	57.08511
virtually everyone agrees , however , that the trend toward female sexual aggressiveness was tremendously accelerated with the postwar rush to the suburbs .	33.07822
left alone while her husband was miles away in the city , the modern wife assumed more and more duties normally reserved for the male .	115.11955
circumstances gave her almost undisputed sway over child-rearing , money-handling and home maintenance .	85.22232
she found she could cope with all kinds of problems for which she was once considered too helpless .	92.90085
she liked this taste of authority and independence , and , with darkness , was not likely to give it up .	57.651962
`` very few wives ' ' , says dr . calderone , `` who balance the checkbook , fix the car , choose where the family will live and deal with the tradesmen , are suddenly going to become submissive where sex is concerned .	35.583237
a woman who dominates other family affairs will dominate the sexual relationship as well ' ' .	16.78405
and an additional factor was helping to make women more sexually self-assertive -- the comparatively recent discovery of the true depths of female desire and response .	71.89543
marriage manuals and women ' s magazine articles began to stress the importance of the female climax .	26.453115
they began to describe in detail the woman ' s capacity for response .	23.268814
in fact , the noted psychologist and sex researcher , dr . albert ellis , has declared flatly that women are `` sexually superior ' ' to men .	21.612757
according to dr . ellis , the average 20-year-old american woman is capable of far greater sexual arousal than her partner .	52.341557
not surprisingly , dr . ellis says , some recently enlightened wives are out to claim these capabilities .	66.91273
yet , paradoxically , according to dr . maurice linden , many wives despise their husbands for not standing up to them .	37.748238
an aggressive woman wants a man to demand , not knuckle under .	141.48277
`` when the husband becomes passive in the face of his wife ' s aggressiveness ' ' , dr . linden says , `` the wife , in turn , finds him inadequate .	14.291822
often she fails to gain sexual satisfaction ' ' .	1.2527033
one such wife , dr . linden says , became disgusted with her weak husband and flurried through a series of extramarital affairs in the hope of finding a stronger man .	23.507025
but her personality was such that each affair lasted only until that lover , too , had been conquered and reduced to passivity .	83.66851
then the wife bed-hopped to the next on the list .	13.209593
in some cases , however , domination of the sex act by one partner can be temporary , triggered by a passing but urgent emotional need .	90.98229
thus a man who is butting a stone wall at the office may become unusually aggressive in bed -- the one place he can still be champion .	97.26056
if his on-the-job problems work out , he may return to his old pattern .	70.13106
sometimes a burst of aggressiveness will sweep over a man -- or his wife -- because he or she feels age creeping up .	100.63237
on the other hand , a husband who always has been vigorous and assertive may suddenly become passive -- asking , psychologists say , for reassurance that his wife still finds him desirable .	74.53717
or a wife may make sudden demands that she be courted , flattered or coaxed , simply because she needs her ego lifted .	36.412064
in any case , dr . calderone remarks , such problems are a couple ' s own affair , and can ' t always be measured by a general yardstick .	51.6924
`` as long as the couple is in agreement in their approach to sex , it makes little difference if one or the other dominates ' ' , dr . calderone declares .	36.877117
`` the important point is that both be satisfied with the adjustment ' ' .	33.690502
other experts say , however , that if sexual domination by one or the other partner exists for longer than a brief period , it is likely to shake the marriage .	75.1242
and just as domination today often begins with the wife , so the cure generally must lie with the husband .	115.68861
`` to get a marriage back where it belongs ' ' , comments dr . schillinger of the lincoln institute , `` the husband must take some very basic steps .	33.61727
he must begin , paradoxically , by becoming more selfish .	24.65876
he must become more expressive of his own desires , more demanding and less ' understanding ' ' ' .	63.45503
too many husbands , dr . schillinger continues , worry about `` how well they ' re doing ' ' , and fear that their success depends on some trick or technique of sexual play .	60.15476
she gave herself a title , lady diana harrington .	7.0186496
the new york d . a . gave her another , the golden girl of cafe society .	84.815056
houston police gave her a third , less flamboyant , title , prostitute .	14.754676
and houston police have the final say in the matter since she died there on september 20 , 1960 , `` diane harris graham , 30 , d . o . a . , circumstances -- unusual ' ' .	42.038692
early in her life she had discovered that where there were men , there was money , and with the two came luxury and liquor .	134.21854
she was still in the play for pay business when she died , a top trollop who had given the world ' s oldest profession one of its rare flashes of glamour .	60.94693
she never hid the fact that she liked to play .	13.120771
her neighbors in the expensive houston apartment building told reporters that the ash-blonde beauty had talked at times about her past as `` the golden girl of the mickey jelke trial ' ' .	52.3231
it was the trial of oleomargarine heir minot ( mickey ) jelke for compulsory prostitution in new york that put the spotlight on the international play-girl .	41.40172
( jelke later served 21 months when he was found guilty of masterminding a ring of high-priced call girls .	30.097147

she had been moving in cafe society as lady diana harrington , a name that made some of the gossip columns .	33.45074

`` in 1951 she was a prostitute in new york county .	53.01578

`` at deauville she met an egyptian by the name of pulley bey .	8.56793

the phony producer asked her if she would like to be in one of his shows .	83.70263

one who needed no such threats was a french financier .	36.143288

`` then she went to deauville where she met a member of a powerful greek syndicate of gamblers ' ' .	19.848019

she could do no wrong at the tables that time .	46.012035
and in short order the croupier had pushed several million francs her way .	323.6432

she teamed up with another beauty , whose name has been lost to history , and commenced with some fiddling that would have made nero envious .	38.49749

pulley had set her up at the semiramis hotel , but she grew impatient waiting for a royal reception and moved to a luxurious apartment to which the royal pimp had no key .	30.494286
she picked her own middle-eastern friends from the flock of ardent egyptians that buzzed around her .	46.121548

held as a material witness in the compulsory prostitution trial of mickey jelke , the comely courtesan was unable to raise bail and was committed to the women ' s house of detention , a terribly overcrowded prison .	25.977283
it is a tribute to her talents that she was able to talk the district attorney into having her removed from the prison to a hotel room , with her meals taken at vesuvio ' s , an excellent italian restaurant .	52.701866
newspapers at the time noted that the move indicated that she was co-operating with the district attorney .	30.420202

the next time the police saw her she was dead .	13.759088

i work for one of the biggest chains of retail carpet houses in the east .	26.362352
we cater mostly to nice people in the $5-8 , 000 annual income bracket and we run a string of snazzy , neon-lit , chromium-plated suburban stores .	28.412607

there is only one trouble with this big , beautiful dream .	131.30638
from where i sit it looks more like a nightmare .	52.199127
they depend on my supposedly expert knowledge of a trade of which they themselves know little .	133.41647
franklin d . lee proved a man of prompt action when mrs . claire shaefer , accompanied by a friend , visited him in bakersfield , california , several months ago as a prospective patient .	27.355576

( he explained that he could diagnose these ailments from squeezing her foot because all of the nervous system was connected to it .	70.72186
) he knew just the thing for her -- a treatment from his `` cosmic light ozone generator ' ' machine .	52.752148
as he applied the applicator extending from the machine -- which consisted of seven differently colored neon tubes superimposed on a rectangular base -- to the supposedly diseased portions of mrs . shaefer ' s body , lee kept up a steady stream of pseudo-scientific mumbo-jumbo .	33.170734
yes , the ozone from his machine would cure practically everything , he assured her .	89.40413

the human body -- he pointed out , for example -- required 33 units of blue light .	144.68878

continuing glibly in this vein , he paused to comfort her	91.704315

he urged her to buy one of his machines -- for $300 .	45.24616

he then sold her minerals to cure her kidney ailment , a can of sage `` to make her look like a girl again ' ' , and an application of plain mud to take her wrinkles away .	53.36104

he then sold her some capsules that he asserted would take care of the tumors and cysts until she could collect the money for buying his machine .	59.195347
when she submitted to his treatment with the capsules , mrs . shaefer felt intense pain .	20.192554
leaving lee ' s office , mrs . shaefer hurried over to her family physician , who treated her for burned tissue .	65.83179
for several days , she was ill as a result of lee ' s treatment .	8.8728285
mrs . shaefer never got around to joining the thousand or so people who paid lee some $30 , 000 for his ozone machines .	63.307785
for mrs . shaefer -- who had been given a clean bill of health by her own physician at the time she visited lee -- and her friend were agents for the california pure food and drug inspection bureau .	98.85929
and she felt amply rewarded for her suffering when the evidence of lee ' s quack shenanigans , gathered by the tape recorder under her friend ' s clothing , proved adequate in court for convicting franklin d . lee .	26.280186
the charge violation of the california medical practices act by practicing medicine without a license and selling misbranded drugs .	22.536627
the sentence 360 days ' confinement in the county jail .	20.910547
rather , it is typical of the thousands of quacks who use phony therapeutic devices to fatten themselves on the miseries of hundreds of thousands of americans by robbing them of millions of dollars and luring them away from legitimate , ethical medical treatment of serious diseases .	24.21711
the machine quack makes his rube goldberg devices out of odds and ends of metals , wires , and radio parts .	96.000694
with these gadgets -- impressive to the gullible because of their flashing light bulbs , ticks , and buzzes -- he then carries out a vicious medical con game , capitalizing on people ' s respect for the electrical and atomic wonders of our scientific age .	33.702763
he milks the latest scientific advances , translating them into his own special buck rogers vocabulary to huckster his fake machines as a cure-all for everything from hay fever to sexual impotence and cancer .	33.65416
the gadget faker operates or sells his phony machines for $5 to $10 , 000 -- anything the traffic will bear .	44.00571
he may call himself a anaprapath , a physiotherapist , an electrotherapist , a naturopath , a sanipractor , a medical cultist , a masseur , a `` doctor ' ' -- or what have you .	21.512163
not only do these quacks assume impressive titles , but represent themselves as being associated with various scientific or impressive foundations -- foundations which often have little more than a letterhead existence .	61.49698
the medical device pirate of today , of course , is a far more sophisticated operator than his predecessor of yesteryear -- the gallus-snapping hawker of snake oil and other patent medicines .	21.901289
his plunder is therefore far higher -- running into hundreds of millions .	30.941362
according to the food and drug administration ( fda ) , `` doctor ' ' ghadiali , dr . albert abrams and his clique , and dr . wilhelm reich -- to name three notorious device quacks -- succeeded , respectively , in distributing 10 , 000 , 5000 , and 2000 fake health machines .	25.392677
authorities believe that many of the doctor frauds using these false health gadgets are still in business .	65.40522
look at the sums paid by two device quack victims in cleveland .	41.635387
sarah gross , a dress shop proprietor , paid $1020 to a masseur , and mr . a . , a laborer , paid $4200 to a chiropractor for treatment with two fake health machines -- the `` radioclast ' ' and the `` diagnometer ' ' .	17.51674
multiply these figures by the millions of people known to be conned by medical pirates annually .	53.001022
you will come up with a frightening total .	24.980751
that ' s why the fda , the american medical association ( ama ) , and the national better business bureau ( bbb ) have estimated the toll of mechanical quackery to be a substantial portion of the $610 million or so paid to medical charlatans annually .	25.941128
the postmaster general recently reported that mail order frauds -- among which fake therapeutic devices figure prominently -- are at the highest level in history .	40.414795
similarly , the american cancer society ( acs ) , the arthritis and rheumatism foundation , and the bbb have each stated lately that medical quackery is at a new high .	24.767044
for example , the bbb has reported it was receiving four times as many inquiries about quack devices and 10 times as many complaints compared with two years ago .	70.32851
authorities hesitate to quote exact figures , however , believing that any sum they come up with is only a surface manifestation -- turned up by their inevitably limited policing -- of the real loot of the medical racketeer .	98.83516
in this sense , authorities believe that all estimates of phony device quackery are conservative .	153.62659
the economic toll that the device quack extracts is important , of course .	31.588627
but it is our health -- more precious than all the money in the world -- that these modern witch doctors with their fake therapeutic gadgets are gambling away .	63.56993
by preying on the sick , by playing callously on the hopes of the desperate , by causing the sufferer to delay proper medical care , these medical ghouls create pain and misery by their very activity .	69.65438
typically , sarah gross and mr . a both lost more than their money as the result of their experiences with their cleveland quacks .	103.42724
sarah gross found that the treatments given her for a nervous ailment by the masseur were not helping her .	32.569717
as a result , she consulted medical authorities and learned that the devices her quack `` doctor ' ' was using were phony .	102.89484
she suffered a nervous breakdown and had to be institutionalized .	7.2839656
mr . a . , her fellow townsman , also experienced a nervous breakdown just as soon as he discovered that he had been bilked of his life savings by the limited practitioner who had been treating his wife -- a woman suffering from an incurable disease , multiple sclerosis -- and himself .	64.898026
mr . a has recovered , but he is , justifiably , a bitter man .	54.815212
`` that ' s a lot of hard-earned money to lose ' ' , he says today .	14.259339
`` neither me nor my wife were helped by that chiropractor ' s treatments ' ' .	13.314033
and there was the case of tom hepker , a machinist , who was referred by a friend to a health machine quack who treated him with a so-called diagnostic machine for what doctor fraud said was a system full of arsenic and strychnine .	39.22667
after his pains got worse , tom decided to see a real doctor , from whom he learned he was suffering from cancer of the lung .	35.903614
yes , tom caught it in time to stay alive .	28.381308
but he ' s a welfare case now -- a human wreck -- thanks to this modern witch doctor .	71.40404
but the machine quack can cause far more than just suffering .	56.735798
in such diseases as cancer , tuberculosis , and heart disease , early diagnosis and treatment are so vital that the waste of time by the patient with doctor fraud ' s cure-all gadget can prove fatal .	42.479233
moreover , the diabetic patient who relies on cure by the quack device and therefore cuts off his insulin intake can be committing suicide .	14.201664
in chicago , some time ago , mr . h . , age 27 , a diabetic since he was six , stopped using insulin because he had bought a `` magic spike ' ' -- a glass tube about the size of a pencil filled with barium chloride worth a small fraction of a cent -- sold by the vrilium company of chicago for $306 as a cure-all .	35.631508
`` hang this around your neck or attach it to other parts of your anatomy , and its rays will cure any disease you have ' ' , said the company .	49.21687
mr . h . is dead today because he followed this advice .	206.92975
doris hull , suffering from tuberculosis , was taken by her husband to see otis g . carroll , a sanipractor -- a licensed drugless healer -- in spokane .	14.331092
carroll diagnosed mrs . hull by taking a drop of blood from her ear and putting it on his `` radionic ' ' machine and twirling some knobs ( fee $50 ) .	31.0717
his prescription hot and cold compresses to increase her absorption of water .	21.045517
although she weighed only 108 pounds when she visited him , carroll permitted her to go on a 10-day fast in which she took nothing but water .	62.45797
inevitably , mrs . hull died of starvation and tuberculosis , weighing 60 pounds .	17.698397
moreover , her husband and child contracted t . b . from her .	51.42226
( small wonder a spokane jury awarded the husband $35 , 823 for his wife ' s death .	15.89348
in california , a few years ago , a ghoul by the name of h . f . bell sold electric blankets as a cure for cancer .	37.423386
he did this by the charming practice of buying up used electric blankets for $5 to $10 from survivors of patients who had died , reconditioning them , and selling them at $185 each .	58.43667
when authorities convicted him of practicing medicine without a license ( he got off with a suspended sentence of three years because of his advanced age of 77 ) , one of his victims was not around to testify he was dead of cancer .	47.415962
`` unfortunately ' ' , says chief postal inspector david h . stephens , who has prosecuted many device quacks , `` the ghouls who trade on the hopes of the desperately ill often cannot be successfully prosecuted because the patients who are the chief witnesses die before the case is called up in court ' ' .	44.372406
that ' s where device quackery can lead .	30.298414
the evidence shows that fake therapeutic machines , substituted for valid medical cures , have hastened the deaths of thousands .	55.74593
who are the victims of the device quacks ? ?	5.116996
authorities say that oldsters are a prime target .	16.32505
says wallace f . jannsen , director of the fda ' s division of public information `` quacks are apt to direct their appeal directly to older people , or to sufferers from chronic ailments such as arthritis , rheumatism , diabetes , and cancer .	23.976803
people who have not been able to get relief from regular medical doctors are especially apt to be taken in by quacks ' ' .	89.103615
the victims of the quacks are frequently poor people , like mr . a . , who scrape up their life savings to offer as a sacrifice to doctor fraud ' s avarice .	41.421722
they are often ignorant as well as underprivileged .	5.3970785
ten-year-old richard stewart had been irritable and quarrelsome for almost a year .	54.074776
his grades had gone steadily downhill , and he had stopped bringing friends and classmates home from school .	49.487885
mr . and mrs . stewart were puzzled and concerned .	25.915094
then one day dick ' s classmate jimmy , from next door , let the cat out of the bag .	28.436619
the youngsters in the boys ' class had nicknamed dick `` bugs bunny ' ' because his teeth protruded .	25.842068
when richard ' s parents told him they wanted to take him to an orthodontist -- a dentist who specializes in realigning teeth and jaws -- their young son was interested .	39.904224
during the year that followed , dick co-operated whole-heartedly with the dentist and was delighted with the final result achieved -- an upper row of strong straight teeth that completely changed his facial appearance .	71.29391
`` the majority of children in the united states could benefit by some form of orthodontic treatment ' ' , says dr . allan g . brodie , professor and head of the department of orthodontics at the university of illinois and a nationally recognized authority in his field .	22.314682
what do parents need to know about those `` years of the braces ' ' in order not to waste a child ' s time and their money ? ?	49.319965
how can they tell whether a child needs orthodontic treatment ? ?	15.399462
why and when should tooth-straightening be undertaken ? ?	1.0198177
occlusion is the dentist ' s expression for the way teeth fit together when the jaws are closed .	79.94353
malocclusion , or a bad fit , is what parents need to look out for .	97.025055
one main type of malocclusion is characterized by a receding chin and protruding upper front teeth .	17.89921
a chin too prominent in relation to the rest of the face , a thrusting forward of the lower front teeth , an overdeveloped lower jawbone , and an underdeveloped upper jaw indicate the opposite type of malocclusion .	29.667484
these two basic malformations have , of course , many variations .	22.994776
a child probably requires some form of treatment if he has any of the following conditions	75.72601
a noticeable protrusion of the upper or lower jaw .	9.199329
crooked , overlapping , twisted , or widely spaced teeth .	10.034843
front teeth not meeting when the back teeth close .	40.49779
upper teeth completely covering the lowers when the back teeth close .	127.81995
the eyeteeth ( third from the middle on top , counting each front tooth as the first ) beginning to protrude like fangs .	83.80966
second teeth that have come in before the first ones have fallen out , making a double row .	58.16864
contrary to the thinking of 30 to 40 years ago , when all malocclusion was blamed on some unfortunate habit , recent studies show that most tooth irregularity has at least its beginning in hereditary predisposition .	24.739723
however , this does not mean that a child ' s teeth or jaws must necessarily resemble those of someone in his family .	28.918547
tooth deformity may be the result of excessive thumb- or finger-sucking , tongue-thrusting , or lip-sucking -- but it ' s important to remember that there ' s a difference between normal and excessive sucking habits .	17.963436
it ' s perfectly normal for babies to suck their thumbs , and no mother need worry if a child continues this habit until he is two or three years old .	58.26122
occasional sucking up to the fifth year may not affect a youngster ' s teeth	116.51916
but after that , if thumb-sucking pressure is frequent , it will have an effect .	44.744694
malocclusion can also result if baby teeth are lost too soon or retained too long .	67.868
if a child loses a molar at the age of two , the adjoining teeth may shift toward the empty space , thus narrowing the place intended for the permanent ones and producing a jumble .	71.08308
if baby teeth are retained too long , the incoming second teeth may be prevented from emerging at the normal time or may have to erupt in the wrong place .	38.422897
every orthodontist sees children who are embarrassed by their malformed teeth .	33.0509
some such youngsters rarely smile , or they try to speak with the mouth closed .	67.75528
in certain cases , as in dick stewart ' s , a child ' s personality is affected .	19.804062
yet from the dentist ' s point of view , bad-fitting teeth should be corrected for physical reasons .	17.950558
bad alignment may result in early loss of teeth through a breakdown of the bony structure that supports their roots .	50.698456
this serious condition , popularly known as pyorrhea , is one of the chief causes of tooth loss in adults .	52.25983
then , too , misplaced or jammed-together teeth are prone to trapping food particles , increasing the likelihood of rapid decay .	40.612236
`` for these and other reasons ' ' , says dr . brodie , `` orthodontics can prolong the life of teeth ' ' .	9.86293
the failure of teeth to fit together when closed interferes with normal chewing , so that a child may swallow food whole and put a burden on his digestive system .	61.113503
because of these chewing troubles , a child may avoid certain foods he needs for adequate nutrition .	106.644035
badly placed teeth can also cause such a speech handicap as lisping .	19.67998
`` most orthodontic work is done on children between the ages of 10 and 14 , though there have been patients as young as two and as old as 55 ' ' , says dr . brodie .	41.139503
in the period from 10 to 14 the permanent set of teeth is usually completed , yet the continuing growth of bony tissue makes moving badly placed teeth comparatively easy .	127.62335
orthodontic work is possible because teeth are held firmly but not rigidly , by a system of peridontal membrane with an involved nerve network , to the bone in the jaw	42.627155
they are not anchored directly to the bone .	2.9233704
abnormal pressure , applied over a period of time , produces a change in the bony deposit , so a tooth functions normally in the new position into which it has been guided .	51.624172
what can 10-year-old susan expect when she enters the orthodontist ' s office ? ?	9.56502
on her first visit the orthodontist will take x-rays , photographs , tooth measurements , and `` tooth prints ' ' -- an impression of the mouth that permits him to study her teeth and jaws .	34.451424
if he decides to proceed , he will custom-make for susie an appliance consisting of bands , plastic plates , fine wires , and tiny springs .	27.97494
this appliance will exert a gentle and continuous or intermittent pressure on the bone .	15.798705
as the tooth moves , bone cells on the pressure side of it will dissolve , and new ones will form on the side from which the tooth has moved .	53.262794
this must be done at the rate at which new bony tissue grows , and no faster .	25.268135
`` if teeth are moved too rapidly , serious injury can be done to their roots as well as to the surrounding bone holding them in place ' ' , explains dr . brodie .	52.741447
`` moving one or two teeth can affect the whole system , and an ill-conceived plan of treatment can disrupt the growth pattern of a child ' s face ' ' .	25.272625
during the first few days of wearing the appliance and immediately following each adjustment , susan may have a slight discomfort or soreness , but after a short time this will disappear .	47.677425
parents are often concerned that orthodontic appliances may cause teeth to decay .	33.51963
when in place , a well-cemented band actually protects the part of the tooth that is covered .	29.376314
next susie will enter the treatment stage and visit the orthodontist once or twice a month , depending on the severity of her condition .	48.402637
during these visits the dentist will adjust the braces to increase the pressure on her teeth .	38.405613
susie ' s teeth have now been guided into a desirable new position .	84.48053
but because teeth sometimes may drift back to their original position , a retaining appliance is used to lock them in place .	35.316486
usually this is a thin band of wire attached to the molars and stretching across the teeth .	17.472603
susie may wear this only at night or for a few hours during the day .	30.553001
then comes the time when the last wire is removed and susie walks out a healthier and more attractive girl than when she first went to the orthodontist .	29.473948
straightening one tooth that has come in wrong may take only a few months .	39.28864
aligning all the teeth may take a year or more .	57.56233
an added complication such as a malformed jaw may take two or three years to correct .	97.890495
the charge for a complete full-banded job differs in various parts of the country .	12.910587
work that might cost $500 to $750 in the south could cost $750 to $1 , 200 in new york city or chicago .	46.588474
an average national figure for two to three years of treatment would be $650 to $1 , 000 .	29.465376
`` factors in the cost of treatment are the length of time involved and the skill and education of the practitioner ' ' , says dr . brodie .	28.723707
to become an orthodontist , a man must first be licensed by his state as a dentist , then he must spend at least two years in additional training to acquire a license as a specialist .	47.293938
`` costs may seem high , but they used to be even higher ' ' , says dr . brodie .	18.419716
`` fees are about half to a third of what they were 25 years ago ' ' .	17.498808
people today are aware of the value of orthodontics , and as a result there are more practitioners in the field .	22.088287
most orthodontists require an initial payment to cover the cost of diagnostic materials and construction of the appliances , but usually the remainder of the cost may be spread over a period of months or years .	27.560926
in many cities in the united states clinics associated with dental schools will take patients at a nominal fee .	56.26532
some municipal agencies will pay for orthodontic treatment for children of needy parents .	22.703428
growth studies have been carried on consistently by orthodontists .	4.831826
dr . brodie has 30-year records of head growth , started 20 minutes after children ' s births .	31.550835
`` in the past anyone who said that 90% of all malocclusion is hereditary was scoffed at	65.5988
now we know that family characteristics do affect tooth formation to a large extent ' ' , he says .	21.903708
`` fortunately through our growth studies we have been able to see what nature does , and that helps us know what we can do ' ' .	20.121662
this knowledge both modifies and dictates diagnosis and treatment .	10.767122
for example , a boy may inherit a small jaw from one ancestor and large teeth from another .	51.672466
in the past an orthodontist might have tried , over four or five years , to straighten and fit the boy ' s large teeth into a jaw that , despite some growth , would never accommodate them .	64.608315
in other cases , in view of present-day knowledge of head growth , orthodontists will recommend waiting four or five years before treatment .	208.92856
the child is kept on call , and the orthodontist watches the growth .	65.36453
`` nature often takes care of the problem ' ' , says dr . brodie .	3.1388419
`` a child with a certain type of head and teeth will outgrow tooth deformity ' ' .	41.551434
that is why dr . brodie asks parents not to insist , against their dentist ' s advice , that their child have orthodontic work done too early .	53.809383
`` both because of our culture ' s stress on beauty and our improved economic conditions , some parents demand that the dentist try to correct a problem before it is wise to do so .	123.16134
let the orthodontist decide the proper time to start treatment ' ' , he urges .	42.40035
superior new material for orthodontic work is another result of research .	54.57532
plastics are easier to handle than the vulcanized rubber formerly used , and they save time and money .	57.578964
plaster of paris , once utilized in making impressions of teeth , has been replaced by alginates ( gelatin-like material ) that work quickly and accurately and with least discomfort to a child .	77.93529
as a rule , the earlier general dental treatment is started , the less expensive and more satisfactory it is likely to be .	61.886395
`` after your child ' s baby teeth are all in -- usually at the age of two and one half to three -- it ' s time for that first dental appointment ' ' , dr . brodie advises .	58.551
`` then see that your youngster has a routine checkup once a year ' ' .	43.685143
to help prevent orthodontic problems from arising , your dentist can do these things	31.791294
he can correct decay , thus preventing early loss of teeth .	37.275497
if a child does lose his first teeth prematurely because of decay -- and if no preventive steps are taken -- the other teeth may shift out of position , become overcrowded and malformed .	52.90826
in turn the other teeth are likely to decay because food particles may become impacted in them .	94.23958
from time to time the medium mentions other people `` around him ' ' , who were `` on the other side ' ' , and reports what they are saying .	37.383953
after a while there come initials and names , and he is interested to hear some rather unusual family nicknames .	90.81923
as the hour progresses , the sensitive seems to probe more deeply and to make more personal and specific statements .	51.879223
there are a few prognoses of coming events .	8.371596
another medium , another sitter , would produce a somewhat different content , but in general it would probably sound much like the foregoing reading .	55.537045
some mediums speak in practical , down-to-earth terms , while others may stress the spiritual .	166.61241
not all , as a matter of fact , consider themselves `` mediums ' ' in the sense of receiving messages from the deceased .	14.529677
in fact , some sensitives rule this out , preferring to consider their expression as strictly extra-sensory perception ( esp ) , on this side of the `` veil ' ' .	20.846577
however that may be , people are known to go to mediums for diverse reasons .	51.996933
perhaps they are mourning a recent death and want comfort , to feel in touch with the deceased , or seek indications for future plans .	84.682144
they may , of course , be curiosity seekers -- or they may just be interested in the phenomenon of mediumship .	34.613163
the mediums with whom the parapsychology foundation is working in this experiment are in a waking or only slightly dissociated state , so that the sitter can make comments , ask and answer questions , instead of talking with a `` control ' ' who speaks through an entranced sensitive .	78.02598
what we have here is in some ways more like an ordinary conversation .	99.84906
but it is not really only a conversation .	10.086508
many a sitter ( in a personal sitting ) has been amazed to realize that the medium was describing very vividly his state of mind .	58.480377
he himself might not have been really aware of his own mood	23.469297
it had been latent , unspecified , semi-conscious and only partly realized -- until she described it to him ! !	90.65991
most striking indeed is this beyond-normal ability to put a finger on `` pre-conscious ' ' moods and to clarify them .	16.7384
however , in the next visit that the researcher made to the medium , he did not receive a personal reading .	87.4617
instead he brought with him the names of some people he had never met and of whom the medium knew nothing .	64.20746
for this was to be a `` proxy sitting ' ' .	6.3522468
as was noted earlier , it is important that in valid , objective study of this sort of communication , the interested sitter should be separated from the sensitive .	52.56313
dr . karlis osis , director of research at the parapsychology foundation , described the basis for the experiment in a tomorrow article , ( `` new research on survival after death ' ' , spring 1958 ) .	66.02157
he remarked `` it has been clearly established that in a number of instances the message did not come from a spirit but was received telepathically by the medium from the sitter ' ' .	40.500973
the possibility has to be ruled out that the medium ' s esp may tap the memory of the sitter , and to do this , the two central characters in this drama must be separated .	29.16836
one way to do this is by `` proxy sittings ' ' , wherein the person seeking a message does not himself meet with the medium but is represented by a substitute , the proxy sitter .	35.43126
if the latter knows nothing about the absent sitter except his name ( given by the experimenter ) , he cannot possibly give any clues , conscious or unconscious , far less ask leading questions .	64.81904
all he can do is to be an objective and careful questioner , seeking to help the sensitive in clarifying and making more specific her paranormal impressions .	51.106396
sometimes in these experiments `` appointment sittings ' ' are used .	10.277882
here the absent sitter makes a `` date ' ' with a communicator ( someone close to him who is deceased ) , asking him to `` come in ' ' at a certain hour , when a channel will be open for him .	40.104774
in this case the proxy sitter will know only the name of the communicator , nothing else .	26.749523
he gives this to the medium at the appointed time , and the reading then will be concerned with material about or messages from the communicator .	75.91753
as always , a tape recording or detailed notes are made , and a typescript of this is sent to the absent sitter .	21.653877
so this proxy situation has set up at least a partial barrier between the medium ' s esp and the absent sitter ' s mind .	10.748553
it is now harder to assume telepathy as a basis for the statements -- though research still does not know how far afield esp can range .	133.22353
now the original absent sitter must decide whether the statements are meaningful to him .	35.558853
here again laboratory approaches are being evolved , for it is recognized how `` elastic ' ' these readings can be , how they can apply to many people , and are often stated in general terms all too easily applied to any individual ' s own case .	65.71201
if you look at a reading meant for someone else , you will probably see that many of the items could be considered as applicable to you , even when you were not in the picture at all ! !	59.433464
an interested sitter may think the sensitive has made a `` hit ' ' , describing something accurately for him , but can he really be sure that another sitter , hearing the same statement , would not apply it subjectively to his own circumstances ? ?	53.412697
it is , of course , easy to see how `` j ' ' will mean uncle jack to one person and little jane to another .	101.41081
`` a journey ' ' , `` a little white house ' ' , `` a change of outlook ' ' , can apply to many people .	32.917816
and even more complex items can be interpreted to conform to one ' s own point of view , which is by nature so personal .	56.02889
one sitter may think `` a leather couch ' ' identifies a reading as surely directed to him	77.77669
to another , it seems that nobody but his father ever used the phrase , `` atta boy ' ' ! !	37.71988
to get around this quite difficult corner , there is one first aid to objectiveness prevent the distant sitter from knowing which reading was for him .	50.088413
if he is not told which of four or five readings was meant for him , he can more readily assess each item in a larger frame `` does that statement really sound as if it were for me , significant in my particular life ? ?	124.06476
or am i taking something that could really apply to almost anybody , and forgetting that many other people probably have had a similar experience ' ' ? ?	77.61234
conversely , experimenters would consider as impressive such statements as the following , which , if they turned out to be hits , are so unusual as to be really significant	83.05961
`` he had four children , two sets of twins .	23.312967
after being a lawyer for twenty-five years he started studying for the ministry .	69.164375
part of his house had been moved to the other side of the road .	12.937556
he died of typhoid in 1921 ' ' .	1.9384239
methods have been developed of assigning `` weights ' ' to statements	11.707544
that is , it is known empirically that names beginning with r are more common than those beginning with z	366.49872
that in the united states more people die of heart disease than of smallpox .	54.516502
so each reading can be given a weight and each reading a score by adding up these weights .	98.87952
specific dates would be important , as would double names .	724.0319
various categories have been explored to find out about these `` empirical probabilities ' ' against which to measure the readings .	35.052513
in the parapsychology foundation ' s long-range experiment , readings are made by a variety of sensitives for a large number of cooperating sitters , trying to throw light on this question of the significance of mediumistic statements .	24.569784
it is very important indeed , in the field of extra-sensory perception and its relation to the survival hypothesis , to know whether the statements are actually only those which any intuitive person might venture and an eager sitter attach to himself .	49.127815
or , on the other hand , are unlikely facts being stated , facts which are in themselves significant and not easily applicable to everybody ? ?	170.36322
that is one thing the experiments are designed to find out .	16.3379
so , after the sitting has been held , several readings at one time are mailed , and the distant sitter ( whose name or whose communicator ' s name was given to the medium ) must mark each little item as correct ( hit ) , incorrect ( miss ) , doubtful , or especially significant ( applying to him and , he feels , not to anyone else ) .	84.5461
he is required to mark every item and to indicate which reading he feels is actually his .	311.05276
all these evaluations are then totted up and tabulated , by adding up the hits and significants , with the weight placed on those in the sitter ' s own reading .	38.60026
that is , if he marks as most correct a reading not meant for him , the total experimental score falls .	180.19383
conversely , if he gives a heavy rating to his own reading , and finds more accurate facts in it than in the others , a point is chalked up for the intrinsic , objective meaningfulness of this type of mediumistic material .	38.57018
and there are some positive results , though the final findings will not be known for a long time -- and then further research can be formulated .	65.077484
in another approach to the same procedure , the content of the readings is analyzed so as to see how the particular medium is likely to slant her statements .	65.73081
does she often speak of locations , of cause of death ? ?	200.0394
does she accurately give dates , ages , kind of occupation ? ?	78.957924
it is possible to find out in which categories most of her correct statements fall , and where she makes most of her `` hits ' ' .	87.65107
now when , so to speak , the cream has been skimmed off , and the items in the successful categories separated out , the sitter can be asked to consider and rate only this concentrated `` cream ' ' , where the sensitive is at her best .	72.702896
mediumistic impressions are evidently of all sorts and seem to involve all the senses .	67.371574
`` i feel cold ' ' , the medium says , or `` my leg aches ' ' , `` my head is heavy ' ' .	20.54953
or perhaps she hears words or sounds `` there ' s such a noise of loud machinery ' ' , or `` i hear a child crying ' ' , or `` he says we ' re all here and glad to see you ' ' .	26.509403
maybe an entire scene comes into consciousness , with action and motion , or a static view `` a house under a pine tree , with a little stone path going up to the door ' ' .	47.153606
the sensitive often seems to smell definite odors , too , or subjectively feels emotions .	26.929842
sometimes she displays amazing eidetic imagery and seems to see all details in perspective , as if the scene were actually there .	59.59298
if pressed by the sitter for more detail , she may be able to bring the picture more into focus and see more sharply , almost as if she were physically going closer .	78.515724
if asked how she gets her impressions , she probably can only say that she `` just gets them ' ' -- some more vividly than others .	84.24428
perhaps this is not so extraordinary after all .	30.986698
even in normal experience one gets impressions without knowing exactly how -- of atmosphere , of one another ' s personalities , moods , intentions .	58.59105
of course , there is an element of training here these gifted people , by concentration , study , guidance , have learned to develop their power .	104.84209
simply using it increases its intensity , i was told by one sensitive .	132.263
nor does a medium automatically know how to interpret her imagery .	126.07594
impressions often appear in a symbolic form and cannot be taken at face value .	317.05966
it is apparently by symbols that the unconscious speaks to the conscious , and the medium has to translate these into meaning .	34.860924
if communication with an entity on the `` other side ' ' is taking place , this too may assume the form of clairvoyant symbolism .	43.793472
during one reading an image appeared of a prisoner in irons .	21.508738
but this did not necessarily refer to an actual jail	907.97363
taken with other details it could have referred to a state of mental or spiritual confinement .	49.886932
in this connection it is worth noting how names are sometimes obtained .	221.51256
though they are often heard clairaudiently , as if a voice were speaking them , in other cases they are apprehended visually as symbols a slope to signify the name `` hill ' ' , for instance .	55.50882
one medium saw two sheets flapping on a line and found that the name shietz was significant to the sitter .	51.246223
the farmer ' s life must be arranged to meet the demands of crops and livestock .	24.593573
livestock must be tended every day , routinely .	2371.2634
a slight change in the work schedule may cut the production of cows or chickens .	50.548973
even if there are no livestock , the farmer cannot leave the farm for long periods , particularly during the growing season .	46.6803
the worker who lives on a farm cannot change jobs readily .	640.3761
he cannot leave the farm to take work in another locality on short notice	74.45962
such a move may mean a loss of capital .	90.239105
hard physical labor and undesirable hours are a part of life .	16.462942
the farmer must get up early , and , at times , work late at night .	118.28038
frequently he must work long hours in the hot sun or cold rain .	100.42936
no matter how well work is planned , bad weather or unexpected setbacks can cause extra work that must be caught up .	73.03229
it may not be profitable for a part-time farmer to own the labor-saving machinery that a full-time farmer can invest in profitably .	17.785938
drought , hail , disease , and insects take their toll of crops .	113.33155
sickness or loss of some of the livestock may cut into the owner ' s earnings , even into his capital .	79.508125
returns for money and labor invested may be small even in a good year .	154.36015
the high cost of land , supplies , and labor make it difficult to farm profitably on a part-time basis .	43.45336
land within commuting distance of a growing city is usually high in price , higher if it has subdivision possibilities .	105.11726
part-time farmers generally must pay higher prices for supplies than full-time farmers because they buy in smaller quantities .	56.966904
if the farm is in an industrial area where wages are high , farm labor costs will also be high .	115.28908
a part-time farmer needs unusual skill to get as high production per hen , per cow , or per acre as can be obtained by a competent full-time farmer .	61.594532
it will frequently be uneconomical for him to own the most up-to-date equipment .	99.09929
he may have to depend upon custom service for specialized operations , such as spraying or threshing , and for these , he may have to wait his turn .	35.301243
there will be losses caused by emergencies that arise while he is away at his off-farm job .	166.48946
the farm may be an additional burden if the main job is lost .	27.349747
this may be true whether the farm is owned or rented .	7.2647033
if the farm is rented , the rent must be paid .	19.941416
if it is owned , taxes must be paid , and if the place is not free of mortgage , there will be interest and payments on the principal to take care of .	47.480244
a farm provides a wholesome and healthful environment for children .	30.741995
it gives them room to play and plenty of fresh air .	73.019684
the children can do chores adapted to their age and ability .	120.81916
caring for a calf , a pig , or some chickens develops in children a sense of responsibility for work .	51.411102
part-time farming gives a measure of security if the regular job is lost , provided the farm is owned free of debt and furnishes enough income to meet fixed expenses and minimum living costs .	57.178276
for some retired persons , part-time farming is a good way to supplement retirement income .	26.819595
it is particularly suitable for those who need to work or exercise out of doors for their health .	86.70747
generally , the same level of living costs less in the country than in the city .	41.422474
the savings are not as great , however , as is sometime supposed .	92.74306
usually , the cost of food and shelter will be somewhat less on the farm and the cost of transportation and utilities somewhat more .	37.58632
where schools , fire and police protection , and similar municipal services are of equal quality in city and country , real estate taxes are usually about the same .	93.40455
a part-time farmer and his family can use their spare time profitably .	27.851295
some persons consider the work on a farm recreational .	17.8502
for some white-collar workers it is a welcome change from the regular job , and a physical conditioner .	73.82534
part-time farming can take comparatively little land , labor , and equipment -- or a great deal .	36.295624
it depends on the kind and the scale of the farming operation .	21.96596
general requirements for land , labor , and equipment are discussed below .	52.025494
specific requirements for each of various types of enterprises are discussed on pages 8 to 14 .	29.526861
three quarters to 1 acre of good land is enough for raising fruits and vegetables for home use , and for a small flock of chickens , a cow , and two pigs .	41.09638
you could not , of course , raise feed for the livestock on a plot this small .	136.14626
if you want to raise feed or carry out some enterprise on a larger scale , you ' ll need more land .	46.677185
in deciding how much land you want , take into account the amount you ' ll need to bring in the income you expect .	86.56883
but consider also how much you and your family can keep up along with your other work .	63.748936
the cost of land and the prospects for appreciation in value may influence your decision .	299.6159
some part-time farmers buy more land than they need in anticipation of suburban development .	51.141705
sometimes a desired acreage is offered only as part of a larger tract .	44.577522
when surplus land is not expensive to buy or to keep up , it is usually better to buy it than to buy so small an acreage that the development of adjoining properties might impair the residential value of the farm .	36.403706
if you have a year-round , full-time job you can ' t expect to grow much more than your family uses -- unless other members of the family do a good deal of the work or you hire help .	53.731987
as a rule , part-time farmers hire little help .	81.966576
in deciding on the enterprises to be managed by family labor , compare the amount of labor that can be supplied by the family with the labor needs of various enterprises listed in table 1 .	59.56522
list the number of hours the family can be expected to work each month .	28.109095
you may want to include your own regular vacation period if you have one .	71.28286
do not include all your spare time or all your family ' s spare time -- only what you are willing to use for farm work .	40.137856
if you are going to produce for home use only , you will need only hand tools .	266.4638
you will probably want to hire someone to do the plowing , however .	36.222748
for larger plantings , you ' ll need some kind of power for plowing , harrowing , disking , and cultivating .	14.701954
if you have a planting of half an acre or more you may want to buy a small garden tractor ( available for $300 to $500 with attachments , 1960 prices ) .	58.328045
these tractors are not entirely satisfactory for plowing , particularly on heavier soils , so you may still want to hire someone to do the plowing .	43.07987
cost of power and machinery is often a serious problem to the small-scale farmer .	17.845268
if you are going to farm for extra cash income on a part-time basis you must keep in mind the needed machinery investments when you choose among farm enterprises .	137.04993
you can keep your machinery investment down by buying good secondhand machinery , by sharing the cost and upkeep of machinery with a neighbor , and by hiring someone with machinery to do certain jobs .	46.156197
