publishers want books that will sell , recording studios want discs that will not seem strange to ears used to hillbilly and jazz music , grade and high schools want quaint , but moral , material .	117.86449
the analyst is apt to be too honest to fit in .	65.01644
as a result , most people don ' t have more than a vague idea what folklore actually is	58.886257
they see it as a potpourri of charming , moral legends and patriotic anecdotes , with a superstition or remedy thrown in here and there .	42.35743
and so well is such ignorance preserved by the amateur and the money-maker that even at the college level most of the hundred-odd folklore courses given in the united states survive on sentiment and nationalism alone .	61.520237
if one wishes to discuss a literary figure who uses folklore in his work , the first thing he must realize is that the literary figure is probably part of this ignorant american public .	72.01697
and while every writer must be dealt with as a special case , the interested student will want to ask himself a number of questions about each .	91.073235
does the writer know the difference between an `` ersatz ' ' ballad or tall tale and a true product of the folk ? ?	35.15777
when the writer uses material does he tamper with it to improve its commercial effect or does he leave it pure ? ?	163.84032
is he swept away by sentiment and nostalgia for an america that was ? ?	172.89717
or does he sincerely want to tap the real springs of american attitude and culture regardless of how unpopular and embarrassing they may be ? ?	139.6257
when he gets the answers to his questions he will be discouraged .	40.030006
in the first place , a good many writers who are said to use folklore , do not , unless one counts an occasional superstition or tale .	50.797707
robert frost , for instance , writes about rural life in new england , but he does not include any significant amount of folklore in his poems .	40.02033
this has not , however , prevented publishers from labeling him a `` folk poet ' ' , simply because he is a rural one .	44.86211
in the second place , a large number of writers , making a more direct claim than frost to being `` folk writers ' ' of one sort or another , clearly make no distinctions between genuine and bogus material .	58.049435
stephen vincent benet ' s john brown ' s body comes immediately to mind in this connection , as does john steinbeck ' s the grapes of wrath and carl sandburg ' s the people , yes .	35.334663
the last two writers introduce strong political bias into their works , and not unlike the union leaders that we will discuss soon , see folklore as a reservoir of protest by a downtrodden and publically silenced mass .	43.43592
folklore , as used by such writers , really reflects images engraved into it by the very person using it .	182.15167
the folk are simply not homogeneous with respect to nation or political attitude .	91.23175
in fact , there is much evidence to indicate they don ' t care a bit about anything beyond their particular regional , ethnic and occupational limits .	94.339165
nevertheless , with a reading public that longs for the `` good old days ' ' and with an awareness of our expanding international interests , it is easy for the benets to obtain a magnified position in literature by use of all sorts of americana , real or fake , and it is easy for the steinbecks and sandburgs to support their messages of reform by reading messages of reform into the minds of the folk .	30.063871
as part of the same arrangement , torrio had , in the spirit of peace and good will , and in exchange for armed support in the april election campaign , bestowed upon o ' banion a third share in the hawthorne smoke shop proceeds and a cut in the cicero beer trade .	61.77283
o ' banion was a complex and frightening man , whose bright blue eyes stared with a kind of frozen candour into others ' .	33.009296
he had a round , frank irish face , creased in a jovial grin that stayed bleakly in place even when he was pumping bullets into someone ' s body .	26.405058
he carried three guns -- one in the right trouser pocket , one under his left armpit , one in the left outside coat pocket -- and was equally lethal with both hands .	36.944897
he killed accurately , freely , and dispassionately .	9.739421
the police credited him with twenty-five murders but he was never brought to trial for one of them .	40.13778
like a fair number of bootleggers he disliked alcohol .	13.593072
he was an expert florist , tenderly dextrous in the arrangement of bouquets and wreaths .	10.206074
he divided humanity into `` right guys ' ' and `` wrong guys ' ' , and the wrong ones he was always willing to kill and trample under .	27.926468
he had what was described by a psychologist as a `` sunny brutality ' ' .	12.000238
he walked with a heavy list to the right , as that leg was four inches shorter than the other , but the lurch did not reduce his feline quickness with his guns .	24.51307
landesco thought him `` just a superior sort of plugugly ' ' but he was , in fact , with his aggression and hostility , and nerveless indifference to risking or administering pain , a casebook psychopath .	12.13492
he was also at this time , although not so interwoven in high politics and the rackets as torrio and capone , the most powerful and most dangerous mob leader in the chicago underworld , the roughneck king .	27.09554
o ' banion was born in poverty , the son of an immigrant irish plasterer , in the north side ' s little hell , close by the sicilian quarter and death corner .	44.57447
he had been a choir boy at the holy name cathedral and also served as an acolyte to father o ' brien .	44.419655
the influence of mass was less pervasive than that of the congested , slum tenements among the bawdy houses , honkytonks , and sawdust saloons of his birthplace	16.267307
he ran wild with the child gangs of the neighbourhood , and went through the normal pressure-cooker course of thieving , police-dodging , and housebreaking .	11.714907
at the age of ten , when he was working as a newsboy in the loop , he was knocked down by a streetcar which resulted in his permanently shortened leg .	20.130564
because of this he was known as gimpy ( but , as with capone and his nickname of scarface , never in his presence ) .	40.023277
in his teens o ' banion was enrolled in the vicious market street gang and he became a singing waiter in mcgovern ' s cafe , a notoriously low and rowdy dive in north clark street , where befuddled customers were methodically looted of their money by the singing waiters before being thrown out .	30.239021
he then got a job with the chicago herald-examiner as a circulation slugger , a rough fighter employed to see that his paper ' s news pitches were not trespassed upon by rival vendors .	21.413689
he was also at the same time gaining practical experience as a safe breaker and highwayman , and learning how to shoot to kill from a neanderthal convicted murderer named gene geary , later committed to chester asylum as a homicidal maniac , but whose eyes misted with tears when the young dion sang a ballad about an irish mother in his clear and syrupy tenor .	25.426111
o ' banion ' s first conflict with the police came in 1909 , at seventeen , when he was committed to bridewell prison for three months for burglary	28.826366
two years later he served another three months for assault .	29.155102
those were his only interludes behind bars , although he collected four more charges on his police record in 1921 and 1922 , three for burglary and one for robbery .	109.38432
but by now o ' banion ' s political pull was beginning to be effective .	50.482468
on the occasion of his 1922 indictment the $10 , 000 bond was furnished by an alderman , and the charge was nolle prossed .	16.737837
on one of his 1921 ventures he was actually come upon by a detective sergeant john j . ryan down on his knees with a tool embedded in a labour office safe in the postal telegraph building	69.172424
the jury wanted better evidence than that and he was acquitted , at a cost of $30 , 000 in bribes , it was estimated .	15.183765
as promptly as torrio , o ' banion jumped into bootlegging .	7.6426806
he conducted it with less diplomacy and more spontaneous violence than the sicilians , but he had his huge north side portion to exploit and he made a great deal of money .	45.04005
unlike the sicilians , he additionally conducted holdups , robberies , and safe-cracking expeditions , and refused to touch prostitution .	15.735592
he was also personally active in ward politics , and by 1924 o ' banion had acquired sufficient political might to be able to state `` i always deliver my borough as per requirements ' ' .	103.94806
until 1924 o ' banion pistoleers and knuckle-duster bullyboys had kept his north side domain solidly democratic .	126.888695
there was a question-and-answer gag that went around at that time q . `` who ' ll carry the forty-second and forty-third wards ' ' ? ?	26.507076
a . o ' banion , in his pistol pocket ' ' .	4.9898524
but as november 1924 drew close the democratic hierarchy was sorely troubled by grapevine reports that o ' banion was being wooed by the opposition , and was meeting and conferring with important republicans .	30.56256
to forestall any change of allegiance , the democrats hastily organised a testimonial banquet for o ' banion , as public reward for his past services and as a reminder of where his loyalties lay .	52.412373
the reception was held in a private dining room of the webster hotel on lincoln park west .	29.625504
it was an interesting fraternisation of ex-convicts , union racketeers , ward heelers , sold-out officials , and gunmen .	18.505941
the guest list is in itself a little parable of the state of american civic life at this time .	26.313835
it included the top o ' banion men and chief of detectives michael hughes .	58.622517
when mayor dever heard of the banquet he summoned hughes for an explanation of why he had been dishonouring the police department by consorting with these felons and fixers .	31.104925
hughes said that he had understood the party was to be in honour of jerry o ' connor , the proprieter of a loop gambling house .	25.637594
`` but when i arrived and recognised a number of notorious characters i had thrown into the detective bureau basement half a dozen times , i knew i had been framed , and withdrew almost at once ' ' .	51.123142
in fact , o ' connor was honoured during the ceremony with the presentation of a $2500 diamond stickpin .	17.39202
there was a brief interruption while one of o ' banion ' s men jerked out both his guns and threatened to shoot a waiter who was pestering him for a tip .	26.62081
then o ' banion was presented with a platinum watch set with rubies and diamonds .	14.374983
this dinner was the start of a new blatancy in the relationship between the gangs and the politicians , which , prior to 1924 , says pasley , `` had been maintained with more or less stealth ' ' , but which henceforth was marked by these ostentatious gatherings , denounced by a clergyman as `` belshazzar feasts ' ' , at which `` politicians fraternized cheek by jowl with gangsters , openly , in the big downtown hotels ' ' .	21.272324
pasley continued `` they became an institution of the chicago scene and marked the way to the moral and financial collapse of the municipal and county governments in 1928-29 ' ' .	28.34563
however , this inaugural feast did its sponsors no good whatever .	113.243225
o ' banion accepted his platinum watch and the tributes to his loyalty , and proceeded with the bigger and better republican deal .	81.84523
on election day -- november 4 -- he energetically marshalled his force of bludgeon men , bribers , and experts in forging repeat votes .	17.982046
the result was a landslide for the republican candidates .	3.9322975
this further demonstration of o ' banion ' s ballooning power did not please torrio and capone .	20.90588
in the past year there had been too many examples of his euphoric self-confidence and self-aggrandisement for their liking .	16.431744
he behaved publicly with a cocky , swaggering truculence that offended their vulpine latin minds , and behaved towards them personally with an unimpressed insolence that enraged them beneath their blandness .	26.856049
they were disturbed by his idiotic bravado -- as , when his bodyguard , yankee schwartz , complained that he had been snubbed by dave miller , a prize-fight referee , chieftain of a jewish gang and one of four brothers of tough reputation , who were hirschey , a gambler-politician in loose beer-running league with torrio and o ' banion , frank , a policeman , and max , the youngest .	22.039885
to settle this slight , o ' banion went down to the la salle theatre in the loop , where , he had learned , dave miller was attending the opening of a musical comedy .	27.107273
at the end of the performance , dave and max came out into the brilliantly lit foyer among a surge of gowned and tuxedoed first nighters .	18.065294
o ' banion drew his guns and fired at dave , severely wounding him in the stomach .	25.511372
a second bullet ricocheted off max ' s belt buckle , leaving him unhurt but in some distress .	20.370964
o ' banion tucked away his gun and walked out of the theatre	55.602043
that sort of braggadocio , for that sort of reason , in the view of torrio and capone , was a nonsense .	30.492804
a further example of the incompatible difference in personalities was when two policemen held up a torrio beer convoy on a west side street and demanded $300 to let it through .	80.83429
one of the beer-runners telephoned o ' banion -- on a line tapped by the detective bureau -- and reported the situation .	48.75839
o ' banion ' s reaction was `` three hundred dollars ! !	52.368103
why , i can get them knocked off for half that much ' ' .	81.0172
upon which the detective bureau despatched rifle squads to prevent trouble if o ' banion should send his gunmen out to deal with the hijacking policemen .	28.296305
but in the meantime the beer-runner , unhappy with this solution , telephoned torrio and returned to o ' banion with the message `` say , dionie , i just been talking to johnny , and he said to let them cops have the three hundred .	64.34505
he says he don ' t want no trouble ' ' .	12.018634
but torrio and capone had graver cause to hate and distrust the irishman .	12.658083
for three years , since the liquor territorial conference , torrio had , with his elastic patience , and because he knew that retaliation could cause only violent warfare and disaster to business , tolerated o ' banion ' s impudent double-crossing .	26.523651
they had suffered , in sulky silence , the sight of his sharp practice in cicero .	148.69736
when , as a diplomatic gesture of amity and in payment for the loan of gunmen in the april election , torrio had given o ' banion a slice of cicero , the profits from that district had been $20 , 000 a month .	36.901646
in six months o ' banion had boosted the profits to $100 , 000 a month -- mainly by bringing pressure to bear on fifty chicago speak-easy proprietors to shift out to the suburb .	26.517822
these booze customers had until then been buying their supplies from the sheldon , saltis-mcerlane , and druggan-lake gangs , and now they were competing for trade with the torrio-capone saloons	22.397886
once again o ' banion ' s brash recklessness had caused a proliferation of ill will .	59.427315
the revenue from o ' banion ' s cicero territory went up still higher , until the yield was more than the torrio-capone takings from the far bigger trade area of chicago ' s south and west sides .	51.91384
but he still showed no intention of sharing with the syndicate .	9.7263565
at last , even the controlled torrio was unable to hold still , and he tentatively suggested that o ' banion should take a percentage in the stickney brothels in return for one from his cicero beer concession .	45.218445
o ' banion ' s reply was a raucous laugh and a flat refusal .	50.861244
still more jealous bitterness was engendered by the o ' banion gang ' s seizure from a west side marshalling yard of a freight-car load of canadian whisky worth $100 , 000 and by one of the biggest coups of the prohibition era -- the sibley warehouse robbery , which became famous for the cool brazenness of the operation .	24.383125
here was stored $1 , 000 , 000 worth of bonded whisky .	13.52967
these 1750 cases were carted off in a one-night operation by the o ' banion men , who left in their stead the same number of barrels filled with water .	31.499891
a tsunami may be started by a sea bottom slide , an earthquake or a volcanic eruption .	23.713957
the most infamous of all was launched by the explosion of the island of krakatoa in 1883	26.523157
it raced across the pacific at 300 miles an hour , devastated the coasts of java and sumatra with waves 100 to 130 feet high , and pounded the shore as far away as san francisco .	27.561491
the ancient greeks recorded several catastrophic inundations by huge waves .	21.675447
whether or not plato ' s tale of the lost continent of atlantis is true , skeptics concede that the myth may have some foundation in a great tsunami of ancient times .	49.97544
indeed , a tremendously destructive tsunami that arose in the arabian sea in 1945 has even revived the interest of geologists and archaeologists in the biblical story of the flood .	14.956864
one of the most damaging tsunami on record followed the famous lisbon earthquake of november 1 , 1755	21.135666
its waves persisted for a week and were felt as far away as the english coast .	135.7841
tsunami are rare , however , in the atlantic ocean	228.71092
they are far more common in the pacific .	24.134197
japan has had 15 destructive ones ( eight of them disastrous ) since 1596 .	17.84195
the hawaiian islands are struck severely an average of once every 25 years .	132.73659
in 1707 an earthquake in japan generated waves so huge that they piled into the inland sea	47.498188
one wave swamped more than 1 , 000 ships and boats in osaka bay .	51.29616
a tsunami in the hawaiian islands in 1869 washed away an entire town ( ponoluu ) , leaving only two forlorn trees standing where the community had been .	92.22731
in 1896 a japanese tsunami killed 27 , 000 people and swept away 10 , 000 homes .	33.93636
the dimensions of these waves dwarf all our usual standards of measurement .	81.65235
an ordinary sea wave is rarely more than a few hundred feet long from crest to crest -- no longer than 320 feet in the atlantic or 1 , 000 feet in the pacific .	15.902663
but a tsunami often extends more than 100 miles and sometimes as much as 600 miles from crest to crest .	20.856226
while a wind wave never travels at more than 60 miles per hour , the velocity of a tsunami in the open sea must be reckoned in hundreds of miles per hour .	20.996092
the greater the depth of the water , the greater is the speed of the wave	72.55727
lagrange ' s law says that its velocity is equal to the square root of the product of the depth times the acceleration due to gravity .	41.190018
in the deep waters of the pacific these waves reach a speed of 500 miles per hour .	49.205193
tsunami are so shallow in comparison with their length that in the open ocean they are hardly detectable .	57.20994
their amplitude sometimes is as little as two feet from trough to crest .	18.98039
usually it is only when they approach shallow water on the shore that they build up to their terrifying heights .	23.629238
on the fateful day in 1896 when the great waves approached japan , fishermen at sea noticed no unusual swells .	62.422176
not until they sailed home at the end of the day , through a sea strewn with bodies and the wreckage of houses , were they aware of what had happened .	31.002932
the seemingly quiet ocean had crashed a wall of water from 10 to 100 feet high upon beaches crowded with bathers , drowning thousands of them and flattening villages along the shore .	35.317986
the giant waves are more dangerous on flat shores than on steep ones .	44.483147
they usually range from 20 to 60 feet in height , but when they pour into a v-shaped inlet or harbor they may rise to mountainous proportions .	19.141596
generally the first salvo of a tsunami is a rather sharp swell , not different enough from an ordinary wave to alarm casual observers .	56.898247
this is followed by a tremendous suck of water away from the shore as the first great trough arrives .	29.112183
reefs are left high and dry , and the beaches are covered with stranded fish .	16.3917
at hilo large numbers of people ran out to inspect the amazing spectacle of the denuded beach .	6.626491
many of them paid for their curiosity with their lives , for some minutes later the first giant wave roared over the shore .	26.368788
after an earthquake in japan in 1793 people on the coast at tugaru were so terrified by the extraordinary ebbing of the sea that they scurried to higher ground .	23.341743
when a second quake came , they dashed back to the beach , fearing that they might be buried under landslides .	11.793659
just as they reached the shore , the first huge wave crashed upon them .	26.911499
a tsunami is not a single wave but a series .	49.850582
the waves are separated by intervals of 15 minutes to an hour or more ( because of their great length ) , and this has often lulled people into thinking after the first great wave has crashed that it is all over .	74.08019
the waves may keep coming for many hours .	5.174855
usually the third to the eighth waves in the series are the biggest .	46.016293
among the observers of the 1946 tsunami at hilo was francis p . shepard of the scripps institution of oceanography , one of the world ' s foremost marine geologists .	7.752254
he was able to make a detailed inspection of the waves .	25.226236
their onrush and retreat , he reported , was accompanied by a great hissing , roaring and rattling .	9.504701
the third and fourth waves seemed to be the highest .	77.42712
on some of the islands ' beaches the waves came in gently	134.2065
they were steepest on the shores facing the direction of the seaquake from which the waves had come .	52.97438
in hilo bay they were from 21 to 26 feet high .	19.8815
the highest waves , 55 feet , occurred at pololu valley .	65.62684
scientists and fishermen have occasionally seen strange by-products of the phenomenon .	19.942339
during a 1933 tsunami in japan the sea glowed brilliantly at night .	12.874422
the luminosity of the water is now believed to have been caused by the stimulation of vast numbers of the luminescent organism noctiluca miliaris by the turbulence of the sea .	9.893552
japanese fishermen have sometimes observed that sardines hauled up in their nets during a tsunami have enormously swollen stomachs	16.634789
the fish have swallowed vast numbers of bottom-living diatoms , raised to the surface by the disturbance .	37.645893
the waves of a 1923 tsunami in sagami bay brought to the surface and battered to death huge numbers of fishes that normally live at a depth of 3 , 000 feet .	41.668766
gratified fishermen hauled them in by the thousands .	107.57848
the tsunami-warning system developed since the 1946 disaster in hawaii relies mainly on a simple and ingenious instrument devised by commander c . k . green of the coast and geodetic survey staff .	26.060892
it consists of a series of pipes and a pressure-measuring chamber which record the rise and fall of the water surface .	65.1598
but when waves with a period of between 10 and 40 minutes begin to roll over the ocean , they set in motion a corresponding oscillation in a column of mercury which closes an electric circuit .	52.799347
this in turn sets off an alarm , notifying the observers at the station that a tsunami is in progress .	28.733362
such equipment has been installed at hilo , midway , attu and dutch harbor .	14.770127
the moment the alarm goes off , information is immediately forwarded to honolulu , which is the center of the warning system .	17.495634
this center also receives prompt reports on earthquakes from four coast survey stations in the pacific which are equipped with seismographs .	62.558506
its staff makes a preliminary determination of the epicenter of the quake and alerts tide stations near the epicenter for a tsunami .	17.517467
by means of charts showing wave-travel times and depths in the ocean at various locations , it is possible to estimate the rate of approach and probable time of arrival at hawaii of a tsunami getting under way at any spot in the pacific .	53.916126
the civil and military authorities are then advised of the danger , and they issue warnings and take all necessary protective steps .	73.533875
all of these activities are geared to a top-priority communication system , and practice tests have been held to assure that everything will work smoothly .	67.82151
since the 1946 disaster there have been 15 tsunami in the pacific , but only one was of any consequence .	32.87379
on november 4 , 1952 , an earthquake occurred under the sea off the kamchatka peninsula .	34.74056
at 17 07 that afternoon ( greenwich time ) the shock was recorded by the seismograph alarm in honolulu .	9.693809
within about an hour with the help of reports from seismic stations in alaska , arizona and california , the quake ' s epicenter was placed at 51 degrees north latitude and 158 degrees east longitude .	23.582022
while accounts of the progress of the tsunami came in from various points in the pacific ( midway reported it was covered with nine feet of water ) , the hawaiian station made its calculations and notified the military services and the police that the first big wave would arrive at honolulu at 23 30 greenwich time .	79.580605
it turned out that the waves were not so high as in 1946 .	42.13171
they hurled a cement barge against a freighter in honolulu harbor , knocked down telephone lines , marooned automobiles , flooded lawns , killed six cows .	34.785492
but not a single human life was lost , and property damage in the hawaiian islands did not exceed $800 , 000 .	19.239304
there is little doubt that the warning system saved lives and reduced the damage .	181.24342
but it is plain that a warning system , however efficient , is not enough .	101.26667
in the vulnerable areas of the pacific there should be restrictions against building homes on exposed coasts , or at least a requirement that they be either raised off the ground or anchored strongly against waves .	103.74583
life has evolved from simple combinations of molecules in the sea to complex combinations in man .	123.0109
the land , too , is changing , and earthquakes are daily reminders of this .	44.633694
earthquakes result when movements in the earth twist rocks until they break .	266.73993
sometimes this is accompanied by visible shifts of the ground surface	63.87095
often the shifts cannot be seen , but they are there	69.26815
and everywhere can be found scars of earlier breaks once deeply buried .	131.73761
today ' s earthquakes are most numerous in belts where the earth ' s restlessness is presently concentrated , but scars of the past show that there is no part of the earth that has not had them .	39.519917
the effects of earthquakes on civilization have been widely publicized , even overemphasized .	24.256124
the role of an earthquake in starting the destruction of whole cities is tremendously frightening , but fire may actually be the principal agent in a particular disaster .	65.94753
superstition has often blended with fact to color reports .	47.638363
we have learned from earthquakes much of what we now know about the earth ' s interior , for they send waves through the earth which emerge with information about the materials through which they have traveled .	64.9554
these waves have shown that 1 , 800 miles below the surface a liquid core begins , and that it , in turn , has a solid inner core .	80.257065
earthquakes originate as far as 400 miles below the surface , but they do not occur at greater depths .	14.990023
two unsolved mysteries are based on these facts .	5.0946984
( 1 ) as far down as 400 miles below the surface the material should be hot enough to be plastic and adjust itself to twisting forces by sluggish flow rather than by breaking , as rigid surface rocks do .	128.28322
( 2 ) if earthquakes do occur at such depths , why not deeper ? ?	68.74575
knowledge gained from studying earthquake waves has been applied in various fields .	17.32385
in the search for oil and gas , we make similar waves under controlled conditions with dynamite and learn from them where there are buried rock structures favorable to the accumulation of these resources .	76.31878
we have also developed techniques for recognizing and locating underground nuclear tests through the waves in the ground which they generate .	70.95957
the following discussion of this subject has been adapted from the book causes of catastrophe by l . don leet .	43.665627
at twelve minutes after five on the morning of wednesday , april 18 , 1906 , san francisco was shaken by a severe earthquake .	19.664349
a sharp tremor was followed by a jerky roll .	15.050683
in ireland ' s county limerick , near the river shannon , there is a quiet little suburb by the name of garryowen , which means `` garden of owen ' ' .	24.715725
undoubtedly none of the residents realize the influence their town has had on american military history , or the deeds of valor that have been done in its name .	62.038647
bursting from the lips of a charging cavalry trooper was the last sound heard on this earth by untold numbers of cheyennes , sioux and apaches , mexican banditos under pancho villa , japanese in the south pacific , and chinese and north korean communists in korea .	35.151352
garryowen is the battle cry of the 7th u . s . cavalry regiment , `` the fighting seventh ' ' .	8.925491
today a battle cry may seem an anachronism , for in the modern army , esprit de corps has been sacrificed to organizational charts and tables .	14.034956
but don ' t tell that to a veteran of the fighting seventh , especially in a saloon on saturday night .	27.929382
of all the thousands of men who have served in the 7th cav , perhaps no one knows its spirit better than lieutenant colonel melbourne c . chandler .	84.43506
wiry and burr-headed , with steel blue eyes and a chest splattered with medals , chandler is the epitome of the old-time trooper .	14.861037
the truth is , however , that when mel chandler first reported to the regiment the only steed he had ever ridden was a swivel chair and the only weapon he had ever wielded was a pencil .	63.800575
chandler had been commissioned in the medical service corps and was serving as a personnel officer for the kansas city medical depot when he decided that if he was going to make the army his career , he wanted to be in the fighting part of it .	38.922806
though he knew no more about military science and tactics than any other desk officer , he managed to get transferred to the combat forces .	37.040264
the next thing he knew he was reporting for duty as commanding officer of troop h , 7th cavalry , in the middle of corps maneuvers in japan .	24.821648
outside of combat , he couldn ' t have landed in a tougher spot .	11.683396
first of all , no unit likes to have a new co brought in from the outside , especially when he ' s an armchair trooper .	55.611195
second , if there is ever a perfect time to pull the rug out from under him , it ' s on maneuvers .	68.32779
in combat , helping your co make a fool of himself might mean getting yourself killed .	376.83505
but in maneuvers , with the top brass watching him all the time , it ' s easy .	55.686817
but his first few days with troop h were full of surprises , beginning with first sergeant robert early .	183.64352
chandler had expected a tough old trooper with a gravel voice .	106.0258
instead sergeant early was quiet , sharp and confident .	10.180323
he had enlisted in the army straight out of high school and had immediately set about learning his new trade .	267.78165
there was no weapon early could not take apart and reassemble blind-folded .	41.841125
he could lead a patrol and he knew his paper work .	116.58173
further , he had taken full advantage of the army ' s correspondence courses .	52.24635
he not only knew soldiering , but mathematics , history and literature as well .	33.352314
but for all his erudite confidence , sergeant early was right out of the garryowen mold .	122.5422
he was filled with the spirit of the fighting seventh .	7.777923
sergeant early let the new co know just how lucky he was to be in the best troop in the best regiment in the united states army .	33.835243
he fed the captain bits of history about the troops and the regiment .	20.41793
for example , it was a battalion of the 7th cavalry under colonel george armstrong custer that had been wiped out at the battle of the little big horn .	16.08508
it didn ' t take captain chandler long to realize that he had to carry a heavy load of tradition on his shoulders as commander of troop aj .	44.58533
but what made the load lighter was the realization that every officer , non-com and trooper was ready and willing to help him carry it , for the good of the troop and the regiment .	39.54095
maneuvers over , the 7th returned to garrison duty in tokyo , captain chandler still with them .	71.58619
it was the 7th cavalry whose troopers were charged with guarding the imperial palace of the emperor .	15.842402
but still mel chandler was not completely convinced that men would really die for a four-syllable word , `` garryowen ' ' .	45.48372
it happened at the st . patrick ' s day party , a big affair for a regiment which had gone into battle for over three-quarters of a century to the strains of an irish march .	46.897327
in the middle of the party chandler looked up to see four smiling faces bearing down upon him , each beaming above the biggest , greenest shamrock he had ever seen .	46.307858
the faces belonged to lieutenant marvin goulding , his wife and their two children .	36.873184
and when the singing began , it was the gouldings who sang the old irish songs the best .	32.701473
though there was an occasional good-natured chuckle about marvin goulding , the jewish officer from chicago , singing tearfully about the ould sod , no one really thought it was strange .	33.838333
for marvin goulding , like giovanni martini , the bugler boy who carried custer ' s last message , or margarito lopez , the one-man army on leyte , was a garryowen , through and through .	25.525883
it was no coincidence that goulding was one of the most beloved platoon leaders in the regiment .	10.227688
and so mel chandler got the spirit of garryowen .	3.7602222
he set out to keep troop h the best troop in the best regiment .	18.16347
one of his innovations was to see to it that every man -- cook and clerk as well as rifleman -- qualified with every weapon in the troop .	52.05671
even the mess sergeant , bill brown , a dapper , cocky transfer from an airborne division , went out on the range .	23.608145
the troop received a new leader , lieutenant robert m . carroll , fresh out of rotc and bucking for regular army status .	35.91767
carroll was sharp and military , but he was up against tough competition for that ra berth , and he wanted to play it cool .	46.588196
so mel chandler set out to sell him on the spirit of garryowen , just as he himself had been sold a short time before .	50.516914
when the korean war began , on june 25 , 1950 , the anniversary of the day custer had gone down fighting at the little big horn and the day the regiment had assaulted the beachhead of leyte during world war 2 , , the 7th cavalry was not in the best fighting condition .	21.398266
its entire complement of non-commissioned officers on the platoon level had departed as cadre for another unit , and its vehicles were still those used in the drive across luzon in world war 2 .	63.513245
just a month after the korean war broke out , the 7th cavalry was moving into the lines , ready for combat .	23.510315
from then on the fighting seventh was in the thick of the bitterest fighting in korea .	15.123679
one night on the naktong river , mel chandler called on that fabled esprit de corps .	16.865156
the regiment was dug in on the east side of the river and the north koreans were steadily building up a concentration of crack troops on the other side .	23.379204
the troopers knew an attack was coming , but they didn ' t know when , and they didn ' t know where .	21.844835
at 6 o ' clock on the morning of august 12 , they were in doubt no longer .	72.22124
the enemy had filtered across the river during the night and a full force of 1000 men , armed with russian machine guns , attacked the position held by chandler ' s men .	52.229176
first came the cannon fodder , white-clad civilians being driven into death as a massive human battering ram .	33.535824
they were followed by crack north korean troops , who mounted one charge after another .	121.898796
they overran the 7th cav ' s forward machine-gun positions through sheer weight of numbers , over piles of their own dead .	77.93377
another force flanked the company and took up a position on a hill to the rear .	24.316357
captain chandler saw that it was building up strength .	109.459404
he assembled a group of 25 men , composed of wounded troopers awaiting evacuation , the company clerk , supply men , cooks and drivers , and led them to the hill .	38.088444
one of the more seriously wounded was lieutenant carroll , the young officer bucking for the regular army .	16.611263
chandler left carroll at the bottom of the hill to direct any reinforcements he could find to the fight .	98.74067
he took one step , two , broke into a trot and then into a run .	35.27849
the first thing he knew the words `` garryowen ' ' ! !	4.770667
his followers shouted the old battle cry after him and charged the hill , firing as they ran .	195.07416
the koreans fell back , but regrouped at the top of the hill and pinned down the cavalrymen with a screen of fire .	10.672334
chandler , looking to right and left to see how his men were faring , suddenly saw another figure bounding up the hill , hurling grenades and hollering the battle cry as he ran .	26.331408
it was bob carroll , who had suddenly found himself imbued with the spirit of garryowen .	23.63914
he had formed his own task force of three stragglers and led them up the hill in a fighting seventh charge .	73.01948
because of this diversionary attack the main group that had been pinned down on the hill was able to surge forward again .	34.432693
but an enemy grenade hit carroll in the head and detonated simultaneously .	25.108826
he went down like a wet rag and the attackers hit the dirt in the face of the withering enemy fire .	16.419949
enemy reinforcements came pouring down , seeking a soft spot .	215.65494
they found it at the junction between troops h and g , and prepared to counterattack .	27.773289
`` okay , men ' ' , he said .	1.9085485
goulding leaped to his feet and started forward , `` garryowen ' ' ! !	10.278764
but the bullets whacked home before he finished his battle cry and marvin goulding fell dead .	38.39398
for an instant his men hesitated , unable to believe that their lieutenant , the most popular officer in the regiment , was dead .	40.51906
then they let out a bellow of anguish and rage and , cursing , screaming and hollering `` garryowen ' ' ! !	6.5553317
they charged into the enemy like wild men .	15.144957
that finished the job that captain chandler and lieutenant carroll had begun .	34.09504
goulding ' s platoon pushed back the enemy soldiers and broke up the timing of the entire enemy attack .	42.66504
reinforcements came up quickly to take advantage of the opening made by goulding ' s platoon .	35.507946
the north koreans threw away their guns and fled across the rice paddies .	22.029316
artillery and air strikes were called in to kill them by the hundreds .	34.200397
though bob carroll seemed to have had his head practically blown off by the exploding grenade , he lived .	47.619354
today he is a major -- in the regular army .	42.641037
so filled was mel chandler with the spirit of garryowen that after korea was over , he took on the job of writing the complete history of the regiment .	38.70251
after years of digging , nights and weekends , he put together the big , profusely illustrated book , of garryowen and glory , which is probably the most complete history of any military unit .	33.76152
the battle of the naktong river is just one example of how the battle cry and the spirit of the fighting seventh have paid off .	67.99968
for nearly a century the cry has never failed to rally the fighting men of the regiment .	29.845469
take the case of major marcus a . reno , who survived the battle of the little big horn in 1876 .	17.459103
from the enlisted men he pistol-whipped to the subordinate officer whose wife he tried to rape , a lot of men had plenty of reason heartily to dislike marcus reno .	37.08654
many of his fellow officers refused to speak to him .	4.8404646
but when a board of inquiry was called to look into the charges of cowardice made against him , the men who had seen reno leave the battlefield and the officer who had heard reno suggest that the wounded be left to be tortured by the sioux , refused to say a harsh word against him .	39.095497
he was a member of the fighting seventh .	7.6471257
although it was at the battle of the little horn , about which more words have been written than any other battle in american history , that the 7th cavalry first made its mark in history , the regiment was ten years old by then .	79.10825
brevet major general george armstrong custer was the regiment ' s first permanent commander and , like such generals as george s . patton and terry de la mesa allen in their rise to military prominence , custer was a believer in blood and guts warfare .	53.10488
during the civil war , custer , who achieved a brilliant record , was made brigadier general at the age of 23 .	43.855556
he finished the war as a major general , commanding a full division , and at 25 was the youngest major general in the history of the u . s . army .	44.702557
i do not mean to suggest that these assumptions are self-evident , in the sense that everyone agrees with them .	33.271214
if they were , walter lippmann would be writing the same columns as george sokolsky , and herb lock would have nothing to draw cartoons about .	50.573925
i do mean , however , that i take them for granted , and that everything i shall be saying would appear quite idiotic against any contrary assumptions .	108.89404
the ultimate objective of american policy is to help establish a world in which there is the largest possible measure of freedom and justice and peace and material prosperity	96.85112
and in particular -- since this is our special responsibility -- that these conditions be enjoyed by the people of the united states .	37.165382
i speak of `` the largest possible measure ' ' because any person who supposes that these conditions can be universally and perfectly achieved -- ever -- reckons without the inherent imperfectability of himself and his fellow human beings , and is therefore a dangerous man to have around .	45.351654
these conditions are unobtainable -- are not even approachable in the qualified sense i have indicated -- without the prior defeat of world communism .	131.9091
this is true for two reasons because communism is both doctrinally , and in practice , antithetical to these conditions	20.62454
and because communists have the will and , as long as soviet power remains intact , the capacity to prevent their realization .	80.75253
moreover , as communist power increases , the enjoyment of these conditions throughout the world diminishes pro rata and the possibility of their restoration becomes increasingly remote .	34.440056
it follows that victory over communism is the dominant , proximate goal of american policy .	36.00437
proximate in the sense that there are more distant , more `` positive ' ' ends we seek , to which victory over communism is but a means .	127.152534
but dominant in the sense that every other objective , no matter how worthy intrinsically , must defer to it .	46.80131
but if we must choose between peace and keeping the communists out of berlin , then we must fight .	53.743317
freedom , in the sense of self-determination , is a worthy objective	35.368946
but if granting self-determination to the algerian rebels entails sweeping that area into the sino-soviet orbit , then algerian freedom must be postponed .	48.665516
but if justice for bantus entails driving the government of the union of south africa away from the west , then the bantus must be prepared to carry their identification cards yet a while longer .	53.553806
but if providing higher standards of living gets in the way of producing sufficient guns to resist communist aggression , then material sacrifices and denials will have to be made .	39.918907
it may be , of course , that such objectives can be pursued consisently with a policy designed to overthrow communism	21.910814
my point is that where conflicts arise they must always be resolved in favor of achieving the indispensable condition for a tolerant world -- the absence of soviet communist power .	27.683018
this much having been said , the question remains whether we have the resources for the job we have to do -- defeat communism -- and , if so , how those resources ought to be used .	44.374893
this brings us squarely to the problem of power , and the uses a nation makes of power .	117.33485
i submit that this is the key problem of international relations , that it always has been , that it always will be .	61.589066
and i suggest further that the main cause of the trouble we are in has been the failure of american policy-makers , ever since we assumed free world leadership in 1945 , to deal with this problem realistically and seriously .	92.78658
in the recent political campaign two charges were leveled affecting the question of power , and i think we might begin by trying to put them into proper focus .	45.478287
the other , for the most part , true .	155.50214
the first was that america had become -- or was in danger of becoming -- a second-rate military power .	101.29439
i know i do not have to dwell here on the absurdity of that contention .	35.457947
you may have misgivings about certain aspects of our military establishment -- i certainly do -- but you know any comparison of over-all american strength with over-all soviet strength finds the united states not only superior , but so superior both in present weapons and in the development of new ones that our advantage promises to be a permanent feature of u . s . -soviet relations for the foreseeable future .	89.95465
i have often searched for a graphic way of impressing our superiority on those americans who have doubts , and i think mr . jameson campaigne has done it well in his new book american might and soviet myth .	80.38913
suppose , he says , that the tables were turned , and we were in the soviets ' position `` there would be more than 2 , 000 modern soviet fighters , all better than ours , stationed at 250 bases in mexico and the caribbean .	60.079563
overwhelming russian naval power would always be within a few hundred miles of our coast .	11.971188
half of the population of the u . s . would be needed to work on arms just to feed the people ' ' .	33.963905
add this to the unrest in the countries around us where oppressed peoples would be ready to turn on us at the first opportunity .	70.57781
add also a comparatively primitive industrial plant which would severely limit our capacity to keep abreast of the soviets even in the missile field which is reputed to be our main strength .	47.95929
if we look at the situation this way , we can get an idea of khrushchev ' s nightmarish worries -- or , at least , of the worries he might have if his enemies were disposed to exploit their advantage .	37.333584
the other charge was that america ' s political position in the world has progressively deteriorated in recent years .	25.104725
the contention needs to be formulated with much greater precision than it ever was during the campaign , but once that has been done , i fail to see how any serious student of world affairs can quarrel with it .	88.90826
the argument was typically advanced in terms of u . s . `` prestige ' ' .	7.139902
prestige , however , is only a minor part of the problem	12.184347
and even then , it is a concept that can be highly misleading .	29.337019
prestige is a measure of how other people think of you , well or ill .	188.8635
but contrary to what was implied during the campaign , prestige is surely not important for its own sake .	29.52909
only the vain and incurably sentimental among us will lose sleep simply because foreign peoples are not as impressed by our strength as they ought to be .	97.3515
the thing to lose sleep over is what people , having concluded that we are weaker than we are , are likely to do about it .	57.83898
the evidence suggests that foreign peoples believe the united states is weaker than the soviet union , and is bound to fall still further behind in the years ahead .	59.642155
this ignorant estimate , i repeat , is not of any interest in itself	77.72601
but it becomes very important if foreign peoples react the way human beings typically do -- namely , by taking steps to end up on what appears to be the winning side .	123.25686
to the extent , then , that declining u . s . prestige means that other nations will be tempted to place their bets on an ultimate american defeat , and will thus be more vulnerable to soviet intimidation , there is reason for concern .	45.680946
still , these guesses about the outcome of the struggle cannot be as important as the actual power relationship between the soviet union and ourselves .	75.61845
here i do not speak of military power where our advantage is obvious and overwhelming but of political power -- of influence , if you will -- about which the relevant questions are is soviet influence throughout the world greater or less than it was ten years ago ? ?	139.062
and is western influence greater or less than it used to be ? ?	54.477016
in answering these questions , we need to ask not merely whether communist troops have crossed over into territories they did not occupy before , and not merely whether disciplined agents of the cominform are in control of governments from which they were formerly excluded the success of communism ' s war against the west does not depend on such spectacular and definitive conquests .	81.815575
success may mean merely the displacement of western influence .	20.979267
communist political warfare , we must remember , is waged insidiously and in deliberate stages .	14.824861
fearful of inviting a military showdown with the west which they could not win , the communists seek to undermine western power where the nuclear might of the west is irrelevant -- in backwoods guerrilla skirmishes , in mob uprisings in the streets , in parliaments , in clandestine meetings of undercover conspirators , at the united nations , on the propaganda front , at diplomatic conferences -- preferably at the highest level .	33.60658
the soviets understand , moreover , that the first step in turning a country toward communism is to turn it against the west .	58.665016
thus , typically , the first stage of a communist takeover is to `` neutralize ' ' a country .	26.999763
the second stage is to retain the nominal classification of `` neutralist ' ' , while in fact turning the country into an active advocate and adherent of soviet policy .	27.194183
and this may be as far as the process will go .	220.50624
the kremlin ' s goal is the isolation and capture , not of ghana , but of the united states -- and this purpose may be served very well by countries that masquerade under a `` neutralist ' ' mask , yet in fact are dependable auxiliaries of the soviet foreign office .	48.514645
to recite the particulars of recent soviet successes is hardly reassuring .	55.961796
six years ago french indochina , though in troubie , was in the western camp .	14.201085
cambodia is , for all practical purposes , neutralist .	81.972404
indonesia , in the early days of the republic , leaned toward the west .	29.39816
today sukarno ' s government is heavily besieged by avowed communists , and for all of its `` neutralist ' ' pretensions , it is a firm ally of soviet policy .	18.176981
ceylon has moved from a pro-western orientation to a neutralism openly hostile to the west .	15.801885
in the middle east , iraq , syria and egypt were , a short while ago , in the western camp .	59.937748
today the nasser and kassem governments are adamantly hostile to the west , are dependent for their military power on soviet equipment and personnel	96.834305
in almost every particular follow the kremlin ' s foreign policy line .	65.45214
a short time ago all africa was a western preserve .	108.66939
never mind whether the kikiyus and the bantus enjoyed wilsonian self-determination the point is that in the struggle for the world that vast land mass was under the domination and influence of the west .	60.477654
today , africa is swerving violently away from the west and plunging , it would seem , into the soviet orbit .	24.554235
latin america was once an area as `` safe ' ' for the west as nebraska was for nixon .	37.3177
one latin american country , cuba , has become a soviet bridgehead ninety miles off our coast .	90.79425
in some countries the trend has gone further than others mexico , panama , and venezuela are displaying open sympathy for castroism , and there is no country -- save the dominican republic whose funeral services we recently arranged -- where castroism and anti-americanism does not prevent the government from unqualifiedly espousing the american cause .	54.594543
only in europe have our lines remained firm -- and there only on the surface .	128.62323
the strains of neutralism are running strong , notably in england , and even in germany .	21.411106
what have we to show by way of counter-successes ? ?	8.801765
we have had opportunities -- clear invitations to plant our influence on the other side of the iron curtain .	41.05585
there was the hungarian revolution which we praised and mourned , but did nothing about .	61.05487
there was the polish revolution which we misunderstood and then helped guide along a course favorable to soviet interests .	300.36258
there was the revolution in tibet which we pretended did not exist .	11.419632
only in one instance have we moved purposively and effectively to dislodge existing communist power in guatemala .	80.99336
and contrary to what has been said recently , we did not wait for `` outside pressures ' ' and `` world opinion ' ' to bring down that communist government	54.722267
we moved decisively to effect an anti-communist coup d ' etat .	29.19919
we served our national interests , and by so doing we saved the guatemalan people the ultimate in human misery .	136.56244
the first rattle of the machine guns , at 7 10 in the evening , roused around me the varied voices and faces of fear .	44.93062
`` sounds exactly like last time ' ' .	2.2890744
the young man spoke steadily enough , but all at once he looked grotesquely unshaven .	79.891396
the middle-aged man said over and over , `` why did i come here , why did i come here ' ' .	26.092587
amid the crackle of small arms and automatic weapons , i heard the thumping of mortars .	20.76763
this was my second day in vientiane , the administrative capital of laos , and my thoughts were none too brave .	55.386646
better stay in the hotel lobby , where the walls looked good and thick .	81.78519
chinese and indian merchants across the street were slamming their steel shutters .	10.187139
hotel attendants pulled parked bicycles into the lobby .	4.2951646
a woman with a small boy slipped in between them .	96.993
`` please ' ' , she said , `` please ' ' .	7.6870856
she held out her hand to show that she had money .	43.011253
the american newspaperman worried about getting to the cable office .	63.52245
had the communist-led pathet lao finally come this far ? ?	38.030537
or was it another revolt inside vientiane ? ?	1.0086863
`` let ' s play hero ' ' , i said .	14.0721445
`` let ' s go to the roof and see ' ' .	10.308233
there had been an eclipse of the moon .	1.9088452
a traditional lao explanation is that the moon was being swallowed by a toad , and the remedy was to make all possible noise , ideally with firearms .	22.543655
the din was successful , too , for just before the moon disappeared , the frightened toad had begun to spit it out again , which meant good luck all around .	91.28358
how quaint it all seemed the next day .	4.2773476
a restaurant posted a reminder to patrons `` who became excited and left without paying their checks ' ' .	66.595116
but everyone i met had sought cover first and asked questions later .	111.241684
and no wonder , for vientiane , the old city of sandalwood , had become the city of bullet holes .	44.64451
i saw holes in planes at the airport and in cars in the streets .	33.901237
along the main thoroughfares hardly a house had not been peppered .	10.722645
in place of the police headquarters was a new square filled with rubble .	33.52987
mortars had demolished the defense ministry and set fire to the american embassy next door .	119.33143
what had been the ambassador ' s suite was now jagged walls of blackened brick .	13.595607
this damage had been done in the battle of vientiane , fought less than three months earlier when four successive governments had ruled here in three days ( december 9-11 , 1960 ) .	72.32535
and now , in march , all laos suffered a state of siege .	30.827744
the pathet lao forces held two northern provinces and openly took the offensive in three more .	117.17639
throughout the land their hit-and-run terrorists spread fear of ambush and death .	11.323347
`` and it ' s all the more tragic because it ' s so little deserved ' ' , said mr . j . j . a . frans , a belgian official of the united nations educational , scientific , and cultural organization .	24.151896
we talked after i hailed his jeep marked with the u . n . flag .	7.777392
practically all the people of laos , he explained -- about two million of them -- are rice farmers , and the means and motives of modern war are as strange to them as clocks and steel plows .	89.63122
they look after their fields and children and water buffaloes in ten or eleven thousand villages , with an average of 200 souls .	37.470654
nobody can tell more closely how many villages there are .	109.15631
they spread over an area no larger than oregon	409.69864
yet they include peoples as different from one another as oregonians are from patagonians .	24.442884
faith in the buddha and staying at peace with the phis , the spirits	15.083107
and to live in harmony with nature ' ' .	1.4552681
`` precisely ' ' , said mr . frans .	3.7468622
he spoke of the season of dryness and dust , brought by the monsoon from the northeast , in harmony with the season of rain and mud , brought by the monsoon from the southwest .	21.761745
the slim pirogues in harmony with the majestically meandering mekong river .	3.4518902
shy , slender-waisted girls at the loom in harmony with the frangipani by the wayside .	12.582391
for so long as death was not violent , it was natural and to be welcomed , making a funeral a feast .	86.72613
to many a frenchman -- they came 95 years ago , colonized , and stayed until laos became independent in 1953 -- the land had been even more delightfully tranquil than tahiti .	32.657482
yet laos was now one of the most explosive headaches of statesmen around the globe .	22.655622
the pathet lao , stiffened by communist veterans from neighboring north viet nam , were supplied by soviet aircraft .	28.084082
the royal lao army , on the other hand , was paid and equipped with american funds .	49.855537
in six years , u . s . aid had amounted to more than $1 . 60 for each american -- a total of three hundred million dollars .	39.46016
we were there at a moment when the situation in laos threatened to ignite another war among the world ' s giants .	26.66844
even if it did not , how would this little world of gentle people cope with its new reality of grenades and submachine guns ? ?	80.9519
to find out , we traveled throughout that part of laos still nominally controlled , in the daytime at least , by the royal lao army from attopeu , the city of buffalo dung in the southeast , to muong sing , the city of lions in the northwest , close to communist china ( map , page 250 ) .	22.923943
we rode over roads so rough that our jeep came to rest atop the soil between ruts , all four wheels spinning uselessly .	26.64678
we flew in rickety planes so overloaded that we wondered why they didn ' t crash .	21.805914
in the end we ran into communist artillery fire .	13.973288
`` we ' ' were bill garrett of the national geographic illustrations staff , whose three cameras and eight lenses made him look as formidable as any fighting man we met	86.45012
boun my -- the name means one who has a boun , a celebration , and is therefore lucky -- was born in savannakhet , the border of paradise .	28.498404
he had attended three universities in the united states .	2.2560422
but he had never seen the mountainous half of his native land north of vientiane , including the royal capital , luang prabang .	18.564177
before the airplanes came , he said , travel in laos was just about impossible .	178.24335
alas , so it almost proved for us , too .	36.107037
to go outside the few cities required permits .	6.170197
and getting them seemed a life ' s work .	18.661425
nobody wanted americans to be hurt or captured , and few soldiers could be spared as escorts .	28.383661
we were told that to the pathet lao , a kidnaped american was worth at least $750 , a fortune in laos .	25.970991
everyone had heard of the american contractor who had spurned an escort .	11.104462
now pathet lao propagandists were reported marching him barefoot from village to village , as evidence of evil american intervention .	84.01196
although we enjoyed our rounds of the government offices in vientiane , with officials offering tea and pleasing conversation in french , we were getting nowhere .	52.76648
we had nearly decided that all the tales of lao lethargy must be true , when we were invited to take a trip with the prime minister .	28.437962
could we be ready in 15 minutes ? ?	1.0198567
his highness had decided only two hours ago to go out of town , and he was eager to be off .	44.402565
and so , after a flight southeast to savannakhet , we found ourselves bouncing along in a jeep right behind the land-rover of prince boun oum of champassak , a tall man of churchillian mien in a bush jacket and a ten-gallon hat from texas .	20.67938
from his shoulder bag peeked the seven-inch barrel of a luger .	9.312134
with our company of soldiers , we made one long column of reddish dust .	47.368515
in keng kok , the city of silkworms , the prime minister bought fried chickens and fried cicadas , and two notebooks for me .	14.518956
then we drove on , until there was no more road and we traversed dry rice fields , bouncing across their squat earth walls .	78.58015
an hour of bouncing , a brief stop in a village to inspect a new school or dispensary .	27.45592
more bouncing , another stop , a new house for teachers , a new well .	173.95369
then off again , rushing to keep up .	40.287514
but our two jeep mates -- keo viphakone from luang prabang and john cool from beaver , pennsylvania -- were beaming under their coatings of dust .	54.024612
together they had probably done more than any other men to help push laos toward the 20th century -- constructively .	68.32268
mr . keo , once a diplomat in paris and washington , was commissioner of rural affairs .	76.86067
john , an engineer and anthropologist with a doctorate from the london school of economics , headed the rural development division of usom , the united states operations mission administering u . s . aid .	28.446663
`` what you see are self-help projects ' ' , john said .	12.92867
`` we ask the people what they want , and they supply the labor .	58.525707
we send shovels , cement , nails , and corrugated iron for roofs .	8.518683
that way they have an infirmary for $400 .	3.7538705
we have 2 , 500 such projects , and they add up to a lot more than just roads and wells and schools .	99.6588
`` our people have been used to accepting things as they found them ' ' , he said .	20.376202
`` where there was no road , they lived without one .	98.52277
now they learn that men can change their surroundings , through their traditional village elders , without violence .	108.987076
that ' s a big step toward a modern state .	55.999485
you might say we are in the nation-building business ' ' .	27.55211
in the villages people lined up to give us flowers .	35.299904
then came coconuts , eggs , and rice wine .	97.247665
the prime minister paid his respects to the buddhist monks , strode rapidly among the houses , joked with the local soldiery , and made a speech .	18.135036
the soldiers are fighting and the americans are helping , he said , but in the fight against the pathet lao the key factor is the villager himself .	42.847385
but our stumping tour of the south wasn ' t all misery .	9.845626
crossing the 4 , 000-foot width of the mekong at champassak , on a raft with an outboard motor , we took off our dusty shirts and enjoyed a veritable ocean breeze .	18.618584
briefly we rolled over a paved road up to pak song , on the cool bolovens plateau .	20.801619
the prince visited the hospital of operation brotherhood , supported by the junior chamber of commerce of the philippines , and fed rice to two pet elephants he kept at his residence at pak song .	35.892796
in the village of soukhouma , which means `` peaceful ' ' , we had a baci .	11.318417
this is the most endearing of lao ceremonies .	2.338873
it takes place in the household , a rite of well-wishing for myriad occasions -- for the traveler , a wedding , a newborn child , the sick , the new year , for any good purpose .	40.100876
the preparations were elaborate flowers , candles , incense sticks , rice wine , dozens of delicacies , and pieces of white cotton string .	26.95016
the strings were draped around flowers in tall silver bowls ( page 261 ) .	15.111056
the candles were lighted , and we sat on split-bamboo mats among the village notables .	11.524281
i was careful to keep my feet , the seat of the least worthy spirits , from pointing at anyone ' s head , where the worthiest spirits reside .	42.143696
now a distinguished old man called on nine divinities to come and join us .	27.064665
a man has 32 souls , one for each part of the body .	51.632027
those souls like to wander off , and must be called back .	264.7804
with the divinities present and our souls in place , we were wished health , happiness , and power .	62.626553
then , one after another , the villagers tied the waiting cotton strings around our wrists .	138.64288
these were to be kept on , to hold in the 32 souls .	59.76751
as we stepped out into the sunlight , a man came up to john cool and silently showed him his hand .	79.837166
it had a festering hole as big as a silver dollar .	22.244713
john said `` i have some antiseptic salve with me , but it ' s too late for that ' ' .	15.076
my interviews with teen-agers confirmed this portrait of the weakening of religious and ethnic bonds .	17.809694
jewish identity was often confused with social and economic strivings .	2.1270604
`` being jewish gives you tremendous drive ' ' , a boy remarked .	7.130706
`` it means that you have to get ahead ' ' .	9.29247
when i pressed for a purely religious definition , i encountered the familiar blend of liberal piety , interfaith good will , and a small residue of ethnic loyalty .	59.159935
`` i like the tradition ' ' , a girl said .	24.860905
`` i like to follow the holidays when they come along .	68.74545
but you don ' t have to worship in the traditional way .	41.8822
as i see it , there ' s no real difference between being jewish , catholic , or protestant ' ' .	38.552315
another teen-ager remarked `` most jews don ' t believe in god , but they believe in people -- in helping people ' ' .	46.952854
still another boy asserted `` to be a good jew is to do no wrong	114.48548
it ' s to be a good person ' ' .	2.0151482
when asked how this was different from being a good protestant , the boy answered , `` it ' s the same thing ' ' .	26.46445
this accords with the study by maier and spinrad .	3.2466044
they discovered that , although 42 per cent of a sample of catholic students and 15 per cent of the protestants believed it important to live in accordance with the teachings of their religion , only 8 per cent of the jewish students had this conviction .	33.405544
the most important aims of the jewish students were as follows to make the world a better place to live in -- 30 per cent	64.10966
to get happiness for yourself -- 28 per cent	1.3083904
nevertheless , most of the teen-agers i interviewed believed in maintaining their jewish identity and even envisioned joining a synagogue or temple .	29.919899
however , they were hostile to jewish orthodoxy , professing to believe in judaism `` but in a moderate way ' ' .	17.309149
one boy said querulously about orthodox jews `` it ' s the twentieth century , and they don ' t have to wear beards ' ' .	7.615399
the reason offered for clinging to the ancestral faith lacked force and authority even in the teen-agers ' minds .	84.36178
`` we were brought up that way ' ' was one statement which won general assent .	114.39582
`` i want to show respect for my parents ' religion ' ' was the way in which a boy justified his inhabiting a halfway house of judaism .	34.47644
still another suggested that he would join a temple `` for social reasons , since i ' ll be living in a suburb ' ' .	36.66953
intermarriage , which is generally regarded as a threat to jewish survival , was regarded not with horror or apprehension but with a kind of mild , clinical disapproval .	76.63052
most of the teen-agers i interviewed rejected it on pragmatic grounds .	18.75581
`` when you marry , you want to have things in common ' ' , a girl said , `` and it ' s hard when you don ' t marry someone with your own background ' ' .	34.453453
a fourteen-year-old girl from the middle west observed wryly that , in her community , religion inconveniently interfered with religious activities -- at least with the peripheral activities that many middle class jews now regard as religious .	118.10707
it appears that an orthodox girl in the community disrupted plans for an outing sponsored by one of the jewish service groups because she would not travel on saturday and , in addition , required kosher food .	72.32618
another girl from a relatively large midwestern city described herself as `` the only orthodox girl in town ' ' .	38.749462
this is , no doubt , inaccurate , but it does convey how isolated she feels among the vast army of the nonobservant .	78.11432
one of the significant things about jewish culture in the older teen years is that it is largely college-oriented .	30.380991
sixty-five per cent of the jewish teen-agers of college age attend institutions of higher learning .	89.5635
this is substantially higher than the figures for the american population at large -- 45 . 6 per cent for males and 29 . 2 per cent for females .	31.571266
this may help explain a phenomenon described by a small-town jewish boy .	36.997906
in their first two years in high school , jewish boys in this town make strenuous exertions to win positions on the school teams .	53.731667
however , in their junior and senior years , they generally forego their athletic pursuits , presumably in the interest of better academic achievement .	43.09044
it is significant , too , that the older teen-agers i interviewed believed , unlike the younger ones , that jewish students tend to do better academically than their gentile counterparts .	23.800404
the percentage of jewish girls who attend college is almost as high as that of boys .	68.12531
the motivations for both sexes , to be sure , are different .	36.80432
the vocational motive is the dominant one for boys , while jewish girls attend college for social reasons and to become culturally developed .	48.73677
one of the significant developments in american-jewish life is that the cultural consumers are largely the women .	70.397285
it is they who read -- and make -- jewish best-sellers and then persuade their husbands to read them .	29.4888
in upper teen jewish life , the non-college group tends to have a sense of marginality .	25.075483
`` people automatically assume that i ' m in college ' ' , a nineteen-year-old machinist observed irritably .	20.559841
however , among the girls , there are some morale-enhancing compensations for not going to college .	40.851707
the jewish working girl almost invariably works in an office -- in contradistinction to gentile factory workers -- and , buttressed by a respectable income , she is likely to dress better and live more expansively than the college student .	37.250587
she is even prone to regard the college girl as immature .	19.480007
one of the reasons for the high percentage of jewish teen-agers in college is that a great many urban jews are enabled to attend local colleges at modest cost .	51.781933
this is particularly true in large centers of jewish population like new york , chicago , and philadelphia .	39.017483
what is noteworthy about this large group of teen-agers is that , although their attitudes hardly differentiate them from their gentile counterparts , they actually lead their lives in a vast self-enclosed jewish cosmos with relatively little contact with the non-jewish world .	38.253586
perhaps the jewish students at brooklyn college -- constituting 85 per cent of those who attend the day session -- can serve as a paradigm of the urban , lower-middle class jewish student .	27.54641
there is , to begin , an important sex difference .	795.81946
typically , in a lower-middle class jewish family , a son will be sent to an out-of-town school , if financial resources warrant it , while the daughter will attend the local college .	58.7469
first , the girl ' s education has a lower priority than the son ' s .	44.93606
second , the attitude in jewish families is far more protective toward the daughter than toward the son .	164.2202
most jewish mothers are determined to exercise vigilance over the social and sexual lives of their daughters by keeping them home .	93.6276
the consequence of this is that the girls at brooklyn college outnumber the boys and do somewhat better academically .	21.24337
one can assume that some of the brightest boys are out of town .	60.39538
brooklyn college students have an ambivalent attitude toward their school .	59.50975
on the one hand , there is a sense of not having moved beyond the ambiance of their high school .	49.73589
this is particularly acute for those who attended midwood high school directly across the street from brooklyn college .	17.764338
they have a sense of marginality at being denied that special badge of status , the out-of-town school .	54.73278
at the same time , there is a good deal of self-congratulation at attending a good college -- they are even inclined to exaggerate its not inconsiderable virtues -- and they express pleasure at the cozy in-group feeling that the college generates .	46.889313
`` it ' s people of your own kind ' ' , a girl remarked .	24.985603
`` you don ' t have to watch what you say .	34.704556
of course , i would like to go to an out-of-town school where there are all kinds of people , but i would want lots of jewish kids there ' ' .	33.316895
for most brooklyn college students , college is at once a perpetuation of their ethnic attachments and a breaking away from the cage of neighborhood and family .	35.14844
brooklyn college is unequivocally jewish in tone , and efforts to detribalize the college by bringing in unimpeachably midwestern types on the faculty have been unavailing .	38.82052
however , a growing intellectual sophistication and the new certitudes imparted by courses in psychology and anthropology make the students increasingly critical of their somewhat provincial and overprotective parents .	53.404755
and the rebellion of these third generation jews is not the traditional conflict of culture but , rather , a protest against a culture that they view as softly and insidiously enveloping .	55.37447
`` as long as i ' m home , i ' ll never grow up ' ' , a nineteen-year-old boy observed sadly .	13.0342245
`` they don ' t like it if i do anything away from home .	46.454376
it ' s so much trouble , i don ' t usually bother ' ' .	5.1940646
for girls , the overprotection is far more pervasive .	12.403564
parents will drive on friday night to pick up their daughters after a sorority or house plan meeting .	93.745544
a freshman girl ' s father not too long ago called a dean at brooklyn college and demanded the `` low-down ' ' on a boy who was going out with his daughter .	25.780079
the domestic tentacles even extend to the choice of a major field .	44.219925
under pressure from parents , the majority of brooklyn college girls major in education since that co-ordinates best with marriage plans -- limited graduate study requirement and convenient working hours .	280.95367
this means that a great many academically talented girls are discouraged from pursuing graduate work of a more demanding nature .	69.891594
a kind of double standard exists here for jewish boys and girls as it does in the realm of sex .	39.70795
the breaking away from the prison house of brooklyn is gradual .	69.84569
first , the student trains on his hapless parents the heavy artillery of his newly acquired psychological and sociological insights .	30.44996
then , with the new affluence , there is actually a sallying forth into the wide , wide world beyond the precincts of new york .	53.4842
it is significant that the catskills , which used to be the summer playground for older teen-agers , a kind of summer suburb of new york , no longer attracts them in great numbers -- except for those who work there as waiters , bus boys , or counselors in the day camps .	48.75409
but it should be pointed out that some of the new watering places -- fire island , nantucket , westhampton , long island , for example -- tend to be homogeneously jewish .	29.978693
although brooklyn college does not yet have a junior-year-abroad program , a good number of students spend summers in europe .	35.10758
in general , however , the timetable of travel lags considerably behind that of the student at harvard or smith .	123.05896
and acculturation into the world at large is likely to occur for the brooklyn college student after college rather than during the four school years .	62.072556
brooklyn college is marjorie morningstar territory , as much as the bronx or central park west .	40.100964
there are hordes of nubile young women there who , prodded by their impatient mothers , are determined to marry .	13.721896
it is interesting that , although the percentage of married students is not appreciably higher at brooklyn than elsewhere -- about 30 per cent of the women and 25 per cent of the men in the graduating class -- the anxiety of the unmarried has puffed up the estimate .	23.674803
