in any case , miss millay ' s sweet-throated bitterness , her variations on the theme that the world was not only well lost for love but even well lost for lost love , her constant and wonderfully tragic posture , so unlike that of fitzgerald since it required no scenery or props , drew from the me that i was when i fell upon her verses an overwhelming yea .	92.64038
but all this , i am well aware , is the bel canto of love , and although i have always liked to think that it was to the bel canto and to that alone that i listened , i know well enough that it was not .	33.048466
if i am to speak the whole truth about my knowledge of love , i will have to stop trying to emulate the transcendant nightingale .	29.883228
there is another side of love , more nearly symbolized by the croak of the mating capercailzie , or better still perhaps by the mute antics of the slug .	28.49862
whether you experienced the passion of desire i have , of course , no way of knowing , nor indeed have i wished with even the most fleeting fragment of a wish to know , for the fact that one constitutes by one ' s mere existence so to speak the proof of some sort of passion makes any speculation upon this part of one ' s parents ' experience more immodest , more scandalizing , more deeply unwelcome than an obscenity from a stranger .	52.672318
at the same time , i am aware that my recoil could be interpreted by readers of the tea leaves at the bottom of my psyche as an incestuous sign , since theirs is a science of paradox if one hates , they say it is because one loves	36.006947
if one bullies , they say it is because one is afraid	127.516304
if one shuns , they say it is because one desires	90.51309
and according to them , whatever one fancies one feels , what one feels in fact is the opposite .	64.53331
well , normally abnormal or normally normal , neurotic or merely fastidious ( do the tea-leaf readers , by the way , allow psyches to have moral taste ? ?	79.01223
) , i have never wanted to know what you knew of passion .	68.60602
you probably would not remember , since you never seemed to remember even the same moments as i , much less their intensity , one sunny midday on fifth avenue when you had set out with me for some final shopping less than a week before the wedding you staged for me with such reluctance at the farm .	88.261986
we had been walking quite briskly , for despite your being so small and me so tall , your stride in those days could easily match mine .	175.8476
we had stopped before a shop window to assess its autumnal display , when you suddenly turned to me , looking up from beneath one of your wrong hats , and with your nervous `` ahem ' ' ! !	27.494307
said `` there are things i must tell you about this man you are marrying which he does not know himself ' ' .	52.35712
if you had screamed right there in the street where we stood , i could not have felt more fear .	69.97974
with scarcely a mumble of excuse , i fled .	15.423868
i fled , however , not from what might have been the natural fear of being unable to disguise from you that the things about my bridegroom -- in the sense you meant the word `` things ' ' -- which you had been galvanizing yourself to tell me as a painful part of your maternal duty were things which i had already insisted upon finding out for myself ( despite , i may now say , the unspeakable awkwardness of making the discovery on principle , yes , on principle , and in cold blood ) because i was resolved , as a modern woman , not to be a mollycoddle waiting for life but to seize life by the throat .	73.32124
i had developed too foolproof a facade to be afraid of self-betrayal .	18.834908
what i fled from was my fear of what , unwittingly , you might betray , without meaning to , about my father and yourself .	72.185196
but i can see from this latest trick of memory how much more arbitrary and influential it is than the will .	233.58144
while my memory holds with relentless tenacity , as i cannot too often stress , to my wrongs , when it comes to my shames , it gestures and jokes and toys with chronology like a prestidigitator in the hope of distracting me from them .	34.377415
just as i was about to enlarge upon my discovery of the underside of the leaf of love , memory , displeased at being asked to yield its unsavory secrets , dashed ahead of me , calling back over its shoulder `` skip it .	66.94292
but i will not skip it or cut it out .	35.28703
it is not my intention in this narrative to picture myself as a helpless victim moored to the rock of experience and left to the buffetings of chance .	54.89486
if to be innocent is to be helpless , then i had been -- as are we all -- helpless at the start .	168.66322
but the time came when i was no longer innocent and therefore no longer helpless .	44.987495
helpless in that sense i can never be again .	109.772705
however , i confess my hope that i will be innocent again , not with a pristine , accidental innocence , but rather with an innocence achieved by the slow cutting away of the flesh to reach the bone .	56.717247
for innocence , of all the graces of the spirit , is i believe the one most to be prayed for .	79.11074
although it is constantly made to look foolish ( too simple to come in out of the rain , people say , who have found in the innocent an impediment ) , it does not mind looking foolish because it is not concerned with how it looks .	64.00647
it assumes that things are as they seem when they seem best , and when they seem worst it overlooks them .	48.910496
to innocence , a word given is a word that will be kept .	48.439705
instinctively , innocence does unto others as it expects to be done by .	36.928207
but when these expectations are once too often ground into the dust , innocence can falter , since its strength is according to the strength of him who possesses it .	89.53699
the innocence of which i speak is , i know , not incorruptible .	44.439106
but i insist upon believing that even when it is lost , it may , like paradise , be regained .	25.12617
however , it was not of innocence in general that i was speaking , but of perhaps the frailest and surely the least important side of it which is innocence in romantic love .	86.06755
here , if anywhere , it is not wholly incontrovertible .	8.913003
to you , for instance , the word innocence , in this connotation , probably retained its biblical , or should i say technical sense , and therefore i suppose i must make myself quite clear by saying that i lost -- or rather handed over -- what you would have considered to be my innocence two weeks before i was legally entitled , and in fact by oath required , to hand it over along with what other goods and bads i had .	98.53813
but to me innocence is far less tangible .	9.956637
i had long since begun to lose my general innocence when i lost my trust in you , but this special innocence i lost before ever i loved , through my discovery that one could tremble with desire and even experience a flaming delight that had nothing , nothing whatever to do with friendship or liking , let alone with love .	116.98111
i knew this knowledge to be corrupting at the time i acquired it	35.061005
today , these many years later , after all the temptations resisted or yielded to , the weasel satisfactions and the engulfing dissatisfactions since endured , i call it corrupting still .	34.74968
you , i could swear to it , remained innocent in this sense until the end .	192.95113
yours , but not mine , was an age in which innocence was fostered and carefully -- if not perhaps altogether innocently -- preserved .	61.93487
you had grown up at a time when the most distinguishing mark of a lady was the noli me tangere writ plain across her face .	28.077782
moreover , because of the particular blot on your family escutcheon through what may only have been one unbridled moment on your grandmother ' s part , and because you had the lean-to kitchen and trundle bed of your childhood to outgrow , what you obviously most desired with both your conscious and unconscious person , what you bent your whole will , sensibility , and intelligence upon , was to be a lady .	70.06892
before being daughter , wife , or mother , before being cultured ( a word now bereft both socially and politically of the sheen you children of frontiersmen bestowed on it ) , before being sorry for the poor , progressive about public health , and prettily if somewhat imprecisely humanitarian , indeed first and foremost , you were a lady .	101.78812
there was , of course , more to the portrait of a lady you carried in your mind ' s eye than the sine qua non of her virtue .	43.65796
a lady , you made clear to me both by precept and example , never raised her voice or slumped in her chair , never failed in social tact ( in heaven , for instance , would not mention st . john the baptist ' s head ) , never pouted or withdrew or scandalized in company , never reminded others of her physical presence by unseemly sound or gesture , never indulged in public scenes or private confidences , never spoke of money save in terms of alleviating suffering , never gossiped or maligned , never stressed but always minimized the hopelessness of anything from sin to death itself .	69.82697
the songs sandburg sang often reminded listeners of songs of a kindred character they knew entirely or in fragments .	90.44553
often these listeners would refer sandburg to persons who had similar ballads or ditties .	20.657112
in due time sandburg was a walking thesaurus of american folk music .	24.639668
after he had finished the first two volumes of his lincoln , sandburg went to work assembling a book of songs out of hobo and childhood days and from the memory of songs others had taught him .	57.208523
he rummaged , found composers and arrangers , collaborated on the main design and outline of harmonization with musicians , ballad singers , and musicologists .	21.79583
the result was a collection of 280 songs , ballads , ditties , brought together from all regions of america , more than one hundred never before published the american songbag .	37.223827
each song or ditty was prefaced by an author ' s note which indicated the origin and meaning of the song as well as special interest the song had , musical arrangement , and most of the chorus and verses .	51.45747
the book , published in 1927 , has been selling steadily ever since .	60.44136
as sandburg said at the time `` it is as ancient as the medieval european ballads brought to the appalachian mountains , it is as modern as skyscrapers , the volstead act , and the latest oil well gusher ' ' .	27.398989
sandburg is in constant demand as an entertainer .	2.2402413
first , carl respects his audience and prepares his speeches carefully .	17.315737
even when he is called upon for impromptu remarks , he has notes written on the back of handy envelopes .	26.779541
he has his own system of shorthand , devised by abbreviations `` humility ' ' will be `` humly ' ' , `` with ' ' will be `` w ' ' , and `` that ' ' will be `` tt ' ' .	13.491265
the second reason for his popularity is his complete spontaneity with the guitar .	19.036255
it is a mistake , however , to imagine that sandburg uses the guitar as a prop .	41.722248
he is no dextrous-fingered college boy but rather a dedicated , humble , and bashful apostle of this instrument .	18.785955
at age seventy-four , he became what he shyly terms a `` pupil ' ' of andres segovia , the great guitarist of the western world .	17.68665
it is not easy to become segovia ' s pupil .	8.956446
`` his fingers labor heavily on the strings and he asked for my help in disciplining them .	36.468727
i found that this precocious , grown-up boy of 74 deserved to be taught .	18.597538
there has long existed a brotherly affection between us , thus i accepted him as my pupil .	75.12904
just as in the case of every prodigy child , we must watch for the efficacy of my teaching to show up in the future -- if he should master all the strenuous exercises i inflicted on him .	69.10751
to play the guitar as he aspires will devour his three-fold energy as a historian , a poet and a singer .	19.72324
one cause of schopenhauer ' s pessimism was the fact that he failed to learn the guitar .	25.556597
i am certain that carl sandburg will not fall into the same sad philosophy .	69.11842
the heart of this great poet constantly bubbles forth a generous joy of life -- with or without the guitar ' ' .	41.85061
the public ' s identification of carl sandburg and the guitar is no happenstance .	21.69107
he is proud of having segovia for a friend and dedicated a poem to him titled `` the guitar ' ' .	19.808935
carl says it is the greatest poem ever written to the guitar because he has never heard of any other poem to that subtle instrument .	40.904316
`` a portable companion always ready to go where you go -- a small friend weighing less than a freshborn infant -- to be shared with few or many -- just two of you in sweet meditation ' ' .	56.689476
the new york herald tribune ' s photographer , ira rosenberg , tells an anecdote about the time he wanted to take a picture of carl playing a guitar .	15.53835
mr . rosenberg suggested that they go out and find one .	133.96246
`` preferably ' ' , said carl , `` one battered and worn , such as might be found in a pawnshop ' ' .	54.40887
they went to the pawnshop of joseph miller of 1162 sixth avenue .	9.837508
`` mr . miller was in the shop ' ' , the herald tribune story related , `` but was reluctant to have anybody ' s picture taken inside , because his business was too ' confidential ' for pictures .	60.21189
`` but after introductions he asked ' carl sandburg ? ?	8.954539
`` he wanted mr . sandburg to pose with one of the guitars he had displayed behind glass in the center of his shop , but the poet eyed this somewhat distastefully .	22.22581
' kalamazoo guitars ' , he said , ' used by radio hillbilly singers .	251.05713
`` he chose one from mr . miller ' s window , a plain guitar with no fancy polish .	33.144005
while the picture was taken , mr . miller ' s disposition to be generous to mr . sandburg increased to the point where he advised , ' i won ' t even charge you the one dollar rental fee ' ' ' .	59.781506
when someone in the audience rose and asked how does it feel to be a celebrity , carl said , `` a celebrity is a fellow who eats celery with celerity ' ' .	19.324331
this has always been carl ' s attitude .	8.539858
lloyd lewis wrote that when he first knew carl in 1916 , sandburg was making $27 . 50 a week writing features for the day book and eating sparse luncheons in one-arm restaurants .	33.324276
he walked home at night for two miles beyond the end of a suburban trolley .	32.528664
when fame came it changed sandburg only slightly .	26.44594
lewis remembered another newspaperman asking , `` carl , have your ideas changed any since you got all these comforts ' ' ? ?	104.824844
carl thought the question over slowly and answered `` i know a starving man who is fed never remembers all the pangs of his starvation , i know that ' ' .	36.15975
that was all he said , lewis reports .	29.872046
in answer to a new york times query on what is fame ( `` thoughts on fame ' ' , october 23 , 1960 ) , carl said `` fame is a figment of a pigment .	36.287266
another is a bubble of a bauble ' ' .	1.3909589
`` ah , did you once see shelley plain ' ' ? ?	15.289479
the impression you get from carl sandburg ' s home is one of laughter and happiness	19.84991
and the laughter and the happiness are even more pronounced when no company is present .	70.97547
carl has been married to paula for fifty-three years , and he has not made a single major decision without careful consideration and thorough discussion with his wife .	81.26497
through all these years , mrs . sandburg has pointedly avoided the limelight .	10.007034
she has shared her husband ' s greatness , but only within the confines of their home	29.036922
it is a dedication which began the moment she met carl .	184.69673
mrs . sandburg received a phi beta kappa key from the university of chicago and she was busy writing and teaching when she met sandburg .	64.61617
`` you are the ' peoples ' poet ' ' ' was her appraisal in 1908 , and she stopped teaching and writing to devote herself to the fulfillment of her husband ' s career .	18.41177
she has rarely been photographed with him and , except for carl ' s seventy-fifth anniversary celebration in chicago in 1953 , she has not attended the dozens of banquets , functions , public appearances , and dinners honoring him -- all of this upon her insistence .	49.217552
even now i will not intrude upon her except to state a few bare facts .	320.65622
the only way to describe paula sandburg is to say she is beautiful in a grecian sense .	51.514206
her clothes , her hair , everything about her is both graceful and simple .	60.917496
she has small , broad , capable hands and an enormous energy .	60.370586
she is not only a trained mathematician and classicist , but a good architect .	14.657121
she designed and supervised the building of the harbert , michigan , house , most of which was constructed by one local carpenter who carried the heavy beams singly upon his shoulder .	35.566544
as the sandburg goat herd increased , she also designed the barn alterations to accommodate them .	11.953772
when erosion threatened the foundation of their home in harbert , paula sandburg planted grapevines and arranged the snow fences which helped hold the sands away .	46.50593
she was born lilian steichen , her parents immigrants from luxemburg .	6.896243
her mother called her paus ' l , a luxemburg endearment meaning `` pussycat ' ' .	9.570129
some of the children of the family could not pronounce this name and called her paula , a soubriquet carl liked so much she has been paula ever since .	76.97738
her parents , pious roman catholics , christened her mary anne elizabeth magdalene steichen .	8.101485
`` my mother read a book right after i was born and there was a lilian in the book she loved and i became lilian -- and eventually i became paula ' ' .	48.422604
this family of luxemburg immigrants , in fact , produced two exceptional children .	61.422424
paula ' s older brother is edward steichen , a talented artist and , for the past half-century , one of the world ' s eminent photographers .	24.265617
( two years ago the photography editor of vogue magazine titled his article about steichen , `` the world ' s greatest photographer ' ' .	18.552513
by the time lilian had been graduated from public school , her parents were doing quite well .	56.415527
her mother was a good manager and established a millinery business in milwaukee .	14.396932
but her father was not enthusiastic about sending young paula to high school .	120.02335
`` this is no place for a young girl ' ' , he said .	5.3423176
the parents compromised , however , on a convent school and paula went to ursuline academy in london , ontario .	34.75938
she was pious , too , once kneeling through the night from holy thursday to good friday , despite the protest of the nuns that this was too much for a young girl .	42.734203
she knelt out of reverence for having read the meditations of st . augustine .	6.9203444
she read everything else she could get her hands on , including an article ( she thinks it was in the atlantic monthly ) by mark twain on `` white slavery ' ' .	71.897316
paula was saddened about what was happening to little girls and vowed to kneel no more in chapel .	66.90226
if there was ever a thought in her mind she might devote her life to religion , it was now dispelled .	83.707016
`` i felt that i must devote myself to the ' outside ' world ' ' .	40.167427
she passed the entrance examinations to the university of illinois , but during the year at urbana felt more important events transpired at the university of chicago .	31.201216
`` and besides , thorstein veblen was one of the chicago professors ' ' .	18.672245
at the university of chicago she studied whitman and shelley , and became a socialist .	22.042944
socialist leaders in milwaukee recognized her worth , not only because of her dedication but because of her fluency in german , french , and luxemburg .	27.1196
she once gave a german recitation before a convention of german-language teachers in milwaukee .	27.561651
carl and paula met in milwaukee in 1907 during paula ' s christmas holiday visit to her parents .	44.738102
he `` legitimized ' ' paula for lilian steichen , and it was paula who insisted on carl for charles .	68.41177
victor berger , the panjandrum of wisconsin socialism and member of congress , had asked paula steichen to translate some of his german editorials into english .	85.55603
carl , who was stationed in appleton , wisconsin , organizing for the social democrats , was in berger ' s office and made it his business to escort paula to the streetcar .	46.732727
she left the next day for her teaching job at princeton , illinois .	30.179558
( after graduation from the university of chicago , paula taught for two years in the normal school at valley city , north dakota , then two years at princeton ( illinois ) township high school .	38.123886
) by the time the streetcar pulled away , he had fallen in love with paula .	34.67832
paula says that even though carl ' s letters usually began , `` dear miss steichen ' ' , there was an understanding from the beginning that they would become husband and wife .	45.03324
paula generously lent me one of carl ' s love letters , dated february 21 , 1908 , hotel athearn , oshkosh , wisconsin	19.784481
`` dear miss steichen it is a very good letter you send me -- softens the intensity of this guerilla warfare i am carrying on up here .	39.739407
never until in this work of s-d organization have i realized and felt the attitude and experience of a teacher .	121.72414
the united states is always ready to participate with the soviet union in serious discussion of these or any other subjects that may lead to peace with justice .	60.922466
certainly it is not necessary to repeat that the united states has no intention of interfering in the internal affairs of any nation	25.771637
by the same token , we reject any soviet attempt to impose its system on us or other peoples by force or subversion .	75.56633
now this concern for the freedom of other peoples is the intellectual and spiritual cement which has allied us with more than forty other nations in a common defense effort .	67.93408
not for a moment do we forget that our own fate is firmly fastened to that of these countries	37.82238
we will not act in any way which would jeopardize our solemn commitments to them .	61.325527
we and our friends are , of course , concerned with self-defense .	35.26613
growing out of this concern is the realization that all people of the free world have a great stake in the progress , in freedom , of the uncommitted and newly emerging nations .	21.081757
these peoples , desperately hoping to lift themselves to decent levels of living must not , by our neglect , be forced to seek help from , and finally become virtual satellites of , those who proclaim their hostility to freedom .	98.020485
but they must have technical and investment assistance .	4.700102
this is a problem to be solved not by america alone , but also by every nation cherishing the same ideals and in position to provide help .	104.82974
in recent years america ' s partners and friends in western europe and japan have made great economic progress .	63.31292
the international economy of 1960 is markedly different from that of the early postwar years .	48.655293
no longer is the united states the only major industrial country capable of providing substantial amounts of the resources so urgently needed in the newly developed countries .	89.42796
to remain secure and prosperous themselves , wealthy nations must extend the kind of co-operation to the less fortunate members that will inspire hope , confidence , and progress .	41.110947
a rich nation can for a time , without noticeable damage to itself , pursue a course of self-indulgence , making its single goal the material ease and comfort of its own citizens -- thus repudiating its own spiritual and material stake in a peaceful and prosperous society of nations .	65.03436
but the enmities it will incur , the isolation into which it will descend , and the internal moral and spiritual softness that will be engendered , will , in the long term , bring it to economic and political disaster .	52.42017
america did not become great through softness and self-indulgence .	1.6269021
her miraculous progress in material achievements flows from other qualities far more worthy and substantial adherence to principles and methods consonant with our religious philosophy	154.12892
the intellectual honesty and capacity to recognize the true path of her own best interests .	105.36552
to us and to every nation of the free world , rich or poor , these qualities are necessary today as never before if we are to march together to greater security , prosperity and peace .	105.10543
i believe that the industrial countries are ready to participate actively in supplementing the efforts of the developing nations to achieve progress .	8.805564
the immediate need for this kind of co-operation is underscored by the strain in this nation ' s international balance of payments .	37.451477
our surplus from foreign business transactions has in recent years fallen substantially short of the expenditures we make abroad to maintain our military establishments overseas , to finance private investment , and to provide assistance to the less developed nations .	46.860947
in 1959 our deficit in balance of payments approached four billion dollars .	157.0933
continuing deficits of anything like this magnitude would , over time , impair our own economic growth and check the forward progress of the free world .	55.489662
we must meet this situation by promoting a rising volume of exports and world trade .	63.20972
further , we must induce all industrialized nations of the free world to work together to help lift the scourge of poverty from less fortunate .	28.208199
this co-operation in this matter will provide both for the necessary sharing of this burden and in bringing about still further increases in mutually profitable trade .	122.897804
new nations , and others struggling with the problems of development , will progress only -- regardless of any outside help -- if they demonstrate faith in their own destiny and use their own resources to fulfill it .	84.80398
moreover , progress in a national transformation can be only gradually earned	123.70058
there is no easy and quick way to follow from the oxcart to the jet plane .	17.649025
but , just as we drew on europe for assistance in our earlier years , so now do these new and emerging nations that do have this faith and determination deserve help .	197.25255
respecting their need , one of the major focal points of our concern is the south-asian region .	19.819376
here , in two nations alone , are almost five hundred million people , all working , and working hard , to raise their standards , and in doing so , to make of themselves a strong bulwark against the spread of an ideology that would destroy liberty .	56.808758
i cannot express to you the depth of my conviction that , in our own and free world interest , we must co-operate with others to help these people achieve their legitimate ambitions , as expressed in their different multi-year plans .	51.734818
through the world bank and other instrumentalities , as well as through individual action by every nation in position to help , we must squarely face this titanic challenge .	59.711304
i shall continue to urge the american people , in the interests of their own security , prosperity and peace , to make sure that their own part of this great project be amply and cheerfully supported .	52.09804
free world decisions in this matter may spell the difference between world disaster and world progress in freedom .	85.91805
other countries , some of which i visited last month , have similar needs .	243.75493
a common meeting ground is desirable for those nations which are prepared to assist in the development effort .	34.0946
during the past year i have discussed this matter with the leaders of several western nations .	40.951443
because of its wealth of experience , the organization for european economic cooperation could help with the initial studies needed .	95.55695
the goal is to enlist all available economic resources in the industrialized free world , especially private investment capital .	79.016975
by extending this help , we hope to make possible the enthusiastic enrollment of these nations under freedom ' s banner .	103.00308
no more startling contrast to a system of sullen satellites could be imagined .	11.032988
if we grasp this opportunity to build an age of productive partnership between the less fortunate nations and those that have already achieved a high state of economic advancement , we will make brighter the outlook for a world order based upon security and freedom .	67.53352
otherwise , the outlook could be dark indeed .	4.8851748
we face , indeed , what may be a turning point in history , and we must act decisively and wisely .	56.820465
as a nation we can successfully pursue these objectives only from a position of broadly based strength .	102.748344
no matter how earnest is our quest for guaranteed peace , we must maintain a high degree of military effectiveness at the same time we are engaged in negotiating the issue of arms reduction .	52.132084
until tangible and mutually enforceable arms reduction measures are worked out we will not weaken the means of defending our institutions .	62.3984
it is my studied conviction that no nation will ever risk general war against us unless we should become so foolish as to neglect the defense forces we now so powerfully support .	119.20954
it is world-wide knowledge that any power which might be tempted today to attack the united states by surprise , even though we might sustain great losses , would itself promptly suffer a terrible destruction .	72.146645
but i once again assure all peoples and all nations that the united states , except in defense , will never turn loose this destructive power .	84.00383
during the past year , our long-range striking power , unmatched today in manned bombers , has taken on new strength as the atlas intercontinental ballistic missile has entered the operational inventory .	26.07786
in fourteen recent test launchings , at ranges of five thousand miles , atlas has been striking on an average within two miles of the target .	38.43289
this is less than the length of a jet runway -- well within the circle of destruction .	55.19218
incidentally , there was an atlas firing last night .	12.2366905
from all reports so far received , its performance conformed to the high standards i have just described .	32.93621
such performance is a great tribute to american scientists and engineers , who in the past five years have had to telescope time and technology to develop these long-range ballistic missiles , where america had none before .	65.501816
this year , moreover , growing numbers of nuclear powered submarines will enter our active forces , some to be armed with polaris missiles .	36.383774
these remarkable ships and weapons , ranging the oceans , will be capable of accurate fire on targets virtually anywhere on earth .	58.08956
to meet situations of less than general nuclear war , we continue to maintain our carrier forces , our many service units abroad , our always ready army strategic forces and marine corps divisions , and the civilian components .	50.807323
the continuing modernization of these forces is a costly but necessary process .	150.00401
it is scheduled to go forward at a rate which will steadily add to our strength .	82.31697
the deployment of a portion of these forces beyond our shores , on land and sea , is persuasive demonstration of our determination to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with our allies for collective security .	52.47464
moreover , i have directed that steps be taken to program on a longer range basis our military assistance to these allies .	61.08108
this is necessary for a sounder collective defense system .	24.606522
next i refer to our program in space exploration , which is often mistakenly supposed to be an integral part of defense research and development .	16.337296
we note that , first , america has already made great contributions in the past two years to the world ' s fund of knowledge of astrophysics and space science .	31.776299
these discoveries are of present interest chiefly to the scientific community	42.740135
but they are important foundation stones for more extensive exploration of outer space for the ultimate benefit of all mankind .	43.202557
second , our military missile program , going forward so successfully , does not suffer from our present lack of very large rocket engines , which are necessary in distant space exploration .	43.180687
i am assured by experts that the thrust of our present missiles is fully adequate for defense requirements .	28.687803
third , the united states is pressing forward in the development of large rocket engines to place vehicles of many tons into space for exploration purposes .	37.57874
fourth , in the meantime , it is necessary to remember that we have only begun to probe the environment immediately surrounding the earth .	31.498764
using launch systems presently available , we are developing satellites to scout the world ' s weather	19.846102
satellite relay stations to facilitate and extend communications over the globe	8.598939
for navigation aids to give accurate bearings to ships and aircraft	98.29003
and for perfecting instruments to collect and transmit the data we seek .	71.31788
fifth , we have just completed a year ' s experience with our new space law .	74.10368
suggested improvements will be submitted to the congress shortly .	158.17569
the accomplishment of the many tasks i have alluded to requires the continuous strengthening of the spiritual , intellectual , and economic sinews of american life .	25.869022
the steady purpose of our society is to assure justice , before god , for every individual .	239.47382
we must be ever alert that freedom does not wither through the careless amassing of restrictive controls or the lack of courage to deal boldly with the issues of the day .	14.542794
a year ago , when i met with you , the nation was emerging from an economic downturn , even though the signs of resurgent prosperity were not then sufficiently convincing to the doubtful .	42.925915
today our surging strength is apparent to everyone .	5.108059
1960 promises to be the most prosperous year in our history .	10.295135
yet we continue to be afflicted by nagging disorders .	24.952671
among current problems that require solutions , participated in by citizens as well as government , are	102.69965
the need to protect the public interest in situations of prolonged labor-management stalemate	38.969288
the persistent refusal to come to grips with a critical problem in one sector of american agriculture	21.390482
the continuing threat of inflation , together with the persisting tendency toward fiscal irresponsibility	17.660398
in certain instances the denial to some of our citizens of equal protection of the law .	92.970825
the group , upon the issuance of its first press release on december 21 , 1957 , designated itself a `` committee of investigation ' ' .	30.959284
in the course of its inquiry , it took testimony from only seven witnesses .	86.29271
it heard bang-jensen twice and his lawyer , adolf a . berle , jr . , once .	19.717707
its second press release was on january 15 , 1958 , and it recommended that the secret papers be destroyed .	14.518672
it also implied that paul bang-jensen had been irresponsible .	10.346605
on january 18 , ernest gross conducted a press conference at the u . n . lasting an hour .	14.259451
here , he openly attacked bang-jensen and referred to his `` aberrant conduct ' ' .	4.37702
this conference was held despite stavropoulos ' assurance to adolf berle , who was leaving the same day for puerto rico , that nothing would be done until his return on january 22 , except that the secretary general would probably order the list destroyed .	54.58405
on january 24 paul bang-jensen , accompanied by adolf berle , was met by dragoslav protitch and colonel frank begley , former police chief of farmington , conn . , and now head of u . n . special police .	14.701677
the four , bundled in overcoats , mounted to the wind-swept roof of the u . n .	9.24859
there , begley lit a fire in a wire basket , and bang-jensen dropped four sealed envelopes into the flames .	27.237577
in one of these he said were notes on the identities of the eighty-one refugees .	7.9621334
the method of destroying the evidence embarrassed paul bang-jensen .	5.221889
he knew it would be implied that it was done in this way at his insistence .	30.286497
he was right , and peter marshall could not help but recall andrew cordier ' s words on the subject , `` well , it seemed as good a place as any to do the job ' ' .	44.97749
the gross group had been formed for the express purpose of advising the secretary general .	67.18826
hammarskjold ' s supposed desire to seek outside legal advice in the guise of ernest gross is illusion , at best .	88.60819
gross ' s , being `` outside ' ' the u . n . applied only to a physical state , not an objective one .	42.684647
but by the time the papers were finally disposed of , the group had informed the world of its purpose , its recommendations , and its belief that paul bang-jensen was not of sound mind .	85.83742
shortly the group would issue its report to the secretary general , recommending paul bang-jensen ' s dismissal from the united nations .	26.095448
the contents of this 195-page document would become known to many before it would become known to the man it was written about .	97.88886
`` until this hungarian committee matter came up , bang-jensen was a fine and devoted individual .	82.898964
i had known him for some years , when i was a delegate and before , and this manner had never been his ' ' .	56.636925
ernest a . gross leaned back in his chair and told peter marshall how secretary general dag hammarskjold had , on december 4 , 1957 , called him in as a private lawyer to review bang-jensen ' s conduct `` relating to his association with the special committee on the problem of hungary ' ' .	57.270916
the result was the `` gross report ' ' , prepared by gross , as chairman , with the assistance of two u . n . under secretaries , constantin stavropoulos and philippe de seynes .	17.267262
`` yes ' ' , gross went on , `` bang-jensen was an up-and-coming young man .	36.475063
never well known , but he had done his work competently .	40.75368
gross had received marshall courteously and they were discussing the case .	14.424459
`` you know ' ' , the lawyer said , `` it ' s difficult to talk like this about a man who can ' t answer back ' ' .	18.796408
gross was behind a clean-top desk , only a manila folder before him .	13.582641
marshall sat in one of the several leather chairs .	10.951907
outside the office windows , twenty-four stories above wall street , a light rain was falling .	73.2326
`` mr . gross , your report says that ' our function is investigative and advisory and does not in any way derogate from or prejudice mr . bang-jensen ' s rights as a staff member .	66.028175
you know , bang-jensen characterized your committee as having prejudged his case ' ' .	36.76616
`` well , how could that have been ? ?	76.75431
i don ' t consider that he was prejudged .	7.054289
we were given a job and we carried it out , and later , his case was taken up by the disciplinary committee .	32.08583
`` we have nothing to hide under a bushel .	8.173758
we did our job , mr . stavropoulos and mr . de seynes and myself , taking evidence from a number of people ' ' .	30.939318
`` what did you think about his mental state ' ' ? ?	38.560783
`` i think our report sums up our finding ' ' , gross answered .	17.529993
`` don ' t forget , here was a man who had been accusing his colleagues for almost a year of willfully attempting to present an incorrect report .	20.23741
`` this was not merely alleging errors , but was carried out by day-after-day allegations in memos , written charges of serious consequence .	25.858412
supposing you or i were being accused in this manner , and yet we were doing our level best to carry on our work .	79.58744
`` i ' ve been in government and i can tell some pretty hairy stories about personnel difficulties , so i know what a problem he was ' ' .	77.21177
`` what i ' d like you to comment on is the criticism leveled at your committee ' ' .	87.12216
`` what do you mean ' ' ? ?	1.0190225
`` for instance , regarding the fact that the gross committee issued two interim announcements to the press during its investigation .	152.77736
you know bang-jensen was told the committee was ' to convey its views , suggestions and recommendations to the secretary general .	38.22777
in his own words , bang-jensen ' took it for granted that the group would report to the secretary general privately and not in public .	94.41355
he claimed that the release of the preliminary findings was ' prejudicial to his position ' ' ' .	35.038284
for an instant he glared speechless at marshall .	10.992825
`` i thought the entire report was going to be confidential from beginning to end .	27.885435
but you know bang-jensen launched an active campaign against us in the press .	40.8688
it was getting so that we , the committee , were being tried .	488.45227
you can find it in the papers ' ' .	1.7940412
`` well , as a matter of fact , i ' ve looked through back-issue files of new york papers for december , 1957 , and haven ' t found a great deal ' ' --	29.759003
`` it wasn ' t necessarily all here in new york .	16.177689
don ' t forget the foreign press ' ' .	1.337685
`` then what about the second interim public announcement ? ?	67.49937
this cited bang-jensen ' s ' aberrant conduct ' ' ' .	14.67677
`` the reason for that report was to settle the matter of the list .	38.28739
as far as i ' m concerned , it was a separate matter from the general committee study of bang-jensen ' s conduct .	66.14055
the january fifteen report recommended that bang-jensen be instructed to burn the list -- the papers -- in the presence of a u . n . security officer ' ' .	26.994492
`` how about your press conference three days later -- what was the reason for that ? ?	37.555744
bang-jensen said you told correspondents that you had checked in advance to make sure the term ' aberrant conduct ' was not libelous .	29.647154
he claimed you made other slanderous allegations ' ' .	1.3524412
`` the entire object of the press conference was to clarify the problem of the list , since many in the press were querying the u . n . about it .	27.691433
bang-jensen never explained what the documents or papers were that he had in his possession .	37.529438
`` it was foolish of him to keep them , whatever they were .	84.09485
he could have been blackmailed , or his family might have been threatened .	57.741295
of course the matter caught the public ' s attention .	8.842396
we attempted to conclude this , and did so by having the papers burned .	173.4822
hammarskjold didn ' t like the way it was carried out .	9.508838
hammarskjold believes the u . n . is an organization that settles matters in a procedural way .	34.35456
if hammarskjold had not wanted the list disposed of in this manner , and if bang-jensen had not wanted it -- who had ordered it ? ?	68.11336
`` mr . gross , concerning the formation of your committee , there ' s the fact that you have been a legal adviser to the u . n . in the past	21.429441

could you comment on that ' ' ? ?	1.0123721
`` i ' ve served as a counsel for the u . n . for some years , specializing particularly in real estate matters or other problems that the regular u . n . legal staff might not be equipped to handle .	40.31833
mr . stavropoulos is the u . n . legal chief and a very good man , but he is not fully versed on some technical points of american law ' ' .	35.044365
`` what did you think about bang-jensen ' s contention of errors and omissions in the hungarian report ' ' ? ?	27.30757
`` why , mick shann went over and over the report with alsing andersen , trying to check them out .	36.373684
even after the incident between bang-jensen and shann in the delegates ' lounge and this was not the way the chicago tribune presented it ' ' .	33.158566
gross reached in his desk and pulled out two newspaper clippings .	56.75639
one was an article on the u . n . by alice widener from the cincinnati enquirer .	18.293758
the other was by chesly manley in the chicago daily tribune .	34.99379
`` i know ches , he ' s a friend of mine .	12.5856285
he probably didn ' t mean to write it this way , or maybe he did .	79.73642
there wasn ' t any ' violent argument ' between bang-jensen and shann , as the tribune puts it .	51.789192
that implies that shann was on the enemy side .	3.2877655
how it ' s phrased there -- the word violent .	54.341084
`` the case was that bang-jensen came up to shann claiming he had found further errors in the report .	57.424976
' i ' ve found errors and i want you to look them over .	75.42931
so once again shann had to argue with him about this .	60.294262
but it wasn ' t a violent discussion .	3.316591
and after all this , shann went over all that bang-jensen had brought up ' ' .	41.142807
( shann ' s own report , peter marshall reflected , describes the encounter as `` immoderate ' ' .	6.5166364
bang-jensen was in `` hysterical condition ' ' .	3.3714855
it was a good report , he did all he could to make it a good report .	56.67396
when i speak of how shann felt , i know well .	149.49048
don ' t forget , i am an old member of the club , a former delegate .	31.758816
i think you are being unfair to take these things up now .	113.92186
`` you know , this hits in many areas .	19.948393
it appeals to those who were frustrated in the outcome of the hungarian situation .	13.997417
don ' t forget , the u . n . did no more than the united states did .	43.586555
it takes a great deal of sophisticated thought to get the impact of this fact ' ' .	23.894154
from the home of his friend , henrik kauffmann , in washington , d . c . , paul bang-jensen sent a telegram dated december 9 , 1957 , to ernest gross .	11.706364
`` the matters to be considered are obviously of a grave character , and i therefore respectfully request that the hearing be postponed for two weeks in order that i might make adequate preparation ' ' .	38.12077
ernest gross replied the next day , putting the suspended diplomat ' s fears to rest .	16.830896
`` this reveals some misunderstanding on your part .	33.096214
the group conducting the review is not holding formal hearings .	18.20377
it wished to pursue , in the course of this review , questions arising from the body of material already in its possession .	85.69048
it sounded like a fair enough invitation , peter marshall reflected , and bang-jensen must have thought so too , because on the thirteenth , he met the group of three on the thirty-sixth floor of the u . n . .	41.524696
`` we were requested by the secretary general , as i understand it , to discuss with you such matters as appear to us to be relevant , and we are not of course either a formal group or a committee in the sense of being guided by any rules or regulations of the secretariat .	39.6159
the only rules which i think we shall follow will be those of common sense , justice , and fairness ' ' .	39.538692
peter marshall noted that bang-jensen had later referred to his two interviews with the gross group as `` unfortunate experiences ' ' , and after his second meeting on the sixteenth the dane refused to attend further hearings without legal counsel .	44.383144
marshall pondered the reason for this , and pondered too the replacement of one member of the three-man group .	39.56109
j . a . c . robertson , after serving gross one week , left for england .	96.01602
fortunately the hole was found at last and plugged .	3.166886
another week passed and even the missionaries were enjoying the voyage .	10.5515995
the sickness was gone and , after all , the two young couples were on their honeymoon .	27.180054
in spite of pickering dodge ' s explicit instructions regarding variation of meals , the food did not seem the same as at home .	61.33567
`` everything tasted differently from what it does on land and those things i was most fond of at home , i loathed the most here ' ' , ann noted .	54.19914
at last they concluded that the heavy , full feeling in their stomachs was due to lack of exercise .	92.554504
walking was the remedy , they decided , but a deck full of chicken coops and pigpens was hardly suitable .	57.528988
a rope was found and , like children in school , the missionaries skipped for hours at a time .	47.806133
finally , tiring of so monotonous a form of exercise , they decided to dance instead .	61.76111
it was much more fun , reminding the girls of their old carefree days in the hasseltine frolics room at bradford .	35.135246
the weather turned warmer and with it came better appetites , although harriet was still a little off-color .	40.386955
she could not face coffee or tea without milk , and was always craving types of food that were not available aboard a sailing ship .	40.723534
by now she was sure she was going to have a baby , deciding it would be born in india or burma that november .	53.960632
she was more excited than frightened at the prospect of having her first child in a foreign land .	54.611168
the crew of the caravan never failed to amaze ann , who during her stay in salem must frequently have overheard strong sailorly language .	142.03166
she wrote in her journal , `` i have not heard the least profane language since i have been on board the vessel .	75.62083
she was now enjoying the voyage very much .	5.5637736
even the first wave of homesickness had passed , although there were moments when captain heard pointed out on his compass the direction of bradford that she felt a little twinge at her heart .	57.757126
as for adoniram , she found him to be `` the kindest ' ' of husbands .	11.174741
on sundays , with the permission of captain heard , who usually attended with two of his officers , services were held in the double cabin .	67.20976
sometimes a ship would be sighted and the caravan pass so close that people could easily be seen on the distant deck .	82.82946
captain heard did not communicate with any strange vessels because of the possibility of war between the united states and britain .	24.304022
as warmer temperatures were encountered ann and harriet were introduced to the pleasures of bathing daily in salt water .	24.128489
when may came the caravan had already crossed the equator .	14.087941
they were sailing round the cape of good hope	1695.7755
at this time harriet wrote in a letter which after their finally landing in india was sent to her mother	186.71283
`` i care not how soon we reach calcutta , and are placed in a still room , with a bowl of milk and a loaf of indian bread .	33.556297
i can hardly think of this simple fare without exclaiming , oh , what a luxury .	40.429047
i have been so weary of the excessive rocking of the vessel , and the almost intolerable smell after the rain , that i have done little more than lounge on the bed for several days .	34.780163
but i have been blest with excellent spirits , and to-day have been running about the deck , and dancing in our room for exercise , as well as ever ' ' .	31.261976
while studying at the seminary in andover , adoniram had been working on a new testament translation from the original greek .	30.583261
he had brought it along to continue during the voyage .	9.49332
there was one particular word that troubled his conscience .	45.074028
this was the greek word most often translated as `` baptism ' ' .	4.3807316
born a congregationalist , he had been baptized as a tiny baby in the usual manner by having a few drops of water sprinkled on his head , yet nowhere in the whole of the new testament could he find a description of anybody being baptized by sprinkling .	48.325634
john the baptist used total immersion in the river jordan for believers	32.42912
the more adoniram looked at the greek word for baptism , the more unhappy he became over its true meaning .	104.31733
as was only natural he confided his searchings to ann , conceding ruefully that it certainly looked as if their own congregationalists were wrong and the baptists right .	36.484756
by this time she had learned that it was futile to argue with her young husband , yet the uncomfortable fact remained the american congregationalists were sending them as missionaries to the far east and paying their salaries .	47.92526
what would happen if adoniram `` changed horses in midstream ' ' ? ?	4.4938946
baptists and congregationalists in new england were on friendly terms .	37.689156
how embarrassing it would be if the newly appointed congregationalist missionaries should suddenly switch their own beliefs in order to embrace baptist teachings ! !	28.202652
`` if you become a baptist , i will not ' ' , ann informed her husband , but sweeping her threat aside adoniram continued to search for an answer to the personal dilemma in which he found himself .	77.66754
by early june they were a hundred miles off the coast of ceylon , by which time all four missionaries were hardened seafarers .	51.991863
even harriet could boldly write , `` i know not how it is	34.74432
and the waves threatening to swallow up the vessel	55.928043
ann thrilled to the sight of a delicate butterfly and two strange tropical birds .	23.804369
land was near , and on june 12 , one hundred and fourteen days after leaving america , they actually saw , twenty miles away , the coast of orissa .	70.59649
captain heard gave orders for the ship to be anchored in the bay of bengal until he could obtain the services of a reputable pilot to steer her through the shallow waters .	29.472696
sometimes ships waited for days for such a man , but captain heard was lucky .	51.228153
next day a ship arrived with an english pilot , his leadsman , an english youth , and the first hindu the judsons and newells had ever seen .	24.0971
a little man with a `` a dark copper color ' ' skin , he was wearing `` calico trousers and a white cotton short gown ' ' .	27.391523
`` he looks as feminine as you can imagine ' ' , she decided .	24.10811
all day long the caravan slowly made her way through the difficult passages .	149.50458
alas , to ann ' s consternation , his language while thus employed left much to be desired .	411.44342
he swore so loudly at the top of his voice , that she didn ' t get any sleep all the next night .	37.80563
next morning the caravan was out of the treacherous bay .	11.318862
relieved of the major part of his responsibility for the safety of the ship , the pilot ' s oaths became fewer .	55.147224
slowly she moved up the hooghli river , a mouth of the mighty ganges , toward calcutta .	23.31807
ann was entranced with the view , as were her husband and friends .	62.949604
running across the deck , which was empty now that the livestock had been killed and eaten , they sniffed the spice-laden breezes that came from the shore , each pointing out new and exciting wonders to the other .	39.563084
out came the journal and in it went ann ' s own description of the scene	98.342064
`` on each side of the hoogli , where we are now sailing , are the hindoo cottages , as thick together as the houses in our seaports .	25.440369
they are very small , and in the form of haystacks , without either chimney or windows .	26.567867
they are situated in the midst of trees , which hang over them , and appear truly romantick .	27.14136
the grass and fields of rice are perfectly green , and herds of cattle are everywhere feeding on the banks of the river , and the natives are scattered about differently employed .	37.125996
some are fishing , some driving the team , and many are sitting indolently on the banks of the river .	16.042805
the pagodas we have passed are much larger than the houses ' ' .	10.99677
where were the hardships she had expected ? ?	1.0535766
she was certain now that it would be no harder to bear her child here in such pleasant surroundings than at home in the big white house in haverhill .	99.359245
with childlike innocence she wrote of the indians as `` walking with fruit and umbrellas in their hands , with the tawny children around them .	49.917934
this is the most delightful trial i have ever had ' ' , she decided .	22.616161
the indians who came aboard ship to collect the mail also interested her greatly , even if she was suitably shocked , according to the customs of the society in which she had been reared , to find them `` naked , except a piece of cotton cloth wrapped around their middle ' ' .	52.32466
at last they saw calcutta , largest city of bengal and the caravan ' s destination .	6.003321
founded august 24 , 1690 by job charnock of the east india company , and commonly called `` the city of palaces ' ' , it seemed a vast and elegant place to ann hasseltine judson .	38.793472
solid brick buildings painted dazzling white , large domes and tall , picturesque palms stretched as far as the eye could see , while the wharves and harbor were filled with tall-masted sailing ships .	21.104256
crowds flocked through the waterfront streets chattering loudly in their strange-sounding bengali tongue .	6.850889
harriet ' s mouth watered with anticipation when after months of dreaming she sat down at last to her much-craved milk and fresh bread .	68.22095
ann , pleased to see her friend happy , was intrigued by the new fruits a friend of captain heard had sent on board for their enjoyment .	46.905537
cautiously she sampled her first pineapple and another fruit whose taste she likened to that of `` a rich pear ' ' .	19.096819
though she did not then know its name , this strange new fruit was a banana .	41.265667
the first act of adoniram and samuel on reaching calcutta was to report at the police station , a necessity when landing in east india company territory .	98.36781
on the way they tried to discover all they could about burma , and they were disturbed to find that michael symes ' s book had not presented an altogether true picture .	62.459187
he had failed to realize that the burmese were not really treating him as the important visitor he considered himself .	83.35949
they were in fact quietly laughing at him , for their king wished to have nothing to do with the western world .	56.476162
when captain john gibault of salem had visited burma in 1793 his ship , the astra , had been promptly commandeered and taken by her captors up the irrawaddy river .	21.646921
although after much trouble he did manage to get it back , he discovered there was no trade to be had .	115.8387
all captain gibault took back to salem were a few items for the town ' s east india museum .	54.82828
a year later another salem ship returned from burma with a cargo of gum lacquer which nobody wanted to buy .	20.468288
after that salem ships decided to bypass unfriendly burma .	2.333433
the burmese appeared to have little knowledge of british power or any idea of trade .	99.49004
cruel burmese governors could , on the slightest whim , take a man ' s life .	18.259619
as for missionaries , even if they succeeded in getting into the country they probably would not be allowed to preach the christian faith to the burmans .	29.692123
unspeakable tortures or even execution might well be their fate .	26.268297
`` go back to america or any other place ' ' , well-meaning friends of captain heard advised them , `` but put thoughts of going to burma out of your heads ' ' .	44.621098
somewhat daunted , the two american missionaries reached the police station where they were questioned by a most unfriendly clerk .	46.510475
when he discovered they had received from the company ' s court of directors no permission to live in india , coupled with the fact that they were americans who had been sent to asia to convert `` the heathen ' ' , he became more belligerent than ever .	33.75569
they explained that they desired only to stop in india until a ship traveling on to burma could be found .	57.69739
she describes , first , the imaginary reaction of a foreigner puzzled by this `` unseasonable exultation ' '	8.4923935
he is answered by a confused , honest englishman .	37.586353
the reasons for the whig joy on this occasion are found to be their expectation of regaining control of the government , their delight at the prospect of a new war , their hopes of having the tories hanged , and so on .	34.0725
as for the author of the englishman , mrs . manley sarcastically deplores that the sole defense of the protestant cause should be left to `` ridpath , dick steele , and their associates , with the apostles of young man ' s coffee-house ' ' .	28.996187
another controversy typical of the war between the englishman and the examiner centered on robert ( later viscount ) molesworth , a whig leader in ireland and a member of the irish privy council .	18.109648
on december 21 , the day that the irish house of commons petitioned for removal of sir constantine phipps , their tory lord chancellor , molesworth reportedly made this remark on the defense of phipps by convocation `` they that have turned the world upside down , are come hither also ' ' .	36.554367
upon complaints from the lower house of convocation to the house of lords , he was removed from the privy council , his remark having been represented as a blasphemous affront to the clergy .	24.58476
steele , who had earlier praised molesworth in tatler no . 189 , now defended him in englishman no . 46 , depicting his removal as a setback to the constitution .	37.158707
on the other hand , molesworth was naturally assailed in the tory press .	18.916384
swift , in the dublin edition of a preface to the bishop of sarum ' s introduction , indicated his feelings by including molesworth , along with toland , tindal , and collins , in the group of those who , like burnet , are engaged in attacking all convocations of the clergy .	19.458614
in the same way he coupled molesworth and wharton in a letter to archbishop king , and he had earlier described him as `` the worst of them ' ' in some `` observations ' ' on the irish privy council submitted to oxford .	26.264145
a month later , in the publick spirit of the whigs , he used steele ' s defense of molesworth as evidence of his disrespect for the clergy , calling steele ' s position an affront to the `` whole convocation of ireland ' ' .	21.989702
on this issue , then , as on so many in these months , steele and swift took rigidly opposed points of view .	82.00661
in the early months of 1714 , the battle between swift and steele over the issue of the succession entered its major phase .	65.95672
the preliminaries ended with the publication of steele ' s crisis on january 19 , and from that point on the fight proceeded at a rapid pace .	59.14081
in answer to the crisis , swift produced the publick spirit of the whigs , his most extensive and bitter attack on his old friend .	31.344595
by this time , as we shall see , the tories were already planning to `` punish ' ' steele for his political writing by expelling him from the house of commons .	34.478622
despite his defense of himself in the final paper of the englishman and in his speech before the house , their efforts were successful .	43.664017
steele lost his seat in parliament , and his personal quarrel with swift , by now a public issue , thus reached its climax .	61.34111
of all the whig tracts written in support of the succession , the crisis is perhaps the most significant .	33.07092
certainly it is the most pretentious and elaborate .	12.601518
hanoverian agents assisted in promoting circulation , said to have reached 40 , 000 , and if one may judge by the reaction of swift and other government writers , the work must have had considerable impact .	77.44931
steele ' s main business here is to arouse public opinion to the immediate danger of a stuart restoration .	18.863672
to this end , the first and longest section of the tract cites all the laws enacted since the revolution to defend england against the `` arbitrary power of a popish prince ' ' .	42.48247
in his comment on these laws steele sounds all the usual notes of current whig propaganda , ranging from a criticism of the tory peace to an attack on the dismissal of marlborough	47.477684
but his principal theme is that the intrigues of the tories , `` our popish or jacobite party ' ' , pose an immediate threat to church and state .	16.833082
like burnet , he deplores the indifference of the people in the face of the crisis .	20.751102
treasonable books striking at the hanoverian succession , he complains , are allowed to pass unnoticed .	17.789993
in this connection , swift , too , is drawn in for attack `` the author of the conduct of the allies has dared to drop insinuations about altering the succession ' ' .	33.44367
in his effort to stir the public from its lethargy , steele goes so far as to list catholic atrocities of the sort to be expected in the event of a stuart restoration , and , with rousing rhetoric , he asserts that the only preservation from these `` terrours ' ' is to be found in the laws he has so tediously cited .	36.762177
`` it is no time ' ' , he writes , `` to talk with hints and innuendos , but openly and honestly to profess our sentiments before our enemies have compleated and put their designs in execution against us ' ' .	25.940563
steele apparently professed his sentiments in this book too openly and honestly for his own good , since the government was soon to use it as evidence against him in his trial before the house .	56.096924
in the final issues of the englishman , which ended just as the new session of parliament began , he provided his enemies with still more ammunition .	113.59644
for example , no . 56 printed the patent giving the electoral prince the title of duke of cambridge .	43.838264
in a few months the duke was to be the center of a controversy of some significance on the touchy question of the protestant succession .	15.619224
at the order of the dowager electress , the hanoverian agents , supported by the whig leaders , demanded that a writ of summons be issued which would call the duke to england to sit in parliament , thus further insuring the succession by establishing a hanoverian prince in england before the queen ' s death .	26.737173
anne was furious , and bolingbroke advised that the request be refused .	316.53806
oxford , realizing that the law required the issuance of the writ , took the opposite view , for which the queen never forgave him .	40.673523
accordingly the request was granted , but the elector himself , who had not been consulted by his mother , rejected the proposal and recalled his agent schutz , whose impolitic handling of the affair had caused the hanoverian interest to suffer and had made oxford ' s dismissal more likely than ever .	41.099728
steele in this paper is indicating his sympathy for such a plan .	69.49828
a few days after this englishman appeared , defoe reported to oxford that steele was expected to move in parliament that the duke be called over	77.33406
defoe then commented , `` if they could draw that young gentleman into their measures they would show themselves quickly , for they are not asham ' d to say they want only a head to make a beginning ' ' .	109.631996
the final issue of the englishman , no . 57 for february 15 , ran to some length and was printed as a separate pamphlet , entitled the englishman being the close of the paper so-called .	71.53643
steele ' s purpose is to present a general defense of his political writing and a resume of the themes which had occupied him in the englishman	40.38439
but there is much here also which bears directly on his personal quarrel with swift .	47.238934
thus he complains , with considerable justice , that the tory writers have resorted to libel instead of answering his arguments .	30.593273
his birth , education , and fortune , he says , have all been ridiculed simply because he has spoken with the freedom of an englishman , and he assures the reader that `` whoever talks with me , is speaking to a gentleman born ' ' .	36.758945
as notable examples of this abuse , he quotes passages from the examiner , `` that destroyer of all things ' ' , and the character of richard steele , which he here attributes to swift .	34.26734
though put in rather maudlin terms , steele ' s defense of himself has a reasonable basis .	61.224167
his point is simply that the tories have showered him with personal satire , despite the fact that as a private subject he has a right to speak on political matters without affronting the prerogative of the sovereign .	41.877148
he claims , too , that his political convictions are simply those which are called `` revolution principles ' ' and which are accepted by moderate men in both parties .	53.794724
the final section of this pamphlet is of special interest in a consideration of steele ' s relations with swift .	34.92455
it purports to be a letter from steele to a friend at court , who , in miss blanchard ' s opinion , could only be meant as swift .	52.461517
steele first answers briefly the charges which his `` dear old friend ' ' has made about his pamphlet on dunkirk and his crisis .	34.35528
then he launches into an attack on the tory ministers , whom he calls the `` new converts ' '	27.353214
by this term he means to ridicule their professions of acting in the interest of the church despite their own education and manner of life -- a gibe , in other words , at the `` presbyterianism ' ' in harley ' s family and at bolingbroke ' s reputed impiety .	23.215607
the tory leaders , he insinuates , are cynically using the church as a political `` by-word ' ' to increase party friction and keep themselves in power .	59.628963
this is the principal point made in this final section of englishman no . 57 , and it caps steele ' s efforts in his other writing of these months to counteract the notion of the tories as a `` church party ' ' supported by the body of the clergy .	31.406326
next , steele turns his attention to the `` courtier ' ' he is addressing .	9.046313
he explains that there are sometimes honorable courtiers , but that too often a man who succeeds at court does not hesitate to sacrifice his sovereign and nation to his own avarice and ambition .	50.317917
such , he implies , is the case with his friend , who is not really a new convert himself but merely a favorer of new converts .	43.99822
if `` jack the courtier ' ' is really to be taken as swift , the following remark is obviously steele ' s comment on swift ' s change of parties and its effect on their friendship `` i assure you , dear jack , when i first found out such an allay in you , as makes you of so malleable a constitution , that you may be worked into any form an artificer pleases , i foresaw i should not enjoy your favour much longer ' ' .	69.418594
he closes his `` letter ' ' by demanding that dunkirk be demolished , that the pretender be forced to move farther away from the coast of england , and that the queen and the house of hanover come to a better understanding .	50.179222
the last point was soon to be included in the `` seditious ' ' remarks used against him in parliament .	20.470352
the examiner , during steele ' s trial a month later , printed an answer from the `` courtier ' ' addressed to `` r . s . ' ' at button ' s coffee-house .	26.431927
he reviews steele ' s entrance into politics and finds that his present difficulties are due to his habit of attributing to his own abilities and talents achievements which more properly should be credited to the indulgence of his friends .	59.340385
once more , in other words , steele is said to be indebted to swift for his `` wit ' '	58.0291
this was the form in which their private feud most often appeared in the tory press , especially the examiner .	28.881592
in the publick spirit of the whigs , it may be noted , swift himself contemptuously dismissed steele ' s reference to his friend at court `` i suppose by the style of old friend , and the like , it must be some body there of his own level	60.804108
among whom , his party have indeed more friends than i could wish ' ' .	35.7912
on february 16 , steele took his seat in parliament .	14.196045
by now he was undergoing a fresh torrent of abuse from tory papers and pamphlets , and action was being taken to effect his punishment by expulsion from parliament .	72.216965
on the very day that the parliamentary session began , another `` infamous libel ' ' appeared , entitled a letter from the facetious dr . andrew tripe , at bath , to the venerable nestor ironside .	17.861338
it is filled with the usual personal abuse of steele , especially of his physical appearance	50.607773
in the opening paragraph , too , steele is accused of extreme egotism , of giving `` himself the preference to all the learned , his contemporaries , from dr . swift himself , even down to poet cr--spe of the customhouse ' ' .	52.079723
when harold arlen returned to california in the winter of 1944 , it was to take up again a collaboration with johnny mercer , begun some years before .	49.584732
the film they did after his return was an inconsequential bit of nothing titled out of this world , a satire on the sinatra bobby-soxer craze .	34.44546
the twist lay in using bing crosby ' s voice on the sound track while leading man eddie bracken mouthed the words .	39.466244
if nothing else , at least two good songs came out of the project , `` out of this world ' ' and `` june comes around every year ' ' .	48.77359
though they would produce some very memorable and lasting songs , arlen and mercer were not given strong material to work on .	91.687744
early in 1941 they were assigned to a script titled hot nocturne .	71.007225
it purported to be a reasonably serious attempt at a treatment of jazz musicians , their aims , their problems -- the tug-of-war between the `` pure ' ' and the `` commercial ' ' -- and seemed a promising vehicle , for the two men shared a common interest in jazz .	44.648434
johnny mercer practically grew up with the sound of jazz and the blues in his ears .	18.395193
he was born in savannah , georgia , in 1909 .	9.047172
his father , george a . mercer , was descended from an honored southern family that could trace its ancestry back to one hugh mercer , who had emigrated from scotland in 1747 .	49.10545
the lyricist ' s father was a lawyer who had branched out into real estate .	22.957247
his second wife , lillian , was the mother of john h . mercer .	47.001453
by the age of six young johnny indicated that he had the call .	19.208641
one day he followed the irish jasper greens , the town band , to a picnic and spent the entire day listening , while his family spent the day looking .	74.720856
the disappearance caused his family to assign a full-time maid to keeping an eye on the boy .	64.5922
both were obviously on the way to the mercer home .	407.0987
the mother inquired , `` where ' s johnny , and why did you leave him ' ' ? ?	29.573395
`` there was nothing else i could do ' ' , the maid answered , satisfied with a rather vague explanation .	43.290424
the maid then told her , `` because he fired me ' ' .	16.427364
with her son evidencing so strong a musical bent his mother could do little else but get him started on the study of music -- though she waited until he was ten -- beginning with the piano and following that with the trumpet .	102.9857
young mercer showed a remarkable lack of aptitude for both instruments .	89.58656
still , he did like music making and even sang in the chapel choir of the woodberry forest school , near orange , virginia , where he sounded fine but did not matriculate too well .	39.079468
when he was fifteen john h . mercer turned out his first song , a jazzy little thing he called `` sister susie , strut your stuff ' ' .	21.724384
if his scholarship and formal musicianship were not all they might have been , mercer demonstrated at an early age that he was gifted with a remarkable ear for rhythm and dialect .	50.637657
from his playmates in savannah , mercer had picked up , along with a soft southern dialect , traces also of the gullah dialects of africa .	26.615814
such speech differences made him acutely aware of the richness and expressivness of language .	9.96269
during the summers , while he was still in school , mercer worked for his father ' s firm as a messenger boy .	48.402924
it generally took well into the autumn for the firm to recover from the summer ' s help .	90.21909
`` we ' d give him things to deliver , letters , checks , deeds and things like that ' ' , remembers his half-brother walter , still in the real estate business in savannah , `` and learn days later that he ' d absent-mindedly stuffed them into his pocket .	50.118515
this rather detached attitude toward life ' s encumbrances has seemed to be the dominant trait in mercer ' s personality ever since .	42.35562
it is , however , a disarming disguise , or perhaps a shield , for not only has mercer proved himself to be one of the few great lyricists over the years , but also one who can function remarkably under pressure .	75.94675
he has also enjoyed a successful career as an entertainer ( his records have sold in the millions ) and is a sharp businessman .	78.287346
in 1927 his father ' s business collapsed , and , rather than go bankrupt , mercer senior turned his firm over to a bank for liquidation .	101.73876
he died before he could completely pay off his debts .	5.243019
some years later the bank handling the mercer liquidation received a check for $300 , 000 , enough to clear up the debt .	47.2983
the check had been mailed from chicago , the envelope bore no return address , and the check was not signed .	62.282707
`` that ' s johnny ' ' , sighed the bank president , `` the best-hearted boy in the world , but absent-minded ' ' .	25.688372
but mercer ' s explanation was simple `` i made out the check and carried it around a few days unsigned -- in case i lost it ' ' .	71.65695
when he remembered that he might have not signed the check , mercer made out another for the same amount , instructing the bank to destroy the other -- especially if he had happened to have absent-mindedly signed both of them .	62.740555
when the family business failed , mercer left school and on his mother ' s urging -- for she hoped that he would become an actor -- he joined a local little theater group .	86.59865
when the troupe traveled to new york to participate in a one-act-play competition -- and won -- mercer , instead of returning with the rest of the company in triumph , remained in new york .	47.187885
he had talked one other member of the group to stay with him , but that friend had tired of not eating regularly and returned to savannah .	133.04012
but mercer hung on , living , after a fashion , in a greenwich village fourth-flight walk-up .	24.015009
`` the place had no sink or washbasin , only a bathtub ' ' , his mother discovered when she visited him .	28.060617
`` johnny insisted on cooking a chicken dinner in my honor -- he ' s always been a good cook -- and i ' ll never forget him cleaning the chicken in the tub ' ' .	32.539772
